TEXT:
In a new interview, Miley Cyrus admits that playing the title character in â€œHannah Montanaâ€ messed with her head.

The pop star and â€œVoiceâ€ coach sat down with CBS Sunday Morning and spoke candidly about how her popular on-screen persona sparked identity issues.

â€œAmerica feels like my aunt [telling me], â€œYou know, youâ€™re growing up so much and we donâ€™t want to see you grow up,â€ she said, continuing, â€œI think why people loved Hannah Montana was because Hannah Montana did feel real, and thatâ€™s because I was under there.â€

Cyrus said the lines between her personas started blurring once she went out on tour as both Hannah Montana and Miley Cyrus. When asked how she dealt with that, she replied, â€œI think thatâ€™s probably whatâ€™s a little bit wrong with me now. I mark that up to doing some extreme damage in my psyche as an adult person.â€

She then credited her provocative â€œWrecking Ballâ€ music video as the catalyst for allowing her to distinguish her true self from her squeaky-clean Disney star alter ego.

â€œI didnâ€™t realize that it was going to shift me into truly being my own person,â€ Cyrus said. â€œIt changed my life. I felt like that divide, that boundary, was very clear.â€

The videoâ€™s sexual nature â€”who can forget a naked Cyrus riding on a wrecking ball â€” combined with a controversial performance at the 2013 Video Music Awards catapulted the singer into a brand new territory, identity-wise. It also led to a fair share of criticism.

Theo Wargo via Getty Images Robin Thicke and Miley Cyrus perform during the 2013 MTV Video Music Awards at the Barclays Center on August 25, 2013.

â€œI got that women-judgment-double-standard in a heavy dosing, and Iâ€™m OK with that,â€ Cyrus said. â€œI just recently read Hillary Clintonâ€™s book [What Happened] and now I think of things in a whole different way. I always think, â€˜If she can lose an election, I can do this.â€™â€

The 24-year-old also reinforced that she doesnâ€™t regret any of her decisions, citing a quote used at a yoga studio she goes to.
TITLE: Miley Cyrus Says â€˜Hannah Montanaâ€™ Did â€˜Damage In My Psycheâ€™

Limitar a Patricia Maya como "la esposa de Rob Schneider" es un error (y uno muy grande).

Entonces, Â¿cÃ³mo describirla en un futuro? AquÃ­ algunos datos:

Maya iniciÃ³ su carrera en CDMX, de hecho, ella fue la productora y escritora de programas como Guerra de chistes, El Monchis y Cuentamelove, todos ellos de Telehit. Gracias al Ã©xito de estos shows, en 2010 se mudÃ³ a Estados Unidos para escribir la serie de Azteca AmÃ©rica, El pelado de la noche, y no solo eso, tambiÃ©n fue la conductora. Ã‰sta fue la primera vez frente a las cÃ¡maras y el pÃºblico.

En 2011, Patricia se casÃ³ con Rob Scheider y en 2012, crearon la serie Rob, para CBS, en la cual tambiÃ©n aparecÃ­a Eugenio Derbez. El programa fue cancelado, pero en 2014, Netflix comprÃ³ la idea y despuÃ©s de esto, las cosas se pusieron interesantes.

Real Rob es una serie de, por ahora dos temporadas, que muestra la vida de una familia mexicoestadounidense que tiene que compaginar ambos estilos de vida. Aunque es ficciÃ³n, en ocasiones parece que estÃ¡s viendo un reality show.

Platicamos en exclusiva con Maya sobre la segunda temporada de Real Rob, la cual ya se encuentra disponible en Netflix; cÃ³mo es su vida junto a uno de los comediantes mÃ¡s icÃ³nicos de Estados Unidos y cÃ³mo fue que convenciÃ³ a Rob de apoyar al equipo de futbol regiomontano, Tigres.

"Claro que muchas cosas de las que suceden en el show es mentira, otras no", nos dijo Maya entre risas.

HuffPost MÃ©xico: Â¿Por ejemplo, quÃ© es verdad?

Maya: En la primera temporada, a Rob se le cae un Buda al baÃ±o. Llamamos al plomero y nos dijeron que tenÃ­an que cambiar todo el baÃ±o. Nos iban a cobrar como dos mil quinientos dÃ³lares, Â¡una locura! Cerca de nosotros habÃ­a una construcciÃ³n y me acerquÃ©. EncontrÃ© a varios mexicanos trabajando ahÃ­, y les pedÃ­ que nos ayudaran. Fueron a la casa y en cuestiÃ³n de minutos, resolvieron nuestro problema. Cuando llegÃ³ el momento de pagarles, nos dijeron que unos sÃ¡ndwiches eran mÃ¡s que suficiente.

La primera temporada consta de 8 capÃ­tulos de aproximadamente 30 minutos, en los que los problemas maritales, de cultura e idioma entran en juego. Para esta segunda entrega, los Schneider decidieron hablar sobre el rol de la mujer en la familia y lo que sucede cuando Ã©sta se convierte en el sostÃ©n y empieza a tener mÃ¡s fama que el mismÃ­smo actor de Hollywood.

"La serie es una exageraciÃ³n de nosotros. Tiene toques de realidad pero no mucho. Va mÃ¡s por el objetivo de entretener a la gente. Ni yo soy una intensa con Rob, ni Rob es un egocÃ©ntrico como se muestra en la serie", dijo Maya.

En cada capÃ­tulo, el matrimonio logra combinar el humor mexicano con el estadounidense, dejÃ¡ndole al televidente una serie de chistes "negros" que, a veces, pueden incomodar. Pero es parte del plan.

"Los dos escribimos la serie, asÃ­ que encontrar el punto medio entre la comedia estadounidense, que es muy fÃ­sico, y el toque se humor sarcÃ¡stico", seÃ±ala la actriz.

AdemÃ¡s de mostrar un poco de su matrimonio y su dÃ­a a dÃ­a, la pareja quiere realmente romper los estereotipos que existen sobre la fama. "Yo pienso que muchas familias se pueden identificar con nosotros. Esos detalles de pareja, como cuando tienes un hijo y no te ayuda el otro".

Rob Schneider y Patricia Maya Schneider

HuffPost: Patricia, vemos que en Estados Unidos firmas como "Patricia Maya Schneider" y en MÃ©xico como "Patricia Maya", a ti Â¿cÃ³mo te gustarÃ­a que te identificaran?

Maya: En esta segunda temporada, firmo como Patricia Maya Scheider, y lo hago porque me gustarÃ­a que la gente me empezara a conocer como Patricia Maya. Y no porque no quiera que sepan que Rob es mi esposo, al contrario, Â¡estoy muy orgullosa de serlo! Pero, siento que hay personas que piensan que Rob me estÃ¡ haciendo un favor en ponerme en la serie. Me quitan valor. Y no se dan cuenta que escribo, produjo e invertÃ­ dinero en este programa. En la primera temporada hay quienes me seÃ±alaban como "la esposa de Rob", por eso es que en esta, quiero que me conozcan por quien soy.

AdemÃ¡s de escribir y actuar en Real Rob, Maya estÃ¡ elaborando un guiÃ³n para hacer una pelÃ­cula enfocada 100% en mujeres, la cual desea empezar a filmar en 2018. AsÃ­ como otro guiÃ³n sobre una mujer poderosa, "yo quiero enaltecer a las mujeres", recalcÃ³.

HuffPost: Con tantas series que hay en Netflix, Â¿cÃ³mo le hacen para destacar y que la gente los vea?

Maya: La ventaja que tiene Netflix es que cuentan con un algoritmo tan preciso y bueno, que si la gente ve comedia, les va a aparecer Real Rob. Ahora, si te fijas, no hay muchas comedias porque es un gÃ©nero que no es para todos. AdemÃ¡s, pienso que cada serie y producto tiene su mercado, Â¡imagÃ­nate! Es una plataforma que llega a mÃ¡s de 190 paÃ­ses, yo creo que en algunos, querrÃ¡n vernos (risas).
TITLE: Patricia Maya Scheider, la mujer detrÃ¡s del Ã©xito de 'Real Rob'

"Der Anteil der BÃ¼rger, die mit einer Jamaika-Koalition rechnen, ist Anfang November im Vergleich zu Mitte Oktober um acht Prozentpunkte zurÃ¼ckgegangen", entgegnet jedoch Forsa-Chef Prof. Manfred GÃ¼llner gegenÃ¼ber der Mediengruppe RTL, wie der Nachrichtensender n-tv berichtet.

"Dennoch setzt nach wie vor eine deutliche Mehrheit auf das Jamaika-BÃ¼ndnis, weil das allein â€“ nach der Regierungs-Verweigerung der SPD â€“ dem WÃ¤hlerwillen entspricht", sagte GÃ¼llner.

GroÃŸes Interesse an den Sondierungen

Laut n-tv haben in der aktuellen Forsa-Umfrage 50 Prozent der BevÃ¶lkerung ein groÃŸes Interesse an den SondierungsgesprÃ¤chen zwischen Union, FDP und GrÃ¼nen.

Dabei gebe es keine nennenswerten Differenzen zwischen den Partei-AnhÃ¤ngern. Nur die NichtwÃ¤hler seien nicht wirklich interessiert: 24 Prozent von ihnen hielten die KoalitionsgesprÃ¤che fÃ¼r wichtig.

Keine Unterschiede zwischen Umfrage und Wahlergebnis

Bei einem Scheitern der Koalitionsverhandlungen stÃ¤nden voraussichtlich Neuwahlen an, die SPD will auch dann keine Koalition mit der Union eingehen. Zum aktuellen Zeitpunkt wÃ¼rden Neuwahlen wenig an der Zusammensetzung des Bundestags Ã¤ndern.

Lediglich die GrÃ¼nen, die der Umfrage nach auf 10 Prozent kommen, wÃ¼rden mehr als einen Prozentpunkt hinzugewinnen.

Sonntagsfrage zur Bundestagswahl â€¢ Forsa fÃ¼r RTL/n-tv: CDU/CSU 32%, SPD 21%, AfD 12%, FDP 11%, GRÃœ 10%, LIN 9%, â€¦ https://t.co/Mniu5kTT1u pic.twitter.com/YnSbvPI4RF â€” Wahlrecht.de (@Wahlrecht_de) 6. November 2017

"Die Wahlberechtigten sehen keinen Grund, ihre Entscheidung neu zu Ã¼berdenken"

GÃ¼llner sagte dazu gegenÃ¼ber n-tv: "Eine Wahlentscheidung ist deshalb nicht einfach, weil ja kaum jemand â€“ auch nicht die meisten Mitglieder einer Partei â€“ hundertprozentig mit allen Vorstellungen einer Partei Ã¼bereinstimmt. Bei der Stimmabgabe aber muss man sich fÃ¼r eine Partei entscheiden â€“ also eine 'Hundertprozent-Entscheidung' treffen.â€

Nachdem die Wahlberechtigten ihre Entscheidung im September gefÃ¤llt hÃ¤tten, sÃ¤hen sie keinen Grund, ihre Entscheidung neu zu Ã¼berdenken - zumal sich das Erscheinungsbild der einzelnen Parteien seit dem 24. September nicht geÃ¤ndert habe.

â€œKÃ¤me es deshalb heute zu Neuwahlen des Bundestags, wÃ¼rde sich das Ergebnis nur in Nuancen vom Wahlergebnis im September unterscheiden."

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: In einem Interview offenbart JÃ¼rgen Trittin, wie bizarr es bei den Jamaika-Verhandlungen zugeht

SUMMARY:
The Fourways branch of Cubana nightclub was fined for breaking the Gauteng Liquor Act on the night former deputy minister Mduduzi Manana assaulted three women there.
Of the R200,000, R150,000 has been suspended for five years, explained Gauteng economic development MEC Lebogang Maile's spokesperson Castro Ngobese.
The board will also make a decision whether to withdraw their licence or not," Ngobese said.
Cubana contravened the Gauteng Liquor Act by selling alcohol outside of the legal hours, which are between 8am and 2am, Ngobese said.
After pleading guilty, Manana was convicted of three counts of assault with the intent to do grievous bodily harm.
TEXT:
The Fourways branch of Cubana nightclub was fined for breaking the Gauteng Liquor Act on the night former deputy minister Mduduzi Manana assaulted three women there.

Following an incident in August 2017 during which Mduduzi Manana, a former deputy higher education and training minister, assaulted three women in the early hours of the morning at the Fourways branch of the Cubana nightclub, the Gauteng Liquor Board has now fined the branch R200,000 for serving alcohol after the official cut-off of 2am.

Of the R200,000, R150,000 has been suspended for five years, explained Gauteng economic development MEC Lebogang Maile's spokesperson Castro Ngobese.

"If a similar offence is committed during the five years, the R150,000 will be upheld. The board will also make a decision whether to withdraw their licence or not," Ngobese said.

Cubana contravened the Gauteng Liquor Act by selling alcohol outside of the legal hours, which are between 8am and 2am, Ngobese said.

After pleading guilty, Manana was convicted of three counts of assault with the intent to do grievous bodily harm. He also stepped down from his government position.

He is expected back in court for sentencing on November 7.

News24
TITLE: Manana Assault: Club Fined R200,000 For Trading After Hours

TEXT:
Si estÃ¡s habituada a pasar noches en vela, no estÃ¡s sola. En general, las mujeres tienden a sufrir mÃ¡s que los hombres de insomnio o problemas para dormir, de acuerdo con un estudio internacional realizado por Calm.

El resultado encontrÃ³ que las mujeres son 40% mÃ¡s proclives a "siempre" dormir mal. La situaciÃ³n empeora cuando se trata de mujeres entre los 45 y 55 aÃ±os (55%).

Existen muchas posibles razones por las que las mujeres tienden a dormir peor que los hombres, dijo el doctor Steve Orma, autor del libro Stop Worrying and Go To Sleep.

"Una de ellas son las hormonas â€“como estrÃ³geno y progesteronaâ€“, que varÃ­an mÃ¡s en las mujeres. Esas variaciones pueden causar incomodidad fÃ­sica, que puede alterar el sueÃ±o", agregÃ³ al especialista, de acuerdo con un comunicado de Calm.

6 razones por las que las mujeres duermen mal

Aunque las hormonas podrÃ­an ser la principal causa de los problemas de sueÃ±o, existen otros factores que van de lo fÃ­sico a lo emocional:

Mayores fluctuaciones en las hormonas como el estrÃ³geno y la progesterona, que causan malestar.

La ansiedad y la depresiÃ³n son dos veces mÃ¡s comunes en las mujeres que en los hombres.

El embarazo y la incomodidad asociada.

El sÃ­ndrome de piernas inquietas: las mujeres lo padecen mÃ¡s.

La menopausia trae mÃ¡s fluctuaciones hormonales, sofocos.

Consejos para dormir mejor

Lo principal es identificar las causas de los problemas para dormir.

De acuerdo con Orma, consultar a un especialista es clave para determinar si la causa es psicolÃ³gica o biolÃ³gica u hormonal. Un mÃ©dico podrÃ­a solicitar una serie de estudios para descartar causas fÃ­sicas.

En caso de que las razones sean psicolÃ³gicas, buscar a un psicoterapia, de preferencia cognitivoâ€“conductual.

Finalmente, estar consciente de que para dormir mejor se necesitan buenos hÃ¡bito e incluso una alimentaciÃ³n sana.
TITLE: Estas son las razones por las que las mujeres tenemos mÃ¡s problemas para dormir

Nur als ich Opfer einer Sexualstraftat wurde, hab ich es nicht mehr alleine geschafft. Auch wegen des Verhaltens der Menschen um mich herum danach. Bloggerin und Studentin

Ich bin dunkelhÃ¤utig und Deutsche - trotzdem werde ich oft wie eine Fremde behandelt Meine Mama kommt aus Deutschland, mein Papa kommt aus Ghana und ich komme aus Berlin. Ich bin dunkelhÃ¤utig und Deutsche. Trotzdem muss ich mich jeden Tag fragen: Was ist eigentlich euer Problem mit mir? Berlinerin

Verschleppt, gefoltert und zum Islam gezwungen: Wie ich in Gefangenschaft der al Nusra-Terroristen geriet Ein Ã¤lterer Mann war gerade dabei, den Kofferraum zu Ã¶ffnen. Rechts neben dem Auto stand eine junge Frau, vielleicht seine Tochter, mit einem Kopftuch. Auf beide waren Gewehre gerichtet. Ich war direkt in einen Ãœberfall geraten. Jurist bei den Vereinten Nationen

Mein Sohn kam mit einer Meningitis auf die Welt - jeder sollte dieses Symptom kennen Als mein Sohn Oscar drei Stunden alt war, begann er zu glucksen. Die Hebamme kam herein, um nachzusehen, wie es uns beiden ging. Da erzÃ¤hlte ich ihr glÃ¼cklich, dass Oscar bereits lachte. Die Hebamme nahm ihn mir sofort aus dem Arm und drÃ¼ckte den NotfallauslÃ¶ser.

Warum mir niemand glaubt, dass mein Exfreund mir gegenÃ¼ber gewalttÃ¤tig war Die Wahrheit ist: Mein Exfreund war mir gegenÃ¼ber gewalttÃ¤tig. Dennoch begegnet mir nahezu jede Person, der ich davon erzÃ¤hle, mit Zweifeln. Sie denken, dass ich Ã¼bertreibe oder lÃ¼ge, wenn ich berichte, was er mir angetan hat. Autorin

Vor 15 Jahren habe ich aufgehÃ¶rt zu arbeiten und wurde Taubenmann - jetzt bin ich berÃ¼hmt Die Tauben im Park erkennen mich sofort, wenn sie mich sehen. In Scharen kommen sie auf mich zugeflogen und setzen sich auf meinen Kopf und meine Schultern. Deshalb nennen die Leute in New York mich nur noch "Paul, den Taubenmann".

Wie das Jobcenter einer Frau wegen 28 Euro MieterhÃ¶hung das Leben zur HÃ¶lle gemacht hat Die KlÃ¤gerin lebte als Mieterin seit Oktober 1998 in einer Wohnung in Hemer. Diese Wohnung war mit 331,50 Euro Warmmiete angemessen und entsprach den Vorgaben des MÃ¤rkischen Kreises. Aber nach 15 Jahren machte der Vermieter nur Tage spÃ¤ter eine Mietanpassung an "den Ã¶rtlichen Mietspiegel" ab dem 01.12.2013 geltend. GrÃ¼ndungsmitglied von aufRECHT e.V, Hartz-IV-EmpfÃ¤nger

TEXT:
David Fisher/REX/Shutterstock Aston Merrygold

With Craig voting to axe Aston and fellow judges Darcey Bussell and Bruno Tonioli opting to keep him in, it was new Head Judge Shirley Ballas who cast the deciding vote, giving the former JLS singer his marching orders. The result was met with a backlash on social media, with many naming it the most shocking exit in â€˜Strictlyâ€™ history, and one of the showâ€™s former experts Alesha was particularly unhappy with the way things transpired.

FeatureflashSHM/REX/Shutterstock ï»¿Alesha Dixon

Venting on her Twitter page, she said that had Craig not given Aston such a low score for his routine the previous night, he probably wouldnâ€™t have wound up in the bottom two at all. She fumed: â€œCraig giving Aston a 4 basically put the nail in the coffin! Ridiculous! Canâ€™t believe one of the best dancers has left so soon!!!

Craig giving Aston a 4 basically put the nail in the coffin! Ridiculous! Can't believe one of the best dancers has left so soon!!! #Strictly â€” Alesha Dixon (@AleshaOfficial) November 5, 2017

Shortly after his exit aired, Aston - who had been a favourite to win the show prior to his departure - posted a statement on his Instagram page, insisting that he had no hard feelings about bowing out so early.

He wrote: â€œThank you so much for letting me be apart of such a great year Iâ€™ve made some amazing new homies!! Class of 17 you are all f***ing brilliant.â€

A post shared by AM (@astonmerrygold) on Nov 5, 2017 at 12:36pm PST

This weekendâ€™s live show also saw Debbie McGee make â€˜Strictlyâ€™ history with her Tango routine, as she and Giovanni Pernice bagged the earliest perfect score in the showâ€™s 15 series. The remaining nine couples will return to the â€˜Strictlyâ€™ dance floor on Saturday night (4 November) on BBC One.
TITLE: 'Strictly Come Dancing': Alesha Dixon Blasts Craig Revel Horwood As Aston Merrygold Leaves Competition

TEXT:
LONDON, ENGLAND - OCTOBER 24: Queen Elizabeth II during an official visit to the Household Cavalry Mounted Regiment at Hyde Park on October 24, 2017 in London, England. (Photo by Chris Jackson/Getty Images)

ADVERTISEMENT

US Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross has business ties to a shipping firm linked to Vladimir Putin's inner circle, according to a vast leak of financial documents that also revealed Britain's Queen Elizabeth II's investments in tax havens.

It was also revealed that Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's top fundraiser and senior advisor Stephen Bronfman, heir to the Seagram fortune, moved some USD 60 million to offshore tax havens with ex-senator Leo Kolber.

The findings have emerged as part of the Paradise Papers released by the US-based International Consortium of Investigative Journalists (ICIJ), which was behind the Panama Papers made public last year.

There is no suggestion that Ross, Bronfman or the Queen's private estate acted illegally. But Ross's ties to Russian entities raise questions over potential conflicts of interest, and whether they undermine Washington's sanctions on Moscow.

The revelations about Bronfman could spell trouble for Trudeau, who was elected two years ago riding on the coattails of promises to reduce economic inequality and tax avoidance.

In the case of Queen Elizabeth's private estate, critics may question whether it is appropriate for the British head of state to invest in offshore tax havens.

Ross, a billionaire investor, holds a 31 per cent stake in Navigator Holdings through a complex web of offshore investments detailed in the documents examined by nearly 100 news organisations as part of an international collaboration. The 79-year-old reduced his stake when he took public office, according to public filings.

Navigator Holdings runs a lucrative partnership with Russian energy giant Sibur, which is partially owned by Putin's son-in-law Kirill Shamalov and Gennady Timchenko, the Russian president's friend and business partner who is subject to US sanctions.

The US imposed sanctions on Russian entities and individuals following its annexation of Crimea and aggression in Ukraine.

Ross's private equity firm has been the biggest shareholder in Navigator. His personal share of the firm's stake was reduced when he took office in February, but the commerce chief's investment is still valued at between USD 2 million to USD 10 million, according to his security filings and government ethics disclosure.

The New York Times reported that Ross's stake in Navigator has been held by companies in the Cayman Islands. His wealth, estimated to exceed USD 2 billion, is said to be tied to similar arrangements in various tax havens like the Cayman Islands. "Secretary Ross was not involved with Navigator's decision to engage in business with Sibur, a publicly traded company, which was not under sanction at the time and is not currently," said James Rockas, a Commerce Department spokesman.

"Moreover, Secretary Ross has never met the Sibur shareholders referenced in this story and, until now, did not know of their relationship."

The documents also show around 10 million pounds (USD 13 million) of the Queen's private money was placed in funds held in the Cayman Islands and Bermuda, first reported in Britain by the BBC and the Guardian newspaper.

They reported the funds reinvested the money in an array of businesses, including controversial rent-to-buy retailer BrightHouse, which has been accused of exploiting the poor, and a chain of alcohol stores that later went bankrupt.

A spokeswoman for the Duchy of Lancaster, which provides the monarch with an income and handles her investments, said, "All of our investments are fully audited and legitimate."

"We operate a number of investments and a few of these are with overseas funds," she added.

The spokeswoman added that one of the fund investments represents only 0.3 per cent of the total value of the Duchy.

The Paradise Papers contain 13.4 million documents mainly from Appleby, an offshore law firm with offices in Bermuda and beyond. The files were first obtained by the German newspaper Suddeutsche Zeitung, and shared with the ICIJ and partner media outlets.

Also on HuffPost India:
TITLE: Paradise Papers Leaks Show Queen Elizabeth II's Offshore Investments

Voleva far sorridere sua moglie con una dichiarazione d'amore originale, ma la sua sorpresa Ã¨ stata rovinata da un tweet della polizia locale.
Il vero autore del gesto, intanto, era ignaro del clamore che aveva suscitato la sua dichiarazione d'amore.
Solo il giorno dopo, il 3 novembre 2017, Murray ha capito che il suo gesto aveva suscitato clamore.
Volevo mostrarle che non sono cosÃ¬ burbero come appaio all'esterno e che la amo veramente".
Quanto alla reazione di sua moglie, il figlio della coppia ha detto che Ã¨ rimasta "alquanto sorpresa".
TEXT:
Voleva far sorridere sua moglie con una dichiarazione d'amore originale, ma la sua sorpresa Ã¨ stata rovinata da un tweet della polizia locale. Murray Graham, un contadino dell'Oxfordshire, in Inghilterra, per stupire la compagna della sua vita aveva pensato di 'incidere' il suo nome, a caratteri cubitali, su un prato. Ha preso il diserbante e, con pazienza, ha fatto in modo che al posto dell'erba comparisse la scritta "Sue", con una "x" accanto. La singolare incisione, perÃ², come racconta The Telegraph Ã¨ stata notata dalla polizia locale che sorvolava l'area con un elicottero.

A tutto hanno pensato gli agenti, tranne ad una dichiarazione d'amore. PoichÃ© non riuscivano a dare una risposta al mistero della scritta sull'erba hanno pensato di postare la foto su Twitter, chiedendo agli utenti di aiutarli a trovare una soluzione.

Does anyone know Sue just south of #Tetsworth, the other side of the M40?! #WhoIsSue #p1526 pic.twitter.com/OhBIVqbyey â€” NPAS Benson (@NPASBenson) 2 novembre 2017

"Qualcuno conosce Sue?", hanno domandato al popolo del web. Insieme alla foto, hanno lanciato l'hashtag #WhoIsSue - "Chi Ã¨ Sue?". Le risposte degli utenti sono state le piÃ¹ disparate: c'era chi faceva riferimento ad un sottomarino chiamato Suex e si chiedeva se non si dovesse seguire questa pista. Alcuni poi erano convinti che si trattasse di un messaggio degli alieni.

Those aliens are getting ever more sophisticated! â€” Karz Sheppard (@karz_05) 2 novembre 2017

"Questi alieni diventano sempre piÃ¹ sofisticati", ha sostenuto un utente. Il vero autore del gesto, intanto, era ignaro del clamore che aveva suscitato la sua dichiarazione d'amore. E anche Sue, la protagonista del 'mistero', non aveva ancora avuto modo di vedere la scritta. Entrambi il giorno in cui l'immagine Ã¨ stata diffusa erano a lavoro e non avevano i loro telefoni cellulari con loro; come ha spiegato il figlio, era quindi impossibile raggiungerli. Solo il giorno dopo, il 3 novembre 2017, Murray ha capito che il suo gesto aveva suscitato clamore.

Intervistato da The Telegraph ha raccontato come Ã¨ nata questa idea: "Mi era rimasto del diserbante ed ho pensato di utilizzarlo per far sorridere la mia donna. Volevo mostrarle che non sono cosÃ¬ burbero come appaio all'esterno e che la amo veramente". CosÃ¬, Murray ha iniziato a cospargere l'area di disserbante, consapevole che i risultati non sarebbero apparsi subito: era necessario, infatti, che l'erba attorno al perimetro delle lettere crescesse perchÃ© queste potessero essere ben visibili.

Peccato, perÃ², che prima che la sua Sue potesse accorgersi della sorpresa e ringraziarlo, l'immagine Ã¨ diventata molto piÃ¹ popolare di quello che lui potesse pensare: "Sono un po' sorpreso - ha confessato e, facendo probabilmente riferimento a chi insinuava che quella scritta l'avessero fatta gli alieni - non immaginavo che questo gesto avrebbe avuto risonanza nazionale, internazionale o addirittura intergalattico!".

Quanto alla reazione di sua moglie, il figlio della coppia ha detto che Ã¨ rimasta "alquanto sorpresa".

Vole
TITLE: Scrive il nome della moglie su un campo per farle una dichiarazione d'amore, ma la polizia gli rovina la sorpresa

Das anstehende BabyglÃ¼ck ist die KrÃ¶nung einer groÃŸen Lovestory:Die Serie "Der Landarzt" mit Wayne Carpendale in der Hauptrolle kÃ¶nnen Sie hier auf DVD bestellenDrum prÃ¼fe...
Im Dezember 2011 verlobten sich Annemarie Warnkross, wie sie damals noch hieÃŸ, und der Sohn des sÃ¼dafrikanischen Schlagerstars Howard Carpendale (71).
Warnkross und Carpendale Junior waren aber auch zuvor schon jeweils mit prominenten Partnern zusammen.
Bleibt abzuwarten, wie viele Schwangerschaftsnews die beiden auf ihren Accounts mit den zusammen um die eine Millionen Fans teilen werden...
TEXT:
Was fÃ¼r eine schÃ¶ne Ãœberraschung! Moderatorin Annemarie Carpendale (40) und ihr Ehemann, der Schauspieler Howard Carpendale (40), werden Eltern. Am Sonntag gaben sie die freudige Nachricht in witzigen Posts via Social Media bekannt: "...mein Mann meint, er hÃ¤tte den dickeren.... ich wette in den nÃ¤chsten Monaten DAGEGEN #threesome #mini #happyus #luckyme", schrieb sie und er: "Noch gewinn ich die Dickbauch-Challenge...NOCH #minicarpendale on the way #lovemywife". Das anstehende BabyglÃ¼ck ist die KrÃ¶nung einer groÃŸen Lovestory:

Die Serie "Der Landarzt" mit Wayne Carpendale in der Hauptrolle kÃ¶nnen Sie hier auf DVD bestellen

Drum prÃ¼fe...

Drum prÃ¼fe, wer sich ewig bindet... Das gilt fÃ¼r dieses Paar im Besonderen, denn die beiden sind seit November 2007 ein Paar. Schon lange zehn Jahre hÃ¤lt diese Liebe also. Im Dezember 2011 verlobten sich Annemarie Warnkross, wie sie damals noch hieÃŸ, und der Sohn des sÃ¼dafrikanischen Schlagerstars Howard Carpendale (71). Ihre persÃ¶nliche Traumhochzeit feierten sie dann im September 2013 auf Ibiza.

Warnkross und Carpendale Junior waren aber auch zuvor schon jeweils mit prominenten Partnern zusammen. WÃ¤hrend die gebÃ¼rtige Hannoveranerin von 2002 bis 2004 mit Comedian Oliver Pocher (39) liiert war, schaffte es der in NRW geborene KÃ¼nstler immerhin auf eine dreijÃ¤hrige Beziehung mit Kollegin Yvonne Catterfeld (37).

Auch beruflich zusammengewachsen

Auch beruflich ist das Traumpaar inzwischen zusammengewachsen. Seit 2016 moderieren Annemarie und Wayne Carpendale gemeinsam "Ran an den Mann" (Sat.1). Zuvor spielte er vor allem in Serien, Reihen und Soaps wie "Unter uns" (2000-2001), "Unser Charly" (2005-2007), " Sturm der Liebe" (2006-2008), "Der Landarzt" (2009-2013), "Mord in bester Gesellschaft" (2013-2015) oder "Heldt" (2015-2016).

Die Ã¶ffentliche Karriere von Annemarie Warnkross begann als TÃ¤nzerin von Bellini ("Brazil"). Von 2000 bis 2005 war sie Mitglied der Pop-Gruppe. Danach konzentrierte sie sich auf Moderation, Modeln und das Studium. Seit 2005 fÃ¼hrt sie durch die Magazine "taff" und "red!" - kurz vor der Sendung zeigt sie ihren Fans regelmÃ¤ÃŸig, welches sexy Outfit sie diesmal wieder tragen wird.

Social-Media-Traumpaar

Apropos: Als Social-Media-Stars sind die Carpendales eines der Promi-Traumpaare, denen man gerne folgt, denn sie sind immer fÃ¼r einen Scherz gut. Und meistens lohnt es sich, beide Accounts anzusehen, denn die Posts beziehen sich oft aufeinander. Bleibt abzuwarten, wie viele Schwangerschaftsnews die beiden auf ihren Accounts mit den zusammen um die eine Millionen Fans teilen werden...
TITLE: Annemarie und Wayne Carpendale werden Eltern - es ist aber nur ein HÃ¶hepunkt ihrer Liebe

SUMMARY:
O'Hara and Single Gaze had a competition to see who could do the widest smile.
Afterwards, you'd never have dreamed that jockey Kathy O'Hara and chestnut mare Single Gaze would be lining up as serious chances in the Melbourne Cup.
It cannoned into another horse, Happy Hannah, which in turn struck Single Gaze.
Two wins and a string of consistent results followed, highlighted by a close-up second in traditional Melbourne Cup lead-up, the Caulfield Cup, in October.
So much â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ A post shared by Kathy Ohara (@kathy_ohara) on Oct 21, 2017 at 3:07am PDTReally, really great mates.
TEXT:
O'Hara and Single Gaze had a competition to see who could do the widest smile. It was a dead heat.

It was the most awful moment. Afterwards, you'd never have dreamed that jockey Kathy O'Hara and chestnut mare Single Gaze would be lining up as serious chances in the Melbourne Cup. But here they are.

The fall happened in April, 2016. Coming round the home turn of the Australian Oaks at Sydney's Randwick Racecourse, top jockey Kathy O'Hara peeled to the outside of the field aboard Single Gaze to make her run.

That's when it happened. In one of those horrible moments which you can file under "that's racing" rather than negligence, jockey Damien Oliver pushed his mount Jameka wide to make its run. It cannoned into another horse, Happy Hannah, which in turn struck Single Gaze.

Down they went.

There were huge initial fears for both horse and rider. O'Hara suffered concussion, and later underwent surgery that night for a collapsed lung. The horse, thankfully, was OK.

Even in her semi-conscious state, as she lay on the Randwick turf, all O'Hara could say to trainer Nick Olive was "Nick, Nick, how's the horse?"

It took until February this year for Single Gaze to race again. Canberra-based trainer Nick Olive extended the olive branch to O'Hara and reunited the duo. Two wins and a string of consistent results followed, highlighted by a close-up second in traditional Melbourne Cup lead-up, the Caulfield Cup, in October.

"She went sensational. She gave everything and I'm so proud of her. She's so tough," O'Hara said after that race.

Jockeys often switch between horses on a race-to-race basis. But when they stick, they often form a close bond. These two have now raced 23 times together, and as you'd imagine, they're great mates.

So much â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ A post shared by Kathy Ohara (@kathy_ohara) on Oct 21, 2017 at 3:07am PDT

Really, really great mates.

Good luck kiss ğŸ˜˜ A post shared by Kathy Ohara (@kathy_ohara) on Oct 12, 2017 at 10:24pm PDT

Onwards, then, to the Melbourne Cup, where Single Gaze will line up as a 40-1 outsider. It's not that there's anything wrong with its form. It's just that there are several hard-fit gallopers who've been running on the big stage for a while now.

Single Gaze may not quite have their class, but she's definitely got the guts.

O'Hara, meanwhile, will try to become the second female jockey after Michelle Payne to win Australia's greatest race. The Sydney-based 31-year-old has been riding professionally for 15 years. In that time she's notched up almost 800 winners, including 215 in Sydney.

O'Hara is in hot form too, having ridden three of the eight winners at the most recent Sydney race meeting just last weekend.

She's never won a race in Melbourne but hey, why not start with the one everyone will remember?
TITLE: The Amazing Fall, Crash And Recovery Of Melbourne Cup Duo Kathy O'Hara And Single Gaze

SUMMARY:
This week, one of oldest figures in politics, Mangosuthu Buthelezi, announced that he will not be contesting the Inkatha Freedom Party leadership at the IFP's next conference.
Meanwhile, ANC Treasury Zweli Mkhize took the hot seat at #702Townhall, as part of his campaign for the ANC presidency.
MANGOSUTHU BUTHELEZI IS STEPPING ASIDE: Inkatha Freedom Party leader Mangosuthu Buthelezi will not be contesting the next IFP conference.
ZWELI MKHIZE BEING CLEAR ABOUT UNITY: ANC presidential candidate Zweli Mkhize was invited to the #702TownHall to answer questions about the way he plans to lead the ANC, should he win in December.
EATING RIGHT CAN SAVE YOUR LIFE: Studies done on diets showcase how some diets might actually be bad for you.
TEXT:
This week, one of oldest figures in politics, Mangosuthu Buthelezi, announced that he will not be contesting the Inkatha Freedom Party leadership at the IFP's next conference. Meanwhile, ANC Treasury Zweli Mkhize took the hot seat at #702Townhall, as part of his campaign for the ANC presidency.

We also had the opportunity to sit down with business owner Nonku Ntshona, who gave us insight into some of the challenges she faces in a male-dominated industry, and as the new month kicks in, we looked into how emotional eating can affect a person.

1. MANGOSUTHU BUTHELEZI IS STEPPING ASIDE: Inkatha Freedom Party leader Mangosuthu Buthelezi will not be contesting the next IFP conference. Buthelezi has been the leader of the party since 1975. Here is a look at his life... READ MORE.





2. BUILDING A PATH FOR WOMEN: Nonku Ntshona, Managing Director of Nonku and Associates, is taking on the challenges of being a female in the quantity surveying industry, and she's making it work. READ MORE.

3. ZWELI MKHIZE BEING CLEAR ABOUT UNITY: ANC presidential candidate Zweli Mkhize was invited to the #702TownHall to answer questions about the way he plans to lead the ANC, should he win in December. READ MORE.

4. EATING RIGHT CAN SAVE YOUR LIFE: Studies done on diets showcase how some diets might actually be bad for you. We sat down with Ashley Gibbon from Dieticians at Work, to help us understand the fad diets out there and how they can affect you. READ MORE.

5: ANELE MDODA BRINGS BACK THE LAUGHS: Anele Mdoda, the host of "Real Talk With Anele" on SABC3, recently started shooting the third season of her show. We had an opportunity to sit down with her and pick her brain on a few things.
TITLE: Editor's Choice: HuffPost's Best Videos Of The Week That Was

SUMMARY:
El mundo de entretenimiento y el de la polÃ­tica estÃ¡n en el ojo del huracÃ¡n por acusaciones de acoso sexual.
Uno de los hallazgos del reporte es que "los perpetradores de acoso sexual son a menudo terceras partes.
TambiÃ©n es frecuente en empleos en que los trabajadores tratan con clientes que podrÃ­an estar bajo los efectos del alcohol, pues a menudo los clientes se sienten con derecho de abordarlos.
A Parsons no sÃ³lo lo buscan mujeres para ayuda en acoso sexual.
Cada vez que llega una nueva queja decimos: 'Ah, ahora es un caso en una industria en la que no se habÃ­a visto... pero, Â¿por quÃ© me sorprende?'"
TEXT:
El mundo de entretenimiento y el de la polÃ­tica estÃ¡n en el ojo del huracÃ¡n por acusaciones de acoso sexual. Sin embargo, los empleados de menor jerarquÃ­a y aquellos que tienen "contratos" laborales precarios en otros sectores son menos propensos a seÃ±alar los abusos debido al temor de perder sus trabajos, dicen expertos.

La dinÃ¡mica del poder en los ataques sexuales y el patrÃ³n para los depredadores para escoger a sus vÃ­ctimas, quienes no siempre conocen sus derechos, derivan en que trabajadores del sector hospitalario y el turismo, asÃ­ como a trabajadores con contratos temporales, enfrenten retos adicionales cuando se trata del acoso sexual.

"Uno no siempre conoce a un empleado de limpieza, o que aÃºn no estÃ¡ en la "nÃ³mina", que piense: 'JÃ³danse todos, al fin que no necesito este trabajo'. De hecho, viven escenarios completamente opuestos, en los que mÃ¡s bien suelen pensar: 'HarÃ© lo que sea por este trabajo, por favor dÃ©jeme quedarme'", dijo a HuffPost UK, Michael Newman, especialista de leyes de discriminaciÃ³n y empleo de la firma legal Leigh Day.

De acuerdo con un reporte del Trade Union Congress (TUC) del aÃ±o pasado sobre el acoso sexual, 67% de las mujeres en la industria de la hospitalidad y el entretenimiento informaron ser vÃ­ctimas de acoso sexual, contra un promedio general de 52%.

Uno de los hallazgos del reporte es que "los perpetradores de acoso sexual son a menudo terceras partes. Las mujeres que trabajan en industrias como la de ventas minoristas, hospitalidad, cuidados de la salud, hospitales, transportes y muchas otras mÃ¡s; asÃ­ que lidian con clientes, pacientes y consumidores cotidianamente y tienen poca protecciÃ³n por parte de sus patrones cuando experimentan acoso. Implementar medidas para que los jefes tomen acciones cuando un empleado haya sido vÃ­ctima de acoso por una tercera persona podrÃ­a ser un paso importante para atacar este delito en los centros de trabajo".

Ya sea al rodar pelÃ­culas o atender un bar, los hombres poderosos ven a las mujeres, y en algunos casos a hombres, como un objetivo que muy probablemente no harÃ¡ nada al respecto si ellos deciden traspasarse de alguna forma.

Los expertos sugieren que es mÃ¡s frecuente observar una cultura del silencio en aquellos que son vulnerables financieramente, o que corren mÃ¡s en riesgo de perder sus empleos, generalmente sienten que no pueden reportar que han sido vÃ­ctimas de acoso sexual.

El acoso sexual estÃ¡ muy relacionado con la dinÃ¡mica del poder.

Scarlet Harris, directora de estrategias y desarrollo del TUC; dijo al HuffPost UK que "Es un hecho que las mujeres mÃ¡s jÃ³venes estÃ¡n mÃ¡s expuestas al acoso sexual y creo que es justo decir que mientras mÃ¡s inferior sea tu puesto en una organizaciÃ³n, mÃ¡s expuesta estÃ¡s a experimentar acoso sexual debido a esa dinÃ¡mica del poder".

Desde octubre, hemos visto una avalancha de acusaciones de acoso sexual que se han hecho en contra del productor cinematogrÃ¡fico, Harvey Weinstein, a las vertidas la semana pasada en Westminster en torno a que miembros del Parlamento han sido involucrados en reclamos de acoso sexual.

Danielle Parsons, una abogada laboral en la firma Slater & Gordon, dice que, a pesar de que no hay una industria inmune al acoso sexual, los miembros mÃ¡s jÃ³venes y en puestos mÃ¡s bajos de un equipo estÃ¡n mÃ¡s expuestos a dicho acoso debido a la dinÃ¡mica del poder.

Â¿En dÃ³nde ocurre el acoso laboral?

De acuerdo con Parsons, Ã©ste puede puede ocurrir en diversas industrias, pero generalmente sucede mÃ¡s donde existe la dinÃ¡mica de tener a alguien en una posiciÃ³n de poder y a otra de menor rango reportÃ¡ndole.

Harris aÃ±adiÃ³ que, a pesar de que el acoso sexual se ve "absolutamente en todos lados", aquellas personas con empleos temporales y los que tienen contratos por proyecto enfrentan mÃ¡s dificultades al reportar casos de acoso.

Esto se debe a que, por la naturaleza de los empleos temporales, los trabajadores se mueven en muchas organizaciones, por lo que a menudo se encuentran en lugares de trabajo en donde no conocen a nadie, no conocen las reglas corporativas y no saben a quiÃ©n reportar los casos de acoso.

"Los perpetradores de acoso sexual suelen ser muy buenos en enfocarse en la persona que aparentemente sea menos capaz de lidiar con ellos; son expertos en detectar a alguien muy vulnerable y los cazarÃ¡n debido porque los consideran un blanco fÃ¡cil", dijo Harris.

AdemÃ¡s, los empleados en la industria de la hospitalidad estÃ¡n mÃ¡s expuestos al riesgo del acoso por terceras personas.

Los puestos en este rubro pueden incluir a empleados de restaurantes y bares, asÃ­ como recepcionistas. TambiÃ©n es frecuente en empleos en que los trabajadores tratan con clientes que podrÃ­an estar bajo los efectos del alcohol, pues a menudo los clientes se sienten con derecho de abordarlos.

El acoso sexual tambiÃ©n puede ser un factor de "humillaciÃ³n para las vÃ­ctimas", dice Parsons, y se puede manifestar de diversas formas, como el bullying, la intimidaciÃ³n o el comportamiento ofensivo.

A Parsons no sÃ³lo lo buscan mujeres para ayuda en acoso sexual. La abogada dice que en una ocasiÃ³n un asistente masculino la buscÃ³ debido a los "comentarios molestos e invasivos" que su jefe profiriÃ³ en torno a su sexualidad.

Newman asegurÃ³ que, aunque ha visto un incremento en la cifra de clientes que han decidido denunciar en pÃºblico, el problema "no parece mejorar".

"No he visto una baja en el problema. Es tristemente continuo, lo cual, creo, es un problema", dijo a HuffPost Uk. "Es un flujo continuo y lo seguimos viendo. Cada vez que llega una nueva queja decimos: 'Ah, ahora es un caso en una industria en la que no se habÃ­a visto... pero, Â¿por quÃ© me sorprende?'"

Concuerda con Parsons y Harris en el sentido de que mientras mÃ¡s joven o inexperto sea alguien, estarÃ¡ mÃ¡s expuesta al acoso sexual. "En esos casos, las oportunidades para la explotaciÃ³n son mayores".

Sin embargo, el acoso sexual tambiÃ©n puede darse "de abajo hacia arriba".

Newman admite que quienes buscan su ayuda a menudo tuvieron que llegar al punto en los que contaban con los recursos para quejarse, una opciÃ³n que quizÃ¡ no sea vÃ¡lida para quienes estÃ¡n en posiciones mÃ¡s vulnerables, financiera y profesionalmente.

"Por lo general, cuando te acosan, si quieres permanecer en tu trabajo, lo mÃ¡s probable es que no te quejes", dice Newman. "AsÃ­ que nunca me llegan esos casos. No es el tipo de gente que me busca".

Asegura que la gente a quien no le preocupan los riesgos a sus empleos o su carrera probablemente se sienten asÃ­ porque ya tienen planeado salirse de ese rubro de trabajo, o es gente que ya llegÃ³ a cierto nivel de seguridad en el que tiene mÃ¡s recursos para denunciar.

Los ejemplos de acoso sexual que ha recibido varÃ­an, pero incluyen comentarios soeces, insinuaciones, contacto fÃ­sico y otro tipo de avances, incluyendo conductas sexuales sin consenso.
TITLE: Estos son los empleos en los que las mujeres sufren mayor acoso sexual

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTAfter cars and phones, homes are the next big frontier for technological innovation.
For years, high-tech homes were seen only in cartoons and movies (remember The Jetsons, or the Stark Mansion from Iron Man?).
But as time rolled on, innovations such as flat-screen televisions and voice-controlled assistants have gone from fantasy to reality.
Much of this high-tech wizardry is still in the pipeline, but expected to hit the market soon.
However, there are five amazing innovations that are already transforming our homes.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

After cars and phones, homes are the next big frontier for technological innovation. For years, high-tech homes were seen only in cartoons and movies (remember The Jetsons, or the Stark Mansion from Iron Man?). But as time rolled on, innovations such as flat-screen televisions and voice-controlled assistants have gone from fantasy to reality. And experts say that the fun's only just beginning.

Researchers are moving steadily closer to perfecting innovations that could transform our lives even furtherâ€”from toilets that can diagnose medical problems, to beds that adjust themselves to maximise sleep quality, and robot housekeepers who can dust and clean faster than any human ever could.

Much of this high-tech wizardry is still in the pipeline, but expected to hit the market soon. However, there are five amazing innovations that are already transforming our homes. Check out this video to find out what they are:

As you can see, smart technology is increasingly getting embedded in every aspect of the modern home, from windows to paint, appliances and more. Yet another reason to hang out at home more often!
TITLE: 5 Innovations That Are Making Our Homes Smarter And Safer

SUMMARY:
Actor Ben Affleck poses for photographers at a photo call to promote the film 'Justice League', in London, Nov. 4, 2017.
LONDON â€” Ben Affleck says the storm of sexual harassment allegations engulfing Hollywood has led him to examine his own behaviour.
In an interview Sunday with The Associated Press for the superhero film "Justice League," Affleck said he's "looking at my own behaviour and addressing that and making sure I'm part of the solution."
After condemning Harvey Weinstein's actions last month, Affleck was forced to defend his own conduct.
Another video from 2004 showed Affleck pulling Montreal TV host Anne-Marie Losique onto his lap.
TEXT:
Actor Ben Affleck poses for photographers at a photo call to promote the film 'Justice League', in London, Nov. 4, 2017.

LONDON â€” Ben Affleck says the storm of sexual harassment allegations engulfing Hollywood has led him to examine his own behaviour.

In an interview Sunday with The Associated Press for the superhero film "Justice League," Affleck said he's "looking at my own behaviour and addressing that and making sure I'm part of the solution."

After condemning Harvey Weinstein's actions last month, Affleck was forced to defend his own conduct. He apologized for groping the actress Hilarie Burton on camera in 2003 when she was a host on MTV's "Total Request Live." Another video from 2004 showed Affleck pulling Montreal TV host Anne-Marie Losique onto his lap.

Speaking Sunday, Affleck said two things need to happen, that "more women need to be pushed to power" and that sexual harassment has to also be "a men's issue" where guys call out inappropriate behaviour.
TITLE: Amid Hollywood Sex Allegations, Ben Affleck Wants To Be 'Part Of The Solution'

SUMMARY:
WASHINGTON, Nov 3 (Reuters) - The United States carried out its first air strikes against Islamic State militants in Somalia and killed "several terrorists," the U.S. military said on Friday.
Islamic State has been gathering recruits in the region, although experts say the scale of its force is unclear and it remains a small player compared to the al Shabaab group.
Last month, a group loyal to Islamic State seized a small port town in Somalia's semi-autonomous Puntland region, the first town it has taken since emerging a year ago.
The group, which refers to itself simply as Islamic State, is a rival to the larger al Shabaab force, which is linked to Islamic State's rival al Qaeda and once controlled much of Somalia.
Earlier this year, the White House granted the U.S. military broader authority to carry out strikes in Somalia against al Shabaab.
TEXT:
The strikes were conducted in coordination with Somalia's government.

WASHINGTON, Nov 3 (Reuters) - The United States carried out its first air strikes against Islamic State militants in Somalia and killed "several terrorists," the U.S. military said on Friday.

The Pentagon's Africa Command said the first strike was carried out at midnight local time (2100 GMT, Thursday) and another one at 11 a.m. on Nov. 3.

"Several terrorists" were killed, the military said in a statement, adding that the strikes were conducted in coordination with Somalia's government.

"U.S. forces will continue to use all authorised and appropriate measures to protect Americans and to disable terrorist threats," the statement said.

Islamic State has been gathering recruits in the region, although experts say the scale of its force is unclear and it remains a small player compared to the al Shabaab group.

More than 350 people were killed in suicide bombings last month.

Last month, a group loyal to Islamic State seized a small port town in Somalia's semi-autonomous Puntland region, the first town it has taken since emerging a year ago.

The group, which refers to itself simply as Islamic State, is a rival to the larger al Shabaab force, which is linked to Islamic State's rival al Qaeda and once controlled much of Somalia.

The United States has occasionally carried out strikes against al Shabaab militants in Somalia, which retains a strong presence in parts of the south and center and carries out gun and bomb attacks.

The al Shabaab group aims to drive out the peacekeepers, topple Somalia's Western-backed government and impose its strict version of Islam on the Horn of Africa state.

More than 350 people were killed in twin bombings in the Somali capital Mogadishu last month, the deadliest attack in the country's history.

Earlier this year, the White House granted the U.S. military broader authority to carry out strikes in Somalia against al Shabaab. (Reporting by Idrees Ali; Editing by Frances Kerry and Alistair Bell)
TITLE: U.S. Carries Out First Strikes Against Islamic State In Somalia

SUMMARY:
In the wake of mounting accusations of sexual harassment and assault against actor Kevin Spacey, his publicist and talent agency will no longer represent him, the Los Angeles Times is reporting.
Spacey created a â€œtoxicâ€ work atmosphere, eight current or former employees told CNN.
Several accusations against Spacey have emerged following BuzzFeedâ€™s report last week of an account by actor Anthony Rapp, who alleged that Spacey made an unwanted sexual advance in 1986 when Rapp was just 14.
Spacey said he didnâ€™t remember the encounter, but if it did occur it was likely due to â€œdrunken behavior,â€ and he apologized.
More accusations have been leveled against Spacey in London, where he was the artistic director of the Old Vic theater from 2004 to 2015.
TEXT:
In the wake of mounting accusations of sexual harassment and assault against actor Kevin Spacey, his publicist and talent agency will no longer represent him, the Los Angeles Times is reporting.

The high-powered talent agency CAA and publicist Staci Wolfe, owner of Polaris Public Relations, are ending their relationships with Spacey, according to sources, just as a number of staff members of Netflixâ€™s TV series â€œHouse of Cardsâ€ came forward with new complaints about nonconsensual sexual encounters with the star. Spacey created a â€œtoxicâ€ work atmosphere, eight current or former employees told CNN.

Several accusations against Spacey have emerged following BuzzFeedâ€™s report last week of an account by actor Anthony Rapp, who alleged that Spacey made an unwanted sexual advance in 1986 when Rapp was just 14. Spacey said he didnâ€™t remember the encounter, but if it did occur it was likely due to â€œdrunken behavior,â€ and he apologized. He also declared then that he was gay, a move critics characterized as a strategy intended to distract attention from Rappâ€™s accusation.

On Wednesday, Wolfe, who was still representing the actor, said that Spacey was â€œtaking the time necessary to seek evaluation and treatment.â€

Since the accusations emerged, filming for â€œHouse of Cardsâ€ has been suspended and a planned International Emmys Founders Award for Spacey was dropped. More accusations have been leveled against Spacey in London, where he was the artistic director of the Old Vic theater from 2004 to 2015.
TITLE: Kevin Spacey Reportedly Dumped By Talent Agency And Publicist

SUMMARY:
Once upon a time, Princess Charlotte could have been bumped down to fifth-in-line to the throne if the third royal baby was a boy.
Princess Charlotte in Berlin during the royal tour of Poland and Germany in July 2017.
The act then became official in March 2015, just two months before Princess Charlotte was born, securing her place as fourth-in-line to the throne.
Earlier on HuffPost:Thanks to the new succession laws, Prince Charles is first-in-line to the throne, followed by Prince William, Prince George and Princess Charlotte.
(L-R) Queen Elizabeth II, Prince Philip, Duchess of Cambridge, Princess Charlotte, Prince George and Prince William, Duke of Cambridge looking out at the Trooping the Colour parade in June 2017.
TEXT:
Once upon a time, Princess Charlotte could have been bumped down to fifth-in-line to the throne if the third royal baby was a boy. However, she can now thank her great-grandmother, Queen Elizabeth II, for changing this (outdated) royal rule before her birth.

Under the Act of Settlement of 1701, all male siblings could skip ahead of their sisters in the line of succession, no matter their birth order, PopSugar reports. This is known as male primogeniture, and unfortunately meant the Queen's second child and only daughter, Princess Anne, was bumped from third-in-line to the throne to fifth after the birth of her siblings Prince Andrew and Prince Edward.

Princess Charlotte in Berlin during the royal tour of Poland and Germany in July 2017.

In 2013, Her Majesty decided to change this sexist system with the Succession of the Crown Act, which essentially replaced male primogeniture with absolute primogeniture. The act then became official in March 2015, just two months before Princess Charlotte was born, securing her place as fourth-in-line to the throne.

The new succession laws now apply to all royals born after Oct. 28, 2011. That year, 16 British Commonwealth countries â€” including Canada, Australia, New Zealand and the Bahamas â€” voted to make the changes. At that time, Britain's then-Prime Minister David Cameron said, "The idea that a younger son should become monarch instead of an elder daughter simply because he is a man ... this way of thinking is at odds with the modern countries that we have become."

Earlier on HuffPost:

Thanks to the new succession laws, Prince Charles is first-in-line to the throne, followed by Prince William, Prince George and Princess Charlotte. The third royal baby, regardless of gender, will then be fifth-in-line, followed by Prince Harry.

The royals have always had very particular rules regarding succession and titles. For example, another rule is that Prince George's future children will receive royal titles, but Princess Charlotte's won't.

(L-R) Queen Elizabeth II, Prince Philip, Duchess of Cambridge, Princess Charlotte, Prince George and Prince William, Duke of Cambridge looking out at the Trooping the Colour parade in June 2017.

Lucy Hume, associate director of expert etiquette company Debrett's, explained this to Town & Country saying, "Royal titles are inherited through sons, so if Princess Charlotte has children they would not automatically inherit the titles HRH, Prince, or Princess," she said.

However, Hume added that there can be exceptions: "The monarch may offer to bestow a royal title upon his or her daughter's children."
TITLE: Princess Charlotte Can Thank The Queen For Securing Her Succession To The Throne

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTNEW DELHI -- The National Human Rights Commission has issued a notice to the Uttar Pradesh government over the death of 26 people in a blast at an NTPC plant in Rae Bareli.
It said there was need to ensure that such tragedies do not recur.
The notice has been sent to the chief secretary of the state.
A detailed report is expected from the government within six weeks, the rights panel said.
At least 26 persons died after a massive explosion in one the boilers at the state-run power giant's Unchahar plant yesterday.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

NEW DELHI -- The National Human Rights Commission has issued a notice to the Uttar Pradesh government over the death of 26 people in a blast at an NTPC plant in Rae Bareli.

Expressing its concern over the incident, the Commission said in a statement today that a "high-level probe into the matter is immediately required to ascertain the negligence and errors, if any, behind the incident, which involves the right to life".

It said there was need to ensure that such tragedies do not recur.

The notice has been sent to the chief secretary of the state. A detailed report is expected from the government within six weeks, the rights panel said.

At least 26 persons died after a massive explosion in one the boilers at the state-run power giant's Unchahar plant yesterday.
TITLE: NHRC Issues Notice To UP Government Over NTPC Blast

TITLE: Sexualite

SUMMARY:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Competition laws will allow Amazon to undercut local businesses with loss-making prices when it opens for business in Australia, expected to be later in November, the Australian competition regulator said on Saturday.
Australian Competition and Consumer Commission Chairman Rod Sims told Fairfax Media that Amazon.com.Inc was able under law to set prices low enough to win business without breaching competition laws.
Australian Small Business Minister Michael McCormack has said he will watch Amazon closely to ensure it pays its fair share of tax.
"Amazon pays all the taxes we are required to pay in every country where we operate," an Amazon spokeswoman told Fairfax.
Australian Small Business and Family Enterprise Ombudsman Kate Carnell said her organization has not seen a copy of the contract under which Amazon will allow small businesses to operate in its marketplace.
TEXT:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Competition laws will allow Amazon to undercut local businesses with loss-making prices when it opens for business in Australia, expected to be later in November, the Australian competition regulator said on Saturday.

Australian Competition and Consumer Commission Chairman Rod Sims told Fairfax Media that Amazon.com.Inc was able under law to set prices low enough to win business without breaching competition laws.

"In terms of misuse of market power, if you open a store in a new town and you set a common price point, you are going to lose money initially if you don't have scale," he said.

"Eventually, if you get your business plan right, you will make that price point, that is in no way illegal."

Amazon has declined to comment on when its Australian operations will begin. It has been building a distribution warehouse in the southern city of Melbourne.

Amazon country manager Rocco Braeuniger is due to hold a meeting in Sydney where he is expected to address more than 500 local suppliers.

Australian Small Business Minister Michael McCormack has said he will watch Amazon closely to ensure it pays its fair share of tax.

"Amazon pays all the taxes we are required to pay in every country where we operate," an Amazon spokeswoman told Fairfax.

Perceived tax avoidance by large foreign companies is a big issue in Australia, and the government is now enforcing new measures known as the "Earned here, Taxed here" corporate tax laws.

Australian Small Business and Family Enterprise Ombudsman Kate Carnell said her organization has not seen a copy of the contract under which Amazon will allow small businesses to operate in its marketplace.
TITLE: Amazon Will Be Able To Legally Set Super-Low Prices And Undercut Local Aussie Competition

Orlando , Las Vegas , Sutherland Springs : three of the worst mass shootings in modern U.S. history all happened in the past 17 months.
As of today, it is no longer one of the 10 deadliest shootings in modern US history.
Now, three shootings in the past 17 months are on the list, and, as CNN pointed out, two of the five deadliest mass shootings in modern U.S. history occurred in the last 35 days.
At the time, the attack was considered the worst mass shooting in modern U.S. history.
According to Mass Shooting Tracker, there have been 377 mass shootings in 2017.
TEXT:
As Denver journalist Kyle Clark grimly observed on Monday, the 1999 Columbine High School massacre that once shocked the world when two gunmen killed 12 students and 1 teacher, has been pushed off the list of the top 10 deadliest mass shootings in recent U.S. history.

Orlando , Las Vegas , Sutherland Springs : three of the worst mass shootings in modern U.S. history all happened in the past 17 months.

The Columbine school shooting shocked America. As of today, it is no longer one of the 10 deadliest shootings in modern US history.

Now, three shootings in the past 17 months are on the list, and, as CNN pointed out, two of the five deadliest mass shootings in modern U.S. history occurred in the last 35 days.

In June 2016, 29-year-old Omar Mateen killed 49 people and wounded 58 when he opened fire in Orlandoâ€™s Pulse Nightclub during Pride month. At the time, the attack was considered the worst mass shooting in modern U.S. history.

One year and four months later, 64-year-old Stephen Paddock opened fire on 22,000 people at a country music festival in Las Vegas, killing 58 and injuring hundreds more. The massacre remains as the deadliest mass shooting in modern U.S. history.

Following the Las Vegas shooting, the New York Times published an interactive feature showing that in the 477 days that had passed since the Pulse nightclub shooting, there had been 521 mass shootings, and no action from Congress on tougher gun laws.

On Sunday, just one month later, a lone gunman killed at least 26 churchgoers and injured 20 others at First Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs, Texas. It was the deadliest mass shooting in the stateâ€™s history. The victims range in age from 5 to 72.

According to Mass Shooting Tracker, there have been 377 mass shootings in 2017.
TITLE: Mass Shootings In America Are Becoming More Common -- And More Deadly

SUMMARY:
These seven delicious recipes for one include all your favourite meals -- from lasagna and pasta, to frittatas and cakes -- and they are all easy to make.
You can cook delicious lasagna for one with five simple ingredients: a lasagna sheet, ricotta, Parmesan, pasta sauce (from a jar is fine) and mozzarella.
Single-serve pan-fried salmon with couscous and veggiesSalmon is packed with healthy fats and protein, and is super easy to cook.
Try this single-serve smoothie with banana, almond or peanut butter, almond milk and a touch of maple syrup.
Here are eight delicious mug cake recipes.
TEXT:
Whether you live alone or just want a quick meal for one, single serving recipes are great to have up your sleeve (or tucked away in your bookmarks).

While a big pot of pasta or tray of lasagna is great for leftovers, not everyone has the space, the inclination or money to whip up a big feast.

These seven delicious recipes for one include all your favourite meals -- from lasagna and pasta, to frittatas and cakes -- and they are all easy to make.

5 tips for food shopping on a budget Plan the meals for the week and make a shopping list with only what you need -- this way you only have to shop once and you avoid food waste; Go shopping on a full stomach to avoid junk food temptations; Buy what's on special -- if silverbeet is cheaper than kale, pick the affordable option and simply amend the recipe; Buy frozen corn, peas and other veg to reduce the cost as well as food waste if produce tends to go off in your fridge; Replace pricey meats in some or all recipes with legumes -- try adding a can of lentils to bolognese or chickpeas to curries. Here are more tips for shopping on a budget.

1. Lasagna for one

Lasagna is a comforting, satisfying meal, and you don't need to make a whole baking dish to enjoy it. You can cook delicious lasagna for one with five simple ingredients: a lasagna sheet, ricotta, Parmesan, pasta sauce (from a jar is fine) and mozzarella.

Try the recipe.

2. Single-serve roast chicken with lemony Bombay potatoes

The key to making chicken taste amazing is cooking it with lots of flavours from herbs and spices. This flavour-packed single serving recipe roasts chicken breast with potatoes and red capsicum tossed in cumin, turmeric, ginger and coriander.

Here's the recipe.

3. Baked veggie frittata for one

Frittata is one of the easiest meals to throw together. To make this frittata for one, all you need is eggs, your choice of vegetables (zucchini, cherry tomatoes, peas and mushrooms work a treat) and cheese.

Try the recipe.

4. Single-serve pasta

If you love pasta, this tasty recipe for one will do the trick. All you need to do is cook a bit of whole grain pasta and serve it with sautÃ©ed veggies, spinach, cheese and pasta sauce.

Here's the recipe.

5. Single-serve pan-fried salmon with couscous and veggies

Salmon is packed with healthy fats and protein, and is super easy to cook. To make this flavour-rich recipe, pan fry salmon with asparagus and zucchini (or whatever vegetables you like) and serve with couscous or ready-made rice.

Try the recipe.

6. Banana almond smoothie for one

Need something for breakfast? Try this single-serve smoothie with banana, almond or peanut butter, almond milk and a touch of maple syrup. Add oats and protein powder to make this smoothie extra filling.

Here's the recipe.

7. Mug cakes

There's always room for dessert and if you're craving cake, one-minute mug cakes are the answer. Coming in a whole range of flavours, mug cakes are fluffy, sweet and easy to make.

Here are eight delicious mug cake recipes.
TITLE: 7 Delicious, Easy Single-Serve Recipes

Am Ende kommt es zu gewalttÃ¤tigen Szenen: Polizisten reiten in friedliche Demonstranten in einem mondartig-anmutenden Niemandsland.
In Bonn trafen sich dann laut Veranstalter mehr als 25.000 Menschen auf den StraÃŸen und demonstrierten fÃ¼r eine Klimawende und speziell den Kohleausstieg.

TEXT:
Das BÃ¼ndnis Ende GelÃ¤nde hat am Sonntag in der Kleinstadt Buir eine Kohlegrube des Energiekonzerns RWE besetzt

Rund 4000 Demonstranten versammelten sich um einen Kohlebagger

Bei der AuflÃ¶sung der Proteste kam es zu gewalttÃ¤tigen Szenen

Sonntag in Buir, etwas mehr als 50 Kilometer von Bonn entfernt. Tausende Aktivisten der zivilgesellschaftlichen Initiative Ende GelÃ¤nde treffen sich, um symbolisch zur Klimakonferenz in Bonn in die Grube zu gehen. Ein Kohlebagger des Energiekonzerns RWE soll besetzt werden.

Am Ende kommt es zu gewalttÃ¤tigen Szenen: Polizisten reiten in friedliche Demonstranten in einem mondartig-anmutenden Niemandsland. Eine junge Frau wird erst von einem Polizisten umgeworfen, dann trampelt ein Pferd auf ihren Torso, wÃ¤hrend sie schreiend auf dem Bauch liegt.

Was als friedliche Demonstration geplant war, wird zu einem chaotischen Ereignis.

Proteste fÃ¼r den Kohleausstieg vor Klimakonferenz Cop23

Hintergrund der Proteste: Vom 6. bis 17. November trifft sich in der ehemaligen Bundeshauptstadt die UN zur 23. Klimakonferenz. Das Interesse an der Konferenz ist groÃŸ, seit Donald Trump vor wenigen Monaten das Aussteigen der USA aus dem Klimaabkommen ankÃ¼ndigte.

Bereits am Samstag den 4. November kam es zu Protesten. Mehrere tausend Menschen fuhren mit dem Fahrrad von KÃ¶ln nach Bonn, um ein Zeichen zu setzen. In Bonn trafen sich dann laut Veranstalter mehr als 25.000 Menschen auf den StraÃŸen und demonstrierten fÃ¼r eine Klimawende und speziell den Kohleausstieg.

Mit dabei bereits hier: Das BÃ¼ndnis Ende GelÃ¤nde, das fÃ¼r Sonntag zu einer symbolischen Aktion im Hambacher Tagebau aufgerufen hatte. Ein Kohlebagger des Betreibers RWE sollte besetzt werden.

Am Sonntag kamen so schlieÃŸlich mehr als 4000 Menschen in das Dorf Buir. Mit Staubmasken, Strohballen, Bannern und Gesang ging es in Richtung Grube. Zahlreiche internationale Demonstranten beteiligten sich an der Aktion - darunter viele Franzosen.

Quelle: Michael Trammer

Elen, eine Ã¤ltere Aktivistin aus Frankreich, erklÃ¤rte: Die Menschen hier sind fÃ¼r eine Durchsetzung des Pariser Klimaabkommens. Mit PrÃ¤sident Emmanuel Macron mache Frankreich RÃ¼ckschritte bei der Klimapolitik. Zusammengefasst mÃ¼sse man laut Elen sagen: "Die Cop21 in Paris war ein kompletter Reinfall! Darauf mÃ¼ssen wir aufmerksam machen!â€œ

Proteste fÃ¼r den Kohleausstieg vor Klimakonferenz Cop23

Ein Aktivist aus Argentinien, der lieber als "Mr. Greenâ€œ bezeichnet werden will, erklÃ¤rte seine Motivation, sich an den Protesten zu beteiligen, mit einem einfachen Wunsch: Er wÃ¼nscht sich den Ausstieg aus der Kohlkraft.

FÃ¼r "Mr. Green" steht auÃŸer Frage: Pazifistischer Widerstand ist seine Aktionsform. Die Polizei sei nicht sein Feind und es dÃ¼rfe ganz klar niemand bei den Protesten zu Schaden kommen.

Auch laut Veranstaltern ist der gemeinsame Nenner, auf den sich alle Gruppen des BÃ¼ndnis fÃ¼r diese Aktion geeinigt hÃ¤tten, ganz klar pazifistisch: Die symbolische Blockade stehe im Vordergrund. Weder RWE-Anlagen, noch Mitarbeiter oder Polizisten sollten zu Schaden kommen.

Am Bagger in der Grube angekommen herrscht somit zunÃ¤chst eine entspannte Stimmung. Es waren zwar GrÃ¤ben ausgehoben und WÃ¤lle aufgeschÃ¼ttet worden, um den Tagebau unzugÃ¤nglich zu machen â€“ die Polizei schritt zunÃ¤chst jedoch kaum ein, um das Treiben zu stoppen.

Quelle: Michael Trammer

Verzweifelt versuchten noch manche Beamte, die 30 Zentimeter tief im aufgeschÃ¼tteten Sand standen, einzelne Aktivisten zu fangen.

Pressesprecher von Ende GelÃ¤nde: "Ich werte den heutigen Tag als groÃŸen Erfolg"

Der Pressesprecher von Ende GelÃ¤nde stellte deshalb schon zu diesem Zeitpunkt fest: "Ich werte den heutigen Tag als groÃŸen Erfolg. Es waren deutlich mehr Aktivisten vor Ort, als wir erwartet haben."

Dem BÃ¼ndnis sei es gelungen, die Grube zu betreten und sogar einen Kohlebagger zum Stoppen zu bringen. Dass der Bagger vor Ankunft der Aktivisten wirklich im Vollbetrieb lief, ist allerdings zu bezweifeln. Betreiber RWE hatte â€“ zu sehen an den getroffenen Vorbereitungen â€“ mit einer Aktion genau an diesem Bagger gerechnet und diesen wohl schon frÃ¼hzeitig auÃŸer Betrieb genommen.

Quelle: Michael Trammer

Dennoch: Die Demonstranten hatten alleine durch die PrÃ¤senz in der Grube einen FÃ¶rderungsstopp erzwungen. Dann aber schritt die Polizei ein.

Polizisten reiten junge Frau nieder

Im Vorfeld der Demonstration hatte Dirk Weinspach, der PolizeiprÃ¤sident von Achen, gesagt: "Das Wichtigste ist mir, dass am Ende der Protestaktion weder Kolleginnen und Kollegen, noch Demonstrantinnen und Demonstranten oder Unbeteiligte zu Schaden gekommen sind.â€œ

De Polizei zeigte NRW dann aber ein anderes Gesicht. Mit einsetzendem Regen zog eine Pferdestaffel auf. Unter Einsatz von Pfefferspray und dem Umreiten von Aktivisten versuchten die Beamten, den Kreis der Demonstranten zu zerstreuen.

Quelle: Michael Trammer

Journalisten wurden mit Pfefferspray attackiert, der Einsatz des Schlagstock angedroht. So sagte ein junger Beamter zu einem Reporter, dieser solle sich "verpissen", sonst gÃ¤be es "auf die Fresse". Besonders unschÃ¶n war eine Szene, als eine junge Aktivistin von einem Polizisten erst brutal zu Boden gestossen wurde und dann ein Pferd auf ihren OberkÃ¶rper trampelte.

Die Polizistin auf dem Pferd rief danach noch: "Das war keine Absicht!â€œ Von der Pressestelle der Polizei NRW war in der unmittelbaren NÃ¤he der Aktion leider kein Ansprechpartner zu finden, um ein Statement zu den Vorkommnissen einzuholen.

Polizei NRW kÃ¼ndigt an, Einsatz von Pfefferspray zu untersuchen

SpÃ¤ter bestÃ¤tigte die Polizei NRW jedoch auf Twitter, dass es sowohl zu der Verletzung einer Person durch eines der Polizeipferde, als auch zu einem Einsatz von Pfefferspray gekommen sei.

Zuvor hatte die Polizei die Echtheit von Bildern eben jenes Einsatzes auf Twitter angezweifelt - nur, um sie spÃ¤ter doch als echt zu bezeichnen.

Echtheit der Bilder Pfeffersprayeinsatz nicht geklÃ¤rt - Ersteller bitte mit weiteren Bildern melden - PrÃ¼fung erfolgt durch #Polizei #Aachen â€” Polizei NRW AC (@Polizei_NRW_AC) 5. November 2017

Zum Ende wurde die Demonstration aufgelÃ¶st und Aktivisten in Busse der RWE-Power-AG verladen. Ãœber Lautsprecher kÃ¼ndigte ein Beamter einen einstÃ¼ndigen Transport auf ein Revier an. Die Besetzung des Kraftwerks wurde beendet, der friedliche Protest von Ende GelÃ¤nde beendet.

Am Ende Ã¼berschattete Gewalt, was als politisches Signal an die Vereinten Nationen und fÃ¼r den Ausstieg aus dem Kohleabbau gedacht war.

TITLE: Vor Start der Klimakonferenz Cop23: Proteste gegen Kohleabbau werden von Polizeigewalt Ã¼berschattet

SUMMARY:
A huge void has been discovered in the Great Pyramid of Giza by scientists using an imaging method based on cosmic rays.
The researchers said it constitutes the first major inner structure found in the Great Pyramid since the 19th century.
The Great Pyramid, looming alongside other large pyramids on the outskirts of Giza, is the last of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World still standing.
Scan Pyramids Mission 3D scans with lasers and drones were also used as part of the investigationIt was constructed during the reign of the Pharaoh Khufu, or Cheops.
travelshooter via Getty Images The Great Pyramid soars to a height of 479 feetâ€œWe are not doing this mission in order to find hidden cavities,â€ Helal said.
TEXT:
A huge void has been discovered in the Great Pyramid of Giza by scientists using an imaging method based on cosmic rays. Experts announced the find on Thursday but have admitted they donâ€™t know what the cavity inside the pyramid, built as a monumental tomb around 2560BC, is for. To see inside the pyramid, the scientists used an imaging technique called muon tomography that tracks particles that bombard Earth at close to the speed of light and penetrate deeply into solid objects.

Scan Pyramids Mission Experts have admitted they don't know what the giant void in the Great Pyramid of Giza is for

They said the newly discovered internal structure was at least 100 feet long, and located above a hallway measuring about 155 feet long called the Grand Gallery, one of a series of passageways and chambers inside the immense pyramid. The researchers said it constitutes the first major inner structure found in the Great Pyramid since the 19th century.

â€œWhat we are sure about is that this big void is there, that it is impressive, that it was not expected by, as far as I know, any kind of theory,â€ said Mehdi Tayoubi, president and co-founder of the HIP Institute in France, one of the leaders of the study published in the journal Nature.

Scan Pyramids Mission The void was discovered using cosmic particle detectors

â€œWe open the question to Egyptologists and archaeologists: what could it be?â€ added Hany Helal of Cairo University. The Great Pyramid, looming alongside other large pyramids on the outskirts of Giza, is the last of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World still standing. It soars to a height of 479 feet, the tallest structure built by humankind until the Eiffel Tower in Paris in 1889, and boasts a base measuring 754 feet.

Scan Pyramids Mission 3D scans with lasers and drones were also used as part of the investigation

It was constructed during the reign of the Pharaoh Khufu, or Cheops. Zahi Hawass, a previous Egyptian antiquities minister, believes the pyramid still contains the tomb of Khufu and that it is unplundered.

DEA / G. DAGLI ORTI via Getty Images An ivory statuette of Khufu

Ahead of the discovery, he told The Times: â€œI really believe that [Khufuâ€™s] chamber is not discovered yet and all the three chambers were just to deceive the thieves, and the treasures of Khufu [are] still hidden inside the Great Pyramid.â€ The findings come from a project called Scan Pyramids that relies on non-invasive scanning methods to probe the internal structure of the pyramids of ancient Egyptâ€™s glorious Old Kingdom period and understand how they were built.

travelshooter via Getty Images The Great Pyramid soars to a height of 479 feet

â€œWe are not doing this mission in order to find hidden cavities,â€ Helal said. Muon particles originate from interactions between cosmic rays from space and atoms of Earthâ€™s upper atmosphere. The particles can penetrate hundreds of yards into stone before being absorbed. Placing detectors inside a pyramid can discern cavities within a solid structure.

Scan Pyramids Mission Infrared thermography readings of the structure were also taken
TITLE: Mysterious Void Found In Egypt's Great Pyramid Of Giza

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTEven as the death toll in the massive explosion in NTPC's Unchahar plant in Uttar Pradesh's Rae Bareli district today rose to 26, survivors' account reveal the intensity of the blast.
#WATCH Congress Vice President Rahul Gandhi reaches Rae Bareli district hospital to meet those injured in #NTPCExplosion.
50,000 each for those injured due to the accident at #NTPC plant in Raebareli.
UP Principal Secretary (Home) Arvind Kumar told reporters in Lucknow that the toll in the NTPC boiler blast has risen to 26.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi had said that he was "deeply pained" by the accident at the power plant.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Even as the death toll in the massive explosion in NTPC's Unchahar plant in Uttar Pradesh's Rae Bareli district today rose to 26, survivors' account reveal the intensity of the blast.

"We were 80-90 metres away. The boiler started shaking and then there was a blast...gas exploded. Many fell unconscious," a survivor told NDTV.

While NTPC has initiated a probe into the blast, while Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has announced Rs 2 lakh compensation for the families of those killed and Rs 50,000 for the grievously injured.

PTI reported that Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi has taken a break from his ongoing 'Navsarjan Yatra' in poll-bound Gujarat and is visiting Rae Bareli, which is the constituency of his mother Sonia Gandhi.

He is expected to meet the family of the victims of the blast.

#WATCH Congress Vice President Rahul Gandhi reaches Rae Bareli district hospital to meet those injured in #NTPCExplosion. pic.twitter.com/9hiEjpmkwr November 2, 2017

The PTI report said that Sonia Gandhi has expressed shock at the "terrible tragedy".

Meanwhile, PM Narendra Modi has Rs. 50,000 each for those injured and ex- gratia of Rs 2 lakh each for next of kin of those who have lost their lives.

PM Narendra Modi also approves Rs. 50,000 each for those injured due to the accident at #NTPC plant in Raebareli. â€” ANI (@ANI) November 2, 2017

While Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath is abroad, Deputy Chief Minister Dinesh Sharma will be visiting Rae Bareli today, reported PTI.

UP Principal Secretary (Home) Arvind Kumar told reporters in Lucknow that the toll in the NTPC boiler blast has risen to 26.

In a statement, the National Thermal Power Corporation (NTPC) has said that at unit number six of its Unchahar plant, there was a sudden abnormal sound at 20-meter elevation around 3:30 yesterday afternoon.

There was an opening in corner number two from which gases and steam "escaped" affecting the people working around the area, the central public sector undertaking said.

It added that around 80 people were rushed to the NTPC Hospital, most of whom were discharged after first-aid.

The 1,550-MW plant supplies electricity to nine states, according to officials, and employs around 870 people.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi had said that he was "deeply pained" by the accident at the power plant.

Union Power Minister R K Singh, through social media posts, expressed deep anguish at the loss of lives and said that he had directed NTPC Chairman and Managing Director Gurdeep Singh to rush to the site.

(with PTI inputs)
TITLE: The Boiler Started Shaking And Then There Was A Blast, Survivor Describes NTPC Explosion As Death Toll Rises To 26

SUMMARY:
Quando il Libano scricchiola c'Ã¨ sempre da preoccuparsi.
Hariri aveva annunciato la decisione di dimettersi lanciando un'accusa nei confronti di Hezbollah, il movimento sciita libanese, e del regime di Teheran di voler strangolare il Libano.
