Siendo el otro, el CEELA, Consejo de Expertos Electorales de LatinoamÃ©rica, una ONG fundada a instancias del presidente Hugo ChÃ¡vez en el 2004.
La organizaciÃ³n que dirige, el ingeniero Luis Lander, Observatorio Venezolano Electoral, no recibiÃ³ el beneplÃ¡cito del ente electoral, asegurando que debido a la premura con la que se convocaron las elecciones, no hubo tiempo para emitir las credenciales a las 500 personas que conforman esta ONG.
Destaca el caso del candidato a la gobernaciÃ³n del estado BolÃ­var, AndrÃ©s VelasquÃ©z, del partido La Causa R quien introdujo un recurso por fraude.
A pesar de que la auditorÃ­a de la totalidad de las actas ha sido solicitada por la coaliciÃ³n de partidos opositores.
TEXT:
Son las 5 de la tarde. Estamos en un cafÃ© de Caracas. Me he citado con el Ingeniero Luis Lander, director del Observatorio Venezolano Electoral (OVE) para conocer su opiniÃ³n sobre las pasadas elecciones del 15 de octubre. Lander fue profesor universitario de la Universidad Central de Venezuela.

En contra de los pronÃ³sticos y encuestas, el partido de gobierno se adjudicÃ³ el triunfo en 18 gobernaciones de un total de 23 estados. Solo en 5 gobernaciones la oposiciÃ³n consiguiÃ³ un mayor nÃºmero de votos.

Luis Lander, director del Observatorio Venezolano Electoral (OVE).

Estamos leyendo el comunicado suscrito por cuatro espaÃ±oles que fueron invitados por el Consejo Nacional Electoral (CNE) para actuar como observadores internacionales, uno de los dos grupos que fueron acreditados por el ente electoral. Siendo el otro, el CEELA, Consejo de Expertos Electorales de LatinoamÃ©rica, una ONG fundada a instancias del presidente Hugo ChÃ¡vez en el 2004.

La organizaciÃ³n que dirige, el ingeniero Luis Lander, Observatorio Venezolano Electoral, no recibiÃ³ el beneplÃ¡cito del ente electoral, asegurando que debido a la premura con la que se convocaron las elecciones, no hubo tiempo para emitir las credenciales a las 500 personas que conforman esta ONG.

El grupo de espaÃ±oles estuvo conformado por tres dirigentes polÃ­ticos y por un periodista: Javier Couso, eurodiputado de Izquierda Unida; la senadora Sara VilÃ , de Podemos; la parlamentaria gallega Eva Solla de En Marea; y el periodista Carlos Enrique Bayo, del diario PÃºblico.

Nuestra primera objeciÃ³n es la metodologÃ­a de selecciÃ³n aleatoria de las 120 mesas de votaciÃ³n

Los observadores espaÃ±oles, aseveran en su comunicado que "el proceso electoral ha cumplido todos los requisitos y garantÃ­as de limpieza y transparencia exigibles a unos comicios". Una conclusiÃ³n refutable.

Nuestra primera objeciÃ³n es la metodologÃ­a de selecciÃ³n aleatoria de las 120 mesas de votaciÃ³n que ellos observaron Â¿cÃ³mo se escogiÃ³ la muestra para representar el universo de 30.274 mesas electorales, distribuidas en un territorio de un millÃ³n de kilÃ³metros cuadrados? puesto que no lo explican en su comunicado.

El comunicado de los observadores espaÃ±oles se refiere a que la oposiciÃ³n contÃ³ "con medios y libertad mÃ¡s que suficientes para desarrollar su campaÃ±a"

El ingeniero Luis Lander no desconfÃ­a de las mÃ¡quinas sumadoras, no desconfÃ­a de los programas, ni de las mÃ¡quinas capta huellas, aunque me aclara, que la base de datos de huellas estÃ¡ en construcciÃ³n. Luis Lander me informa que hubo inconvenientes en la realizaciÃ³n de las auditorÃ­as que debieron realizarse en un 54% de las mesas electorales, no se realizaron en muchos casos como un acto pÃºblico, a pesar de que la ley estipula la participaciÃ³n de cualquier ciudadano.

Los problemas surgen cuando el proceso informatizado es interrumpido, continÃºa explicÃ¡ndome. Varios de los candidatos a las gobernaciones, con copias de las actas de votaciÃ³n en mano, han denunciado que hubo alteraciÃ³n de los resultados por la manipulaciÃ³n de la data en centros de votaciÃ³n que se ubican en aldeas remotas, donde no hay comunicaciÃ³n telefÃ³nica y los resultados no son transmitidos electrÃ³nicamente.

Destaca el caso del candidato a la gobernaciÃ³n del estado BolÃ­var, AndrÃ©s VelasquÃ©z, del partido La Causa R quien introdujo un recurso por fraude. El CNE todavÃ­a no ha respondido a su denuncia.

En la web del Colegio Nacional de Periodistas de Venezuela se puede leer el informe "Periodistas y medios de prensa de Venezuela son censurados y agredidos durante elecciones regionales"

Otro de los puntos del comunicado de los observadores espaÃ±oles se refiere a que la oposiciÃ³n contÃ³ "con medios y libertad mÃ¡s que suficientes para desarrollar su campaÃ±a". En la pÃ¡gina web del Colegio Nacional de Periodistas de Venezuela, puede leerse el informe titulado: "Periodistas y medios de prensa de Venezuela son censurados y agredidos durante elecciones regionales." Donde se hace Ã©nfasis en el cierre de 50 emisoras de radio de lÃ­nea editorial opositora en los Ãºltimos meses. AdemÃ¡s en dicha pÃ¡gina web se reportan los casos de las agresiones verbales y fÃ­sicas a periodistas que intentaron cubrir las recientes elecciones regionales.

Como es costumbre en las elecciones en Venezuela, los medios de comunicaciÃ³n que son propiedad del estado venezolano, son utilizados para hacer campaÃ±a polÃ­tica a favor del partido de gobierno, a travÃ©s de propaganda y entrevistas. SegÃºn la ONG Espacio PÃºblico en el 2012, el gobierno controla unos seis canales de televisiÃ³n, y 200 emisoras de radio, ademÃ¡s de numerosos periÃ³dicos y diarios.

Las alocuciones del presidente Maduro no estuvieron exentas de propaganda a favor de sus candidatos. En cadena nacional de medios pÃºblicos y privados, se refiriÃ³ a ellos, ofreciÃ©ndoles cuantiosos recursos para sus futuras gestiones.

Se produjeron graves incidentes en algunos centros de votaciÃ³n

Se produjeron graves incidentes en algunos centros de votaciÃ³n. Algunos centros de trayectoria opositora, fueron cerrados pocos dÃ­as antes de las elecciones, obligando a sus votantes a presentarse en otros centros, alejados y de difÃ­cil acceso. Unos 700.000 electores se vieron afectados.

Se reportÃ³ presencia de los llamados colectivos o las bandas de motorizados armados en Guarenas y Guatire. TambiÃ©n se colocaron puntos rojos cerca de centros de votaciÃ³n en la populosa zona de Petare, donde los votantes mostraban su carnet de la patria antes de votar.

Una lectura de la prensa del dÃ­a nos da una idea de las irregularidades y de los hechos de violencia que se reportaron, a tal punto que muchos testigos de la oposiciÃ³n fueron sacados de los centros de votaciÃ³n a partir de las 6 de la tarde. Los centros funcionaron hasta las 8 de la noche sin su presencia. AsÃ­ lo ha denunciado el candidato de la gobernaciÃ³n del estado Miranda.

SegÃºn la Red de ObservaciÃ³n Electoral de la Asamblea Nacional de EducaciÃ³n es "imposible considerar la elecciÃ³n de gobernadores como expresiÃ³n fiel de la voluntad ciudadana"

Luis Lander me refiere a los informes de la Red de ObservaciÃ³n Electoral de la Asamblea Nacional de EducaciÃ³n, una de las dos organizaciones que sÃ­ fueron acreditadas como observadores nacionales. En su informe disponible en internet, esta ONG, asevera que las elecciones regionales padecieron de numerosos vicios y por tal motivo es "Imposible considerar elecciÃ³n de gobernadores como expresiÃ³n fiel de la voluntad ciudadana".

A la fecha, dos semanas despuÃ©s de haberse realizado las elecciones, no se estÃ¡ realizando una auditorÃ­a del 100% de las actas como indicaron los observadores espaÃ±oles. A pesar de que la auditorÃ­a de la totalidad de las actas ha sido solicitada por la coaliciÃ³n de partidos opositores.

SÃ­guenos tambiÃ©n en el Facebook de HuffPost Blogs
TITLE: Â¿La limpieza del proceso electoral venezolano?

Stefan Rousseau - PA Images via Getty ImagesA single mother will be Â£2,236 worse off under the governmentâ€™s Universal Credit benefit than they would have been if Labourâ€™s tax credit system had been left in place, research published on Monday has revealed.
According to the Child Poverty Action Group (CPAG), the governmentâ€™s flagship benefits reform is a â€œcolossal failureâ€ that will leave a generation of children â€œscarredâ€ by austerity.
According to the data, the freezes and cuts to Universal Credit work allowances will leave lone parents worse off by, on average, Â£710 a year, couples Â£250 a year.

TEXT:
Stefan Rousseau - PA Images via Getty Images

A single mother will be Â£2,236 worse off under the governmentâ€™s Universal Credit benefit than they would have been if Labourâ€™s tax credit system had been left in place, research published on Monday has revealed. According to the Child Poverty Action Group (CPAG), the governmentâ€™s flagship benefits reform is a â€œcolossal failureâ€ that will leave a generation of children â€œscarredâ€ by austerity. The analysis, conducted with the Institute for Public Policy Research (IPPR), also calculated that one million more children are likely to be in poverty in 2020 as a result of cuts to the new benefit programme. According to the data, the freezes and cuts to Universal Credit work allowances will leave lone parents worse off by, on average, Â£710 a year, couples Â£250 a year. And a single parent already working full time on the national living wage would have to work an extra 41 days a year to make up for the losses suffered as a result of the cuts.

Theresa May is under pressure from backbench Tory MPs as well as the Labour Party to pause the roll-out of the system - or make significant changes to how Universal Credit operates. The new benefit system, the brainchild of Iain Duncan Smith, combines six of the main welfare benefits into a single payment. It is designed to both simplify the system and encourage people back into work. David Cameron promised in 2009 in his party conference speech that Duncan Smith was the â€œone person this party can rely onâ€ to tackle child poverty. But Alison Garnham, the chief executive, of CPAG, said today that pledge â€œhas been brokenâ€.
TITLE: Universal Credit Leaving Children 'Scarred' By Poverty, Warns Think-Tank

SUMMARY:
On Tuesday, film director Tony Montana told Radar Online that Spacey groped him in 2003.
Montana told Radar Spacey â€œgrabbed my whole package.â€â€œThis designates ownership,â€ Montana recalled the actor telling him.
The allegations have been enough to concern Londonâ€™s Old Vic theater, where Spacey served as artistic director from 2004 to 2015.
Old Vic has opened a tip line, confidential@oldvictheatre.com, for those who have been involved with its productions to share any complaints anonymously.
According to Mexican actor Roberto Cavazos, unwanted sexual advances toward younger men were â€œcommonâ€ when Spacey was at the Old Vic.
TEXT:
UPDATE: Nov. 2 â€• A man who wished to remain anonymous says Kevin Spacey attempted to rape him when he was 14 years old, New York Magazine reported Thursday.

The man said that Spacey, 24 at the time, â€œtold me how he was in love with meâ€ before he went to the actorâ€™s apartment and began a sexual relationship that comprised several encounters. Spacey attempted unwanted penetrative sex in their last encounter, he said, and it ended when the teenager ran outside.

â€œI would call him a pedophile and a sexual predator,â€ the man told New York Magazine.

PREVIOUSLY:

Several men have now shared stories of being sexually harassed by Kevin Spacey after â€œStar Trek: Discoveryâ€ actor Anthony Rapp came forward with his own story earlier this week.

In an interview with BuzzFeed, Rapp said that the â€œHouse of Cardsâ€ star invited him to a party and made a sexual advance toward him on a bed in the 1980s. At the time, Rapp was 14 and Spacey was 26. In response, Spacey posted a widely criticized apology to Twitter on Monday that contained his first public declaration of being gay.

On Tuesday, film director Tony Montana told Radar Online that Spacey groped him in 2003. HuffPost confirmed the story with Montana.

â€œHe grabbed me very hard,â€ Montana told HuffPost.

The â€œOvernightâ€ documentarian said he was ordering a drink at a bar in 2003 when Spacey put an arm around him and made a joke about the title of a movie heâ€™d recently been in. Then he tried to convince Montana to leave with him, the filmmaker said.

Montana told Radar Spacey â€œgrabbed my whole package.â€

â€œThis designates ownership,â€ Montana recalled the actor telling him.

Montana said that Spacey then followed him into the bathroom, after which Montana told the actorâ€™s friends to take him home, and the group ended up leaving.

Montana hopes that sharing his story has an impact â€œnot just regarding issues of sexual harassment, but people using power in other threatening manners in Hollywood.â€

â€œI would hope that is going to lessen, if not go away,â€ he told HuffPost. â€œI hope that this isnâ€™t just a phase, it isnâ€™t just a cycle thatâ€™s going to come and go.â€

On Wednesday, a man who wished to remain anonymous shared another story, on BBC 2â€²s â€œVictoria Derbyshireâ€ program, saying that he spent a weekend at the actorâ€™s New York City home as a 17-year-old in the mid-â€™80s. Spacey allegedly pressured the teen into sharing his bed and â€œwas sobbingâ€ when his guest refused the offer.

â€œIn the morning, I woke up and [Spaceyâ€™s] head was on my stomach and his arms were wrapped around my torso, very affectionately, I would suppose,â€ the man said. â€œHe certainly wasnâ€™t aggressive, but it was affectionate and certainly not something I was comfortable with as a heterosexual male.â€

The two had met at a summer theater program. Spacey would have been in his mid-20s at the time.

â€œI was uncomfortable at best, traumatized at worst,â€ the man said, per the BBC.

Another story about the â€œHouse of Cardsâ€ star appeared in the British tabloid The Sun on Tuesday. The publication reported that Spacey exposed himself in 2010 to a man named Daniel Beal, who was working as a bartender at an English hotel.

The allegations have been enough to concern Londonâ€™s Old Vic theater, where Spacey served as artistic director from 2004 to 2015. While the theater claims no complaints were made against Spacey during his tenure there, it released a statement Tuesday expressing its â€œdeep dismayâ€ about its former employeeâ€™s alleged misbehavior.

â€œWe aim to foster a safe and supportive environment without prejudice, harassment or bullying of any sort, at any level,â€ the statement read. Old Vic has opened a tip line, confidential@oldvictheatre.com, for those who have been involved with its productions to share any complaints anonymously.

However, a report published Wednesday in the Guardian claims that â€œa number of peopleâ€ have contacted the publication with stories about misbehavior by Spacey during his time as artistic director at the Old Vic. Citing stories by one anonymous and one named source, the publication accused the theater of ignoring past complaints.

According to Mexican actor Roberto Cavazos, unwanted sexual advances toward younger men were â€œcommonâ€ when Spacey was at the Old Vic. In a Spanish-language Facebook post shared Monday, Cavazos said he personally experienced behavior that was â€œon the borderline of being considered assault.â€ Spacey would allegedly make his advances after inviting younger actors to meet with him to talk about their careers â€• setting up Champagne picnics on stage as a meeting spot â€• or else he would approach men at bars.

â€œThose of us who knew him in London when he was director of the Old Vic Theatre know that there will be many more victims who will dare to tell their stories in the next days and weeks,â€ he wrote. â€œI wouldnâ€™t be surprised if the numbers were similar to those of Weinstein.â€

Harvey Weinstein, the now former head of The Weinstein Company, stands accused by more than 50 women of sexual harassment and assault.

Netflix, home of â€œHouse of Cards,â€ announced this week that the upcoming sixth season of the fan-favorite series would be its last. Production has been suspended while executives address any â€œconcernsâ€ from cast or crew.
TITLE: Other Men Come Forward With Harassment Allegations Against Kevin Spacey

SUMMARY:
Weâ€™ve compiled nine helpful reads that outline the most common financial mistakes and tell you how to get around them.
10 Dumb Money Mistakes People Make In Their 30sPeopleImages via Getty ImagesWith so much going on with work and life, itâ€™s easy to focus on the here-and-now and put aside your bigger financial goals.
6 Money Mistakes Everyone MakesPeopleImages via Getty ImagesYou know that going to your doctor for regular checkups is important for your physical health, but have you run tests lately on your financial health?
A â€œgoodâ€ credit score is generally considered something in the low 700s or above.
The 8 Biggest Financial Mistakes Newlyweds Makepixdeluxe via Getty ImagesHow each partner feels about finances is often shaped by their experiences with money growing up.
TEXT:
Whether youâ€™re living paycheck to paycheck or managing a healthy nest egg, there are certain classic money blunders youâ€™ll want to avoid. Between hidden fees, budgeting mishaps and poor communication around finances, itâ€™s almost too easy to throw money away. Weâ€™ve compiled nine helpful reads that outline the most common financial mistakes and tell you how to get around them. With this advice in hand, youâ€™ll be well prepared to navigate any rocky financial waters ahead. 1. The Unnecessary Risk Too Many Women Take With Their Money

IRATXE LOPEZ DE MUNAIN

Are you worried about getting swindled out of your savings or losing everything in a crash? Alice Finn, the author of Smart Women Love Money, explains the simple ways to avoid those catastrophes â€” and warns us about a threat to our earnings one never seems to consider. 2. 4 Money Myths That Are Hurting Your Savings

triloks via Getty Images

We sometimes cling to myths that can set us up for financial failure because of our complicated emotions surrounding money, from overexcitement to anxiety or fear. Here are some of the most persistent untruths â€” and tips for banishing them once and for all. 3. 10 Dumb Money Mistakes People Make In Their 30s

PeopleImages via Getty Images

With so much going on with work and life, itâ€™s easy to focus on the here-and-now and put aside your bigger financial goals. However, this will leave you scrambling later in life. Think of this article as a map to help you bypass those monetary gaffes. 4. 6 Money Mistakes Everyone Makes

PeopleImages via Getty Images

You know that going to your doctor for regular checkups is important for your physical health, but have you run tests lately on your financial health? You donâ€™t want to wait until youâ€™re having money troubles to seek help. In fact, there may be things youâ€™re doing now that seem like no big deal but could seriously derail your finances. 5. 6 Things You Should Know About Your Credit Score

kizilkayaphotos via Getty Images

Lenders look at your credit score, also known as your FICO score, to gauge how likely you are to pay back the money they lend you for a mortgage, auto loan or credit card. Credit scores range from 300 on the low end to 850 on the high end. A â€œgoodâ€ credit score is generally considered something in the low 700s or above. Once you get down below 600, itâ€™s hard to get anyone to lend to you at all. 6. You Should Basically Never Check Your 401(k) Statement

Tassii via Getty Images

The best thing to do with your 401(k) is set it and forget it. Hereâ€™s what you need to know to make that possible. 7. Thinking of Taking an Early 401(k) Withdrawal? Consider the Ultimate Cost.

shironosov via Getty Images

The balance in your 401(k) can be a tempting source of cash when times are tough and you have no other options. And, yes, itâ€™s possible to take an early distribution without having to pay it back, depending on your personal situation and your specific plan. But possible doesnâ€™t necessarily mean practical in terms of your financial future. 8. The 8 Biggest Financial Mistakes Newlyweds Make

pixdeluxe via Getty Images

How each partner feels about finances is often shaped by their experiences with money growing up. And knowing what that history is can give you a greater understanding of your significant otherâ€™s attitudes toward money â€” and help clue you in to sore spots. 9. The 5 Biggest Money Mistakes People Make

BernardaSv via Getty Images

It doesnâ€™t matter what you think you deserve; it doesnâ€™t matter what you think you need; it doesnâ€™t matter what you think is the bare bones to fit in with your friends or neighbors. If you donâ€™t have the money, then you canâ€™t incur the responsibilities, the debt and the obligation.
TITLE: The Most Common Financial Mistakes To Avoid

Americans spend one third of their lives in bed, but as a nation, we still arenâ€™t getting enough sleep.
As a result of chronic under-rest, our wellbeing is eroding.
To bring awareness -- and solutions -- to this public health issue, The Huffington Post has partnered with Sleep NumberÂ® to present Sleep + Wellness, an editorial section dedicated to empowering readers to live their best, healthiest lives by gaining a better understanding of sleep as a crucial pillar of our well-being.
By taking an all-encompassing, personalized approach to wellness, and educating readers on how sleep connects to fitness, work-life balance, and more, Sleep + Wellness aims to take the stress out of sleep, for good.
To contribute, please email sleeppluswellness@huffingtonpost.com.

Ein 28-jÃ¤hriger Mann, der eine Sachbearbeiterin Ã¼ber Stunden in seiner Gewalt hatte, sei festgenommen worden, sagte ein Sprecher am Montag.
Ein Spezialeinsatzkommando (SEK) nutzte nach den Angaben einen gÃ¼nstigen Moment, um den Mann zu Ã¼berwÃ¤ltigen.

TEXT:
Bei dem Geiselnehmer im Jugendamt des Landkreises Pfaffenhofen an der Ilm handelt es sich mutmaÃŸlich um einen 28 Jahre alten Mann (SYMBOLBILD) | delectus via Getty Images

Ein Mann hat Geiseln im Jugendamt von Pfaffenhofen genommen

Medienberichten zufolge soll der Hintergrund ein Sorgerechtsstreit sein

Die Geiselnahme im Jugendamt in des Landkreises Pfaffenhofen an der Ilm hat die Polizei beendet. Ein 28-jÃ¤hriger Mann, der eine Sachbearbeiterin Ã¼ber Stunden in seiner Gewalt hatte, sei festgenommen worden, sagte ein Sprecher am Montag. Ein Spezialeinsatzkommando (SEK) nutzte nach den Angaben einen gÃ¼nstigen Moment, um den Mann zu Ã¼berwÃ¤ltigen.

Der Geiselnehmer hatte sich gegen 8.30 Uhr mit der Sachbearbeiterin am Jugendamt des oberbayerischen Landkreises verbarrikadiert. Er bedrohte die 31-JÃ¤hrige mit einem Messer mit zehn Zentimeter langer Klinge. Die Frau erlitt eine Schnittwunde am OberkÃ¶rper. Ob er weitere Waffen bei sich hatte, war zunÃ¤chst unklar.

Polizei: "Der TÃ¤ter spricht mit uns"

Das GebÃ¤ude in unmittelbarer Nachbarschaft des Landratsamtes in Pfaffenhofen war am Morgen kurz nach der Geiselnahme gerÃ¤umt worden. Danach befanden sich lediglich Opfer und TÃ¤ter in dem Haus, erlÃ¤uterte der Sprecher.

Es begann ein stundenlanger Nervenkrieg: Die Polizei war mit einem GroÃŸaufgebot vor Ort. Auch mehrere Krankenwagen und Ã„rzte sowie SanitÃ¤ter wurden zum Tatort geschickt.

Im Zusammenhang mit der Geiselnahme in dem Jugendamt baten die Ermittler darum, keine Bilder oder Videos vom Tatort zu verbreiten. Solche Bilder im Netz kÃ¶nnten dem TÃ¤ter helfen, twitterte die Polizei.

Bitte unterstÃ¼tzt uns bei unserer Arbeit in #Pfaffenhofen und verbreitet KEINE Bilder, Videos etc. Ihr helft damit dem TÃ¤ter. â€” Polizei Oberbayern N (@polizeiOBN) 6. November 2017

Unterdessen nahm die Verhandlungsgruppe telefonisch Kontakt mit dem Geiselnehmer auf. Die speziell fÃ¼r Geiselnahmen geschulten Beamten versuchten, deeskalierend auf den Mann einzuwirken.

Als die Frau darum bat, dass ein Arzt gerufen wird, griff das SEK zu und Ã¼berwÃ¤ltigte den 28-JÃ¤hrigen. Es kam dabei nicht zu einem Schusswaffeneinsatz.

Die 31-jÃ¤hrige Sachbearbeiterin war nach den Angaben psychisch stabil. Sie habe lediglich eine leichte SchÃ¼rfwunde. Es kÃ¶nne derzeit nicht eingeordnet werden, woher die Verletzung rÃ¼hrt.

Wieso es keine Bilder vom Ort der Geiselnahme geben soll

Das Opfer sei zwar psychisch angegriffen, kÃ¶rperlich aber nicht schwer verletzt, teilte die Polizei weiter mit. Auch der mutmaÃŸliche TÃ¤ter sei weitgehend unverletzt. Das Motiv der Geiselnahme ist nach den Angaben ein Sorgerechtsstreit des 28-JÃ¤hrigen.
TITLE: Geiselnahme im Jugendamt: Mann bedrohte Sachbearbeiterin mit Messer - was zum Fall bekannt ist

TEXT:
Probablemente te suene la fotografÃ­a de una mujer que, montada en bicicleta, no dudÃ³ a la hora de hacerle una peineta al coche que llevaba al presidente de EEUU, Donald Trump. Por si las moscas, te refrescamos la memoria:

La imagen, tomada por un fotÃ³grafo de la Casa Blanca que viajaba con el presidente cuando salÃ­a de su campo de golf en Sterling, Virginia, se volviÃ³ viral casi de inmediato. Los medios de comunicaciÃ³n se hicieron eco de ella, los programas nocturnos le dedicaron minutos y minutos y en las redes se difundiÃ³ con el hastag #Her2020, haciendo referencia a que la querÃ­an como candidata para las elecciones de 2020.

La mujer protagonista de la imagen es Juli Briskman y no estÃ¡ contenta, para nada, con el resultado que ha tenido la fotografÃ­a. Su empresa, la gubernamental Akima LLC, la ha despedido. AsÃ­ se lo ha contado a los compaÃ±eros de El HuffPost USA, a quienes ha explicado que se quedÃ³ "atÃ³nita" cuando descubriÃ³ que las cÃ¡maras habÃ­an captado el instante.

Briskman, de 50 aÃ±os y madre de dos niÃ±os, decidiÃ³ contar al departamento de Recursos Humanos lo que estaba pasando. El martes, sus jefes la llamaron y le dijeron que habÃ­a violado la polÃ­tica de redes sociales de la compaÃ±Ã­a al haber usado la foto como imagen de perfil tanto en Twitter como en Facebook.

"Me dijeron: "Nos distanciamos de ti. BÃ¡sicamente no puedes tener cosas lascivas u obscenas en tus cuentas de redes sociales", explica Briskman. La mujer, que llevaba poco mÃ¡s de 6 meses en la empresa, asegura que enfatizÃ³ a sus jefes que no estaba en el trabajo cuando ocurrieron los hechos y que en ninguna de sus pÃ¡ginas personales pone para quiÃ©n trabaja. Pero no sirviÃ³ de nada: se limitaron a decir que dado que era una empresa que trabaja para el Gobierno, acciones asÃ­ podrÃ­an daÃ±ar sus negocios.
TITLE: Despiden de su trabajo a la mujer que se hizo viral haciÃ©ndole una peineta a Donald Trump

TEXT:
In San Francisco steht ein Haus, das auf den ersten Blick wie ein gewÃ¶hnliches Reihenhaus aussieht

Wenn man es jedoch betritt, wird ein klar, weshalb es 10 Millionen Euro kostet

Wie es von innen aussieht, seht ihr im Video oben

In der Chenery Street in San Francisco steht ein Haus, das auf den ersten Blick wie ein gewÃ¶hnliches Reihenhaus aussieht. Doch dieser Eindruck tÃ¤uscht - hinter der Fassade des Hauses versteckt sich mehr. Das Haupthaus erstreckt sich auf drei GebÃ¤udeeinheiten, die an die StraÃŸe angrenzen.

Wenn man es betritt, kÃ¶nnte man meinen, in einer Villa aus einem James Bond-Film zu sein.

Das Haupthaus sieht nÃ¤mlich aus wie ein eindrucksvoller Palast â€“ mit Glasdach und einem Swimmingpool im Speisesaal. Im HauptgebÃ¤ude sind Buntglasfenster der ehemaligen Kirche Little Sisters of the Poor verbaut.

Das Haus wurde im Jahr 1987 erbaut

Das Glasdach der Villa lÃ¤sst sich zudem zur Seite fahren, damit die Sonnenstrahlen auch ungefiltert in das Innere des Hauses fallen kÃ¶nnen. Im HauptgebÃ¤ude befinden sich fÃ¼nf Schlafzimmer und genauso viele BÃ¤der. Im Obergeschoss der Villa hat man einen atemberaubenden Blick auf die Skyline von San Francisco.

Die Villa wurde im Jahr 1987 fÃ¼r den Werbefachmann Robert Pritikin gebaut. Derzeit steht das Anwesen zum Verkauf. Wer es haben mÃ¶chte, muss aber tief in die Tasche greifen: Das Anwesen kostet elf Millionen Dollar, also umgerechnet knapp zehn Millionen Euro.

(lp)
TITLE: Es sieht aus wie ein ganz gewÃ¶hnliches Haus - doch es kostet nicht ohne Grund 10 Millionen Euro

TEXT:
Dieser Text erschien zuerst bei The Mighty.

Von Jenna B.

Ihr wisst sicher einiges Ã¼ber Depressionen.

Ihr wisst, dass Menschen mit Depressionen sich oft traurig und leer fÃ¼hlen, keinen Appetit haben oder schlecht schlafen kÃ¶nnen. Dass sie mÃ¼de sind und dass ihnen Dinge keine Freude mehr bereiten, die sie normalerweise lieben wÃ¼rden. Und dass sie vielleicht sogar an den Tod und ans Sterben denken.

Doch ein Symptom von Depressionen, von dem ihr wahrscheinlich noch nicht gehÃ¶rt habt und gleichzeitig eines, das mit am schwersten zu ertragen ist: Einsamkeit.

Wir Menschen sehnen uns nach NÃ¤he. Sogar die meisten Introvertierten wollen mit kleinen Gruppen oder einzelnen Personen in Interaktion treten.

Doch wenn ich mich depressiv fÃ¼hle, kann ich mich selbst nicht dazu bringen, Verabredungen auszumachen oder einzuhalten. Manchmal kann ich nicht mal duschen und mich anziehen, geschweige denn das Haus verlassen.

Ich wÃ¼nsche mir so sehr, dass jemand bei mir ist, dass es weh tut

Doch das bedeutet nicht, dass ich keine Gesellschaft mÃ¶chte. Im Gegenteil: Ich wÃ¼nsche mir so sehr, dass jemand bei mir ist, dass es weh tut. Doch ich habe Angst, jemanden zu fragen.

Ich weiÃŸ, dass ich andere damit belaste. Und ich weiÃŸ auch, dass es keinen SpaÃŸ macht, mit mir Zeit zu verbringen, weil ich immer traurig bin und es mir schwer fÃ¤llt, die Dinge zu genieÃŸen, die ich frÃ¼her gerne mochte.

Ich fÃ¼hle mich schuldig, dass ich diese Gesellschaft mÃ¶chte, dass ich jemanden in meiner NÃ¤he brauche.

Wenn ich mich sehr schlimm niedergeschlagen fÃ¼hle, sehne ich mich nach jemanden, mit dem ich sprechen kann und der mich versteht, ohne mich zu verurteilen. Doch ich bekomme meinen Mund nicht auf, um nach der Hilfe zu fragen, die ich brauche.

Je stÃ¤rker meine Depression wird, desto isolierter fÃ¼hle ich mich von der AuÃŸenwelt

Ich bin gefangen in meinem eigenen Kopf und ich kann mich innerlich schreien hÃ¶ren. Doch leider kann niemand meine Gedanken lesen.

Je stÃ¤rker meine Depression wird, desto isolierter fÃ¼hle ich mich von der AuÃŸenwelt und desto weniger Kraft habe ich, mit anderen Menschen in Kontakt zu treten. Doch das ist genau der Zeitpunkt, an dem ich am meisten auf jemanden angewiesen bin, der sieht, was mit mir los ist.

Es ist traurig, dass die Symptome von Depressionen dafÃ¼r sorgen, dass du so viele Freunde verlierst. Wegen des Stigmas, das der Krankheit anhaftet, oder weil sie nicht verstehen oder Angst haben oder nicht wissen, wie sie helfen sollen. Oder weil sie beschÃ¤ftigt sind und nicht gestÃ¶rt werden wollen.

Denn manchmal ist der beste Weg, einem Freund oder geliebten Person mit Depressionen zu begegnen, einfach Zeit mit ihm zu verbringen und zu tun, wonach ihm ist.

Es ist so wichtig, mit ihm oder ihr Zeit zu verbringen

Auch wenn das nur ein Netflix-Abend auf der Couch ist oder ein gemeinsamer Kaffee oder ein Abendessen. Allein dadurch, dass du dich um deinen Freund oder deine Freundin kÃ¼mmerst, hilft ihm oder ihr, sich besser zu fÃ¼hlen.

Sogar wenn der Andere deine Worte der Beschwichtigung und des Trostes nicht zu hÃ¶ren scheint, kann deine Anwesenheit sehr wertvoll fÃ¼r ihn sein. Es tut immer gut zu wissen, dass jemand sich um dich sorgt und aufrichtige, liebevolle Worte zu hÃ¶ren.

Mir hilft das immer sehr, wenn ich depressiv bin. Es erinnert mich daran, dass ich diese Liebe verdient habe und hilft mir, an meiner Selbstliebe zu arbeiten, die mich aus der Depression herausziehen kann.

Wenn ihr also einen Freund oder Liebsten habt, der unter Depressionen leidet, erinnert euch bitte immer daran: Es ist so wichtig, mit ihm oder ihr Zeit zu verbringen. Depressionen sind eine Krankheit, die sehr einsam macht. Und NÃ¤he zu anderen Menschen ist extrem wichtig bei der Genesung.

Dieser Text erschien ursprÃ¼nglich in der HuffPost USA und wurde von Lea Kosch aus dem Englischen Ã¼bersetzt.

____

Ihr habt auch ein spannendes Thema?

Die HuffPost ist eine Debattenplattform fÃ¼r alle Perspektiven. Wenn ihr die Diskussion zu politischen oder gesellschaftlichen Themen vorantreiben wollt, schickt eure Idee an unser Blog-Team unter blog@huffingtonpost.de.

(jg)
TITLE: Das Symptom von Depressionen, Ã¼ber das niemand spricht

SUMMARY:
Anyone who owns a cast iron pan will know how much of a delight it is to cook with.
Not to mention the fact that cooking in a cast iron pan can add significant amounts of iron to your food and body.
If you're confused about looking after your cast iron pan -- including how to season it and what to do when your pan is rusty -- we've got you covered.
How to clean a cast iron panDaily cleanWhen you're washing your cast iron pan after everyday use, wash it with warm water and a kitchen sponge.
How to season a cast iron panNow that you've got a clean and bare cast iron pan, it's time to re-season it, which doesn't mean rubbing spices on it.
TEXT:
Anyone who owns a cast iron pan will know how much of a delight it is to cook with. The satisfying weight, the even heating and cooking, the natural non-stick abilities, the way you can chuck it in a hot oven, and they last for literal lifetimes.

Not to mention the fact that cooking in a cast iron pan can add significant amounts of iron to your food and body.

One thing cast iron pans do require, however, is some love and care every so often. But the positive cooking experience using cast iron certainly outweighs this negative.

If you're confused about looking after your cast iron pan -- including how to season it and what to do when your pan is rusty -- we've got you covered.

How to clean a cast iron pan

Daily clean

When you're washing your cast iron pan after everyday use, wash it with warm water and a kitchen sponge. While cast iron purists recommend not using dish washing liquid as it could remove the seasoning, others are more easygoing about it. Either way, don't go scrubbing your pan too hard.

Once your pan is clean, it's important to dry the pan thoroughly straightaway as water is cast iron's enemy. Simply hand-dry the pan with a tea towel, then place it on the hob over high heat to evaporate the remaining moisture.

Deep clean

So your cast iron pan is looking a little rusty and whatever you're cooking tends to stick more than usual. Don't worry, it's salvageable. It's just time to give your pan a deep clean.

What you'll need is some course salt, water and a stiff brush, steel wool or green cleansing pad. Splash your pan with water, add some salt and start scrubbing away the rust. Then rinse your pan well until the water runs clear, dry it off thoroughly (with a tea towel and place it in the oven for 10 minutes) and it's ready for seasoning.

How to season a cast iron pan

Now that you've got a clean and bare cast iron pan, it's time to re-season it, which doesn't mean rubbing spices on it. Because iron on its own is reactive and will rust (and stick), you need to season the pan by applying oil and heating it so it creates a sturdy layer of non-stick goodness.

The oil you should use to season cast iron is one with a neutral flavour and high smoking point, so vegetable or rice bran oil. Olive oil may become rancid and impart big flavour which you do not want.

When you apply oil to the pan, rub it all over (even the bottom!) and heat it in the oven for one hour at 230Â°C plus, the oil undergoes a chemical reaction and becomes a polymer (a stronger molecular bond), so you're locking that non-stick layer on the pan. Doing this method correctly makes your cast iron pan stay seasoned and conditioned.

Tip: place the pan upside down in the oven and place a baking tray underneath the baking shelf to catch any excess oil. Leave the pan in the oven for one hour, then you're done.

From this point on, with regular use of your cast iron pan you'll know when it needs to be re-seasoned when food begins to stick or the pan looks more metallic or begins to rust.
TITLE: How To Clean And Season A Cast Iron Pan

SUMMARY:
Part of the festival will be an unusual exhibition on 30 November 2017 of surfing women photographed by Saskia Koerner.
Koerner is creating "Lightwaves", a collection of portraits of the "tribe" of single-fin female surfers she has encountered in her travels.
Her portrait series celebrates the lives of the surfers, who she says are closely interwoven with their passion for surfing single-fin boards.
Koerner says that her work has raised issues about image and gender, and also those regarding gender inequality, marginalisation and sexualisation of women in the surfing world.
In this series, Koerner says she seeks to explore and celebrate the untold story of female surfing in iconic surf spots around the world.
TEXT:
Cape Town's premier summer wavescape festival starts in a few days. The festival runs in Durban in July and makes its way to the Mother City in November.

Part of the festival will be an unusual exhibition on 30 November 2017 of surfing women photographed by Saskia Koerner. Koerner is creating "Lightwaves", a collection of portraits of the "tribe" of single-fin female surfers she has encountered in her travels.

Her portrait series celebrates the lives of the surfers, who she says are closely interwoven with their passion for surfing single-fin boards.

Koerner says that her work has raised issues about image and gender, and also those regarding gender inequality, marginalisation and sexualisation of women in the surfing world.

LIGHTWAVES || outtake from my portrait session with lisetteforsyth and OJ down at our local... https://t.co/JaDqvfYC7Z â€” saskia koerner (@saskiakoerner) November 4, 2017

She portrays her series in a way that demonstrates that women are different in shape and sizes and also shows how they are passionate about the ocean and riding waves and not just "looking sexy as they want you to in the magazines."

In this series, Koerner says she seeks to explore and celebrate the untold story of female surfing in iconic surf spots around the world.

"I have been immersed in the culture my entire life, and heritage and nostalgia are a strong force behind my project."

The project was started in 2013, while Koerner was doing her Bachelor of Fine Arts at Brooks Institute of Photography in Santa Barbara, California.

Also read: These Could Be The Reasons Why Cape Town Is The 'Healthiest' City To Live In This Year

Be sure to check out more of Saskia's work here.
TITLE: Powerful Cape Town Exhibit Celebrates The Best Women Of Surfing

TEXT:
J'ai sept ans, je suis chez mes parents, lui, on ne sait pas son Ã¢ge mais il est vieux, je joue et je rÃªve, il s'approche de moi pour me dire au revoir en m'embrassant sur la joue sauf que ses lÃ¨vres se collent aux miennes. Je n'ai pas criÃ©, je n'ai rien dit Ã  personne, je me suis cachÃ©e en entier dans ma honte et mon dÃ©goÃ»t de ce premier baiser forcÃ©, volÃ©, humiliant qui disait haut et fort que les hommes pouvaient consommer ma peau et mÃªme avoir ma peau.

J'ai seize ans, j'ai ratÃ© la correspondance de mon train, je dÃ©cide de faire de l'auto stop. TrÃ¨s vite un automobiliste s'arrÃªte. Il quitte brusquement la nationale et prend une dÃ©partementale, il a soit disant un colis Ã  dÃ©poser ...j'ouvre la portiÃ¨re et je sautÃ© en marche en prenant tous les risques, notamment qu'il revienne et je cours de peur qu'il me tue...

Je suis Ã©tudiante Ã  Paris 7, j'ouvre la porte de mon immeuble et je sens le corps d'un homme qui me pousse en avant, je me retourne et je hurle en donnant un coup avec mon genou dans ses couilles...il s'est sauvÃ© en courant et moi, je le suivais le menaÃ§ant.

J'ai grandi en comprenant que c'Ã©tait la guerre. En stratÃ¨ge fÃ©minin, je me suis inventÃ©e des armures, des gilets de sauvetage, des ceintures de sÃ©curitÃ©, j'ai portÃ© des armes inutiles; j'ai fait du judo et j'ai compris qu'il valait mieux s'entraÃ®ner Ã  la course Ã  pied, fuir et ne pas se battre parce qu'Ã  musculature Ã©gale, les hommes sont plus forts. Dans les couloirs dÃ©serts du mÃ©tro, j'Ã©coute les pas qui rÃ©sonnent. La peur s'est glissÃ©e sous ma peau et fait bloc dans sa tÃªte. J'intÃ©riorise les scÃ©narios de self-dÃ©fense pour Ã©viter la prÃ©dation masculine qu'elle soit visuelle, tactile ou verbale. Dans la rue et ailleurs, les garÃ§ons se promÃ¨nent rÃªvent et lisent tranquilles.

J'ai quarante ans, les flÃ¨ches de la cathÃ©drale de Chartres dÃ©chirent les lumiÃ¨res du ciel. Le Ter Paris-Le Mans se vide. Dans le compartiment reste deux voyageurs, deux mecs. Si l'un d'eux descend Ã  la prochaine station, je serai seule avec un type forcÃ©ment capable de tout. La nuit s'installe, la peur aussi. Les femmes disent qu'elles ne veulent plus faire ce trajet en train et prÃ©fÃ¨rent rester chez elles dans le Perche plutÃ´t que d'aller se divertir Ã  Paris.

J'aime les garÃ§ons, j'aime trop quand nos regards se croisent dans ces moments improbables d'assentiments alchimiques sensuels et amoureux, mÃªme que c'est trop bien quand on se drague les uns et les autres dans la rue et ailleurs. Sauf que dans l'espace privÃ© ou public, ce n'est pas Ã©quitable, les hommes de la famille ou d'autres peuvent abuser de nos corps. Tous les jours dans le Perche que traverse ce Ter Paris-Le Mans des petites filles perdent leur virginitÃ© au monde, les assistantes sociales le savent mais soumises au secret professionnel, elles doivent se taire. MalgrÃ© les luttes de nos mÃ¨res pour l'Ã©galitÃ© des femmes et des hommes, dÃ¨s notre naissance nous sommes des proies potentielles, des candidates au silence, des soumises Ã  la domination au boulot et ailleurs, et pourtant on fait la guerre au quotidien pour ne pas vivre en alerte permanente. Les tribunaux ne sont d'aucun intÃ©rÃªt. Le vrai changement doit s'opÃ©rer dans les comportements et les mentalitÃ©s de tous et de toutes, relevons la tÃªte et revendiquons le droit de marcher, de travailler, de rÃªver sans Ãªtre victime voire consentante de livrer nos sexes sans dÃ©sirer celui de l'autre mais parfois avons-nous vraiment le choix.

Parlons, tÃ©moignons, touche pas Ã  ma potesse, touche pas Ã  ma mÃ¨re, touche pas Ã  ma fille si elle en n'a pas envie. Heureusement il y a plein de garÃ§ons qui ont compris cela, qu'ils tÃ©moignent contre ceux qui les salissent en tant qu'homme et qui compliquent les relations amoureuses entre les hommes et les femmes.

C'est une convocation planÃ©taire, un enjeu pour toutes les petites filles de demain, parlons,rÃ©pÃ©tons...

Souvenez-vous, battez-vous, Ã©crivez mÃªme les noms des prÃ©dateurs. Si nous voulons que la sociÃ©tÃ© change, ne soyez pas complice en restant silencieuse, quant aux mauvais garÃ§ons, la prochaine fois si vous ne voulez pas que votre nom Ã©clate au grand jour, demandez mais n'insistez pas si une fille n' a pas envie de votre sexe

Alors, lentement mais sÃ»rement, le fait de naÃ®tre fille ne sera plus un handicap Ã  la libertÃ© de rÃªver, de se promener, de travailler sans revÃªtir des peurs imaginaires ou rÃ©elles.

SUMMARY:
In 26 sono arrivate ieri, senza vita, a Salerno a bordo della nave spagnola Cantabria.
Parole che non possono lasciare indifferenti.
Personalmente sono convinta che opporsi all'hate speech non possa essere considerata censura ma, per chi fa giornalismo, un dovere professionale.
E necessario far passare il principio che gli operatori dell'informazione abbiamo nei confronti degli utenti una sorta di responsabilitÃ  all'educazione sociale.
L'hate speech su queste vicende, come sul caso di Salerno, si sviluppa in crescendo e ciÃ² impone una riflessione e, soprattutto, una reazione.
TEXT:
Erano tutte giovanissime, adolescenti tra i 14 e i 18 anni. Sono morte lungo la traversata dalla Nigeria alle coste italiane. In 26 sono arrivate ieri, senza vita, a Salerno a bordo della nave spagnola Cantabria.

Sulla stessa imbarcazione quasi 400 migranti, tra cui numerosi bambini, alcuni non accompagnati.

La notizia, oltre a essere ripresa da gran parte dei media, compresi i tg delle principali edizioni, ha fatto il giro del web che mai come in questa occasione Ã¨ stato invaso da reazioni e commenti sconcertanti, anche per chi Ã¨ ormai abituato al linguaggio d'odio sempre piÃ¹ imperante sui social.

"26 donne morte? Troppo poche...", "Si chiama selezione naturale..", "Sinistra in lutto, persi 26 voti" queste solo alcune delle atrocitÃ  scritte da chi usa internet per sfogare gli istinti peggiori.

Parole che non possono lasciare indifferenti.

Secondo i dati dell'Unar l'hate speech Ã¨ in continuo aumento, sia sui social network che sulle testate online dove i lettori possono commentare gli articoli.

Su questo fenomeno si Ã¨ animato da tempo un dibattito, in particolare sul limite alla libertÃ  di espressione e, per quanto riguarda i giornali, fino a che punto si possa e si debba intervenire sui titoli che istigano all'odio. Ne abbiamo scritto anche qui.

Personalmente sono convinta che opporsi all'hate speech non possa essere considerata censura ma, per chi fa giornalismo, un dovere professionale.

Per far assimilare questi concetti serve una formazione in grado di "inculcare" questa forma di tutela nei confronti dei piÃ¹ deboli, i giovani, maggiormente esposti al condizionamento di un determinato linguaggio. E necessario far passare il principio che gli operatori dell'informazione abbiamo nei confronti degli utenti una sorta di responsabilitÃ  all'educazione sociale.

Ogni volta che arriva un barcone, che riesca ad approdare o che affondi in mare aperto lasciando l'incombenza alla Guardia Costiera di recuperarne il carico umano, si leggono su una certa stampa articoli e titoli che gridano allo scandalo dei rifugiati "accolti con troppa facilitÃ  in Italia", innescando gli strali violenti dei lettori.

Visti da molti come "pesi morti" che lo Stato si "accolla" a scapito dei tanti italiani in difficoltÃ , non vengono considerati per quello che sono: profughi che rischiano la vita attraversando il Mediterraneo su barconi stracolmi perchÃ© non hanno alternative.

L'hate speech su queste vicende, come sul caso di Salerno, si sviluppa in crescendo e ciÃ² impone una riflessione e, soprattutto, una reazione. Ferma.

Anche se difficilmente chi continua a manifestare chiusura, avversione, nei confronti dei migranti e delle politiche d'integrazione riuscirÃ  a comprendere il profondo significato della solidarietÃ  e del dovere all'accoglienza rispetto a un'emergenza di dimensioni colossali. La piÃ¹ grave crisi dalla Seconda Guerra mondiale a oggi.
TITLE: L'hate speech sulla tragedia di Salerno. Quando la libertÃ  di parola travalica il limite del lecito

SUMMARY:
The deep ocean around Antarctica is a special place for several reasons.
So although the continent itself is remote, we can reach the deep ocean close inshore here - handy for us diving in minisubmarines, despite the need to dodge icebergs.
Much of the life-giving oxygen in deep waters across the world begins its journey from the atmosphere here.
As this deep water flows out from the Antarctic, it carries oxygen, dissolved from the atmosphere at the surface.
Overall, seeing the deep Antarctic sea floor close-up from our minisubs should help us to understand how "dropstones" shape the pattern of life here.
TEXT:
"It has always been our ambition to get inside that white space, and now we are there the space can no longer be blank," wrote the polar explorer Captain Scott, on crossing the 80th parallel of the Antarctic continent for the first time in 1902. Fast-forward more than a century - and the deep ocean floor around Antarctica still offers a "white space", beyond the reach of scuba divers, only partially mapped in detail by sonar from ships and seldom surveyed by robotic vehicles.

So I jumped at the chance to join a team from the BBC on an expedition to the Antarctic Peninsula for Blue Planet II, to help them as a scientific guide. Thanks to the crew of the research ship Alucia, we dived in minisubmarines to 1km deep in the Antarctic for the first time. And while we didn't face anything like the physical hardships endured by early polar explorers on land, those dives did give us the opportunity for some unique science.

The deep ocean around Antarctica is a special place for several reasons. Because Antarctica is pushed down by the weight of its ice sheets, the submerged continental shelf around it is deeper than usual, around 500-600m deep at its edge rather than 100-200m deep. It's also cut by even deeper channels close inshore, some plunging more than 1km, scoured out by larger ice sheets in the past. So although the continent itself is remote, we can reach the deep ocean close inshore here - handy for us diving in minisubmarines, despite the need to dodge icebergs.

Giant sponges found in the deep waters of the Antarctic.

There's a gateway to the deep for marine life here too. Some deep-sea animals come into much shallower depths than usual around Antarctica, because the water temperature near the surface is similar to the cold temperatures elsewhere in the deep ocean. And in the past, shallow-living ancestors of some deep-sea animals spread out across the deep oceans from the Antarctic, via this cold gateway between the shallows and the deep.

One of my favourite animals that we saw on dives was the octopus Graneledone antarctica, whose ancestor ventured down from the shallows around 15m years ago, when the water temperature at the surface cooled to the same chilly temperature as the deep. Her descendants then spread out across the abyss like wagon-train pioneers, giving rise to several different species of deep-sea octopus found around the world today. Some stayed behind, however, becoming the species that we saw.

The ocean around Antarctica is also the lungs of the deep. Much of the life-giving oxygen in deep waters across the world begins its journey from the atmosphere here. As seawater freezes around the white continent in winter, it leaves behind very cold and salty water that sinks and flows into the depths of the Atlantic, Indian and Pacific Oceans - even the deepest water in the ocean, at the bottom of the Marianas Trench 14,000km away, came from here. As this deep water flows out from the Antarctic, it carries oxygen, dissolved from the atmosphere at the surface. So the Antarctic is where the world's deep oceans breathe in - and its waters are among the most oxygen-rich on our planet.

The #BluePlanet2 team were the first humans ever to dive to a depth of a thousand metres in Antarctica #EarthOnLocation by @jameshoneybornepic.twitter.com/KlyWu0VcbQ â€” BBC Earth (@BBCEarth) November 3, 2017

Another of my favourite animals from our dives takes advantage of those oxygen-rich waters: giant sea-spiders, with legspans up to 40cm across. Sea spiders lack a respiratory system, which usually limits their size, but can grow much larger in the oxygen-rich conditions here.

'Ancient ocean ecosystems'

Diving in the Antarctic is also a journey back in time, to glimpse what ancient ocean ecosystems were once like. Fish dominate as predators in most marine ecosystems today, but few fish species can cope with the -1.5â„ƒ conditions where we were diving. The "ice dragonfish", Cryodraco antarcticus, is a notable exception, however, and another of my favourite animals - with antifreeze proteins that stop its blood from icing up. Its blood is also clear, without any of the oxygen-carrying haemoglobin that gives ours its red colour - in the cold waters, enough oxygen dissolves directly in the fluid of the fish's blood to keep it alive.

But there are few fish with remarkable adaptations like the ice dragon, and so invertebrates have diversified to dominate as predators in the deep ocean here, just as they did throughout the oceans more than 350m years ago. A final favourite from our dives epitomises that: the Antarctic sunstar Labidiaster annulatus, which is a relative of the familiar five-armed starfish. Nicknamed "the Death Star" by those inside the subs who watched its behaviour, it has up to 50 arms and grows larger than a dinner plate. It uses those arms like fishing rods, holding them up off the seabed to snag passing krill, thanks to tiny pincers on its skin that snap shut when anything brushes past them. Unlike other starfish, Labidiaster can wave its arms to catch prey here because there are relatively few predatory fish to chew them off.

A feather star dances in the deep waters of the Antarctic Sound.

Overall, seeing the deep Antarctic sea floor close-up from our minisubs should help us to understand how "dropstones" shape the pattern of life here. "Dropstones" are car-sized boulders that fall from passing icebergs - they provide "islands" of rocky habitat for filter-feeding species which otherwise don't get a look-in on the soft mud of the Antarctic seafloor. But where the dropstones settle depends on the undersea terrain. As we found on our dives, they slide down steeper undersea slopes, actually scraping off marine life. But if you're at the bottom of a gully, then lots of dropstones end up there, giving a major boost to local biodiversity. That pattern of life is hard to see from samples collected by nets or trawls in the past, so our first minisub dives to 1km deep in the Antarctic should help to make that "white space" no longer such a blank.

This article originally appeared in The Conversation. It was written by Jon Copley - Associate Professor in Ocean Exploration & Public Engagement, University of Southampton.
TITLE: I Explored The Antarctic Deep Seas For Blue Planet II - And It Was Like Going Back 350 Million Years

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTA massive explosion ripped a boiler at the state-run power giant NTPC's Unchahar plant in Uttar Pradesh's Rae Bareli district today, killing at least 20 people and injuring nearly 100, officials said.
Another 15 are admitted to a Rae Bareli hospital," UP's ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said.
Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi will take a break from election campaign in Gujarat to visit Rae Bareli tomorrow to meet the families of the victims.
"Due to the unfortunate NTPC accident, I will visit Rae Bareli tomorrow morning," he said on Twitter.
Some of the injured were being sent to Rae Bareli, Khatri said.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

A massive explosion ripped a boiler at the state-run power giant NTPC's Unchahar plant in Uttar Pradesh's Rae Bareli district today, killing at least 20 people and injuring nearly 100, officials said.

The NTPC initiated a probe to ascertain the reasons behind the blast, while Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath announced Rs 2 lakh compensation for the families of those killed and Rs 50,000 for the grievously injured, they added.

"Twenty deaths have been confirmed by the district administration. Twenty-two people with severe burns have been referred to Lucknow. Another 15 are admitted to a Rae Bareli hospital," UP's ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said.

He said that the number of casualties could rise.

Principal Secretary (Home) Arvind Kumar said that 90-100 people were injured in the blast.

In a statement, the National Thermal Power Corporation (NTPC) said that at unit number six of its Unchahar plant, there was a sudden abnormal sound at 20-meter elevation around 3:30 in the afternoon.

There was an opening in corner number two from which hot flue gases and steam "escaped" affecting the people working around the area, the central public sector undertaking said.

#NTPCExplosion : Three victims undergoing treatment in hospital in Raebareli, rest of the injured referred to Lucknow pic.twitter.com/iXV8HgUAGC November 2, 2017

It added that around 80 people were rushed to NTPC hospital, most of whom were discharged after first-aid.

The 1,550-MW plant supplies electricity to nine states, according to officials, and employs around 870 people.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi said he was "deeply pained" by the accident at the power plant and added that the situation was being closely monitored.

'Deeply Pained'

"Deeply pained by the accident at the NTPC plant in Raebareli. My thoughts are with the bereaved families. May the injured recover quickly. The situation is being closely monitored & officials are ensuring normalcy is restored: PM @narendramodi," the prime minister's office tweeted.

Union Power Minister R K Singh, through social media posts, expressed deep anguish at the loss of lives and said that he had directed NTPC Chairman and Managing Director Gurdeep Singh to rush to the site.

The Unchahar sub-division in Rae Bareli, which is represented by Congress president Sonia Gandhi in Parliament, is around 110 km from the state capital.

ADG Kumar said that all available ambulances were pressed into service, and the additional district magistrate and the additional superintendent of police were on the spot to supervise relief and rescue operations.

Chief Minister Adityanath, on a three-day official visit to Mauritius, ordered that necessary steps be taken for rescue and relief.

The chief minister has taken cognisance of the Unchahar accident and has directed the principal secretary (home) to ensure that all steps were taken for rescue and relief, principal secretary (information) Awanish Awasthi, who is accompanying Adityanath, said.

Compensation

"The chief minister expressed his condolences over the deaths of workers in the Unchahar NTPC unit and announced Rs 2 lakh compensation for the family of those killed and Rs 50,000 for the grievously injured, besides Rs 25,000 for other injured workers," Awasthi said.

A National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) team was also despatched to the explosion site from the state capital for relief and rescue operations, an official said.

The explosion triggered panic among the employees who ran helter-skelter. Such explosions can generate searing heat, an official said.

An injured employee undergoing treatment at a hospital said that a sudden gush of hot gas with contents of ash-like material engulfed him at the NTPC plant.

The man said he was unable to understand what had happened and found himself on a hospital bed with his body scalded all over, when he regained consciousness.

The plant area was cordoned off by the police to facilitate smooth running of ambulances. Two companies of the Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) have been sent to the plant as reinforcement.

Congress president Sonia Gandhi expressed shock and horror at the "terrible tragedy" in her Lok Sabha constituency. Conveying her deepest condolences to the families of the bereaved, Gandhi urged upon the authorities to provide immediate medical assistance to the injured.

Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi will take a break from election campaign in Gujarat to visit Rae Bareli tomorrow to meet the families of the victims.

"Due to the unfortunate NTPC accident, I will visit Rae Bareli tomorrow morning," he said on Twitter.

District Magistrate Sanjay Kumar Khatri told PTI that 40 ambulances were immediately pressed into service.

Chief Medical Officer of Rae Bareli D K Singh, along with a team of 10 doctors, was deployed to carry out immediate treatment to the injured, the district magistrate said.

He also said that arrangements have been made to bring the serious cases to KGMU Hospital and the Civil Hospital in Lucknow. Some of the injured were being sent to Rae Bareli, Khatri said.

CMO Singh said that, if necessary, some of the critical cases could be referred to Delhi by air ambulance.
TITLE: 20 Killed, 100 Injured In Massive Boiler Explosion At NTPC's Rae Bareli Plant

SUMMARY:
President Donald Trump responded to the deadliest mass shooting in Texas history by saying the attack was a result of â€œa mental health problemâ€ and not due to lax gun control laws.
â€œThis is a mental health problem at the highest level.
â€” Jim Acosta (@Acosta) November 6, 2017Trump on Texas shooting and gun control: "It's a little bit soon to go into it."
(He said this after Vegas shooting too) â€” Jim Acosta (@Acosta) November 6, 2017.
Focuses on mental health.
TEXT:
President Donald Trump responded to the deadliest mass shooting in Texas history by saying the attack was a result of â€œa mental health problemâ€ and not due to lax gun control laws.

During a news conference Monday in Tokyo, Trump said it was â€œa little bit soonâ€ to get into a discussion about gun control.

â€œThis isnâ€™t a guns situation,â€ Trump said, noting that a person in the crowd with a gun shot at the attacker and caused him to flee. â€œThis is a mental health problem at the highest level. Itâ€™s a very, very sad event.â€

The president woke on Monday morning in Japan to the news that a lone gunman had opened fire on churchgoers at a small Baptist church in rural Texas and killed at least 26 people and injured another 20. The dead and wounded range in age from 5 to 72 years old.

While answering questions in Tokyo, the president referred to the gunman, who multiple reports identified as 26-year-old Devin Patrick Kelley, as a â€œvery deranged individual.â€

BREAKING: Trump calls Texas church shooting a 'mental health problem at the highest level,' says gunman 'deranged' â€” The Associated Press (@AP) November 6, 2017

Trump on Texas shooting and gun control: "I think mental health is your problem here." â€” Jim Acosta (@Acosta) November 6, 2017

Trump on Texas shooting and gun control: "It's a little bit soon to go into it." (He said this after Vegas shooting too) â€” Jim Acosta (@Acosta) November 6, 2017

.@POTUS, at joint news conference, brings up the Texas church shooting. Asks: who would ever think a thing like that could happen? â€” Hallie Jackson (@HallieJackson) November 6, 2017

NEW / POTUS on TX shooting: â€œthis isnâ€™t a guns situation. We could go into itâ€ but itâ€™s a little soon, he says. Focuses on mental health. â€” Hallie Jackson (@HallieJackson) November 6, 2017

The accused gunman was a former member of the U.S. Air Force from 2010 until his discharge in 2014. He was court-martialed in 2012 for assault on his spouse and their child, according to a USAF spokesperson.

Earlier on Monday, Trump tweeted his prayers to the people of Sutherland Springs, Texas, before giving an official statement on the shooting at a meeting with U.S. and Japanese business leaders in Tokyo.

May God be w/ the people of Sutherland Springs, Texas. The FBI & law enforcement are on the scene. I am monitoring the situation from Japan. â€” Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) November 5, 2017
TITLE: Trump Says Deadly Texas Shooting Isn't A Guns Issue, It's A Mental Health Problem

TEXT:
Luigi Di Maio aveva paura del confronto con Renzi? Teme il segretario Pd? Non vuole "bruciarsi" al primo confronto televisivo con l'ex presidente del Consiglio, che in ogni caso resta un comunicatore brillante? Anche se tutto ciÃ² fosse vero, Di Maio ha colto il momento giusto per "scaricare" Renzi.

Nelle ore in cui Musumeci, alfiere del centrodestra in Sicilia, Ã¨ accreditato della probabile vittoria, e nelle stesse ore in cui l'esito del voto isolano sembra comunque oscillare tra grillini e centrodestra, Di Maio ha buon gioco a dire:

"Avevo chiesto il confronto con Renzi qualche giorno fa, quando lui era il candidato premier di quella parte politica. Il terremoto del voto in Sicilia ha completamente cambiato questa prospettiva. Mi confronterÃ² con la persona che sarÃ  indicata come candidato premier da quel partito o quella coalizione".

E ancora:

"Il Pd Ã¨ politicamente defunto. A quello che leggo oggi sui giornali in interviste di esponenti Pd, non sappiamo neanche se Renzi sarÃ  il candidato premier del centro sinistra. Anzi, secondo le ultime indiscrezioni riportate dai media, a breve ci sarÃ  una direzione del Pd dove il suo ruolo sarÃ  messo in discussione. Il nostro competitor non Ã¨ piÃ¹ Renzi o il Pd. Combattiamo contro l'indifferenza che genera l'astensione".

Dunque il Pd â€“ dice Di Maio â€“ Ã¨ morto. Non Ã¨ in partita e non Ã¨ lui il competitor per il voto politico. Effettivamente, se le proiezioni troveranno definitiva conferma, i grillini prendono il doppio dei dem in Sicilia e il Pd Ã¨ in crisi perchÃ© ancora non si trova una squadra a sinistra. C'Ã¨ isolamento intorno a Renzi e Di Maio prova, dall'esterno, ad aumentare questa frattura, ad allargare il divario e a far esplodere le contraddizioni interne al Partito democratico.

Nelle parole di Di Maio, perÃ², manca la legittimazione nei confronti del logico, nuovo, avversario: il centrodestra. Di Maio scrive su Facebook e proverÃ  ancora a dire che il nemico da battere Ã¨ "l'indifferenza che genera l'astensione", ma il gioco durerÃ  poco.

CiÃ² che Ã¨ piÃ¹ probabile Ã¨ che il centrosinistra subisca un progressivo oscuramento come capitÃ² giÃ  al centrodestra in occasione delle passate elezioni amministrative, quelle in cui si imposero i grillini a Roma e Torino e il Pd a Milano. In sostanza per qualche anno, successivo alle elezioni del 2013, soprattutto a causa dall'appannarsi della posizione pubblica di Berlusconi, Renzi fu considerato da larga parte dell'opinione pubblica come il solo argine al grillismo montante.

Se la logica del voto utile si imporrÃ , suggerendo la dicotomia centrodestra-M5S, allora per Renzi sarÃ  ancora piÃ¹ difficile succhiare voti ad Articolo Uno e la battaglia identitaria di Speranza e Bersani potrÃ  acquistare significato. Ãˆ presto per dire come finirÃ  ma Ã¨ di tutta evidenza che il piano si Ã¨ inclinato e il Pd sta scivolando a vantaggio di Forza Italia.

Di Maio ha colto la palla al balzo, comunicativamente e politicamente, e a causa delle divisioni e delle incertezze che caratterizzano il centrodestra sul piano della leadership, potrÃ  ancora per due mesi evitare qualsivoglia confronto tv.

C'Ã¨ chi dice che Di Maio ha sbagliato, ma la storia politica Ã¨ piena di candidati in vantaggio che ritardano o rifiutano sfide televisive con competitor che potrebbero solo guadagnare punti in un match pubblico. Le settimane guadagnate saranno preziose per il giovane candidato pentastellato che perÃ² non Ã¨ nuovo a forfait dell'ultima ora e ora dovrÃ  stare molto attento a non declinare piÃ¹ confronti e interviste scomode.
TITLE: La mossa intelligente di Di Maio

TEXT:
Sulle pensioni nella legge di bilancio "c'Ã¨ il vuoto pneumatico, nonostante gli impegni sottoscritti un anno fa dal governo sulla fase due". Nel giorno in cui il tavolo tecnico tra il governo e i sindacati sul tema dell'aumento dell'etÃ  pensionabile mette in evidenza le distanze tra le parti, arriva dal segretario generale della Cgil, Susanna Camusso, un nuovo affondo contro il governo. Nel corso di un'audizione in Senato sulla manovra, la numero uno del sindacato di corso d'Italia Ã¨ perentoria: bisognava "intervenire prima che scatti l'innalzamento automatico dell'etÃ , con un provvedimento di legge che lo eviti" e poi avere anche "uno sguardo verso il futuro" per facilitare i giovani e le donne.

Il tema dell'aumento dell'etÃ  pensionabile, previsto dal 2019 (da 66 anni e 7 mesi a 67 anni), Ã¨ al centro del confronto tra governo e sindacati, ma il tavolo tecnico, seguito all'incontro politico della settimana scorsa a palazzo Chigi, ha suscitato una reazione negativa da parte dei sindacati. "L'incontro, come temevamo, Ã¨ partito in salita. Intanto abbiamo appurato che non c'Ã¨ la volontÃ  di discutere in questa sede dei temi della 'fase due' della previdenza. E abbiamo appurato che non esistono dati, ricerche, statistiche utili al ragionamento sull'aspettativa di vita in rapporto al lavoro svolto", ha dichiarato il segretario confederale della Cgil, Roberto Ghiselli, al termine dell'incontro. "La strada Ã¨ molto in salita. Il governo non vuole affrontare nell'insieme i temi della fase due sulla previdenza", relativi in particolare alle donne e ai giovani", ha sottolineato il segretario confederale della Uil, Domenico Proietti. Meno pessimista la Cisl: "Abbiamo avuto oggi degli scambi di opinioni e compiuto delle valutazioni: c'Ã¨ l'impegno del governo a presentare una proposta. Ãˆ un dato di serietÃ ", ha dichiarato il segretario generale della Cisl, Gigi Petteni.

Il governo Ã¨ al lavoro per esonerare i cosiddetti lavori gravosi dallo scalino, ma a Cgil, Cisl e Uil potrebbe non bastare perchÃ© chiedono un blocco, generale, dello scatto. Lo stesso esecutivo, attraverso il premier Paolo Gentiloni e il ministro dell'Economia, Pier Carlo Padoan, si era impegnato a rivedere i meccanismi che determinano lo scalino, ma i sindacati ora temono che l'intervento di palazzo Chigi e Tesoro alla fine si limiterÃ  solo all'estensione della platea che sarÃ  esonerata dallo scatto, inglobando circa 15mila nuovi lavoratori.

Chi si schiera contro il blocco dello scalino Ã¨ Confindustria. "Apprezzabile che il governo si riuscito finora a respingere le richieste in materia di etÃ  pensionabile, che avrebbero un impatto significativo sul deficit pubblico", ha detto il direttore generale di confindustria, Marcella Panucci.

Il Pd, che aveva presentato alcuni emendamenti alla manovra in Senato per chiedere un rinvio di sei mesi (a giugno 2018 ndr) della decisione sull'aumento dell'etÃ  pensionabile, apre alla convergenza con il governo. "Se serve modificare la norma sull'Ape social, per ricomprendere altri lavori, siamo disponibili", ha sottolineato il capogruppo Pd in commissione Bilancio, Giorgio Santini.

L'Istat intanto avverte: non basta stabilire le categorie lavorative da escludere dall'automatismo dell'aumento dell'etÃ  pensionabile, ma anche il percorso del lavoratore. "Ãˆ un tema che si puÃ² affrontare ma va studiato sia dal punto di vista della misura da scrivere che della fattibilitÃ  a implementarla", ha spiegato il presidente dell'Istituto nazionale di statistica, Giorgio Alleva. "Non basta stabilire le categorie - ha osservato il presidente dell'Istat - bisogna anche stabilire se una persona sia stata, per una certa durata della vita lavorativa, in quella posizione. Bisogna valutare anche il percorso lavorativo delle persone".

La Cgil stronca la manovra: "Ancora condoni, lo Stato si piega agli evasori"

Le riaperture dei condoni rafforzano l'idea di una amministrazione che, incapace di recuperare quanto non versato, si piega all'evasore incentivando nuova aspettativa di condoni futuri e quindi nuova evasione". Ãˆ il j'accuse, contenuto nel documento sulla manovra che la Cgil ha depositato alle commissioni Bilancio di Camera e Senato. Il sindacato si riferisce alla riapertura dei termini della rottamazione delle cartelle contenuta nel decreto fiscale, provvedimento che "appare piÃ¹ come un milleproroghe", "una sorta di manovra minima tra nuove entrate ed esigenze indifferibili".
TITLE: "Nella manovra c'Ã¨ il vuoto pneumatico sulle pensioni, lo scatto va fermato"

TEXT:
MÃ‰DIAS - Pourquoi tombe-t-on amoureux d'une personne et pas d'une autre? Qu'est-ce qui nous plaÃ®t tant chez quelqu'un ou au contraire nous insupporte? Pour Ã©valuer le taux de compatibilitÃ© des participants de "MariÃ©s au premier regard", dont la saison 2 commence ce lundi 6 novembre sur M6, les trois experts de l'Ã©mission ont dÃ» mettre en place toute une sÃ©rie de tests.

Comme vous pouvez le dÃ©couvrir en avant-premiÃ¨re dans l'extrait ci-dessus, les cÃ©libataires ayant acceptÃ© de participer Ã  cette Ã©mission qui a rÃ©uni 3,6 millions de tÃ©lÃ©spectateurs en moyenne l'an dernier, ont par exemple dÃ» rÃ©pondre Ã  des questions d'ordres psychologiques et sociologiques telles que: "Vous retenez plus facilement les noms ou les visages?", "Vos opinions dÃ©coulent plus souvent de votre intuition ou de la logique?" ou encore "Vous prÃ©fÃ©rez parler des idÃ©es ou bien des personnes?"

Le psychothÃ©rapeute Jean-Luc Beaumont, lui, a mis au moins des tests sur les croyances et les valeurs. Ce sont par exemple "la fidÃ©litÃ©, le temps passÃ© en famille, l'Ã©ducation des enfants, le respect des autres", liste-t-il.

Enfin, on dÃ©couvre dans cet extrait que les cÃ©libataires ont pu participer Ã  un test olfactif. Chacun d'entre eux devait dormir trois nuit avec un T-shirt, sans aucun parfum, puis le vÃªtement Ã©tait mis dans un sac et prÃ©sentÃ© aux participants de sexe opposÃ©.

D'autres tests seront proposÃ©s par les trois experts de l'Ã©mission (Catherine Solano, Pascal de Sutter et Jean-Luc Beaumont), comme des tests de compÃ©tences conjugales ou de personnalitÃ©. Pour finaliser leurs rÃ©sultats, ils se rendront au domicile des participants afin de se rendre compte de potentiels points communs ou divergents.

SUMMARY:
Another such case has come to light from Maharashtra's Amaravati after a woman filed a missing complaint to the police for her husband and in-laws.
She said that while her husband, Varun, was not the problem, he had a hard time convincing his family.
The in-laws, Sangeeta has claimed, has stopped speaking to her after the birth of her baby in June.
While she is in Amravati, in her maternal home, the trio have gone missing from Virar (West).
The police are still trying to figure out where the six people have gone missing.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Even as the government in India has campaigned to save the girl child with its Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao Yojana, ground reality has changed little. To this day mothers and girl children continue to be abandoned by families because of the baby's gender.

Another such case has come to light from Maharashtra's Amaravati after a woman filed a missing complaint to the police for her husband and in-laws.

Times of India reported that Sangeeta Tiwari, an analyst with a multinational in Pune, suspects that she has been deserted by her husband and in-laws because she gave birth to a girl child. She said that while her husband, Varun, was not the problem, he had a hard time convincing his family.

The in-laws, Sangeeta has claimed, has stopped speaking to her after the birth of her baby in June.

While she is in Amravati, in her maternal home, the trio have gone missing from Virar (West). She used to live in Pune with her husband who is a graphic designer.

The Times of India report says that they family is said to have gone to Nashik to perform religious rights of Satishchandra, the father-in-law, Varun, her brother-in-law Ashwini and Satishchandra's brother Surendra, his wife Malati and their 16-year-old daughter too were missing.

She that her husband's phone was unreachable, and Ashwini took the call but did not speak.

The police are still trying to figure out where the six people have gone missing.
TITLE: Woman Claims Husband, In-laws Have Abandoned Her And 'Gone Missing' After She Gave Birth To A Girl

SUMMARY:
We speak with Wayne and Linda, who helped bring former Manus Island detainee, Amir, to Canada.
Tim O'Connor, communications director at the Refugee Council of Australia, accused Turnbull of "playing games with peoples lives".
"Prime Minister Turnbull is saying 'we don't want these refugees, but you can't have them either'," O'Connor said.
"It's an absolutely bizarre situation Prime Minister Turnbull has got himself into.
"Prime Minister Turnbull should be putting human lives in front of short term political point scoring".
TEXT:
An Iranian refugee detained on Manus Island for four years has been whisked to safety in Canada by a big-hearted family, as hundreds of his friends and fellow refugees languish in abysmal conditions in Papua New Guinea.

Amir Taghinia is 24, and until last week he was among the 600 refugees and asylum seekers in the Australian-run centre on Manus Island.

The centre has since been officially closed, with power, water and food cut off in an attempt by local PNG authorities to force residents to move to other nearby accommodation complexes. The United Nations reported last week that at least one of these three new facilities is not finished, while the other two still lack security fences.

We speak with Wayne and Linda, who helped bring former Manus Island detainee, Amir, to Canada. #TheProjectTV pic.twitter.com/iocGYKtRjS â€” The Project (@theprojecttv) November 6, 2017

Taghinia was last week flown to Coquitlam, near Vancouver, where he will be resettled under a novel Canadian policy which allows private sponsorship of refugees. He was sponsored by the family of Chelsea Taylor, an Australian aid worker who formerly worked on Manus, who have agreed to aid him for one year. Under the Canadian program, the sponsoring family or organisation takes responsibility for providing food, accommodation and living expenses, assisting with enrolling in healthcare and education, finding local doctors, and helping with employment searches.

"I am glad some good people of Canada have brought me to safety, but my heart aches for the many brothers I have left behind in the absolute hell that is Manus Island," Taghinia said.

"That ordinary citizens can bring me to safety, with their meagre resources, shines a light on the shameful practices of this government in keeping these other innocent men trapped in such a terrible situation.

"There are clearly many options the Australian Government has to resettle my friends on Manus, it is inhuman that the Australian Government would not take action to give them safety."

In an interview with Canada's CBC News, Taghinia said "I still cannot believe that I am in Canada... People are so welcoming ... they are so lovely, especially my sponsors."

The Asylum Seeker Resource Centre said that Taghinia's case showed why Australia needed to urgently explore third-country resettlement options for the men on Manus, and decried the Turnbull government's refusal to consider the offer of New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern to take 150 of the refugees. The ASRC said the Canadian example was "a precedent it could and should extend to those suffering on Manus and Nauru."

Here's a statement from PM Ardern on Manus, reiterating her comments in our story from yesterday.https://t.co/FU76bl0Buv@SkyNewsAust pic.twitter.com/bt0YoDFV4k â€” James O'Doherty (@jmodoh) November 3, 2017

"Amir's Canadian sponsorship demonstrates clearly that it is entirely possible for third countries to step in and provide a workable solution to the current crisis on Manus," said ASRC director of advocacy and campaigns, Jana Favero.

"The Turnbull government must get out of the way. Allow food, water and power to be restored. Allow medical services in and then allow third countries to take the refugees, where they will be welcomed to a new life."

The ASRC said it was a case of "PM Turnbull dithers while crisis deepens". Tim O'Connor, communications director at the Refugee Council of Australia, accused Turnbull of "playing games with peoples lives".

"Prime Minister Turnbull is saying 'we don't want these refugees, but you can't have them either'," O'Connor said.

"It's an absolutely bizarre situation Prime Minister Turnbull has got himself into. New Zealand is prepared to take Australia's refugees from Manus, caring members of the Australian community are putting their hand up, even people in Canada have gone to great lengths to ensure the safety of people whose lives are in jeopardy."

"Prime Minister Turnbull should be putting human lives in front of short term political point scoring".
TITLE: Manus Refugee Resettled In Canada As Australia Ignores His Friends

TEXT:
JÃ¼rgen Trittin ist bei den SondierungsgesprÃ¤chen fÃ¼r eine Jamaika-Koalition Verhandler fÃ¼r die GrÃ¼nen

Die "taz" schrieb unlÃ¤ngst in einem Portrait Ã¼ber Trittin, er sei fÃ¼r Union und FDP - aber auch fÃ¼r manche Parteikollegen, ein U-Boot: "Sie fragen sich, ob er fÃ¼r Jamaika Geleitschutz gibt oder ob er irgendwann den Torpedo auf den eigenen Tanker feuert."
