TEXT:
Video ist die beherrschende Kommunikationsform unserer Zeit. Gilt das auch fÃ¼r den Vertrieb? Wird die Kommunikation per Video das Telefon ablÃ¶sen?

Das Thema ist nicht neu. Bereits in den frÃ¼hen 1960er Jahren gab es seitens der Telefonhersteller Vorzeigeprojekte mit BildÃ¼bertragung. Ich selbst habe damals noch keine Erfahrungen mit Bildtelefonie machen kÃ¶nnen. Es hatte sich aber offenbar nicht durchgesetzt.



Â© Fotolia/anyaberkut

Vielleicht liegt es an dem Effekt, den man auch den Telefax-Effekt nennen kÃ¶nnte: Obwohl das Telefax bereits 1843 erfunden war, konnte es sich erst 130 Jahre spÃ¤ter wirklich nennenswert verbreiten. Woran lag das? Nun, es gibt keinen Grund, ein FaxgerÃ¤t zu kaufen, wenn man einer der ersten Teilnehmer an diesem Kommunikationsdienst ist. SchlieÃŸlich mÃ¼sste man viel investieren und kÃ¶nnte das GerÃ¤t kaum zum Einsatz bringen. So ging es auch dem Telefax: Die Kosten fÃ¼r ein GerÃ¤t waren hoch und die Chancen, einen Kommunikationspartner zu finden, gering.

Erst in den 1970er Jahren gelang der Durchbruch des FaxgerÃ¤tes, wobei vor allem japanische Unternehmen diesen Siegeszug verursachten. Endlich gab es ein Medium, mit dem die komplexen japanischen Schriftzeichen sicher Ã¼bertragen werden konnten. Der massenhafte Erfolg des FaxgerÃ¤tes in Japan brachte erschwingliche Preise und schlieÃŸlich eine weltweite Verbreitung.

Video im Vertrieb - Welche Technik eignet sich?

In unserer Zeit haben fast alle Menschen einen Computer im beruflichen Einsatz. Und mindestens genauso verbreitet sind Smartphones, die hervorragend als EndgerÃ¤te fÃ¼r Video-Kommunikation geeignet sind. Die EndgerÃ¤te sind also schon vorhanden und deshalb steht der Verbreitung der Video-Kommunikation nichts mehr im Wege - wenn man weiÃŸ, wie die Technik funktioniert.

Es gibt sicherlich eine groÃŸe Anzahl von Systemen, mit denen man eine geeignete Verbindung per Video aufbauen kann. Hier mÃ¶chte ich mich auf einige wenige beschrÃ¤nken, die aufgrund ihrer Verbreitung erwÃ¤hnenswert sind.

Skype - eignet es sich fÃ¼r Vertrieb per Video-Kommunikation?

Das Unternehmen Skype ist inzwischen im Microsoft-Konzern aufgegangen. Der Name hat sich vielerorts als Kategorie-Begriff durchgesetzt. â€Lass uns skypen" versteht man als Aufforderung, statt dem Telefon die kostenlose Kommunikation per Internet zu wÃ¤hlen.

Um teilnehmen zu kÃ¶nnen, benÃ¶tigt man ein Konto bei Skype und bekommt dann ein â€Skype Handle". Das ist ein eindeutiger Name, der aus zusammenhÃ¤ngenden Buchstaben und Ziffern besteht. Bevor man sich kontaktieren kann, muss man sich gegenseitig autorisieren. Das verhindert SPAM und Missbrauch, ist jedoch fÃ¼r Neulinge mÃ¼hsam zu verstehen. Vielleicht ein Grund, dass sich Skype nur relativ langsam verbreitet. Inzwischen geht man von etwa 1,3 Milliarden Nutzern weltweit aus.

KÃ¼rzlich wurden auch Gruppenkommunikationen mit mehr als zwei Teilnehmern mÃ¶glich, sodass es jetzt einen wesentlichen Nachteil gegenÃ¼ber Wettbewerbern ausgleichen konnte.

Google Hangouts ermÃ¶glicht Video-Kommunikation in Gruppen

Zehn Jahre nach Skype kam Google mit seinem Video-Kommunikations-Dienst Hangouts auf den Markt. Um ihn zu benutzen, benÃ¶tigt man lediglich ein Google-Konto.

DarÃ¼ber hinaus ist der Dienst von Google mit Skype vergleichbar, auch wenn er noch weitere Funktionen bietet, die wir spÃ¤ter noch behandeln werden.

Zoom bietet einen Meetingraum fÃ¼r den Vertrieb

Meine bevorzugte LÃ¶sung fÃ¼r Video-Kommunikation im Vertrieb ist derzeit zoom.us. Es ist kostenlos, wenn man nur mit einem GesprÃ¤chspartner kommunizieren will. Bei mehr als zwei Teilnehmern ist die GesprÃ¤chsdauer auf 40 Minuten beschrÃ¤nkt. Die einfachste kostenpflichtige Variante bekommen Sie ab 15 Euro. Dann sind bis zu 100 Teilnehmer mÃ¶glich.

Der besondere Vorteil: Nur einer der Teilnehmer benÃ¶tigt ein Konto beim Anbieter. Also kÃ¶nnen VerkÃ¤ufer sich ein Konto anlegen. Die anderen GesprÃ¤chspartner benÃ¶tigen nur einen einfachen Link. Wenn man darauf zum ersten Mal klickt, wird automatisch eine Software installiert. Das gilt auch fÃ¼r Smartphones. Dann kann man einfach teilnehmen. Alle Beteiligten kÃ¶nnen eigenstÃ¤ndig ihre Kamera und Mikrofon ein- und ausschalten. Ebenso kÃ¶nnen alle Teilnehmer ihren Bildschirminhalt Ã¼bertragenen und so beispielsweise PrÃ¤sentationen allen andern Teilnehmern zeigen.

Die Video-Meetings kÃ¶nnen automatisch aufgezeichnet werden. Nach Ende der Video-Konferenz dauert es einen kurzen Moment, dann ist eine Video-Datei verfÃ¼gbar, die das GesprÃ¤ch und alle Video-Inhalte enthÃ¤lt. Das kann sehr hilfreich sein, wenn man das GesprÃ¤ch im Nachgang dem Kunden zur VerfÃ¼gung stellen mÃ¶chte.

Sales on Camera - So gelingt Vertrieb per Video

Jeder weiÃŸ, was zu tun ist, um zu Telefonieren. Bei der Kommunikation per Video sind die meisten Menschen ungeÃ¼bt. Deshalb hier einige Ideen, um per Video besser zu verkaufen.

In unseren Tagen ist die Kommunikation per Video - zumindest privat - an der Tagesordnung. Jeder kann irgendwie damit umgehen. Denken wir. Ausgebildete Kameraleute schlagen verzweifelt die HÃ¤nde Ã¼ber dem Kopf zusammen, wenn Sie so manche Videonachrichten sehen. Das muss aber nicht sein. Hier einige einfache, aber wichtige Informationen.

Perspektive erzeugt Emotionen

Die Kamera entspricht im VideogesprÃ¤ch dem Auge des Betrachters. Wenn Sie Ã¼ber Webcam kommunizieren, ist die Webcam das Auge des Kunden. Achten Sie deshalb darauf, dass die Kamera auf gleicher HÃ¶he zu Ihren Augen ist.

Wenn Sie eine normale Haltung einnehmen und einen Notebook verwenden, ist das Bild Ihrer Bildschirm-Kamera nicht optimal, weil es von unten kommt und Ihr Gesicht verzerrt. Wenn Sie einen Notebook verwenden, sollten Sie ihn deshalb besser auf einen Stapel BÃ¼cher stellen.

Noch besser ist eine USB-Kamera, die man auf ein Stativ montieren kann. Dann ist die HÃ¶he sehr gut einstellbar. AugenhÃ¶he ist auch aus psychologischer Sicht wichtig.

Wenn die Kamera zu nah ist, kann Ihr Gesicht verzerrt wirken. Stellen Sie die Kamera lieber etwas weiter weg. Wenn Sie die Variante mit dem Notebook auf dem BÃ¼cherstapel wÃ¤hlen, sollten Sie eine zweite Tastatur und eine Maus einplanen.

Hintergrund fÃ¼r Video-Kommunikation

Ein neutraler, weiÃŸer Hintergrund ist optimal. Bitte keine auffÃ¤lligen Bilder im Hintergrund. Ihre GesprÃ¤chspartner wÃ¤ren abgelenkt.

FÃ¼r die Beleuchtung ist es wichtig, dass der Hintergrund Ã¤hnlich hell ist, wie Ihr Gesicht im Vordergrund. Ein helles Fenster hinter Ihnen ist ebenso schlecht, wie ein dunkler Raum. FÃ¼r eine gute Video-Kommunikation sollten Sie gut erkennbar sein und kein besonderer Helligkeitskontrast zum Hintergrund bestehen.

Licht fÃ¼r das Verkaufen per Video

Wenn Sie eine weiche, gleichmÃ¤ÃŸige Ausleuchtung suchen, ist eine groÃŸflÃ¤chige Beleuchtung mit wenig Abstand ideal. Direkt vor einem Fenster sitzend - mit dem Blick dorthin - haben Sie eine gute Ausleuchtung, wenn das Fenster keine direkte Sonneneinstrahlung hat.

Abends sollten Sie eine Lampe nutzen, die Sie anstrahlt. Je grÃ¶ÃŸer die FlÃ¤che des LeuchtkÃ¶rpers ist und je nÃ¤her am Gesicht, je weicher wird das Licht. Umgekehrt erzeugt weit entferntes Licht mit kleiner FlÃ¤che ein hartes Licht, das sehr harte Schatten wirft (beispielsweise ein Halogenstrahler an der Decke).

Ton ist entscheidend, wenn Sie per Video verkaufen

Machen Sie beim Ton keine Kompromisse. Ideal ist eine Kombination aus KopfhÃ¶rern und einem GroÃŸmembran-Mikrofon. So kÃ¶nnen Sie mit geringem Abstand zum Mikrofon viele UmgebungsgerÃ¤usche ausblenden und Ihre Sprache ohne Hall und RÃ¼ckkoppelung Ã¼bermitteln.

Ich selbst nutze das Rode Podcaster, das man einfach an einem USB-Anschluss nutzen kann.

Die nÃ¤chstbeste Variante ist ein Headset mit Mikrofon, das Ã¼ber USB oder den KopfhÃ¶reranschluss angesteckt wird. Eine Variante Ã¼ber Bluetooth ist nicht so optimal, weil es bei FunkÃ¼bertragung immer kleine ÃœbertragungsverzÃ¶gerungen gibt (Fachchinesisch: Latenzen), die dann zu Hall und anderen akustischen StÃ¶rungen fÃ¼hren kÃ¶nnen. Bei wichtigen VerkaufsgesprÃ¤chen per Video wÃ¼rde ich nach heutigem Stand der Technik noch immer ein Mikrofon und Headset mit Kabel nutzen.

Verhaltensregeln fÃ¼r das Verkaufen per Video

VerÃ¤ndern Sie Ihre Sprechweise nicht kÃ¼nstlich und verhalten Sie sich wie am Telefon. Jetzt dÃ¼rfen Sie zusÃ¤tzlich noch beachten, dass Sie mÃ¶glichst immer in die Kamera blickten und nur noch peripher den Rest Ihres Bildschirms sehen. Das gilt zumindest so lange, wie Sie selbst sprechen oder Ihr Kunde spricht. Kurze Unterbrechungen des Augenkontakts sind ok, aber ohne diesen - wenn auch virtuellen - ist es kaum mÃ¶glich eine Bindung zu erzeugen.

Wenn Sie Husten mÃ¼ssen, oder es kurz laut in Ihrem Umfeld wird, kÃ¶nnen Sie temporÃ¤r mit einem Klick Ihr Mikrophon stumm schalten und spÃ¤ter wieder aktivieren.

Sie sollten auch darauf achten, dass die Internetverbindung wÃ¤hrend der Unterhaltung nicht unnÃ¶tig belastet wird. Dazu kÃ¶nnen Sie alle Programme beenden, die im Hintergrund das Internet nutzen. Typische Bandbreitenfressen sind: Dropbox, E-Mail und andere Programme, die ohne Ihr Eingreifen Dateien synchronisieren.

Scheitern an der Technik - Wie einfach ist es fÃ¼r den Kunden?

Egal mit welchem System Sie arbeiten wollen - wichtig ist, dass Sie dem unerfahrenen Kunden eine Anleitung zukommen lassen, damit er - ohne sich zu blamieren - an der Video-Konferenz teilnehmen kann. Am besten, Sie finden online eine Anleitung in der passenden Sprache oder Sie schreiben selbst eine.

Wie bereits erwÃ¤hnt ist Zoom.us meine aktuelle Wahl, weil man als Teilnehmer einfach mit einem Klick auf einen Link teilnehmen kann. Aber auch hier gibt es HÃ¼rden: Manche Unternehmen blockieren aus SicherheitsgrÃ¼nden das Installieren von zusÃ¤tzlicher Software auf den firmeneigenen Notebooks. Daran kann auch eine Video-Kommunikation mit Zoom scheitern. Am besten Sie geben dem Kunden die Gelegenheit, es vorher zu testen.

Auch fÃ¼r Skype und Hangouts kann es Blockaden geben, weil manche Unternehmen Streaming generell aus dem Unternehmensnetz verbannt haben.

Eine Alternative wÃ¤re die Nutzung eines Smartphones. Alle genannten Dienste bieten jeweils eine App fÃ¼r iOS und Android an, mit der man einfach teilnehmen kann. Allerdings muss auch diese erst einmal geladen werden.

Wenn alle Stricke reiÃŸen, wÃ¤re auch eine Einwahl per klassischem Telefon mÃ¶glich. Wegen des dann fehlenden Bildkanals wÃ¤re das ein RÃ¼ckschritt. Aber wenn ein einzelner Teilnehmer dabei sein will, im Moment jedoch auf Reisen ist und nur so teilnehmen kann, ist das ein akzeptabler Kompromiss.

Inhalte prÃ¤sentieren - Verkaufen per Video-Kommunikation

Alle hier genannten Dienste bieten die MÃ¶glichkeit, Bildschirminhalte zu Ã¼bertragen. Auf diese Weise kÃ¶nnen Sie PrÃ¤sentationen mit Powerpoint & Co. leicht vorbereiten und Ihren Teilnehmern zeigen. Auch andere Inhalte Ihres Bildschirms kÃ¶nnen auf diese Weise mit einer Gruppe besprochen werden.

Weil beispielsweise bei Zoom daraus automatisch eine Aufzeichnung entsteht, die man herunterladen und ggf. weiterbearbeiten kann, ist es auf diese Weise sehr einfach, einmal durchgefÃ¼hrte PrÃ¤sentationen ganz oder teilweise auch Dritten zur VerfÃ¼gung zu stellen.

Verkaufen per Video - Ihre Botschaft geht um die Welt

Google Hangouts bietet mit der Option â€on Air" eine MÃ¶glichkeit an, die Inhalte der Video-Botschaft sofort an eine breite Ã–ffentlichkeit auszustrahlen. Gleiches bietet auch Facebook Live. Beide Varianten lassen es auch zu, dass der Teilnehmerkreis beschrÃ¤nkt wird, beispielsweise so, dass nur die Mitglieder einer bestimmten Facebook-Gruppe die Inhalte sehen kÃ¶nnen. Wenn Sie Erfahrung mit Messen, Roadshows und Konferenzen als Werkzeug fÃ¼r Vertrieb und Marketing gemacht haben, kÃ¶nnen Sie diese Technik nutzen, um zusÃ¤tzliche Teilnehmer hinzuzufÃ¼gen, die live nicht teilnehmen kÃ¶nnen. Sie mÃ¼ssten lediglich diese MÃ¶glichkeit zur Teilnahme ankÃ¼ndigen und vor Ort die Technik dafÃ¼r schaffen. FÃ¼r geringe Zusatzkosten kÃ¶nnen Sie so eine ganze Menge mehr Teilnehmer einbinden.

Video als Werkzeug fÃ¼r den Vertrieb

Wir dÃ¼rfen die neuen MÃ¶glichkeiten nutzen, um dort, wo es sinnvoll ist, das Telefon abzulÃ¶sen und vielleicht sogar GeschÃ¤ftsreisen zu ersetzen. GegenÃ¼ber dem Telefon kÃ¶nnen wir sicher die Wirkung der Kommunikation verbessern. Und dort, wo man GeschÃ¤ftsreisen einsparen kann, werden nicht nur Kosten gespart, sondern vor allem die unproduktiven Reisezeiten verringert. Auch wenn der direkte persÃ¶nliche Kontakt sicher besser ist, kann man so die ein oder andere Reise durch eine professionell gemachte Video-Konferenz ersetzen.

Wenn Sie die Checkliste fÃ¼r Ihre Video-Konferenz herunterladen wollen, kÃ¶nnen Sie das jetzt ganz einfach hier erledigen. Sie bekommen dann automatisch auch den Zugriff auf die anderen Artikel und Zusatzinhalte unseres Schwerpunktthemas Neukundengewinnung.
TITLE: Video im Vertrieb - LÃ¶st die Digitalisierung das Telefon ab?

TEXT:
La delantera rusa Elena Danilova le arrebata de una barrida el balÃ³n a la centrocampista bÃ¡vara Dzsenifer Marozsan durante un partido de la fase de grupos de la Eurocopa Femenil de la UEFA del 2017 entre Rusia y Alemania en el Estadio Galgenwaard en Utrecht el 25 de julio, 2017.

El futbol es un deporte que provoca una cascada de sentimientos que cuando son cuestionados, a veces ni sabemos quÃ© contestar. Es pasiÃ³n, amor, desilusiÃ³n, frustraciÃ³n y enojo. Es tantas cosas que no hay nada mÃ¡s bonito en el mundo que sentarte en la sala y ver un buen partido en domingo, con una chela y unas papitas para botanear.

Algo que a veces no soporto del futbol masculino mundial es que cada vez se ve mÃ¡s displicencia y condescendencia con respecto al juego, simulaciones de faltas y ganas de engaÃ±ar al Ã¡rbitro, asÃ­ como muchos jugadores que no sudan la camiseta.

Mientras el amor que tenÃ­a por este deporte se difuminaba, estas pasadas vacaciones tuve la oportunidad de seguir la Eurocopa femenil de fÃºtbol en Holanda... y me preguntÃ© por quÃ© no lo habÃ­a descubierto antes: unas ganas y actitud de esfuerzo por parte de las futbolistas inigualable. MÃ¡s fuertes, duras y toscas en las faltas e incluso los partidos son mÃ¡s agradables por la mentalidad de "ganar" por parte de todas. En el futbol femenil los partidos son mucho mÃ¡s emocionantes y dinÃ¡micos (con decirles que la final quedÃ³ 4-2) que muchos de su contraparte masculina.

Este resumen de la final de la Euro entre Holanda y Dinamarca les puede dar una idea de lo apasionantes que se vuelven estos duelos:

Ya que la competiciÃ³n futbolÃ­stica se estÃ¡ expandiendo en muchos lugares para las mujeres, y con el inicio de la Liga MX femenil en nuestro paÃ­s apenas el pasado 28 de julio, les traigo a tres de las futbolistas que (aparte de poseer una calidad impresionante en el terreno de juego) tuvieron que superar adversidades que muchos hombres nunca se van a tener que enfrentar, solo por el hecho de ser mujeres:

Nadia Nadim

La danesa Nadia Nadim celebra luego de anotar el primer gol de la final de la Eurocopa Femenil 2017 disputada entre Holanda y Dinamarca el 6 de agosto del 2017.

Una de cinco hermanas, la danesa adoptiva Nadia Nadim tuvo que escapar de su paÃ­s natal, AfganistÃ¡n, luego de que su padre fuese asesinado por los talibanes. Ella cuenta que sus padre fue citado por los talibanes (parte del Emirato IslÃ¡mico de AfganistÃ¡n) y que nunca regresÃ³, pero que seis meses despuÃ©s su madre descubriÃ³ que fue llevado al desierto y ejecutado.

La vida para seis mujeres en un paÃ­s en esta guerra, provocada por un grupo que se caracteriza por tratar a la mujer mÃ¡s como un objeto que como un ser humano, era prÃ¡cticamente imposible.

Ella misma dijo que si se hubiera quedado ahÃ­ probablemente se hubiera suicidado por ser muy independiente como para conformarse en una sociedad tan represiva.

Luego su madre invirtiÃ³ todos sus ahorros con el objetivo de escapar, asÃ­ consiguieron refugiarse en Italia con pasaportes falsos. Posteriormente se subieron a un autobÃºs que se suponÃ­a irÃ­a a Londres (donde la familia de Nadia tenÃ­a familia), pero el bus se detuvo, los sacaron, le preguntaron a un transeÃºnte en donde estaban y descubrieron que se encontraban en las zonas rurales de Dinamarca.

Los enviaron a un centro de refugiados y Nadia finalmente pudo jugar al balÃ³n sin sufrir ningÃºn prejuicio cultural o social, por lo que decidiÃ³ competir por la naciÃ³n que no reprimÃ­a su gusto por el balompiÃ©.

Ahora, a sus 29 aÃ±os, la delantera se ha convertido en una de las jugadoras mÃ¡s determinantes de su equipo, logrando llevar a su selecciÃ³n a la final de la Ãºltima Eurocopa y llegando a anotar 22 goles para su paÃ­s adoptivo.

Charlyn Corral

Charlyn Corral celebra el gol que le hizo en tiempo extra a Trinidad y Tobago en el Premundial Femenino de CONCACAF por el tercer lugar el 26 de octubre del 2014.

La delantera mexicana de 26 aÃ±os, autodenominada la Cinco Copas del futbol femenil, naciÃ³ en cuna futbolera. Ella relata que su padre era el que armaba las retas en su barrio, por lo que desde temprana edad pudo entrenar y llegÃ³ a su primer club, Pumitas.

Sin embargo, los sacrificios se hacen evidentes para cualquier familia mexicana de clase media para abajo, por lo que tenÃ­a que salir (desde los diez aÃ±os) entre cinco y seis de la maÃ±ana todos los fines de semana a jugar partidos, ya que empezaban a entrenar desde las 8 de la maÃ±ana.

Charlyn dudÃ³ en continuar con su carrera futbolÃ­stica antes de la operaciÃ³n que le realizaron cuando se le diagnÃ³stico sindrome compartimental en los chamorros.

Los problemas econÃ³micos para cualquier jugadora se intensifican cuando el aspecto laboral y salarial del futbol femenil en MÃ©xico no estÃ¡n definidos... y se juntan con la economÃ­a mexicana en crisis casi permanente. Por lo que para ella todo es claro: "Todas las jugadoras que estamos en selecciÃ³n, en algÃºn momento tuvimos que invertir en camiones, uniformes. Por eso muchas nos vamos al extranjero, porque si no ganas, tampoco vas a gastar".

TambiÃ©n ha sufrido de momentos crÃ­ticos en su vida, como cuando incluso pensÃ³ en retirarse luego de que se le diagnosticara sindrome compartimental en los chamorros, antes de la operaciÃ³n dudÃ³ en continuar con su carrera futbolÃ­stica.

No obstante, la no. 9 mexicana superÃ³ esa lesiÃ³n y actualmente milita en el Levante de EspaÃ±a donde da cÃ¡tedra sobre lo que es una verdadera atacante, que no solo vislumbra por su calidad sino tambiÃ©n por su entrega. Les dejo una recopilaciÃ³n de sus mejores goles en el Levante:

Marta Vieira

Bruno Zanardo/Getty Images Marta Vieira da Silva observa el campo de la Arena Amazonia en un partido de los Juegos OlÃ­mpicos de Brasil el 9 de agosto del 2016.

Considerada como la mejor futbolista de la historia por sus cinco balones de oro consecutivos (entre 2006 y 2010) la brasileÃ±a Marta Vieira sufriÃ³ la desigualdad de gÃ©nero en su paÃ­s y las dificultades que se encontrÃ³ por vivir en una sociedad sexista. Ella explica que desde su infancia sus hermanos la perseguÃ­an para que nadie viera a una mujer jugando este deporte, el cual solo podÃ­an jugar los hombres en Dois Riachos (ciudad donde ella creciÃ³).

Incluso sus propios padres se avergonzaban de ella por todos los comentarios sexistas que recibÃ­an de sus vecinos.

Ella incluso mencionÃ³ que su familia deseaba otra cosa: "QuerÃ­an que jugara a las muÃ±ecas o que hiciera algo para volver al mundo femenino".

ImagÃ­nense que tanto talento y calidad se habrÃ­an perdido si le hubiera hecho caso a sus padres...

Ya con 14 aÃ±os saliÃ³ de su pueblo y fue a RÃ­o de Janeiro para poder cumplir su sueÃ±o: jugar con el Vasco de Gama. Su origen no solo era sexista, tambiÃ©n humilde. Y con la meta en su mente logrÃ³ recorrer en autobÃºs los 2 mil kilÃ³metros que hay entre Dois Riachos hasta RÃ­o (para que se den una idea el recorrido de la CDMX a Acapulco son 378 km en carretera).

Ahora, la 10 de la Canarinha es la jugadora que mÃ¡s anotaciones ha clavado en un Mundial con 15, ha sido campeona de la liga de Suecia en seis oportunidades y dos ocasiones de la Liga de Estados Unidos.

Sin embargo, aunque fue llamada por el CEO de equipo Orlando Pride como "la mejor futbolista de la historia", la desigualdad de gÃ©nero en el fÃºtbol femenil es visible en los temas salariales. En el RÃ¶sengard (antiguo equipo de Marta) ganaba aproximadamente 500 mil dÃ³lares ya contando salario, primas y patrocinios, pero su contraparte masculina en la selecciÃ³n nacional, Cristiano Ronaldo, por ejemplo, de puro sueldo con el Real Madrid gana 50 millones de dÃ³lares al aÃ±o.

Y por Ãºltimo, para continuar quitando prejuicios que se tienen del futbol femenil, les dejo una recopilaciÃ³n que hizo el canal "Teo CRi" en YouTube de las mejores habilidades, dribles, regates, goles y asistencias en el futbol femenino mundial. Se darÃ¡n cuenta que algunas son incluso mejores que en sus contrapartes masculinas:

*Este contenido representa la opiniÃ³n del autor y no necesariamente la de HuffPost MÃ©xico.

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTBHOPAL -- Five days after the gangrape of a 19-year-old college student in Bhopal, the Madhya Pradesh government has transferred two senior officers including Inspector General of Police (IG).
Railway police official, Anita Malviya, who had faced strong criticism for allegedly being insensitive during the handling of the case, has also been transferred.
This is the first action that has been taken against senior officials.
Till now mostly the lower rank officials including three SHOs apart and a middle-level official had faced action.
Though he has been removed from the post of IG Bhopal, Choudhary has been given the charge of IG (Law-and-Order).
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

BHOPAL -- Five days after the gangrape of a 19-year-old college student in Bhopal, the Madhya Pradesh government has transferred two senior officers including Inspector General of Police (IG).

Bhopal IG, Yogesh Choudhary, has been moved to the police headquarters.

Railway police official, Anita Malviya, who had faced strong criticism for allegedly being insensitive during the handling of the case, has also been transferred.

When asked by media persons, she was seen laughing and reportedly said that she had a "headache talking about case again and again". After the video of conversation went viral, there was anger among citizens, which was reflected on social media as well.

Malviya, a state police service (SPS) officer, was posted as superintendent of Railway Police. The GRP police station was directly under her supervision. The GRP too had refused to register an FIR initially.

This is the first action that has been taken against senior officials. Till now mostly the lower rank officials including three SHOs apart and a middle-level official had faced action.

Though he has been removed from the post of IG Bhopal, Choudhary has been given the charge of IG (Law-and-Order). Choudhary is being replaced by Jaideep Prasad.
TITLE: Bhopal Inspector General And SP Of Railway Police Transferred For Mishandling 19-Year-Old's Gangrape Case

The international development secretary has also been reprimanded by Downing Street for her actions.
The BBC was the first to report on Friday that Patel had undisclosed meetings.
Kate Osamor MP, Labourâ€™s shadow development secretary, said: â€œTodayâ€™s statement is a desperate last-ditch attempt by Priti Patel to save her job.
However Patel today admitted the foreign secretary â€œbecame aware of the visitâ€ but â€œnot in advance of itâ€.
TEXT:
Priti Patel has apologised for taking time out of a family holiday to meet Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other politicians without telling the Foreign Office in advance.

The international development secretary has also been reprimanded by Downing Street for her actions.

Labour said Patel must either be investigated by the Cabinet Office or resign.

Patel was accompanied to nearly all of her meetings with Israeli ministers, charities and non-governmental organisations by honorary president of the Conservative Friends of Israel lobbying group, Lord Polak.

She apologised for setting up and reporting the meetings â€œin a way which did not accord with the usual proceduresâ€ and clarified her claim that Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson â€œknew about the visitâ€, admitting he did not know about it in advance.

The BBC was the first to report on Friday that Patel had undisclosed meetings.

Patel said in a statement on Monday: â€œThis summer I travelled to Israel, on a family holiday paid for myself.

â€œWhile away, I had the opportunity to meet a number of people and organisations. I am publishing a list of who I met.â€ The Foreign and Commonwealth Office was aware of my visit while it was under wayâ€.

â€œIn hindsight, I can see how my enthusiasm to engage in this way could be misread, and how meetings were set up and reported in a way which did not accord with the usual procedures. I am sorry for this and I apologise for it.

â€œMy first and only aim as the Secretary of State for International Development is to put the interests of British taxpayers and the worldâ€™s poor at the front of our development work.â€

Downing Street said Theresa May had spoken to Patel and â€œaccepted her apology for her handling of the matterâ€.

â€œThe prime minister met the secretary of state this morning to remind her of the obligations which exist under the ministerial code,â€ a No.10 spokesman said.

Downing Street also revealed May did not know about the meeting between Patel and Netanyahu until Friday.

Kate Osamor MP, Labourâ€™s shadow development secretary, said: â€œTodayâ€™s statement is a desperate last-ditch attempt by Priti Patel to save her job. It has now emerged that, contrary to her statement on Friday, the Foreign Secretary was never told in advance about her meetings in Israel - which we have only now discovered included meetings with Prime Minister Netanyahu and with the Foreign Ministry.

â€œNot only does it look like she might have breached the Ministerial Code, she has now been caught misleading the British public. If she doesnâ€™t now resign, then Theresa May must immediately refer the issue to the Cabinet Office for a full investigation.â€

Dfid has admitted that the statement Patel gave to The Guardian on November 3 could have left given the impression Johnson knew about her trip in advance.

â€œBoris knew about the visit. The point is that the Foreign Office did know about this, Boris knew about [the trip],â€ she told the newspaper.

However Patel today admitted the foreign secretary â€œbecame aware of the visitâ€ but â€œnot in advance of itâ€.

Dfid also had to acknowledge that Patel may have led people to believe all the meetings she had in Israel had already been publically reported - when they had not.

â€œThe Secretary of State regrets the lack of precision in the wording she used in these statements, and is taking this opportunity to clarify the position,â€ Dfid said.

The department has also published a list of those Patel met on her visit.
TITLE: Priti Patel Apologises For Undisclosed Meetings With Israeli Government

SUMMARY:
Actress Mila Kunis expertly trolls Vice President Mike Pence on a monthly basis.
On Thursday's broadcast of "Conan," the "Bad Moms" star revealed how she protests against Pence and his policies on limiting access to reproductive health care.
"I disagreed with some of the stuff that Pence was doing and was trying to do," Kunis told host Conan O'Brien.
To remind Pence that "there are women out there in the world that may or may not agree with his platform," Kunis set up a recurring monthly donation to a particular nonprofit organisation in his name.
But it's one that likely wouldn't please the conservative politician.
TEXT:
Actress Mila Kunis expertly trolls Vice President Mike Pence on a monthly basis.

On Thursday's broadcast of "Conan," the "Bad Moms" star revealed how she protests against Pence and his policies on limiting access to reproductive health care.

"I disagreed with some of the stuff that Pence was doing and was trying to do," Kunis told host Conan O'Brien.

To remind Pence that "there are women out there in the world that may or may not agree with his platform," Kunis set up a recurring monthly donation to a particular nonprofit organisation in his name.

But it's one that likely wouldn't please the conservative politician.

SUMMARY:
Kevin Spacey has reportedly been dropped by both his publicist and talent agency, after multiple came forward to accuse him of varying levels of sexual harassment.
Accusations against Spacey were made public earlier this week, when actor Anthony Rapp described an alleged incident which transpired between the two of them when he was just 14 years old.
Since then, several more people have shared their own experiences of Spacey, including several crew members who worked with him on the hit Netflix series â€˜House Of Cardsâ€™.
One production assistant described working on the show as a â€œtoxic environmentâ€, alleging that he was once fondled by Spacey in a car without his consent, and later cornered in his trailer.
After the allegations came to light, it was confirmed that production on the upcoming sixth and final series of â€˜House Of Cardsâ€™ - in which Spacey stars as corrupt politician Frank Underwood - had been suspended indefinitely.
TEXT:
The Oscar-winning actorâ€™s publicist Staci Wolfe has confirmed to Vulture that she will no longer be representing Stacey, following the allegations, while â€œa source closeâ€ to the â€˜House Of Cardsâ€™ star told them that talent agency CAA has also chosen to part ways with him .

Kevin Spacey has reportedly been dropped by both his publicist and talent agency, after multiple came forward to accuse him of varying levels of sexual harassment.

Accusations against Spacey were made public earlier this week, when actor Anthony Rapp described an alleged incident which transpired between the two of them when he was just 14 years old.

Spacey responded to the allegations in a statement on his Twitter page, in which he admitted he didnâ€™t recall the events described, but offered his â€œsincerest apologiesâ€ for â€œwhat would have been deeply inappropriate drunken behaviourâ€.

He also came under fire for taking this moment to publicly acknowledge that he was â€œchoosing to live his life as a gay manâ€, which was perceived by some prominent figures in the LGBT+ community as a way of â€œdeflectingâ€ from the accusations.

Since then, several more people have shared their own experiences of Spacey, including several crew members who worked with him on the hit Netflix series â€˜House Of Cardsâ€™.

One production assistant described working on the show as a â€œtoxic environmentâ€, alleging that he was once fondled by Spacey in a car without his consent, and later cornered in his trailer.

After the allegations came to light, it was confirmed that production on the upcoming sixth and final series of â€˜House Of Cardsâ€™ - in which Spacey stars as corrupt politician Frank Underwood - had been suspended indefinitely.
TITLE: Kevin Spacey Dropped By Publicist Following Sexual Harassment Allegations

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTStruggling against an orgy of shouting, clapping, and singing, the solemn weight of history dissolves in the deep shadows of the Gol Gumbaz.
This flux characterises Bijapur, a palimpsest notable for the legacies of the monumental Adil Shahs.
From the Baran Kaman to the Taj Bauri, from Ibrahim Rauza to Gagan Mahal, the past speaks in Bijapur.
In almost a century since, as the Palmyra lies devastated, the built legacy of Bijapur is at risk of an oblivion given the splintering of civic belonging and urban development.
It is ours, a shared task: it is a challenge to make the past one with the future.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Struggling against an orgy of shouting, clapping, and singing, the solemn weight of history dissolves in the deep shadows of the Gol Gumbaz. A royal tomb, the Gumbaz is sublimely grave in a way only maqbaras can be. Yet, after half a millennium it is also the sanctuary of a motley public. Despite its sepia magnificence, it is reinvented daily and is many things and places simultaneously.

And why not? Buildings, after all, do have a life of their own. They breathe and suffer, and are reborn with the communities who live in and around them. They change with the people who come to them as much, perhaps, as people are changed by their experiences of them. This infusion of character is constant and dynamic, and so the original creative intent becomes one amongst an unending matrix of meanings which emerge from brick and mortar.

This flux characterises Bijapur, a palimpsest notable for the legacies of the monumental Adil Shahs. The long shadows of memory and the tangible history of built form make the boundaries of past and present sfumato with constant use. From the Baran Kaman to the Taj Bauri, from Ibrahim Rauza to Gagan Mahal, the past speaks in Bijapur. It whispers of ambition, the seductions of power strange and terrible, desire and aspiration immortalised in stone. Born of vanity and vision, it symbolises a fusion of form, time, and space not only in terms of what was but also of what can be.

How do we imagine â€” spatially, economically, and affectively â€” the contours of such a fusion though? Who belongs to a city, and to whom do its edifices, not just its monuments but also buildings and infrastructure, belong? The law shelters the business of conservation from the commerce and traffic of daily life. Our conservation apparatus seems designed to institute alienation, and rarely does a neighbourhood, community, or people claim trusteeship over a building. We care about our homes, the houses we live in, but find it difficult to think of our cities as home, to care for the songs and shadows they surround us with.

The personal, therefore, is exiled from the communal, and the voice of memory and affect is unable to find a niche under the arch of history. In turning deaf to these voices, in seeing our past not as vibrantly alive but as delicately dead, we perform a grave disservice to our future. The Jami Masjid in Bijapur, for example, belongs both to the community of worshipers, as to the conservation apparatus which serves to memorialise it as a beacon of dakhini architecture. These meanings are not necessarily contrary, but that they often can be is a story local not just to Bijapur but to scores of cities across the subcontinent.

What is needed, then, is a marriage of interpretations and practice. Writing in 1889, Henry Cousens, then Superintendent of the Archaeological Survey of India (Western Circle), related that 'Bijapur has been called the Palmyra of the Dekhan'. In almost a century since, as the Palmyra lies devastated, the built legacy of Bijapur is at risk of an oblivion given the splintering of civic belonging and urban development. The manifold significance of the past is often in its ability to overwhelm, to instil a reverential awe which prompts interrogation and introspection. As we cloister these works and stories of our ancestors behind higher walls and turn blindly towards the future, we risk becoming harsher, meaner, and poorer.

Our heritage belongs to all of us. We cannot privilege one meaning and practice, without irrevocably losing the layered richness which grounds us organically to our communities and cities. The processes of use and interpretation have to be contextual, and it is through constant conversation alone that this erosion can be checked. How, for instance, do we make Taj Bauri relevant to the potable needs of residents without losing sight of the public generosity which informed its making? How do we reinvent Gol Gumbaz as a rendezvous point for a citizenry starved of safe public spaces? Can Baran Kaman become the breathing emblem of ambition which soars, and fails, and yet lives? The challenge at hand is to birth a future which sustains as much from the past as it loops back to it, where growth will aspire to be not from but with a common legacy. This challenge is monumental in itself, for it is not specific to Bijapur. It is ours, a shared task: it is a challenge to make the past one with the future.

Anubhav Pradhan is an Urban Research Fellow with the Indian Institute for Human Settlements. The views expressed here are his own.
TITLE: Notes From Bijapur: Why Its Architectural Legacy Is At The Risk Of Oblivion

Cette opposition entre jeux vidÃ©o et bonne santÃ© doit-elle empÃªcher l'e-sport d'intÃ©grer les Jeux Olympiques?
Et si on montrait au monde les jeux vidÃ©o comme une activitÃ© compÃ©titive, prÃ´nant l'esprit d'Ã©quipe, le dÃ©passement de soi et le respect d'autrui?
Ces valeurs sont partagÃ©es par l'e-sport et par le sport traditionnel, et il serait grand temps que le grand public en soit informÃ©.
TEXT:
La nouvelle s'est rapidement rÃ©pandue: le sport Ã©lectronique, plus communÃ©ment appelÃ© e-sport, pourrait figurer sur la liste des disciplines aux Jeux Olympiques de Paris en 2024. C'est tout du moins ce qu'a laissÃ© entendre Tony Estanguet, le PrÃ©sident du ComitÃ© d'Organisation lors d'une interview:

"Nous devons nous pencher sur la question car nous ne pouvons pas dire 'non, Ã§a ne nous regarde pas, Ã§a n'a rien Ã  voir avec les JO'. La jeunesse est intÃ©ressÃ©e par l'e-sport et ce genre de pratiques. Nous devons y prÃªter attention. Nous devons les rencontrer et voir si nous pouvons tisser des liens. Je ne veux pas dire 'non' dÃ¨s le dÃ©but. Je pense qu'il est intÃ©ressant d'interagir avec le ComitÃ© Olympique International, avec les joueurs, avec la famille de l'e-sport, pour mieux comprendre comment cela fonctionne et pourquoi c'est un tel succÃ¨s."

Depuis cette dÃ©claration, les grands acteurs du sport mais aussi du milieu des jeux vidÃ©o y vont de leur opinion sur la question et les avis sont partagÃ©s chez les sportifs comme chez les joueurs. J'ai d'ailleurs compilÃ© les dÃ©clarations de quelques acteurs majeurs de l'e-sport franÃ§ais que vous pourrez trouver sur le blog Gamezine.fr

En tant que passionnÃ© d'e-sport et amateur de sport traditionnel, je suis fermement convaincu que la reprÃ©sentation des jeux vidÃ©o compÃ©titifs aux Jeux Olympiques de Paris est concevable. Plus que Ã§a, je pense mÃªme que les jeux vidÃ©o ont tout Ã  fait leur place dans la compÃ©tition sportive la plus prestigieuse au monde!

L'e-sport est-il un sport?

Il faut avouer que la frontiÃ¨re du sport est vague: l'effort physique est-il une composante indispensable pour qu'une activitÃ© puisse Ãªtre appelÃ©e "sport"? Et si cette question n'avait finalement pas tellement d'importance?

Le tir Ã  l'arc, le tir Ã  la carabine, le golf ou encore le curling sont bien reprÃ©sentÃ©s aux Jeux Olympiques. Et de nouvelles activitÃ©s peu physiques pourraient rejoindre la liste puisque la pÃ©tanque et le billard ont aussi candidats pour une intÃ©gration aux JO de Paris.

L'e-sport est trÃ¨s similaire aux sports Ã©voquÃ©s ci-dessus si l'on se penche uniquement sur les aptitudes qui permettent aux athlÃ¨tes de performer au plus haut niveau: de l'adresse, un esprit d'analyse, une stratÃ©gie efficace et mÃªme des rÃ©flexes et un solide esprit d'Ã©quipe pour certains titres.

Le symbole d'une nouvelle gÃ©nÃ©ration de compÃ©titeurs

L'e-sport est loin d'Ãªtre un effet de mode rÃ©cent et passager. Si les mÃ©dias ne s'y intÃ©ressent que depuis quelques annÃ©es avec l'explosion de l'audience et des cash prizes de jeux comme League of Legends, Dota2 ou CS:GO, les jeux vidÃ©o compÃ©titifs sont pratiquÃ©s activement depuis prÃ¨s de 20 ans.

Aujourd'hui, si les jeux vidÃ©o ont encore mauvaise rÃ©putation aux yeux du grand public, ils sont devenus un support de loisir et de compÃ©tition incontournable pour une grande partie de la population, notamment les 15-25 ans. Comme l'a indiquÃ© Tony Estanguet dans son interview, l'e-sport a aujourd'hui trop d'ampleur pour Ãªtre simplement ignorÃ©... et l'Ã©volution de cette discipline n'est pas prÃªte de s'arrÃªter!

Les Jeux Olympiques ont cette image de graal ultime pour tout compÃ©titeur: la plus prestigieuse des compÃ©titions de sport au monde. C'est donc tout naturellement que la possibilitÃ© de voir de l'e-sport aux JO remplit d'Ã©toiles les yeux de nombreux passionnÃ©s.

Un message important Ã  passer

Alors que notre sociÃ©tÃ© est plus sÃ©dentaire que jamais, le Jeux Olympiques promeuvent le sport et ses bienfaits pour la santÃ©. Les jeux vidÃ©o quant Ã  eux sont au contraire l'un des symboles de cette sÃ©dentaritÃ© poussÃ©e Ã  ses extrÃªmes et nÃ©faste pour notre santÃ©.

Cette opposition entre jeux vidÃ©o et bonne santÃ© doit-elle empÃªcher l'e-sport d'intÃ©grer les Jeux Olympiques? Surtout pas, au contraire!

Certains Ã©diteurs de jeux vidÃ©o, Ã  l'image de Riot Games et son cÃ©lÃ¨bre jeu League of Legends, tentent au fil du temps de mettre en avant l'importance de l'activitÃ© physique dans la vie d'un joueur. Au travers de diffÃ©rents spots publicitaires et documentaires sur les joueurs professionnels, la sociÃ©tÃ© amÃ©ricaine vante les vertus d'une activitÃ© physique sur les performances en jeu. Le dicton "un esprit sain dans un corps sain" s'applique parfaitement Ã  l'e-sport.

IntÃ©grer l'e-sport aux Jeux Olympiques serait un pas de gÃ©ant pour mettre une bonne fois pour toute l'accent sur l'importance de l'activitÃ© physique dans la vie d'un joueur de jeux vidÃ©o. La mise en avant de l'exercice physique auprÃ¨s des communautÃ©s les plus sÃ©dentaires est une mission d'intÃ©rÃªt gÃ©nÃ©ral et les Jeux Olympiques sont la compÃ©tition idÃ©ale pour avancer sur le sujet.

RÃ©concilier le grand public avec les jeux vidÃ©o

L'image nÃ©gative que transporte les jeux vidÃ©o aux yeux du grand public (franÃ§ais tout du moins) est loin de s'Ãªtre totalement rÃ©sorbÃ©e au fil des annÃ©es. Demandez Ã  une personne Ã¢gÃ©e ce qu'elle pense des joueurs d'Ã©checs et des joueurs de jeux vidÃ©o. Elle aura souvent une image radicalement diffÃ©rente des deux disciplines alors qu'elles ont de nombreuses similitudes: pas d'activitÃ© physique intense, une grande demande de concentration, d'analyse et de stratÃ©gie (tous les jeux ne demandent Ã©videmment pas ces mÃªmes aptitudes). Non, les faits divers alarmants sur les excÃ¨s d'une poignÃ©e de joueurs ne sont pas reprÃ©sentatifs de l'ensemble de la communautÃ©!

Et si on montrait au monde les jeux vidÃ©o comme une activitÃ© compÃ©titive, prÃ´nant l'esprit d'Ã©quipe, le dÃ©passement de soi et le respect d'autrui? Ces valeurs sont partagÃ©es par l'e-sport et par le sport traditionnel, et il serait grand temps que le grand public en soit informÃ©. Alors que cette discipline concerne aujourd'hui des millions de joueurs Ã  travers le monde, l'exposer sous son meilleur jour Ã  un public aussi large que celui des JO serait une belle avancÃ©e pour attÃ©nuer l'image injustement nÃ©gative des jeux vidÃ©o.

SUMMARY:

Ameziane's Edmonton-based lawyer, Nate Whitling, said the government's recent out-of-court settlement â€” worth a reported $10.5 million â€” with Khadr over violation of his rights has prevented scrutiny of Canada's alleged complicity in abuses at Guantanamo Bay.
The U.S. detained Ameziane at Guantanamo Bay for more than 11 years until his release in December 2013.
Naval Base in Guantanamo Bay, Cuba on March 21, 2016.
According to his claim, Ameziane left Algeria in the 1990s to escape rising violence there.
TEXT:
TORONTO â€” An Algerian man is set to sue the federal government for the abuses he says he suffered at the hands of American security forces after he left Canada 15 years ago.

The unproven allegations by Djamel Ameziane, who was never charged or prosecuted, raise further questions about Canada's complicity in the abuse of detainees at Guantanamo Bay â€” a topic his lawyer said demands a full-scale public inquiry.

"My current situation is really bad, I am struggling to survive,'' Ameziane, 50, said from near Algiers. "I was repatriated from Guantanamo and left like almost homeless. I couldn't find a job because of the Guantanamo stigma and my age, so a settlement would be very helpful to me to get my life back together."

In a draft statement of claim obtained by The Canadian Press, Ameziane seeks damages of $50 million on the grounds that Canada's security services co-operated with their U.S. counterparts even though they knew the Americans were abusing him.

I couldn't find a job because of the Guantanamo stigma and my age, so a settlement would be very helpful to me to get my life back together. Djamel Ameziane

"The Crown's conduct constituted acquiescence and tacit consent to the torture inflicted upon the plaintiff," the lawsuit alleges.

Canadian intelligence, the suit alleges, began sharing information with the Americans after failing to pick up on the 1999 "Millennium plot" in which Ahmed Ressam, another Algerian who had been living in Montreal, aimed to blow up the Los Angeles airport. After 9/11, Canadian agents interrogated Ameziane at the infamous American prison in Cuba, as they did Canada's Omar Khadr, according to the claim.

Ameziane's Edmonton-based lawyer, Nate Whitling, said the government's recent out-of-court settlement â€” worth a reported $10.5 million â€” with Khadr over violation of his rights has prevented scrutiny of Canada's alleged complicity in abuses at Guantanamo Bay. A judicial inquiry is needed, Whitling said.

"Only then can the Canadian public come to understand the extent to which Canada is responsible for the torture of innocent detainees in the aftermath of 9/11,'' Whitling said.

More lawsuits from others could be coming

The lawyer, who said he planned to file the lawsuit in Court of Queen's Bench in Edmonton on Monday, said Ameziane would be prepared to put the claim on hold in exchange for an inquiry. Whitling also said two other people planned similar suits that name the federal government, RCMP and Canadian Security and Intelligence Service.

Public Safety Minister Ralph Goodale had no comment given the pending legal proceedings.

The U.S. detained Ameziane at Guantanamo Bay for more than 11 years until his release in December 2013.

A deserted guard tower within Joint Task Force Guantanamo's Camp Delta at the U.S. Naval Base in Guantanamo Bay, Cuba on March 21, 2016.

"For many years, I had the idea of suing the Canadian government but didn't know how and honestly didn't know it was possible until I read the news about the settlement of Omar Khadr, who was my fellow inmate in Guantanamo Bay," Ameziane said. "The action I am taking may also make (Canadian officials) think twice before acting against the interests of Canada and Canada's human values."

According to his claim, Ameziane left Algeria in the 1990s to escape rising violence there. After working as a chef in Austria, he came to Canada in December 1995 and asked for refugee status. He lived in Montreal for five years, attending mosques where the Americans said members of al-Qaida prayed.

Claims Canadian intel sent him to Gitmo

When Canada rejected his request for asylum, Ameziane opted to go to Afghanistan rather than Algeria, where he feared abuse. He left Afghanistan for Pakistan in October 2001 when fighting erupted, but was captured and turned over to American forces in exchange for a bounty, his claim states.

The Americans first took him to a detention facility in Kandahar, where he alleges guards brutalized him, then sent him to Guantanamo Bay based partly on information provided by Canadian intelligence, according to his claim.

Ameziane, who denies any terrorism links, says Canadian agents interviewed him in Guantanamo in February and May 2003 and turned over recordings of the interrogations to the Americans. They did so, he claims, despite widespread allegations that U.S. forces were abusing detainees and even though they knew he faced no charges and had no access to a lawyer or the courts.

I refused to answer questions, after that I was subjected to a worse treatment by the Americans. Djamel Ameziane

Ameziane alleged American officials interrogated him hundreds of times and abused him when they decided he wasn't co-operating. The abuse, he alleges, included sleep-deprivation, intrusive genital searches, pepper-spraying, waterboarding, being left in freezing conditions, and having his head slammed against walls and the floor, dislocating his jaw.

"Canadian officials came to interview me on two occasions (and) they not only shared information about me with my American torturers but even tried to get information out of me that had nothing to do with Canada in order to help my American torturers," Ameziane said. "I refused to answer questions, after that I was subjected to a worse treatment by the Americans.''

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Djamel Ameziane Sues Canada For $50 Million For Alleged Complicity In His Torture At Guantanamo Bay

SUMMARY:
In the â€œHarry Potterâ€ universe, itâ€™s a little befuddling why the Dursleys hate Harry so much.
According to the theory, the Dursleys were such turd buckets because Harry was a Horcrux and they had to live with him for years.
Just like Slytherinâ€™s Locket adversely affected Ronâ€™s mood during â€œHarry Potter and the Deathly Hallows,â€ Harry may have had a similar effect on the Dursleys.
In an interview with Daniel Radcliffe about his new movie â€œJungle,â€ we brought up the theory and asked if it could explain why the Dursleys were so mean.
â€œThatâ€™s interesting, yeah.â€Radcliffe continued, â€œYeah, thatâ€™s definitely the first time Iâ€™ve heard that one.
TEXT:
Dumbledore once said happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.

Yeah, thatâ€™s easy to say when you donâ€™t live with the Dursleys.

In the â€œHarry Potterâ€ universe, itâ€™s a little befuddling why the Dursleys hate Harry so much. He seems like a generally genial guy. Sure, he can be a bit moody, but heâ€™s got a piece of the Dark Lord living inside of him. Give the man a break.

Actually, the fact that Harry is somewhat of a Horcrux became the center of a popular theory a couple of years ago, and it seemed to finally explain why the Dursleys were so horrible to the wizard all this time.

According to the theory, the Dursleys were such turd buckets because Harry was a Horcrux and they had to live with him for years. Just like Slytherinâ€™s Locket adversely affected Ronâ€™s mood during â€œHarry Potter and the Deathly Hallows,â€ Harry may have had a similar effect on the Dursleys. Though Ron and Hermione spent a lot of time with Harry at Hogwarts, the Dursleys were with him constantly over a much longer period of time.

In an interview with Daniel Radcliffe about his new movie â€œJungle,â€ we brought up the theory and asked if it could explain why the Dursleys were so mean.

â€œOh OK, so it affects the behavior of people around it,â€ he said. â€œThatâ€™s interesting, yeah.â€

Radcliffe continued, â€œYeah, thatâ€™s definitely the first time Iâ€™ve heard that one. Itâ€™s definitely interesting because it sort of posits a world where these people only known to be a certain way. Actually if you remove him from the situation, [they] would have been quite a nice, friendly family.â€

OK, maybe â€œfriendly familyâ€ is a stretch.

â€œHaving been there for Richard Griffithsâ€™ (Vernon) and Fiona Shawâ€™s (Petunia) performances,â€ Radcliffe said, â€œI feel like it was more they just hated having this kid around.â€

â€œBut I think thatâ€™s definitely a cool theory,â€ he added. â€œHas anyone asked Jo Rowling what she thinks of that one yet? I feel like that one â€• thatâ€™s definitely a good one.â€

Though itâ€™s not in the books, J.K. Rowling has written about the Dursleysâ€™ dislike for Harry on Pottermore, calling them â€œreactionary, prejudiced, narrow-minded, ignorant and bigoted.â€ Rowling explained that Petuniaâ€™s loathing stemmed from jealousy of her sister Lilyâ€™s magical abilities, and that Vernon hated anything out of the ordinary. The couple also had a falling out with Harryâ€™s parents and never made up.

Rowling doesnâ€™t mention whether or not Harry being a Horcrux contributed to the Dursleysâ€™ hatred; however, the theory does make a lot of sense and offers a unique way of looking at the family.

Even Radcliffe thinks itâ€™s cool. If this were Quidditch, weâ€™d call it a keeper.
TITLE: Even Daniel Radcliffe Is Into This 'Harry Potter' Theory About The Dursleys

SUMMARY:
At least 26 are dead and 20 others injured after a gunman opened fire at a small Baptist church in rural Texas on Sunday morning.
Local residents embrace during a candlelight vigil for victims of a mass shooting in a church in Sutherland Springs, Texas, on Sunday.
First responders on the scene of the shooting at the First Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs, Tx.
Law enforcement officials work the scene of a fatal shooting at the First Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs, Texas, on Nov. 5, 2017.
FBI officers walk behind the First Baptist Church of Sutherland Springs after a fatal shooting on Nov. 5, 2017, in Sutherland Springs, Texas.
TEXT:
At least 26 are dead and 20 others injured after a gunman opened fire at a small Baptist church in rural Texas on Sunday morning. The ages of the wounded and dead range from five to 72 years.

Multiple media reports identified the suspect as 26-year-old Devin Patrick Kelley. His motive remains unknown.

Kelley was previously a member of the United States Air Force, serving at a base in New Mexico.

SUTHERLAND SPRINGS, Texas â€• More than 100 people gathered outside the post office here on Sunday night, just blocks away from the First Baptist Church where a lone gunman killed 26 members of this tight-knit community on Sunday morning. It was the worst mass killing in the state's history.

"Who are we going to be tomorrow?" Stephen Curry, a pastor from a nearby church, asked the crowd. "We're going to be people of love."

"Amen!" the audience exclaimed.

Mourners held candles and raised their open palms in the air as religious leaders urged them to help their neighbors heal. Reminders of the tragedy were all around them. Behind the vigil, the lights of a police car continued to flash, and the road toward the church remained blocked off.

Local residents embrace during a candlelight vigil for victims of a mass shooting in a church in Sutherland Springs, Texas, on Sunday.

Officials responded to reports of a gunman at the church at around 11:20 a.m. A young white male wearing black clothing and tactical gear â€• identified in multiple media reports as 26-year-old Devin Patrick Kelley â€• had opened fire with a Ruger assault-type rifle outside the church and then entered the building as he continued to fire.

As the gunman left the church, a resident began firing with his own weapon, causing the suspect to flee in his car, officials said. The suspect was later found with a fatal gunshot wound in his vehicle in nearby Guadalupe County. Authorities said they did not know who fired the fatal shot. Multiple weapons were found inside the suspect's vehicle.

First responders on the scene of the shooting at the First Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs, Tx. on Sunday.

Texas Gov. Greg Abbott confirmed that 26 people had been killed in the shooting during a press conference on Sunday afternoon. A pregnant woman and several children â€• including the church pastor's 14-year-old daughter â€• were among the dead. At least 20 people were injured. The ages of the wounded and dead ranged from 5 to 72 years. A witness told San Antonio TV station KENS 5 that the fatalities accounted for about half of the church's congregation.

Shocked community members were still reeling from the massacre that took place just hours before. They described the unincorporated community, home to cattle ranches and oil fields, as the type of place where everyone knows each other. People move there to avoid crime, residents told HuffPost.

Law enforcement officials work the scene of a fatal shooting at the First Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs, Texas, on Nov. 5, 2017.

"It's a nice, quiet town. It's respectful," said former resident Pamela Padilla. "We don't normally have any crime or anything ... It was a small town, and quiet until today."

"This has just been so devastating. It hasn't hit home quite yet," said resident Kelly Carter.

"It's very small, quiet. Everyone knows each other," said David Betancourt, 18. His friend was wounded in the shooting. The last Betancourt heard, he was undergoing surgery.

FBI officers walk behind the First Baptist Church of Sutherland Springs after a fatal shooting on Nov. 5, 2017, in Sutherland Springs, Texas.

Michael Ward had family members at the church that morning. When he heard that the killer had fled, he said he considered going after him. But when he saw the police en route, he went to the church with his wife Leslee to look for their family members.

The family of Ward's brother Chris was severely affected, Ward said. Chris' wife Joann is in surgery, as is Chris' son Rylan and daughter Brooke. Chris' daughter Emily is among the deceased, Ward said.

As of Sunday evening, authorities had not yet provided information about a possible motive for the suspect.

Texas Gov. Greg Abbott gives an update during a news conference at the Stockdale Community Center following the deadly shooting on Sunday.

Kelley was previously a United States Air Force member who served in logistics readiness at Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico, from 2010 until his bad conduct discharge in 2014. He was court-martialed in 2012 for assault on his spouse and assault on their child.

Sunday's shooting comes just over a month after a gunman killed 58 people at a country music festival in Las Vegas before killing himself. It was the deadliest mass shooting in recent U.S. history.

President Donald Trump on Twitter said he was monitoring the situation from Japan, where he is on a five-nation tour through Asia. White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders said Trump was receiving regular updates on the situation.

May God be w/ the people of Sutherland Springs, Texas. The FBI & law enforcement are on the scene. I am monitoring the situation from Japan. â€” Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) November 5, 2017â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

In a post on Twitter Sunday afternoon, Abbott also responded to news of the shooting by calling it an "evil act."

Our prayers are with all who were harmed by this evil act. Our thanks to law enforcement for their response. More details from DPS soon. https://t.co/KMCRmOPkiM â€” Greg Abbott (@GregAbbott_TX) November 5, 2017

Prime Minister Justin Trudeau called the shooting "tragic."

Canadians send their condolences to those affected by today's tragic church shooting in Texas - we wish a full recovery to the injured. â€” Justin Trudeau (@JustinTrudeau) November 5, 2017

Mike Gonzalez, who lives nearby and works at Cornerstone Church in San Antonio, helped lead prayers at Sunday night's vigil.

"Let us not be people of anger," he told the crowd. "Let us not be people of fear. Let us build your kingdom as something constructive in the face of destruction."

"I propose that we make a pact, right here, in this small town, that evil will not prevail!"

A woman attends a candle light vigil Sunday for the victims of the mass shooting at the First Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs, Tx.

Lydia O'Connor, Matt Ferner, Nick Visser and Samantha Tomaszewski contributed reporting.

â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹With a file from HuffPost Canada.
TITLE: At Least 26 Dead In Shooting At Texas Baptist Church

Turn On iCloud Backup Whereas before you might backup your iPhone via iTunes, iCloud Backup allows your phone to do it wirelessly and in the background Once turned on it will automatically backup everything on your phone when itâ€™s plugged in and connected to a WiFi network.
Settings - iCloudHuffPost UK2. iCloud - iCloud BackupHuffPost UK3.
Make sure iCloud Backup is turned ON.
It will upload all your photos to iCloud effectively giving you a backup should you ever have your phone stolen or break it.
Apple gives you 5GB of free iCloud storage.
TEXT:
Backing up your iPhone or Android phone is a process thatâ€™s usually dumped into the same category as finally organising your passwords or actually sorting through your photos. Itâ€™s understandable, itâ€™s not exactly an exciting task and on the surface it sounds like something that probably takes a long time.

Thomas Peter / Reuters

Well we have some good news because not only is backing up your iPhone incredibly quick and easy, but it also comes with some big benefits which are: Youâ€™ll never lose your photos if you drop your phone down the toilet. Your shiny new iPhone X can literally set itself up without you having to do a thing. All your downloaded music wonâ€™t be lost when you switch phones. Never lose your messages or WhatsApp messages if (again) you drop your phone down the toilet. You could actually increase the storage space on your iPhone. Now weâ€™ve cleared that up, here are some simple steps for backing up your entire iPhone. What is iCloud? Before we get started on the specifics itâ€™s probably good to quickly explain where youâ€™re going to be storing all this information. Apple has a cloud-based ecosystem called iCloud. Think of it as a safe deposit box where a virtual clone of your phone and its entire contents are stored safely away from any puddles, toilet-based accidents or boxes filled with rice.

Turn On iCloud Backup Whereas before you might backup your iPhone via iTunes, iCloud Backup allows your phone to do it wirelessly and in the background Once turned on it will automatically backup everything on your phone when itâ€™s plugged in and connected to a WiFi network. For the majority of us thatâ€™s when we go to bed, so itâ€™ll just backup your phone while youâ€™re asleep. 1. Settings - iCloud

HuffPost UK

2. iCloud - iCloud Backup

HuffPost UK

3. Make sure iCloud Backup is turned ON.

HuffPost UK

Turn on iCloud Photo Library If you havenâ€™t got this turned on weâ€™d recommend you do it now. It will upload all your photos to iCloud effectively giving you a backup should you ever have your phone stolen or break it. Youâ€™ll never have to worry about manually putting them onto your laptop and any edits you make on one device will be instantly pushed onto your other devices. Apple gives you 5GB of free iCloud storage. This includes images, iMessages, notes, documents etc. If youâ€™ve got more than 5GB of images then for 79p per month you can upgrade to 50GB. If youâ€™re someone who takes a lot of photos this feels like a small price to pay. You can do that by doing the following: 1. Settings - Photos and Camera

The Huffington Post UK

2. Photos and Camera - Turn iCloud Photo Library on

The Huffington Post UK

Optimise iCloud Photo Library Now at this juncture you might find that youâ€™ve used up or gone over the 5GB storage limit that iCloud gives you. If you have there are two solutions, you can either pay a small fee per month to increase the amount of storage you have or you can optimise your photos, effectively reducing the amount of space they take up on your iPhone. You can do this by going to: 1. Settings - Photos and Camera

The Huffington Post UK

2. Photos and Camera - Optimise iPhone Storage

The Huffington Post UK

Backup WhatsApp So while WhatsApp is backed up to iCloud, you actually have to go in and make sure that itâ€™s turned on and that itâ€™s backing up your chats daily. If youâ€™re moving over to a new phone, make sure this is one of the last things you do so that when you do turn on your new phone it has the most up to date conversations you were having. 1. Open WhatsApp - Settings - Chats

HuffPost UK

2. Chats - Chats Backup

HuffPost UK

2. Chats - Back Up Now (also check and see how regularly Auto Backup is enabled).

HuffPost UK
TITLE: How To Backup Your iPhone's Photos, Messages, Music And Apps On iCloud

SUMMARY:
We may have had several billion years under our belts to figure it out, but scientists today continue to be puzzled by how early cellular life on Earth first came to be.
Researchers have long speculated that a chemical reaction called phosphorylation was a crucial step in the arrival of early life forms.
â€œIt reminds me of the fairy godmother in Cinderella, who waves a wand and poof, poof, poof, everything simple is transformed into something more complex and interesting,â€ he added.
It might have been able to do what early life forms required, but is there evidence that this compound even existed in this period?
Astronomers have found that this magical chemical compound would have indeed been around in the form of phosphorus-nitrogen compounds in the gas and dust of interstellar space.
TEXT:
Now it seems a new study might be able to provide some of the answers, after a team of chemists stumbled upon the â€˜missingâ€™ compound that could have been the catalyst for this epic journey to begin.

And, more precisely, the chemical compounds which allowed it to happen.

We may have had several billion years under our belts to figure it out, but scientists today continue to be puzzled by how early cellular life on Earth first came to be.

Researchers have long speculated that a chemical reaction called phosphorylation was a crucial step in the arrival of early life forms.

This is because in order for life to come into existence it needed a few simple ingredients - strands of nucleotides to store genetic information, chains of amino acids for cell function, and lipids to form cell walls and other structures.

These are just basic requirements of all biological structures.

Despite knowing this, scientists had never been able to find a phosphorylating chemical agent that would have plausibly been around at this time, in the right quantities, in the right place, to serve as the trigger.

But now researchers at the Scripps Research Institute have found one that could have played this central role: diamidophosphate (DAP).

Senior author Ramanarayanan Krishnamurthy and his colleagues have previously shown how DAP is able to generate a variety of simple sugars that are present in early life forms.

â€œThat in turn would have allowed other chemistries that were not possible before, potentially leading to the first simple, cell-based living entities,â€ said Krishnamurthy.

â€œIt reminds me of the fairy godmother in Cinderella, who waves a wand and poof, poof, poof, everything simple is transformed into something more complex and interesting,â€ he added.

It might have been able to do what early life forms required, but is there evidence that this compound even existed in this period?

Astronomers have found that this magical chemical compound would have indeed been around in the form of phosphorus-nitrogen compounds in the gas and dust of interstellar space.

And it continues to exist in humans today.
TITLE: We May Have Found The 'Missing Link' In Understanding How Life On Earth Started

SUMMARY:
Kyler Zeleny doesn't know who this man is, but he's fascinated by him.
Toronto researcher and photographer Kyler Zeleny has a new book out on Polaroid photography.
His new book, Found Polaroids, matches these pictures with flash fiction (very short stories) contributed by strangers online.
Photographer Kyler Zeleny's new book 'Found Polaroids' gives new life to old pictures.
From his thousands of images, Zeleny was able to track down a total of four subjects.
TEXT:
Kyler Zeleny doesn't know who this man is, but he's fascinated by him.

Toronto researcher and photographer Kyler Zeleny has a new book out on Polaroid photography.

"My mind goes pretty wild thinking of all the possibilities," the photographer told HuffPost Canada in an email. "This image ... is telling us that a story took place, that this man lived a life â€” we can see that in his auburn hair and the wrinkles on his face."

Zeleny grew up on a farm in central Alberta and is usually based in Toronto. He's currently in London, doing a fellowship at Goldsmiths, University of London.

His obsession with mysterious Polaroids grew from a hobby to making a website to publishing a book. He spent years collecting more than 6,000 Polaroids from shops in Calgary, Toronto, New York and Amsterdam, and then on eBay. His new book, Found Polaroids, matches these pictures with flash fiction (very short stories) contributed by strangers online.

Kyler Zeleny collected 6,000 Polaroid pictures in the hopes of identifying their subjects.

"The original intent of the project was to return the found images back to their original owners, although that has proved mostly futile," Zeleny said. "Understanding how futile it was to try to return these images, I thought it was quite a shame to allow the Polaroids to live in a state of limbo ... So I came up with the idea to allow people to contribute flash-fiction stories in response to the Polaroids, answering for who [the people in the photos] could have been, where they could have gone and what they might have known."

Found Polaroids includes 35 of the 400 short stories Zeleny received online, as well as essays on Polaroid photography.

Photographer Kyler Zeleny's new book 'Found Polaroids' gives new life to old pictures.

Zeleny says Polaroids are unlike any other type of photograph.

"It has no negative and cannot be reproduced," he said. "It really is the only photographic medium that allows us to make that claim."

From his thousands of images, Zeleny was able to track down a total of four subjects. In one case, he got in touch with two former cheerleaders by looking up the team's logo, identifying the school they went to, and then reaching out to the current cheerleading squad.

"One thing that still remains a mystery in all the cases is either who took the image, or how it came to be in my possession," Zeleny said.

Read a story from FoundPolaroids.com:

By Christin Peter "How to tell them?" I wonder. I haven't even been sitting on this couch for an hour, and I've already smoked three cigarettes. Jack is in the other room, and I'm afraid I've made him angry because he acts like the whole thing is a joke. At twenty-one, I'm not a baby by any means, but since I'm her youngest child my mama thinks I am. And right now I feel like one. I just want to curl up with the plush frog Karen made me, close my eyes, and be someone new, someone younger. Or maybe just someone smarter. Jack enters the room, fiddling with his camera. "So just tell them," he says. "It doesn't have to be a big deal. You're an adult. You can make your own decisions." Yes, I'm legally an adult, but I'm still in college. And I'm also in his apartment instead of my dorm. I try to do the math in my head, trying to figure out if there is some way to still graduate, but I know it's impossible. It's still only January. "We can go to the courthouse this weekend. Tell them after; I don't care." Jack raises his camera to his face. "Come on, smile. This should be a happy day." My mother got married youngâ€”at a mere nineteen years of ageâ€”but it was not what I had envisioned for myself. I was going to get a degree and then join the Peace Corps. I was going to travel, then get a teaching job, then get married and have children. But it was too late for that now. "Come on, Lizzie. Show me a smile." I can't find one. I still don't know how I'm going to tell my parents.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: 'Found Polaroids' Book Lets Strangers Rewrite History Of Old Photos

Ein 28-jÃ¤hriger Mann, der eine Sachbearbeiterin Ã¼ber Stunden in seiner Gewalt hatte, sei festgenommen worden, sagte ein Sprecher am Montag.
Ein Spezialeinsatzkommando (SEK) nutzte nach den Angaben einen gÃ¼nstigen Moment, um den Mann zu Ã¼berwÃ¤ltigen.
Der Geiselnehmer hatte sich gegen 8.30 Uhr mit der Sachbearbeiterin am Jugendamt des oberbayerischen Landkreises verbarrikadiert.
Er bedrohte die 31-JÃ¤hrige mit einem Messer mit zehn Zentimeter langer Klinge.
Im Zusammenhang mit der Geiselnahme in dem Jugendamt baten die Ermittler darum, keine Bilder oder Videos vom Tatort zu verbreiten.
TEXT:
Bei dem Geiselnehmer im Jugendamt des Landkreises Pfaffenhofen an der Ilm handelt es sich mutmaÃŸlich um einen 28 Jahre alten Mann (SYMBOLBILD) | delectus via Getty Images

Ein Mann hat Geiseln im Jugendamt von Pfaffenhofen genommen

Medienberichten zufolge soll der Hintergrund ein Sorgerechtsstreit sein

Die Geiselnahme im Jugendamt in des Landkreises Pfaffenhofen an der Ilm hat die Polizei beendet. Ein 28-jÃ¤hriger Mann, der eine Sachbearbeiterin Ã¼ber Stunden in seiner Gewalt hatte, sei festgenommen worden, sagte ein Sprecher am Montag. Ein Spezialeinsatzkommando (SEK) nutzte nach den Angaben einen gÃ¼nstigen Moment, um den Mann zu Ã¼berwÃ¤ltigen.

Der Geiselnehmer hatte sich gegen 8.30 Uhr mit der Sachbearbeiterin am Jugendamt des oberbayerischen Landkreises verbarrikadiert. Er bedrohte die 31-JÃ¤hrige mit einem Messer mit zehn Zentimeter langer Klinge. Die Frau erlitt eine Schnittwunde am OberkÃ¶rper. Ob er weitere Waffen bei sich hatte, war zunÃ¤chst unklar.

Polizei: "Der TÃ¤ter spricht mit uns"

Das GebÃ¤ude in unmittelbarer Nachbarschaft des Landratsamtes in Pfaffenhofen war am Morgen kurz nach der Geiselnahme gerÃ¤umt worden. Danach befanden sich lediglich Opfer und TÃ¤ter in dem Haus, erlÃ¤uterte der Sprecher.

Es begann ein stundenlanger Nervenkrieg: Die Polizei war mit einem GroÃŸaufgebot vor Ort. Auch mehrere Krankenwagen und Ã„rzte sowie SanitÃ¤ter wurden zum Tatort geschickt.

Im Zusammenhang mit der Geiselnahme in dem Jugendamt baten die Ermittler darum, keine Bilder oder Videos vom Tatort zu verbreiten. Solche Bilder im Netz kÃ¶nnten dem TÃ¤ter helfen, twitterte die Polizei.

Bitte unterstÃ¼tzt uns bei unserer Arbeit in #Pfaffenhofen und verbreitet KEINE Bilder, Videos etc. Ihr helft damit dem TÃ¤ter. â€” Polizei Oberbayern N (@polizeiOBN) 6. November 2017

Unterdessen nahm die Verhandlungsgruppe telefonisch Kontakt mit dem Geiselnehmer auf. Die speziell fÃ¼r Geiselnahmen geschulten Beamten versuchten, deeskalierend auf den Mann einzuwirken.

Als die Frau darum bat, dass ein Arzt gerufen wird, griff das SEK zu und Ã¼berwÃ¤ltigte den 28-JÃ¤hrigen. Es kam dabei nicht zu einem Schusswaffeneinsatz.

Die 31-jÃ¤hrige Sachbearbeiterin war nach den Angaben psychisch stabil. Sie habe lediglich eine leichte SchÃ¼rfwunde. Es kÃ¶nne derzeit nicht eingeordnet werden, woher die Verletzung rÃ¼hrt.

Wieso es keine Bilder vom Ort der Geiselnahme geben soll

Das Opfer sei zwar psychisch angegriffen, kÃ¶rperlich aber nicht schwer verletzt, teilte die Polizei weiter mit. Auch der mutmaÃŸliche TÃ¤ter sei weitgehend unverletzt. Das Motiv der Geiselnahme ist nach den Angaben ein Sorgerechtsstreit des 28-JÃ¤hrigen.
TITLE: Geiselnahme im Jugendamt: Mann bedrohte Sachbearbeiterin mit Messer - was zum Fall bekannt ist

SUMMARY:
Quando tutto questo non si realizza si evocano fantasmi, si fa appello alla democrazia che non c'Ã¨ piÃ¹, all'ideologia in disuso pur di fare testimonianza e rinfocolare i rancori.
La ditta Bersani e D'Alema ha fatto piÃ¹ danni che Bertoldo in guerra.
I primi cento passi siciliani non si sono visti e oggi la sinistra Ã¨ punto a capo.
Ãˆ sostanziale che Renzi abbia zero colpe in un presepe cosÃ¬ desolante.
Capite che sono ipotesi campate in aria che non si realizzeranno mai.
TEXT:
Non ci voleva la debacle delle elezioni siciliane per capire lo stato di salute della sinistra. Il male di quella parte politica Ã¨ storico: dividersi quando non si riesce stare in minoranza e si vorrebbe che le proprie ragioni, minoritarie, fossero assunte dalla maggioranza, senza fiato ferire. Quando tutto questo non si realizza si evocano fantasmi, si fa appello alla democrazia che non c'Ã¨ piÃ¹, all'ideologia in disuso pur di fare testimonianza e rinfocolare i rancori. Questo Ã¨ avvenuto nel Pd. La ditta Bersani e D'Alema ha fatto piÃ¹ danni che Bertoldo in guerra. I primi cento passi siciliani non si sono visti e oggi la sinistra Ã¨ punto a capo.

Renzi potrÃ  fare anche un passo indietro e lasciare spazio a una persona che raccolga i rimasugli ma, dubitiamo, come sempre abbiamo sostenuto, sull'efficacia del dopo, un percorso fatto di mediazioni, posti da dividere salvo poi accorgersi che dialoghi e programmi fumosi, tutto e niente, sono merce di qualitÃ  taroccata dalla quale gli elettori si tengono alla larga.

Ãˆ sostanziale che Renzi abbia zero colpe in un presepe cosÃ¬ desolante. E lo sosteniamo a ragion veduta perchÃ© l'ex Presidente del Consiglio, malgrado la sua alterigia intellettuale, che non Ã¨ sempre un male in un paese gerentocratico e caotico fino al midollo, Ã¨ stato fin troppo tollerante con le minoranze dentro il Pd, lasciandole fare nell'opposizione al leader-segretario accentuando cosÃ¬ quell'opera di decostruzione d'immagine che ha condotto alle dimissioni di Renzi dalla carica di premier.

Si profila all'orizzonte un ulteriore processo a Renzi, confermando cosÃ¬ che la Ditta di sinistra-sinistra ha in mente solo le messa a riposo del leader del Pd. Settimane su settimane di discussioni, convegni, caminetti di cui Bersani&D'Alema sono maestri professionali.

Avremo una candidatura del presidente Grasso a capo dell'arcipelago della sinistra-sinistra? Ho giÃ  spiegato in un post i limiti dell'ex magistrato di Palermo. Non ha consenso dentro il suo patchwork di riferimento ma nemmeno fuori, in zona Pd, visto che era stato proposto candidato unitario dallo stesso Renzi - appunto giusto per ricordare chi divide e chi unisce la sinistra - ma probabilmente il presidente Grasso aveva giÃ  in mente altro, o gli era stato promesso altro di piÃ¹ allettante, sempre perÃ² con l'obiettivo di tenersi lontano da eventuali unioni sotto il marchio renziano.

Sia chiaro. La legge elettorale in vigore non prevede l'elezione del premier. E nemmeno un leader di coalizione. Ãˆ una discussione di lana caprina starci su. L'obiettivo Ã¨ quello di superare soglia 40% per vincere. Ma con spirito proporzionale si va verso questo traguardo. Quindi a regime potenziato di singolo partito e capo di quel partito. Dopo il risultato della cabina elettorale si vedono le forze in campo e Mattarella sceglie il premier, certo indicato dai partiti. Ma prima del rush finale non servono nemmeno le primarie di coalizione, ma il solo principio che vale Ã¨ sintetizzato da quel genialone di Berlusconi che per arrivare al dunque e farsi capire Ã¨ imbattibile: il partito della coalizione che prende piÃ¹ voti indica il premier. Questo dovrebbe essere il principio ispiratore anche nel centrosinistra, senza perdersi nei meandri dell'ovvio e del banale.

Ma i preludi futuri non sottintendono nulla di confortante: a meno che Bersani e D'Alema se ne vadano dalla scena politica e con loro rimangano a riposo eventuali ritorni come quello di Vendola, che ha giÃ  lisciato il pelo all'avvento di Grasso premier. Capite che sono ipotesi campate in aria che non si realizzeranno mai. Troppo il livore in circolo, la voglia di rivincite impossibili, l'odio politico verso Renzi. La palla passerÃ  al leader democratico che dovrÃ  ritrovare carica e convinzione per farcela da solo con alcune liste importanti che facciano leva su movimenti, stati d'animo diffusi, a sinistra come al centro, slegate dai partiti ma con la disponibilitÃ  di correre a fianco del Pd in una alleanza inedita di Governo.
TITLE: La ditta Bersani-D'Alema fa piÃ¹ danni che Bertoldo in guerra
