SUMMARY:
American actress Uma Thurman has given a chilling response to questions about allegations of sexual assault and harassment against Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein.
"So I've been waiting to feel less angry, and when I'm ready I'll say what I have to say".
More than 90 women have now come out with allegations against Weinstein, now including actresses like Gwyneth Paltrow, Lupita Nyong'o, Ashley Judd and Angelina Jolie.
In recent days the New York Police Department has declared that they are investigating claims of rape against the producer.
BREAKING: NYC police say they have a credible rape allegation against Harvey Weinstein, are gathering evidence for possible arrest.
TEXT:
American actress Uma Thurman has given a chilling response to questions about allegations of sexual assault and harassment against Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein.

At the premiere of 'The Parisian Woman' Thurman spoke to The Hollywood Reporter, saying that the actions of women who had spoken out against figures like Weinstein were "commendable".



But before expanding on that, Thurman gave this message:



"I don't have a tidy soundbite for you because I am not a child, and I have learned that when I have spoken in anger, I usually regret the way I express myself".



"So I've been waiting to feel less angry, and when I'm ready I'll say what I have to say".

More than 90 women have now come out with allegations against Weinstein, now including actresses like Gwyneth Paltrow, Lupita Nyong'o, Ashley Judd and Angelina Jolie.

In recent days the New York Police Department has declared that they are investigating claims of rape against the producer.

BREAKING: NYC police say they have a credible rape allegation against Harvey Weinstein, are gathering evidence for possible arrest. â€” AP Eastern U.S. (@APEastRegion) November 3, 2017

The allegations against Weinstein have also spurred on fresh claims against other Hollywood figures, such as director James Toback, and 'House of Cards' actor Kevin Spacey.

Thurman has worked with Weinstein on 'Pulp Fiction' and the 'Kill Bill' movies.
TITLE: Uma Thurman's Response To Hollywood's Sexual Harassment Scandal Is Perfect

FDP-Chef Christian Lindner schlÃ¤gt im Poker um eine Jamaika-Koalition nun wieder harte TÃ¶ne an. Seine Partei habe "keine Angst vor Neuwahlen", sagte er den Zeitungen der Funke-Mediengruppe am Sonntag. Er glaube auch nicht, dass dann vor allem die AfD profitiere.

Die Punkte der FDP mÃ¼ssten sich spÃ¼rbar in einem Koalitionsprogramm wiederfinden. "Wenn das nicht mÃ¶glich ist, gehen wir in die Opposition. DafÃ¼r nehme ich jeden Shitstorm in Kauf."

Lindner hatte wÃ¤hrend der ersten zwei Sondierungswochen fÃ¼r ein schwarz-gelb-grÃ¼nes BÃ¼ndnis bereits in mehreren Interviews sowohl die GrÃ¼nen als auch die CDU attackiert. Auch sein Vize Wolfgang Kubicki hatte betont: "Die FDP hat keine Angst vor Neuwahlen."

In der Zwischenbilanz der UnterhÃ¤ndler hatte sich Lindner dann am Freitag eher zurÃ¼ckgehalten und von der Notwendigkeit gesprochen, BrÃ¼cken zu bauen. Kubicki mahnte danach die Kompromissbereitschaft aller Seiten an und warnte vor einer Neuwahl. Nun setzt Lindner wieder andere Akzente.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Reporter fragt FDP-Vize Kubicki nach Merkel - seine Antwort offenbart einen Ã¼berraschenden Grund fÃ¼r das Jamaika-Chaos

TEXT:
2015 hat eine Schlammlawine in Brasilien 19 Menschen unter sich begraben

Was das mit Kaffeekapseln zu tun hat, erklÃ¤rt der Soziologe Stephan Lessenich

Es ist leicht, es ist bequem - und George Clooney macht es auch: der Kaffee aus der Kapsel.

20.600 Tonnen der Kapseln haben die Deutschen 2015 verbraucht. Zehn Jahre zuvor waren es gerade einmal 800 Tonnen. Ein sprunghafter Anstieg.

Dabei gelten die kleinen Kapseln schon lÃ¤nger als wahre UmweltsÃ¼nder. Das VerhÃ¤ltnis von Inhalt zu Verpackung ist vÃ¶llig unverhÃ¤ltnismÃ¤ÃŸig - und das Material, Aluminium, ist hÃ¤ufig umweltschÃ¤dlich.

Das Ergebnis: 5000 Tonnen Abfall an Aluminium. Wem diese Zahl zu abstrakt ist, der kann sich auch dieses Foto ansehen. Es macht deutlich, welche SchÃ¤den ein scheinbar harmloser Genuss wie Kaffeetrinken anrichten kann:

Quelle: Getty

Die Aufnahme zeigt das brasilianische Dorf Bento Rodrigues. Am 5. November 2015 kamen hier 19 Menschen ums Leben, sie wurden von einer Schlammlawine Ã¼berrollt.

Und neben uns die Sintflut

Ursache war ein Dammbruch im RÃ¼ckhaltebecken der Eisenerzmine Samarco in der brasilianischen Bergbaustadt Mariana. Durchsetzt mit Schwermetallen Ã¼berzog eine giftige Schicht von Schlamm das Tal. Die Wasserversorgung fÃ¼r Millionen von Menschen ist seitdem gefÃ¤hrdet.

Schlamm und Tote hier, unschuldiger Kaffeekonsum dort - beides hÃ¤nge zusammen, erklÃ¤rt der Soziologe Stephan Lessenich in seinem Buch "Neben uns die Sintflut", Ã¼ber das er am Sonntag im Deutschlandfunk sprach.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Wie ein Brasilianer seit 40 Jahren Baum fÃ¼r Baum den Regenwald rettet

Am Beispiel des Dammbruchs in Brasilien versucht Lessenich, die ZusammenhÃ¤nge von Konsum und Ausbeutung der Natur verstÃ¤ndlich zu machen.

Kaffeekonsum und die ZerstÃ¶rung von Lebensgrundlagen

FÃ¼r Lessenich dient Samarco als Beispiel fÃ¼r den Rohstoffhunger des Westens in Brasilien. Das Bergbauunternehmen Rio Tinto, das einen Anteil an der Mine hÃ¤lt, hat seine EisenerzfÃ¶rderung zwischen 2006 und 2014 drastisch gesteigert. SicherheitsmÃ¤ngel im RÃ¼ckhaltebecken der Mine seien ignoriert worden, schreibt Lessenich in seinem Buch.

Rio Tinto steigerte auch seine FÃ¶rderung von Bauxit drastisch. Dieses Erz wiederum dient der Herstellung von Aluminium. Und Aluminium steckt dann etwa auch in den kleinen, fein portionierten und leicht verwendbaren Kaffeekapseln, die in den vergangenen Jahre immer beliebter wurde.

"Da kann man sehen, dass es da bestimmte Verbindungen gibt", sagte Lessenich im Deutschlandfunk. "Also der lockerleichte, nebenher betriebene Kaffeekonsum hierzulande und die ZerstÃ¶rung von Lebensgrundlagen von vielen, vielen Menschen anderswo in der Welt."

In der Regel wÃ¼rden die Verbindungen nicht so klar hervortreten. Im Fall des Dammbruchs mit seinen 19 Toten aber bleibe die Verbindung von Rohstoffhunger und die â€œZerstÃ¶rung von Lebensgrundlagenâ€ nicht verborgen. In der Tat: Sie ist auf den Fotos Ã¼berdeutlich.

Quelle: Getty

Mit dem Beispiel will Lessenich zeigen, wie sehr kleine Entscheidungen im Alltag grÃ¶ÃŸere Folgen nach sich ziehen kÃ¶nnen - und wie kompliziert das mit dem Konsum in einer modernen, globalisierten Welt geworden ist.

Wenn jede Entscheidung plÃ¶tzlich zÃ¤hlt

"Konsum ist Politik mit dem Einkaufswagen", kommentierte kÃ¼rzlich die Wochenzeitung "Die Zeit" die Verwirrung, die verantwortungsvolle KÃ¤ufer zwangslÃ¤ufig Ã¼berkommt. Wie wahr dieser Satz ist. Der Fortbestand des Regenwalds entscheidet sich eben auch an der heimischen Kaffeemaschine.

Jede Entscheidung will gut Ã¼berlegt sein, jede Kaufentscheidung kann einen ganzen Rattenschwanz von Folgen mit sich bringen. Manchmal gute, manchmal schlechte, manchmal verheerende.

Im Falle der Kaffeekapseln gibt es allerdings auch mehrere mÃ¶gliche LÃ¶sungen, um den Schaden fÃ¼r die Umwelt zu begrenzen. Man steigt um auf Filterkaffee - oder man gewÃ¶hnt sich einen Handgriff an: Man wirft die Kapseln zumindest in den gelben Sack. Nespresso etwa, der grÃ¶ÃŸte Hersteller von Kaffeekapseln, bemÃ¼ht sich darum, das Recyceln so leicht wie mÃ¶glich zu machen.

Wie viele Kaffeetrinker die Kapseln dort reinwerfen, weiÃŸ der Hersteller nicht. Es ist eine Entscheidung, die jedem selbst Ã¼berlassen bleibt.

Aber auch eine, die Folgen am anderen Ende der Welt haben kann.

(lk)
TITLE: Wenn ihr morgens Kapseln in eure Kaffeemaschine schiebt, solltet ihr dieses Bild kennen

TEXT:
Depuis l'affaire Weinstein, nous, les femmes, libÃ©rons notre parole pour dÃ©noncer les harcÃ¨lements, les agressions et les viols que nous avons subis dans notre vie familiale du fait de nos proches, dans notre parcours professionnel du fait de nos collÃ¨gues ou de nos supÃ©rieurs, et jusque dans la rue. Les rÃ©seaux sociaux ont largement contribuÃ© Ã  cette libÃ©ration.

Parler

Des milliers d'entre nous, passant par les hashtags #balancetonporc ou #metoo, ont rÃ©vÃ©lÃ© ce qu'elles gardaient pour elles par gÃªne, par honte, par peur, ou par l'effet d'une culpabilitÃ© inversÃ©e. Certaines, encore peu nombreuses, ont dÃ©posÃ© plainte, donnant le nom de leurs agresseurs.

EspÃ©rons qu'il ne s'agit pas lÃ  seulement d'un Ã©lan circonstanciel, appelÃ© Ã  retomber, avant un retour Ã  la case dÃ©part. Nous avons besoin de cette libÃ©ration. Elle est peut-Ãªtre plus nÃ©cessaire que l'allongement des dÃ©lais de prescription que nombre d'entre nous rÃ©clament, quand peu de plaintes aboutissent hÃ©las Ã  la condamnation effective des responsables. Nous savons en effet que plus le temps est long entre l'agression et la procÃ©dure, moins les plaignantes ont des chances de faire reconnaÃ®tre le tort qui leur a Ã©tÃ© fait. Une grande frustration s'ajoutant alors au prÃ©judice initial.

Si nous ne nous emparons pas de la parole dans la durÃ©e, nous n'avancerons pas. Certes, le traumatisme engendrÃ© par la violence sexuelle tarde souvent Ã  Ã©merger. Mais la parole n'en est pas moins le seul outil Ã  notre disposition pour nous en sortir et pour protÃ©ger celles qui, demain, risquent Ã  leur tour d'Ãªtre victimes de ces violences. Parler, c'est commencer Ã  agir.

Agir

Education dÃ¨s le plus jeune Ã¢ge pour dÃ©tecter l'agresseur, lui tenir tÃªte, parler Ã  ses proches de l'agression subie; formation des policiers, des gendarmes, des magistrats, des mÃ©decins, des enseignants sur ces problÃ¨mes trop souvent banalisÃ©s ou minorÃ©s, une formation visant Ã  aiguiser leur Ã©coute, sans jugement prÃ©alable; crÃ©ation de cellules d'Ã©coute dans les entreprises, les institutions, les partis, les associations, au Parlement, dans les cabinets ministÃ©riels, etc., tout cela se rÃ©vÃ¨le indispensable compte tenu de l'ampleur du flÃ©au, que la parole libÃ©rÃ©e a rÃ©vÃ©lÃ©e.

Les communes, elles non plus, ne peuvent plus se dispenser de prendre leur part dans ce travail, les mairies doivent mettre en place des spots oÃ¹ des personnes averties accueilleront les femmes concernÃ©es et les aideront Ã  porter plainte. Pour tout cela, il faudra des fonds, une action continue des pouvoirs publics, y compris de grandes campagnes d'information, et le gouvernement ne pourra plus se contenter des bonnes paroles et d'un "secrÃ©tariat d'Ã‰tat chargÃ©e de l'Ã©galitÃ© entre les femmes et les hommes" rÃ©duit Ã  la portion congrue.

Tout ne changera pas du jour au lendemain. Ce mal a une histoire, qui remonte Ã  loin, il ne disparaÃ®tra pas dans le court terme. Dans ce combat, la libÃ©ration de la parole n'est qu'une Ã©tape.

Si la femme continue d'Ãªtre exhibÃ©e comme un argument de vente pour Ã©couler vÃªtements, bijoux, voitures ou produits de luxe, elle ne cessera pas d'Ãªtre perÃ§ue elle-mÃªme comme un objet de consommation et comme un objet sexuel. Sans oublier la pornographie, bien sÃ»r, et ses effets dÃ©lÃ©tÃ¨res. Si nous ne nous attaquons pas Ã  ces marqueurs qui faÃ§onnent les mentalitÃ©s de beaucoup d'hommes, la libÃ©ration de la parole des femmes â€“ qui n'a pas le droit Ã  l'erreur dans la dÃ©signation de leurs agresseurs si elle veut garder quelque poids â€“, cette libÃ©ration, dis-je, n'ira pas loin. Elle restera vaine.

Les femmes ne sont pas (seulement) des victimes

Il ne faudrait pas non plus que nous, les femmes, nous nous Ã©rigions seulement en victimes. Des victimes Ã  plaindre. VoilÃ  qui pourrait arranger tous ceux qui continuent Ã  nous tenir pour des Ãªtres fragiles, Ã  qui il suffirait de prodiguer un peu de compassion pour se faire pardonner. Il faut aller plus loin, exiger plus.

Nous voulons simplement occuper la place qui nous revient. La paritÃ©, oui. Mais la paritÃ© dans les faits. La prise en compte de nos acquis, de nos ambitions, de notre savoir-faire, de notre savoir-dire, avec des postes et des salaires Ã©gaux Ã  ceux des hommes Ã  mÃªme niveau de compÃ©tence. Cette paritÃ©-lÃ  a de toute Ã©vidence besoin d'un coup de pouce. Sur le papier, c'est facile, sur le terrain social, c'est autre chose.

Encore aujourd'hui, la parole des femmes peine Ã  se faire entendre y compris par exemple au Parlement, dans les commissions, en sÃ©ance. Cette parole, il faut souvent l'arracher. Celles qui veulent parler, et elles ne sont pas nombreuses, sont obligÃ©es de jouer des coudes. DÃ¨s que nous ouvrons la bouche, jusque dans l'hÃ©micycle, les hommes se mettent Ã  bavarder, Ã  chahuter comme dans une cour de rÃ©crÃ©ation, ils nous coupent la parole, raillent notre tenue, lancent des remarques dÃ©placÃ©es, ou simplement ne nous Ã©coutent pas, et je dirai mÃªme, ne nous entendent pas. Et si nous Ã©levons la voix, nous sommes bien sÃ»r jugÃ©es agressives. Dans les institutions, dans les partis, dans l'entreprise, Ã  l'UniversitÃ©, ce n'est guÃ¨re mieux.

LÃ  oÃ¹ il y a de la parole, il y a du pouvoir, et les hommes dominent "naturellement". Ce sont toujours les mÃªmes qui font de longs discours pour dire souvent si peu. Il n'y a pas de place, pas de temps pour la parole des femmes. Cette mÃªme parole qui longtemps s'est tue face au harcÃ¨lement, Ã  l'agression sexuelle ou au viol. Oui, la parole, c'est le pouvoir. Et les femmes n'ont pas Ã  la prendre seulement pour dÃ©noncer. Notre parole ne doit en aucun cas Ãªtre rÃ©duite Ã  une parole de victimes.

L'"inclusion" ne se dÃ©crÃ¨te pas, elle s'arrache

Ã€ la tÃ©lÃ©vision, les femmes sont nombreuses pour prÃ©senter les informations. Mais regardez plutÃ´t les dÃ©bats. Elles y sont si rares. La parole pensante et dÃ©battante est l'apanage des hommes. Nous ne serions pas, semble-t-il, aussi expertes qu'eux. Seraient-elles donc si rares, les femmes Ã  avoir fait de longues Ã©tudes? Le retour sans fin sur les plateaux des mÃªmes hÃ¢bleurs masculins n'aide pas les femmes Ã  figurer en nombre au haut des rÃ©pertoires tÃ©lÃ©phoniques des puissances invitantes. Ã€ la radio, ce n'est guÃ¨re diffÃ©rent. Parler de choses sÃ©rieuses reste une affaire d'hommes. Lorsqu'une femme est conviÃ©e Ã  participer au dÃ©bat, il lui faut dÃ©ployer bien des efforts pour ne pas Ãªtre coupÃ©e par les hommes. Et mÃªme lorsque c'est une femme qui anime les Ã©changes, par automatisme, elle laissera souvent les hommes â€“ eux d'abord â€“ parler tout leur soÃ»l.

Bref, nous voulons notre temps de parole. Et plus que cela. Aucune orthographe inclusive, aucune fÃ©minisation des noms de mÃ©tiers n'y suffiront. De telles initiatives peuvent rappeler aux oublieux qu'il y a 50% de femmes au monde et qu'elles mÃ©ritent un autre traitement que celui qu'on leur rÃ©serve. Mais ces mesures, Ã  elles seules, ne suffiront pas Ã  faire reconnaÃ®tre les femmes pour ce qu'elles sont: des Ãªtres libres et autonomes. La fÃªlure est bien plus importante. Et nous avons Ã  la rÃ©parer ensemble, femmes et hommes. Ce n'est ni la censure au nom du fÃ©minisme, ni les petits bricolages autour des droits des femmes, ni un statut de victime dans lequel nous nous draperions, qui libÃ©reront les hommes de leurs prÃ©jugÃ©s et nous Ã©pargneront leurs dÃ©rives.

S'il y a un temps pour rÃ©vÃ©ler et pour soigner les plaies, ce temps ne saurait faire oublier que nous sommes encore loin de notre but, qui est d'assumer pleinement, sans complexes, avec toute l'Ã©nergie dont nous sommes capables, et sans que cela enlÃ¨ve rien Ã  notre fÃ©minitÃ© intrinsÃ¨que, notre rÃ´le de sujets pensants et agissants.

Personne ne nous fera ce cadeau, sinon nous-mÃªmes.

TITLE: Vu du SÃ©nat #81: Nous, les femmes

TEXT:
Vale quanto un partito minore la fetta di elettorato che alle elezioni regionali in Sicilia ha votato per la coalizione di centrosinistra ma non il suo candidato alla presidenza Fabrizio Micari. Preferendo, a quest'ultimo, il candidato del Movimento 5 Stelle Giancarlo Cancelleri. In altre parole, il voto "utile" e disgiunto si Ã¨ riversato sull'esponente grillino, tutto a danno del candidato della coalizione targata Partito Democratico. In numeri, stando alle ultime proiezioni tanto di Emg/La7 quanto Piepoli/Rai, su una copertura del 40% circa (e margine d'errore del 2,8%), Micari risulta aver preso quasi l'8% in meno come candidato rispetto alla somma dei voti presi dai partiti che lo hanno sostenuto.

La coalizione Micari Presidente ha quindi ottenuto, secondo i dati provvisori ma in via di consolidamento, circa il 26,1% mentre i consensi andati al rettore di Palermo come presidente della Regione si fermano intorno al 18%. Dove sono finiti questi voti? A naso, tutti o quasi su Cancelleri che ha ottenuto il 36% circa dei voti mentre la sua lista Movimento 5 Stelle si Ã¨ fermata al 28,8%.

Il voto disgiunto Ã¨ una pratica che spesso emerge nelle elezioni che prevedono un secondo turno, il cosiddetto ballottaggio. La tendenza stavolta assume un peso giÃ  rilevante perchÃ© avviene in una elezione aperta a piÃ¹ candidati e senza ballottaggio. Ãˆ quindi sintomo di diversi fattori. In primis: gli elettori della coalizione del centrosinistra hanno percepito la sfida per la Regione come una corsa a due in via esclusiva: da una parte il candidato del centrodestra Nello Musumeci, dall'altro il grillino Cancelleri. Non solo: Ã¨ evidente che i sostenitori di centrosinistra non hanno riconosciuto nel rettore di Palermo Micari una candidatura forte in grado di avere un quid spendibile nella corsa per Palazzo d'Orleans. No chance. E allora tanto vale orientarsi sul candidato grillino per arginare la destra.

Ancora: la coalizione di centrodestra ha dimostrato che quando c'Ã¨ un accordo su un nome unitario, i partiti coalizzati fanno la loro parte senza dÃ©faillance: Musumeci si avvia alla presidenza della Regione Sicilia con il 38% delle preferenze, mentre la coalizione che lo ha sostenuto orbita intorno al 37,4%. Detta ancora diversamente, nessuno ha fatto mancare i suoi voti. Stesso discorso, ma su numeri ridotti, per Claudio Fava (7%) in linea con le preferenze raccolte dalla sua lista, i Cento Passi (7,1%).

Il voto disgiunto penalizza quindi il Partito Democratico e il suo candidato. Non a caso, Davide Faraone, sottosegretario alla Salute ma pure uomo forte dei dem in Sicilia, ha sottolineato come sia "un dato inquietante: se avessimo avuto una coalizione unita probabilmente questa polarizzazione non sarebbe avvenuta". Al momento, pare di capire, la lettura che viene data dai dem sul voto disgiunto attribuisce alla doppia candidatura presentata dalla sinistra, quella di Micari (sostenuto anche da Angelino Alfano) e quella di Fava (sostenuto da Mdp, Sinistra Italiana e Possibile), la responsabilitÃ  del cattivo risultato del rettore palermitano.

Voto "utile" ma alla fine "inutile", dal momento che il supporto arrivato dagli elettori di centrosinistra al candidato del Movimento 5 Stelle non Ã¨ riuscito a farlo prevalere su Musumeci. Magra consolazione per il candidato del Pd.

Guarda anche:

Di Stefano (M5s): "Temiamo brogli"
TITLE: Votano Pd ma scelgono Cancelleri: il voto "utile" e disgiunto penalizza il centrosinistra

SUMMARY:
A saleswoman keeps a gold necklace in a shelf at a showroom in Mumbai, India, August 13, 2015.
Gold is considered an essential part of weddings in India, second-biggest consumer of the metal in the world after China, and it is a popular gift on such occasions.
In the next few weeks, there are many wedding dates, which will boost demand," said Kumar Jain, a Mumbai-based jeweller.

That's why the market is in premium, despite moderate demand," said a dealer with a private bank in Mumbai.
TEXT:
A saleswoman keeps a gold necklace in a shelf at a showroom in Mumbai, India, August 13, 2015.

ADVERTISEMENT

MUMBAI/BENGALURU -- Demand for physical gold was lacklustre in top consumers India and China this week, while the lure of the metal remained stable in Singapore, but India's peak wedding season is expected to usher in renewed interest for bullion in coming weeks.

Gold is considered an essential part of weddings in India, second-biggest consumer of the metal in the world after China, and it is a popular gift on such occasions.

"The wedding season has started. In the next few weeks, there are many wedding dates, which will boost demand," said Kumar Jain, a Mumbai-based jeweller.

Dealers in India were charging a premium of up to $3 an ounce this week over official domestic prices, unchanged from last week. The domestic price includes a 10 percent import tax.

"Gold imports by (jewellery) export houses have fallen sharply in the last few weeks. That's why the market is in premium, despite moderate demand," said a dealer with a private bank in Mumbai.

In October, India tightened gold import norms for jewellery exporters by restricting them from importing the yellow metal only for export purposes and not for selling in the domestic market.

Meanwhile, in China, the market for the precious metal remained quiet, with premiums of $5 to $9 an ounce being charged over benchmark rates, as against the $6.50 to $10 range in the previous week.

Benchmark spot gold was on track to register a small weekly gain, hovering around the $1,275.00 level as of 0919 GMT on Friday, but still below Thursday's mark of $1,284.10, highest in nearly two weeks. [GOL/]

"Dips below the $1,270 level (toward the beginning of the week) spurred some buying, but the upside, (around the $1,280 level) limited purchases," said Ronald Leung, chief dealer at Lee Cheong Gold Dealers in Hong Kong.

Premiums in Hong Kong remained more or less unchanged from last week, in the 60 cents to $1.20 range.

"Premiums are quite low, and except for periodic large sales, the market is quiet," said Joshua Rotbart, managing partner of J. Rotbart & Co in Hong Kong.

In Singapore, premiums rose to 70-90 cents from the 50 cents last week.

"There has been interest from two segments, the wholesalers and high net worth individuals, so it is still strong," said Loh Mun Chun, Director, Private Wealth at GoldSilver Central in Singapore.

"The wholesalers need to buy ... to produce jewellery, especially with some spillover demand coming from the Diwali and Dhanterras festivals, while the high net worth individuals ... buy to diversify their portfolio and they have the money."

Japanese markets were closed for a public holiday on Friday.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Wedding Bells Set To Ring In Fresh Gold Demand In India

SUMMARY:
I do all of my weight training and cardio at home with what equipment I have.
Before I started training I was completely inactive other than walking to run errands or walking to school.
I do resistance training, weight lifting, and cardio, both walking and running.
Because my goal is no longer weight loss, my focus now is on maintaining my current weight and healthy lifestyle.
A post shared by STEPHANIE KATRINA (@stephaniekatrinaa) on Aug 9, 2017 at 2:03pm PDTFinal thoughts:Know that as human beings, we are always capable of change, both physically and mentally.
TEXT:
Full name: Stephanie Katrina

Occupation: Writer/blogger and aspiring personal trainer

Age: 24

City: Sudbury, Ont.

Height: 5'3

The scoop:

I have never shared my weight publicly. I have girls as young as 12 years old that message me on Instagram asking what they can do to weigh "this" amount or "that" amount, and I believe that as an "influencer" and self-love advocate, I need to be mindful of what I share.

I would never want young girls to strive to reach my weight, or anyone else's weight, as it truly is just a number. That being said, since I began my health journey, I've lost 65 pounds.

A post shared by STEPHANIE KATRINA (@stephaniekatrinaa) on Oct 24, 2017 at 1:20pm PDT

The story:

I was never overweight or obese growing up, however I remember struggling with my weight and body image from a very young age.

The weight gain really started in university. I was away from home, suffering terribly from depression, and binge drinking socially with my friends every week.

Over the years I would always try the latest "fad" diet: diet pills, cleanses, and low calorie diets. None of these worked, of course, because they're unrealistic and not maintainable long term.

The final straw:

After leaving my final year of university due to a health scare, combined with debilitating depression and anxiety, I was desperate for change. So I decided that I would start by working to change my physical body, with the hope that eventually my mental health would improve as well.

A post shared by STEPHANIE KATRINA (@stephaniekatrinaa) on Sep 19, 2017 at 1:20pm PDT

The plan of attack:

I started using a program called "Bikini Body Guide," a guide comprised of workouts that can all be done at home using minimal equipment. I downloaded a food tracking app and started tracking what I was eating. In the first year I lost 30 pounds and it took me two years in total to lose the 65 pounds.

Story continues below.

Check out more inspiring women:

Inspiring Lifestyle Success Stories Inspiring Lifestyle Success Stories



1 of 270 Share this slide:





Why I share my story on social media:

I wanted to show other people, particularly women, that you can hit rock bottom physically/mentally/emotionally, and bounce back. I wanted a place to talk about physical and mental health.

I was inspired by Kayla Itsines and other "BBG girls" (women who were doing the program that I eventually started). I saw so many women sharing their stories and journeys publicly, and I felt encouraged to do the same.

I wanted to show other people, particularly women, that you can hit rock bottom physically/mentally/emotionally, and bounce back.

The hardest adjustment:

Learning self-discipline was quite difficult for me in the beginning. I had to learn to hold myself accountable for what I was eating and how often I was training. There was no one that was going to hold me accountable other than me, and that was a scary thought.

A post shared by STEPHANIE KATRINA (@stephaniekatrinaa) on Mar 15, 2017 at 1:21pm PDT

The food element:

I gradually made changes to my diet â€” I knew it wasn't realistic to overhaul my entire diet overnight. I started by preparing all of my meals at home, rather than ordering takeout, and started focusing on nutrient-dense, higher protein foods.

I tracked calories in the very beginning, which helped me to learn serving sizes and portion control. I had no idea how many calories were in certain foods, so tracking did help.

For the first year, I limited certain foods (fast food, takeout), but I did not cut them out completely. I allowed myself to eat them in moderation. For the last year-and-a-half I have completely cut out meat, but this decision was unrelated to weight loss.

The exercise factor:

I did not join a gym or hire a personal trainer. I did, and still do, all of my training at home. I do all of my weight training and cardio at home with what equipment I have. (Weights, treadmill, benches, barbell, etc.)

Before I started training I was completely inactive other than walking to run errands or walking to school. I had not worked out in years prior to starting my journey.

I still do all of my training at home. I do resistance training, weight lifting, and cardio, both walking and running. I aim to work out three to five days per week. Each workout typically takes about 60 minutes, sometimes slightly less.

Because my goal is no longer weight loss, my focus now is on maintaining my current weight and healthy lifestyle. I make sure to switch up my workouts fairly often to challenge my body.

A post shared by STEPHANIE KATRINA (@stephaniekatrinaa) on Sep 5, 2017 at 1:19pm PDT

How I stay motivated:

I remind myself of my "why": Why I started, why I wanted to make changes, and why I continue to live the way that I do. I train often and eat well because I feel at my best mentally and physically when I do so. And I know that if I were to return to my old lifestyle, I would feel just as miserable as I once did.

The day-to-day:

I work out multiple days during the week and once on weekends. I write a lot, I read a lot, and I am constantly striving to improve myself not only physically, but mentally as well.

I do allow myself treats and "cheat" days, however I try to eat well 75% of the time. Finding a balance that works for me has allowed me to maintain my current weight for a long time, while not having to be utterly restrictive with my diet.

What I'm most proud of:

My resilience. As someone living with major depressive disorder, it's not easy battling your own mind every day. I am proud of myself for accomplishing all that I have, despite the difficulties that I've endured along the way.

I regret not being kinder to myself along the way. I am just now learning that we can love ourselves as we are, while still striving to make changes and improvements in our lives. Being kind to ourselves makes the journey a lot more enjoyable. I wish I had realized that from the very beginning.

A post shared by STEPHANIE KATRINA (@stephaniekatrinaa) on Aug 9, 2017 at 2:03pm PDT

Final thoughts:

Know that as human beings, we are always capable of change, both physically and mentally. Though it may feel this way, you're never stuck in your current body, or current circumstances. If you want something badly enough, with hard work, perseverance, and belief in yourself, you can do anything that you set out to do.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: A Serious Health Scare Prompted This Woman To Overcome Her Fear And Get Healthy

TEXT:
Martin Schulz will den SPD-Mitgliedern mehr Mitsprache bei Personalfragen einrÃ¤umen

In einem Reformpapier rechnet er auch mit dem eigenen Wahlkampf ab

"JÃ¼nger und weiblicher" sollte die SPD nach dem Debakel bei der Bundestagswahl werden. Zu sehen ist davon allerdings bisher wenig. Parteichef Martin Schulz drÃ¤ngt nun laut einem Medienbericht auf eine umfassende Reform der SPD.

Die Mitglieder sollen kÃ¼nftig in Personalfragen - auch auf Bundesebene - stÃ¤rker mitbestimmen kÃ¶nnen. Das stehe in einem entsprechenden Leitantrag fÃ¼r den Bundesparteitag im Dezember, berichtet der "Spiegel".

Ziel sei es, spÃ¤testens 2019 Ã¼ber den SPD-Vorsitz per Urwahl abstimmen zu lassen, zitiert das Nachrichtenmagazin Parteikreise. Bislang ist eine Urwahl nur fÃ¼r die Frage der Kanzlerkandidatur vorgesehen.

"Der Kanzlerkandidat und die SPD haben die Wahl verloren"

In dem Papier gehe Schulz auch Ã¼berraschend hart mit dem SPD-Wahlkampf ins Gericht. "Nicht die Medien, nicht die Demoskopen und auch nicht die politischen Gegner sind schuld an unserer Wahlniederlage", zitiert der "Spiegel" daraus.

"Der Kanzlerkandidat und die gesamte SPD haben diese Wahl verloren." Vielen WÃ¤hlern sei nicht klar gewesen, wofÃ¼r die SPD stehe.

Zudem habe es an einer klaren Botschaft an die WÃ¤hler gefehlt. Viele WÃ¤hler hÃ¤tten den Eindruck gehabt, "die SPD treibe jeden Tag eine 'neue Sau durch das Dorf', schreibe Schulz in dem Reformpapier.

"Eine verstÃ¤ndliche ErzÃ¤hlung, wo wir mit dem Land hinwollen, fehlt - und damit eine wesentliche Voraussetzung fÃ¼r echte Zukunftskompetenz", zitiert der "Spiegel" weiter.

Ruf nach Erneuerung

Schulz' Papier sei weder "revolutionÃ¤r", noch biete es ein "fertiges Konzept fÃ¼r den Wiederaufbau der SPD", kommentiert das Nachrichtenmagazin. Allerdings enthalte das Dokumente viele Anhaltspunkte, wie es fÃ¼r die Sozialdemokraten weitergehen kÃ¶nnte.

Zuletzt hatte Hamburgs BÃ¼rgermeister Olaf Scholz sich mit einem Papier in die Debatte um die Erneuerung der SPD eingemischt. Er forderte eine "schonungslose Betrachtung der Lage".

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: SPD am Scheideweg - Erneuern oder erodieren

J'ai racontÃ© cette histoire devant des adultes, des journalistes, des professeurs et les rÃ©actions n'ont Ã©tÃ© que rires et blagues graveleuses.
Il y a quelques temps, je me suis fait agresser en boÃ®te de nuit par un type que je connaissais vaguement.
En racontant l'histoire Ã  des gens qui le connaissent, je me suis aperÃ§ue qu'il n'en Ã©tait pas Ã  son premier fait d'armes.
(pardon, vous n'avez citÃ© QUE des hommes, je me permets de ne citer QUE des femmes).
Ceux qui en critiquent le sens, les mÃ©thodes, qui tentent de diviser ("toutes les femmes ne pensent pas cela voyons...").
TEXT:
La tribune publiÃ©e par Nicolas Bedos dans Le HuffPost, sur la libÃ©ration de la parole qui vire, selon lui, Ã  la guerre des sexes, m'a passablement Ã©nervÃ©e. D'autant plus qu'elle a Ã©tÃ© partagÃ©e par des gens que j'estime, alors qu'elle reste pour moi le reflet d'une misogynie bien ancrÃ©e et qui refuse de dire son nom. Je me suis donc accordÃ© un droit de rÃ©ponse.

Cher Nicolas Bedos,

Vers l'Ã¢ge de 12 ans, j'apprends qu'un de mes cousins, un adulte, avait commis des attouchements sur une de mes cousines de 8 ans. Peu de temps auparavant, il avait tentÃ© de violer une autre de mes cousines qui en avait fait part Ã  ses parents. Tout le monde savait.

Quand j'Ã©tais Ã©tudiante, j'apprends que mes amies Ã  Sciences Po qui avaient DSK comme professeur, demandaient Ã  leurs copines d'attendre devant la porte lorsqu'elles avaient Ã  passer un oral avec lui, de peur de se retrouver dans une situation "dÃ©licate". J'ai racontÃ© cette histoire devant des adultes, des journalistes, des professeurs et les rÃ©actions n'ont Ã©tÃ© que rires et blagues graveleuses. Tout le monde savait.

Il y a quelques temps, je me suis fait agresser en boÃ®te de nuit par un type que je connaissais vaguement. Le serveur d'un cafÃ© qui me draguait et dont j'ai toujours repoussÃ© les avances. En racontant l'histoire Ã  des gens qui le connaissent, je me suis aperÃ§ue qu'il n'en Ã©tait pas Ã  son premier fait d'armes. Tout le monde savait.

Pour tous les cas que je viens de citer, des gouttes d'eau dans un ocÃ©an de plaintes Ã©touffÃ©es, "un seul nom suffisait". Ce nom que l'on vous demande de balancer aujourd'hui, certes bÃªtement, est celui que l'on s'Ã©change sous le manteau depuis des annÃ©es. Celui qui a pu faire rire sous cape. Celui qui a pu devenir un mythe ("Je vais te faire une Baupin", "Je suis le DSK de France 2"). Et pourquoi on vous le demande Nicolas? Parce que jusque ici, ce type-lÃ  est restÃ© impuni alors que tout le monde savait. Jusqu'ici c'Ã©taient mes cousines, les Ã©tudiantes de Sciences Po, ou moi-mÃªme qui devions avoir honte de nos agressions.

Je pense d'ailleurs que tout cela vous le savez pertinemment, comme la diffÃ©rence entre la drague lourde et le harcÃ¨lement, je ne vais pas vous faire l'affront de vous donner un cours sur la notion de consentement. D'ailleurs, je prendrai comme un jeu rhÃ©torique de votre part le fait que vous compariez un violeur Ã  un homme infidÃ¨le ou Ã  un radin. Vous-mÃªme, je pense, vous choisiriez sans hÃ©siter l'option "mon radin de patron a refusÃ© de m'augmenter" plutÃ´t que "mon violeur de patron m'a sodomisÃ© de force".

Par contre ne me demandez pas de "comprendre votre colÃ¨re". Je la trouve dÃ©placÃ©e. Vous avez l'impression, en tant qu'homme, d'Ãªtre devenu un gibier? Mais n'est-ce pas cela, entre autres, qui rÃ©volte les femmes? D'avoir le sentiment d'Ãªtre traquÃ©e en permanence?

Et que cela soit clair, je n'ai pas choisi les exemples ci-dessus pour remettre en cause le fait que DSK soit un Ã©conomiste brillant, que j'ai de bons souvenirs d'enfance avec mon cousin, ou que le serveur qui m'a agressÃ©e soit le roi des Frozen Margaritas. Comme je ne remets pas en cause le fait que les films de Woody Allen, Roman Polanski, Kevin Spacey ou produits par Harvey Weinstein puissent Ãªtre remarquables. J'ai Ã©tÃ© fan du "Cosby show" comme de la musique de Michael Jackson ou de Noir DÃ©sir. D'ailleurs, Emile Louis Ã©tait sÃ»rement un formidable chauffeur de bus et peut-Ãªtre dans un autre contexte, j'aurais pu prendre un cafÃ© avec Guy Georges et trouver le mec super sympa.

La question de sÃ©parer l'homme de l'Å“uvre ou mÃªme "la bÃªte", "le porc", puisqu'on l'a nommÃ© ainsi, de l'Ãªtre humain (du voisin, du copain, du pÃ¨re, du fils, du cousin), pose question et cela personne ne peut le nier. C'est philosophiquement et humainement un dÃ©bat Ã  avoir. Mais a-t-on pour autant besoin de le porter aux nues? Qu'un homme qui a tuÃ© sa femme Ã  coups de poing fasse la une des magazines? Qu'un organisme public rende hommage Ã  un homme accusÃ© de plusieurs viols et qui fuit la justice depuis des annÃ©es? Est-ce cela pour vous un monde libre? Un monde oÃ¹ le talent, le pouvoir et l'argent excusent tout? OÃ¹ les coupables n'ont pas honte? OÃ¹ l'on dit aux victimes encore une fois de se taire car leur parole ne vaut rien contre la leur? Mais surtout, est-ce vraiment cela sur quoi porte le dÃ©bat aujourd'hui?

Et si vous (re)lisiez King Kong thÃ©orie de Virginie Despentes? Ou Le deuxiÃ¨me sexe de Simone de Beauvoir? Et si vous creusiez un peu plus les pensÃ©es de FranÃ§oise HÃ©ritier, Marguerite Duras ou GeneviÃ¨ve Fraisse? (pardon, vous n'avez citÃ© QUE des hommes, je me permets de ne citer QUE des femmes). Vous comprendriez sÃ»rement que ce qui se passe aujourd'hui n'est pas "une chasse aux sorciÃ¨res au nom du progrÃ¨s moral". Et que derriÃ¨re ce #, ce n'est pas seulement un ras-le-bol qui s'exprime, mais la remise en cause d'un systÃ¨me oÃ¹ se construisent et se perpÃ©tuent inÃ©galitÃ©s et stÃ©rÃ©otypes. Un systÃ¨me tellement ancrÃ© en nous, hommes comme femmes, qu'il nous a amenÃ© Ã  considÃ©rer que la violence envers la moitiÃ© de l'humanitÃ© Ã©tait naturelle, puisque jusqu'ici personne n'a rien fait.

Et lorsque l'on vous demande si vous connaissez des gens autour de vous qui auraient pu avoir ce genre de comportement, n'est-ce pas beaucoup plus facile de prendre la plume pour dÃ©noncer les dÃ©rives totalitaires d'une "dÃ©nonciation arbitraire", que de se poser les vraies questions: "Ai-je moi aussi un jour Ã©tÃ© un "porc"? "Ai-je, mÃªme sans m'en apercevoir, dÃ©passÃ© la limite? Ai-je laissÃ© passer des comportements inacceptables qui se sont dÃ©roulÃ©s sous mes yeux, par peur, lÃ¢chetÃ©, ignorance? Et la rÃ©ponse est oui, Nicolas, vous l'avez fait. Je l'ai fait aussi. Nous l'avons tous fait. Cette dÃ©ferlante vous gÃªne et tant mieux, car elle vous remet et nous remet tous en question.

Et puis, n'avez-vous pas un peu l'impression que sous couvert de fustiger la pensÃ©e unique, vous en Ãªtes en fait le parfait reprÃ©sentant: le mÃ¢le alpha blanc. Celui qui occupe la place dans les mÃ©dias, Ã  l'assemblÃ©e, dans les postes Ã  responsabilitÃ© et les conseils d'administration, celui qui a, par dÃ©finition, le pouvoir et la parole. Celui qui n'a pas besoin de quota, de manifs ou de # pendÃ©mique pour Ãªtre Ã©coutÃ©. Parce que, si vous approuvez le fait qu'enfin les voix des femmes s'Ã©lÃ¨vent, pourquoi mettre un bÃ©mol en parlant au-dessus d'elles? Si vous souhaitez rÃ©ellement que les femmes de votre entourage n'aient plus Ã  subir et que cette parole libÃ©rÃ©e permette enfin de changer les choses, pourquoi dÃ©placer (et accaparer) le dÃ©bat?

Dans un couple "tout sauf le silence dites-vous"? Mais vous n'Ãªtes pas en couple avec la moitiÃ© de l'humanitÃ© que je sache? Et mÃªme si je suivais votre raisonnement jusqu'au bout, si votre femme vous apprend qu'elle a Ã©tÃ© agressÃ©e par le facteur, allez-vous lui couper la parole pour lui rÃ©torquer: "je comprends chÃ©rie, mais il va d'abord falloir laisser faire la justice avant de prÃ©venir les voisins et qu'il arrÃªte de venir livrer le courrier chez nous... et puis on ne peut pas lui retirer que c'est un bon facteur, il monte les Chronoposts jusqu'au 6Ã¨me...Â».

Pensez-vous, Nicolas, qu'il serait possible qu'un homme, juste pendant un moment, n'ait rien Ã  dire, juste Ã  Ã©couter? Rien Ã  ajouter si ce n'est tenter de comprendre quelque chose qui le dÃ©passe? Rien Ã  faire, si ce n'est son examen de conscience?

Il n'y a pas Ã  proprement parler de guerre des sexes. Mais oui, il y a bien une rÃ©volte et comme dans toute rÃ©volte qui se respecte, il y a ceux, dont vous faites partie, ainsi que "vos amis avec qui vous discutez en privÃ©", bien accrochÃ©s Ã  leurs acquis qui ne veulent pas voir les choses bouger. Ceux qui en critiquent le sens, les mÃ©thodes, qui tentent de diviser ("toutes les femmes ne pensent pas cela voyons..."). Ceux qui sous couvert de s'interroger, sont juste terrifiÃ©s Ã  l'idÃ©e que le monde qui arrive "soit moins profitable". Moins profitable Ã  qui? Ã€ eux... et Ã  eux seulement.

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Cher Nicolas Bedos, il y a une rÃ©volte des femmes, et vous faites partie de ceux qui ne veulent pas voir les choses bouger

SUMMARY:
This year has seen legislation against drivers who use their smartphone on UK roads get tougher - now lawbreakers face a potential Â£200 fine and six points - but how dangerous really is it?
The initiative began in April 2015 and was rolled out across 28 police forces, catching over 4,000 dangerous drivers in just two years.
Other offences include not wearing a seat belt, not being in proper control of the vehicle and speeding.
In total there were 388 verbal warnings and 838 fixed or graduated penalty notices given out to these drivers.

TEXT:
Richard Leonard, Head of Road Safety at Highways England, said: â€œI dread to think what would have happened if he had needed to brake suddenly.â€

Highways England have released secret police dash cam footage of a HGV driver checking his mobile, and resting his foot on the dashboard, to persuade road users to think twice about what they are doing.

This year has seen legislation against drivers who use their smartphone on UK roads get tougher - now lawbreakers face a potential Â£200 fine and six points - but how dangerous really is it?

The anonymous driver was caught on the M18 in East Yorkshire by an undercover police operation that uses unmarked HGV cabs to capture footage inside the high vehicles.

The initiative began in April 2015 and was rolled out across 28 police forces, catching over 4,000 dangerous drivers in just two years.

Nearly two-thirds of those pulled over were using a mobile phone. Other offences include not wearing a seat belt, not being in proper control of the vehicle and speeding.

One driver in Devon was found to have sent 10 replies to text messages within one hour and another in the East Midlands was steering with his knees while eating his lunch.

One man in Surrey was trying to put toothpaste on his toothbrush.

In total there were 388 verbal warnings and 838 fixed or graduated penalty notices given out to these drivers.

There were also 113 prosecutions for more serious offences.

Chief Constable Anthony Bangham, National Police Chiefsâ€™ Council lead for roads policing said: â€œPeople have to think about the consequences of their actions. A momentâ€™s distraction can change innocent lives. It is never a risk worth taking.â€
TITLE: This Shocking Video Is Why You Shouldn't Use Your Smartphone While Driving

Jacob Thompson, a 9-year-old boy with stage 4 high-risk neuroblastoma, loves the holiday season.
But doctors have told him he may not live long enough to celebrate Christmas this year.
Jacob was diagnosed at age five with neuroblastoma, a malignant cancer of the nerve cells that is almost exclusively found in children and extremely difficult to treat.
Heâ€™s been fighting the disease for years, but things took a turn for the worse last month.
On 11 October, he was admitted to Barbara Bush Childrenâ€™s Hospital in Portland, Maine, for the â€œlast time,â€ his parents wrote on a GoFundMe page created to help cover the costs of his funeral.
TEXT:
Jacob Thompson, a 9-year-old boy with stage 4 high-risk neuroblastoma, loves the holiday season. But doctors have told him he may not live long enough to celebrate Christmas this year.

Jacob was diagnosed at age five with neuroblastoma, a malignant cancer of the nerve cells that is almost exclusively found in children and extremely difficult to treat. Heâ€™s been fighting the disease for years, but things took a turn for the worse last month.

On 11 October, he was admitted to Barbara Bush Childrenâ€™s Hospital in Portland, Maine, for the â€œlast time,â€ his parents wrote on a GoFundMe page created to help cover the costs of his funeral.
TITLE: 9-Year-Old Cancer Patient Asks For Homemade Cards As Final Christmas Wish

Selon la doctorante, le mÃ©tier dâ€™agriculteur est reconnu comme l'un des plus Ã  risque de stress Ã  cause dâ€™Ã©lÃ©ments incontrÃ´lables comme la mÃ©tÃ©o. Mais la mondialisation, les traitÃ©s commerciaux, le prix du lait, le prix du quota, lâ€™endettement des entreprises, les changements technologiques, les conflits familiaux, les chicanes de couple ou lâ€™isolement sont tous des facteurs de stress qui sâ€™additionnent et font grimper le taux de la dÃ©tresse psychologique. Â« Jusquâ€™Ã  ce que lâ€™Ã©lastique pÃ¨te Â», explique celle qui a Ã©tudiÃ© le malaise des agriculteurs tant au QuÃ©bec quâ€™en France et en Suisse1.



Toutefois, la seule Ã©tude disponible sur le taux de suicide des agriculteurs quÃ©bÃ©cois indiquait quâ€™il Ã©tait le double de celui des hommes dans la population gÃ©nÃ©rale quÃ©bÃ©coise. Le problÃ¨me, pour obtenir lâ€™heure juste, câ€™est que lâ€™Institut national de la santÃ© publique du QuÃ©bec ne comptabilise pas les suicides par profession. En 2014, 845 QuÃ©bÃ©cois se sont enlevÃ© la vie et, depuis 1981, cette triste statistique annuelle oscille entre 795 et 1284 hommes.



Parmi les pays dÃ©veloppÃ©s, la France sâ€™est toutefois dotÃ©e en 2013 dâ€™un Observatoire national du suicide qui dÃ©nombre 417 suicides chez les hommes agriculteurs entre 2007 Ã  2009, surtout dans les Ã©levages de bovins.

Notre enquÃªte rÃ©vÃ¨le cependant que le phÃ©nomÃ¨ne du suicide des agriculteurs existe bel et bien dans la campagne quÃ©bÃ©coise. Parlez-en Ã  Laurier Gauthier, un voisin de Rudy Ducreux. Lâ€™homme de 67 ans est producteur de lait et copropriÃ©taire avec ses frÃ¨res de la seconde plus grosse Ã©rabliÃ¨re de la Belle Province. Il a offert de nous accompagner Ã  la ferme DucrÃªt.

La vraie raison profonde, les gens partent avec.

â€“ Laurier Gauthier

En chemin, Ã  bord de son camion, M. Gauthier lance devant la ferme dâ€™un de ses voisins. Â« Lui aussi il sâ€™est suicidÃ©. Puis pourtant, il avait de lâ€™argent plein les poches. Il venait de sâ€™acheter une Cadillac. Un bon matin, on apprend quâ€™il sâ€™Ã©tait tirÃ© un coup de 22 en arriÃ¨re des oreilles. Surprise totale Â». Il ajoute avoir connu six personnes, dont cinq producteurs et un employÃ© de ferme, qui se sont enlevÃ© la vie dans un rayon de 12 kilomÃ¨tres de son entreprise.



Quant au geste irrÃ©mÃ©diable de Rudy Ducreux, M. Gauthier lâ€™explique peut-Ãªtre par une charge de travail trop lourde pour un seul homme, mais, Â« la vraie raison profonde, les gens partent avec Â», dit-il. Maire de Saint-Basile durant une trentaine dâ€™annÃ©es, le producteur pointe du doigt lâ€™actuel contexte socio-Ã©conomique comme facteur important de dÃ©tresse psychologique chez les producteurs agricoles. Il reproche Ã  QuÃ©bec, depuis le rÃ¨gne du ministre de lâ€™Agriculture pÃ©quiste Jean Garon (1976-1985), champion de la souverainetÃ© alimentaire, de nommer des ministres de lâ€™Agriculture Ã  temps partiel ou ignorant des enjeux.



Quant au fÃ©dÃ©ral, le producteur se demande jusquâ€™oÃ¹ Ottawa, dans lâ€™actuelle renÃ©gociation de lâ€™ALENA exigÃ©e par le prÃ©sident Donald Trump, est prÃªt Ã  dÃ©fendre la gestion de lâ€™offre et ne pas la sacrifier au profit des secteurs du bois dâ€™Å“uvre, de lâ€™automobile ou de lâ€™aviation.

Connie McLellan, une jeune productrice, s'occupe du troupeau de Rudy Ducreux.



La jeune femme explique avoir Ã©tÃ© recrutÃ©e pour traire le troupeau de 26 bÃªtes. Ã€ part le cliquetis des chaÃ®nes des vaches Ã  lâ€™Ã©table, le silence rÃ¨gne autour de la maison, de la fromagerie, de lâ€™Ã©tabli et des remises dÃ©sertÃ©s. Seul un chat en manque de caresses nous suit dâ€™un bÃ¢timent Ã  lâ€™autre.



Dans les champs adjacents, de la machinerie rouille au milieu de hautes herbes. Et on peut apercevoir de nouvelles plantations dâ€™arbres sur les terres voisines autrefois cultivÃ©es. Comme lâ€™arbre qui cache la forÃªt, le suicide du crÃ©ateur du Gaulois de Portneuf cache un pan de lâ€™agriculture quÃ©bÃ©coise en pÃ©ril.

SUMMARY:
A missile was shot down near the city of Riyadh.
RIYADH, Nov 4 (Reuters) - Saudi Arabia's air defence forces intercepted a ballistic missile fired from Yemen over the capital Riyadh on Saturday, state news agencies reported.
The missile was brought down near King Khaled Airport on the northern outskirts of the city and did not cause any casualties, said state-owned Al Ekhbariya TV.
Rocket fragments fell near the airport grounds, but air traffic carried on normally, the civil aviation authority said on its official Twitter account.
Houthi-run Saba News in Yemen reported that the missile was a Burkan H2 and that the airport had been the target.
TEXT:
A missile was shot down near the city of Riyadh.

RIYADH, Nov 4 (Reuters) - Saudi Arabia's air defence forces intercepted a ballistic missile fired from Yemen over the capital Riyadh on Saturday, state news agencies reported.

The missile was brought down near King Khaled Airport on the northern outskirts of the city and did not cause any casualties, said state-owned Al Ekhbariya TV.

Rocket fragments fell near the airport grounds, but air traffic carried on normally, the civil aviation authority said on its official Twitter account.

Residents of northern Riyadh reported hearing a single deafening explosion that rattled windows around 20:20 local time, followed by rumbling and sounds of low-flying aircraft.

"We heard an enormous loud boom and went outside, then heard a low rumbling noise like thunder and six to 12 smaller explosions," one resident told Reuters.

The northwestern city of Saada in Yemen was hit by an airstrike in November.

The missile was fired into Saudi territory from Yemen at 20:00 local time, the spokesman of a Saudi-led military coalition said in a statement carried by state news agency SPA.

Houthi-run Saba News in Yemen reported that the missile was a Burkan H2 and that the airport had been the target.

The Saudi-led coalition has launched thousands of air strikes against the Iran-allied Houthi movement that controls much of neighbouring Yemen. On Wednesday, witnesses said one such strike killed 26 people at a hotel and adjoining market in northern Yemen, although the coalition said on Saturday it had hit a legitimate target.

The Houthi and allied forces loyal to former Yemeni President Ali Abdullah Saleh have fired dozens of missiles into Saudi territory over the course of a 2-1/2 year war, including a ballistic missile shot down near Mecca in July.

The conflict has led to one of the world's worst humanitarian crises and killed at least 10,000 people. (Reporting by Mostafa Hashem, Reem Shamseddine and Katie Paul; Editing by Hugh Lawson)
TITLE: Saudia Arabia Says It Intercepts Missile Close To Capital

TEXT:
"Es heiÃŸt ja, Bundestrainer oder Bundeskanzler sei der hÃ¤rteste Job der Republik", schreibt Hajo Schumacher im GruÃŸwort zu "Der Tag der Entscheidung" (Matthaes Verlag): "Falsch. Hotelier ist hÃ¤rter. Denn er oder sie muss die beiden anderen beherbergen, bei Laune halten und womÃ¶glich in einem nÃ¤chtlichen TherapiegesprÃ¤ch wieder aufbauen." Rolf Westermann hat in dem Buch die Menschen portrÃ¤tiert, die hinter den groÃŸen TraditionshÃ¤usern oder Hotspots stecken. Eine davon ist Innegrit Volkhardt, die mit 27 Jahren den Bayerischen Hof in MÃ¼nchen Ã¼bernahm, nachdem ihr Vater, Falk Volkhardt, einen Schlaganfall erlitten hatte.

Das 5-Sterne-Haus ist bei der Prominenz weltweit beliebt. Charlie Chaplin, Sigmund Freud, Alfred Hitchcock, Grace Kelly, Bob Dylan, die Beatles, der Dalai Lama, Pele und Messi sind nur einige der vielen Stars, die im Bayerischen Hof schon zu Gast waren. Monatelang wohnte auch Michael Jackson dort, zu Volkhardts Aufgaben gehÃ¶rte es, heiÃŸt es in Westermanns Buch, "dem Superstar mit einem Schwert den Weg aus dem Hotel durch kreischende Fans zu bahnen, als dieser einmal Ã¼berraschend spazieren gehen wollte und nicht genÃ¼gend SicherheitskrÃ¤fte zur VerfÃ¼gung standen".

"Der Tag der Entscheidung" von Rolf Westermann finden Sie hier

Geisterbild mit Nicholas Cage

Es gibt allerdings nicht viele Bilder von Innegrit Volkhardt mit berÃ¼hmten GÃ¤sten. "Ich finde nichts peinlicher, als Fotos vom HÃ¤ndeschÃ¼tteln mit einem Star", erklÃ¤rt sie in "Der Tag der Entscheidung". Mit einigen wenigen GrÃ¶ÃŸen habe sie sich dennoch ablichten lassen. Dazu gehÃ¶rten Jack Nicholson und Muhammad Ali. Ausgerechnet bei ihrem Lieblingsstar Nicholas Cage habe jedoch die Technik versagt. Als ein Mitarbeiter die beiden zusammen aufnehmen sollte, entstand nur ein verhuschtes Geisterbild.

"Wen ich bewundere", sagt Innegrit Volkhardt zudem in dem Buch, "ist Frau Dr. Merkel. Sie ist bescheiden, freundlich und geht auf den anderen ein. Das Gleiche gilt fÃ¼r Herrn Steinmeier. Ich freue mich, sie zu Gast zu haben." Auch fÃ¼r den frÃ¼heren Nato-GeneralsekretÃ¤r Javier Solana empfinde sie Hochachtung und fÃ¼r den Dalai Lama. "Ich bin Beobachter und schaue, wie er mit den Menschen umgeht. Er hat so viel GÃ¼te, gibt jedem mit gleicher Hingebung die Hand."
TITLE: Wieso die Chefin des Bayerischen Hofs fÃ¼r Michael Jackson zum Schwert griff

SUMMARY:
I grew up saying â€œAllahu Akbarâ€ numerous times every day.
Allahu AkbarThe saying literally means God is the greatest.
It is required of all Muslims to say several times during prayer, which is demanded five times a day.
So when and why is the phrase Allahu Akbar used as a battle cry, when a terrorist is about to kill someone?
Hereâ€™s where the double standard hurts: When that man killed 58 people in Las Vegas, the word terrorist was not uttered by anyone.
TEXT:
I grew up saying â€œAllahu Akbarâ€ numerous times every day.

And no, I wasnâ€™t, and am not, a terrorist.

I wasnâ€™t someone who blew buildings up, killed people or shot a missile from my rocket launcher. As far as the West is concerned, those are the events associated with the saying when something bad is about to happen. People of the West are terrified of the phrase.

I was a Muslim boy trying to pray as many times as he could amidst a life of love and peace, in a home that did not condone any terrorism. My father was a poet who read me love poetry instead of nursery rhymes. He uttered the phrase when he prayed. If love existed in the form of a man, it was my father.

â€œLove everyone,â€ was the phrase he uttered almost daily. To him, there was not a problem he couldnâ€™t solve with love.

Allahu Akbar

The saying literally means God is the greatest. It is required of all Muslims to say several times during prayer, which is demanded five times a day. On the average a Muslim ends up saying it hundreds of times. The words are also used as a celebration of life: When a baby is born, when a couple marry or when a veteran returns home safe.

The word Islam means surrender. Youâ€™re supposed to surrender to God and worship him. Love, mercy and compassion are uttered several hundred times a day by any Muslim when they say Besm Allah Alrahman Alraheem, In The Name Of God The Merciful The Compassionate. That saying is uttered before you do anything.

So when and why is the phrase Allahu Akbar used as a battle cry, when a terrorist is about to kill someone? The latest incident was the horrific act in New York when the terrorist shouted the phrase before the police shot him, and after he killed eight people and injured many more.

For the majority of Muslims, to shout Godâ€™s name as you killed the innocent is an abomination. Muslims no more want innocent people killed than anyone else. So why is the phrase used by terrorists?

For the same reason ISIS and Al-Qaida exist: The misinterpretation of Islam. When you use religion as the motive for you actions, you have the power to appeal to the masses. Itâ€™s a brain washing if you will. The terrorists who flew the planes into the World Trade Center on September 11th are no different than any suicide bomber in Israel/Palestine, are no different that the one who mowed down bicyclists in New York. They are people who misunderstood and misused the religion. They are sick and twisted and evil.

The phrase is to remind Muslims that God is supreme. Thatâ€™s it. It was never to be used as a battle cry during horrendous actions furthering political agendas with evil motives.

My heart sank when I heard the terrorist shouted the saying after the attack. I will never understand the link between Islam and Terrorism. The Islam I grew up amidst condemns such actions. It preaches love and peace and tranquility and feeding the hungry and clothing the poor and sheltering the homeless. One of the five main requirements of Islam in addition to prayer and fasting is to give a percentage of your money to the poor.

Is There A Difference?

To me, there is no difference between the terrorists who shout Allahu Akbar when committing a crime and those white nationalists and racists who shouted â€œJews will not replace usâ€ in Charlottesville â€• Virginia recently.

Hereâ€™s where the double standard hurts: When that man killed 58 people in Las Vegas, the word terrorist was not uttered by anyone. Why is it only attached to people who claim Islamic affiliation?

The Quran was brought down to Muhammad in the seventh century. The verses which preach war and fighting were contextual and apply to the time when he and his followers had no choice but to fight back, or die. It is no different than the Old Testament which contains many verses preaching war and killing.

In Deuteronomy Chapter 2, Verses 32-37, Moses is told to kill men, women, and children:

â€œAnd the LORD said unto me, Behold, I have begun to give Siphon and his land before thee: begin to possess, that thou mayest inherit his land. Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz. And the LORD our God delivered him before us; and we smote him, and his sons, and all his people. And we took all his cities at that time, and utterly destroyed the men, and the women, and the little ones , of every city, we left none to remain. From Aroer, which is by the brink of the river of Arnon, and from the city that is by the river, even unto Gilead, there was not one city too strong for us: the LORD our God delivered all unto us.â€

How is this any different than whatâ€™s in the Quran? And why are Muslims judged by a different prism? Most of the Quran preaches love and harmony and helping those who have not. Take this for example:

â€œAnd feed with food the needy wretch, the orphan and the prisoner, for love of Him (saying): We feed you, for the sake of Allah only. We wish for no reward nor thanks from you.â€ [76:8-9]

Any ancient religious book can be misunderstood and misrepresented. The Ku Klux Klan said the Jesus was the first Klansman. They burned crosses to spread their ill will. How is that any different?

My Sister

Karim Shamsi-Basha My sisters Mimi, right, and Rowaida.

My sister Rowaida lives in New York. We chatted last night when I wanted to make sure her head covering was not causing any problems. In the past when terrorists committed atrocities in the name of Islam, women with head coverings were profiled. She said everything was fine, and prayed for those people affected by the terror.

My sister prayed for them.

She is a teacher and her husband is an architect. All they want is food, water, and a roof over their heads, and for their children to thrive. They have four: a computer scientist, a doctor, a physical therapist, and a pharmacist. They love like anyone else, and they have compassion and mercy and empathy like anyone else.

The covering on her head says two things: Modesty and humility.

A Wish Or Two

I have one wish, well maybe two.

The first is for my children to thrive and go through life without any judgment based on their last name.

The second is for this world to know that Muslims mean no one any harm. The people who mean harm are as far from Islam as the KKK is far from Christianity.

My religion is love.
TITLE: I Say Allahu Akbar. I Am Not A Terrorist.

TEXT:

On Sunday (5 November), 26 people were killed in a shooting at a church in Sutherland Springs, Texas.

The response from the US government, including President Trumpâ€™s claim this is not â€œa gun situationâ€ but a problem relating to â€œmental healthâ€, and Speaker Paul Ryanâ€™s call for â€œprayersâ€ has been met with a backlash on social media, including from a number of celebrity critics.

Siebenmal Sechs Fax-AntrÃ¤ge. Bei keinem der 42 AntrÃ¤ge erfolgte auch nur ein Bescheid. Nicht einmal eine EingangsbestÃ¤tigung. Aber diesmal ist jede einzelne Ãœbersendung dokumentiert und das auch mit Bildvorschau und OK-BestÃ¤tigung.

C'est violent et fort que le clitoris soit invisibilisÃ©. Il Ã©tait totalement absent des manuels scolaires. Tout ce qu'on ne nomme pas n'existe pas, une majoritÃ© de filles de 13 ans ne connaissaient pas son existence. De ce flou total, on en tire une honte de notre sexe. C'est un immense frein Ã  une sexualitÃ© saine, riche en plaisir. On dÃ©couvre aujourd'hui des choses sur son anatomie, alors qu'il paraÃ®t simple de dÃ©crire un organe."

"Les dessins sont retranscrits d'aprÃ¨s une scÃ¨ne rÃ©elle, que l'on m'a racontÃ©e. Ã‡a montre Ã  quel point c'est le tabou absolu. C'est tout un systÃ¨me. MÃªme dans le porno oÃ¹ l'on voit des millions de choses, on ne voit pas un seul filet de sang. Dans les publicitÃ©s, c'est la mÃªme chose. Ã‡a concerne la moitiÃ© de l'humanitÃ©, et on n'en parle pas, on a des langages codÃ©s pour en parler entre filles, on apprend trÃ¨s vite Ã  en avoir honte."

"Les poils, c'est un sujet que j'aborde depuis le tout dÃ©but de mon blog.

En tant que femme, on a beaucoup trop de poils, on devient un monstre. On ne voit pas de femmes non Ã©pilÃ©e, mÃªme dans les pubs pour l'Ã©pilation elles sont dÃ©jÃ  Ã©pilÃ©es...

Quand il y a un article sur le sujet, les rÃ©actions sont trÃ¨s violentes. C'est un sujet trÃ¨s important, une des injonctions les plus marquÃ©es. Ã‡a suscite du dÃ©goÃ»t, de la colÃ¨re, on ne peut pas sortir sans susciter des dÃ©bats, des questionnements.

Dans la planche, cette jeune fille cÃ¨de, parce qu'il faut Ã©normÃ©ment de courage quand on est confrontÃ© Ã  ces discours. On peut avoir un discours distancÃ©, et cÃ©der. Ce serait utopique de la voir rÃ©sister, parce que Ã§a dÃ©clenche tellement de violence... . On n'a pas le temps d'avoir le choix, les poils fÃ©minins dÃ©rangent trop."

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: "Libres!" d'Ovidie et Diglee: lâ€™illustratrice nous commente trois de ses planches sur le corps des femmes

SUMMARY:
Just as the 'yes' campaign appears to have downed tools in the same-sex marriage vote, opponents announced they were tooling up for a longer battle.
At least one study of Twitter opinions points to a narrow defeat for the 'yes' vote, at odds with the 60 percent in favour expected by pollsters.
Exclusive: Conservative MPs want up to 100 amendments to Smith same-sex marriage bill.
From today's @westaustralian pic.twitter.com/6XH28w13Sv â€” Sarah Martin (@msmarto) October 29, 2017A Perth schoolgirl has handed back an award because the MP who sponsored it is opposed to same-sex marriage.
#9News https://t.co/x00jrRKcVZ October 30, 2017Meanwhile a group of conservative MPs is reportedly working on between 60 and 100 amendments to WA Senator Dean Smith's same-sex marriage legislation.
TEXT:
Just as the 'yes' campaign appears to have downed tools in the same-sex marriage vote, opponents announced they were tooling up for a longer battle.

Even if the the Federal Government's controversial $122 million survey on the limits of love returns an overwhelming 'yes' vote in the coming weeks, we'll likely be hearing 'no' for years to come.

At least one study of Twitter opinions points to a narrow defeat for the 'yes' vote, at odds with the 60 percent in favour expected by pollsters.

Former prime minister Tony Abbott, speaking in New York to the listed hate group Alliance Defending Freedom, said he believed the result of the postal survey could still "swing Â­either way" and claimed a 40 percent vote would be a "moral victory" for traditional marriage.

Win or lose we are emboldened & we are not going to go away. https://t.co/5tA8K0ATvi â€” Lyle Shelton (@LyleShelton) November 1, 2017

"Win, lose, or draw, though, starting from scratch two months ago, the campaign for marriage in my country has mobilised thousands of new activists; and created a network that could be deployed to defend Western civilisation more broadly and the Judeo-Christian ethic against all that's been undermining it," he is reported to have said.

Exclusive: Conservative MPs want up to 100 amendments to Smith same-sex marriage bill. From today's @westaustralian pic.twitter.com/6XH28w13Sv â€” Sarah Martin (@msmarto) October 29, 2017

A Perth schoolgirl has handed back an award because the MP who sponsored it is opposed to same-sex marriage. #9News https://t.co/x00jrRKcVZ October 30, 2017

Meanwhile a group of conservative MPs is reportedly working on between 60 and 100 amendments to WA Senator Dean Smith's same-sex marriage legislation.

Conservative Tasmanian Senator Eric Abetz has said Smith's bill was "not acceptable as a starting point".

"It (the Bill) is seriously inadequate, as parents, freedom of speech and religious freedom, along with conscientious objection, all need full protection," Senator Abetz said. Fellow conservatives Andrew Hastie and Ian Goodenough are also reportedly mounting opposition.

"I don't want to legislate in haste": Bernardi hints at conservative plan to delay SSM if "yes" wins https://t.co/4HT0upDq4S â€” Lane Sainty (@lanesainty) October 26, 2017

Those on the 'yes' side may have downed their tools, but they'll pick them up again in the weeks and months ahead should political machinations swallow a parliamentary vote on same-sex marriage.

After November 15 the attention of this entire country will turn to Parliament, wrote Australian Marriage Equality co-chair Alex Greenwich and historian Shirleene Robinson for the HuffPost Australia on Friday.

"Having put their hearts and souls into this cause, Australians will not tolerate any more attempts to delay a positive reform that will bring our country together," they wrote.

"Just as loving same-sex couples want to honour their commitment to each other, the Australian government must honour its commitment to act on the results of this survey by Christmas."
TITLE: A Same-Sex Marriage 'Yes' Vote Might Be A Lock, But 'No' Will Yell Louder

TEXT:
WASHINGTON â€• You may have seen this photo of President Donald Trumpâ€™s motorcade winding down a wooded road last week as a woman on a bicycle pedaled by â€• giving the middle finger to Trump.

BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI via Getty Images

The picture, snapped by a White House photographer traveling with the president as he left his golf course in Sterling, Va., went viral almost immediately. News outlets picked up the story when it appeared in a White House pool report. Late-night talk show hosts told jokes about the encounter and people on social media began hailing the unidentified woman as a â€œshe-ro,â€ using the hashtag #Her2020.

The womanâ€™s name is Juli Briskman. Her employer, government contractor Akima LLC, wasnâ€™t so happy about the photo. They fired her over it.

In a Saturday interview with HuffPost, Briskman, a 50-year-old mother of two, said she was stunned that someone had taken a picture of her giving Trump the middle finger.

As the photo circulated online, Briskman decided to tell Akimaâ€™s HR department what was happening when she went to work on Monday. By Tuesday, her bosses called her into a meeting and said she had violated the companyâ€™s social media policy by using the photo as her profile picture on Twitter and Facebook.

â€œThey said, â€˜Weâ€™re separating from you,â€˜â€ said Briskman. â€œBasically, you cannot have â€˜lewdâ€™ or â€˜obsceneâ€™ things in your social media. So they were calling flipping him off â€˜obscene.â€™â€

Briskman, who worked in marketing and communications at Akima for just over six months, said she emphasized to the executives that she wasnâ€™t on the job when the incident happened and that her social media pages donâ€™t mention her employer. They told her that because Akima was a government contractor, the photo could hurt their business, she said.

Virginia is an employment-at-will state, meaning employers can fire people anytime and for any reason. But Briskman said whatâ€™s been particularly infuriating is that a male colleague kept his job after recently posting lewd comments on his Facebook page that featured Akima LLC as his cover photo. She said this colleague was reprimanded for calling someone â€œa fucking Libtard assholeâ€ on Facebook, but was allowed to delete the post and keep his job.

â€œHow is that any less â€˜obsceneâ€™ than me flipping off the president?â€ she asked. â€œHow is that fair?â€

Akima did not respond to requests for comment via email and phone.

Juli Briskman Someone posted this graphic on Juli Briskman's Facebook page after she flipped off the president's motorcade. Briskman was amused.

Asked what she was thinking when she saw Trumpâ€™s motorcade roll up next to her, Briskman said it was a gut reaction to flip him off.

â€œHe was passing by and my blood just started to boil,â€ she said. â€œIâ€™m thinking, DACA recipients are getting kicked out. He pulled ads for open enrollment in Obamacare. Only one-third of Puerto Rico has power. Iâ€™m thinking, heâ€™s at the damn golf course again.â€

â€œI flipped off the motorcade a number of times,â€ she added.

Briskman, a Democrat, said she plans to look for a new job with an advocacy group that she believes in, like Planned Parenthood or PETA.

Despite getting fired, she said she has no regrets about the attention her public show of displeasure with Trump received. In fact, she said sheâ€™s happy to be an image of protest that resonates with many Americans.

â€œIn some ways, Iâ€™m doing better than ever,â€ she said. â€œIâ€™m angry about where our country is right now. I am appalled. This was an opportunity for me to say something.â€
TITLE: Woman Fired For Flipping Off Donald Trump's Motorcade

In der Chenery Street in San Francisco steht ein Haus, das auf den ersten Blick wie ein gewÃ¶hnliches Reihenhaus aussieht. Doch dieser Eindruck tÃ¤uscht - hinter der Fassade des Hauses versteckt sich mehr. Das Haupthaus erstreckt sich auf drei GebÃ¤udeeinheiten, die an die StraÃŸe angrenzen.

Wenn man es betritt, kÃ¶nnte man meinen, in einer Villa aus einem James Bond-Film zu sein.

Das Haupthaus sieht nÃ¤mlich aus wie ein eindrucksvoller Palast â€“ mit Glasdach und einem Swimmingpool im Speisesaal. Im HauptgebÃ¤ude sind Buntglasfenster der ehemaligen Kirche Little Sisters of the Poor verbaut.

Das Haus wurde im Jahr 1987 erbaut

Das Glasdach der Villa lÃ¤sst sich zudem zur Seite fahren, damit die Sonnenstrahlen auch ungefiltert in das Innere des Hauses fallen kÃ¶nnen. Im HauptgebÃ¤ude befinden sich fÃ¼nf Schlafzimmer und genauso viele BÃ¤der. Im Obergeschoss der Villa hat man einen atemberaubenden Blick auf die Skyline von San Francisco.

Die Villa wurde im Jahr 1987 fÃ¼r den Werbefachmann Robert Pritikin gebaut. Derzeit steht das Anwesen zum Verkauf. Wer es haben mÃ¶chte, muss aber tief in die Tasche greifen: Das Anwesen kostet elf Millionen Dollar, also umgerechnet knapp zehn Millionen Euro.

SUMMARY:
WASHINGTON â€• Attorneys for former Trump campaign manager Paul Manafort told a federal judge on Saturday that he's not "akin to a 68-year-old 'Jason Bourne' character" despite his possession of three passports.
U.S. District Judge Amy Berman Jackson said at Manafort's second court hearing on Thursday that she was concerned that he posed a flight risk.
Manafort is currently on house arrest under electronic monitoring and a $10 million unsecured bond.
Prosecutors with Mueller's office are expected to file their response to the Manafort filing on Sunday.
On Thursday, Jackson seemed open to lifting Manafort's house arrest but skeptical of removing his electronic monitoring.
TEXT:
WASHINGTON â€• Attorneys for former Trump campaign manager Paul Manafort told a federal judge on Saturday that he's not "akin to a 68-year-old 'Jason Bourne' character" despite his possession of three passports.

Manafort is set to appear in court again on Monday morning for a hearing on the conditions of his release following his arrest last week on 12 federal counts, including conspiracy and money laundering. He and his business associate Rick Gates have pleaded not guilty to the charges brought forward by special counsel Robert Mueller, who is investigating Russian interference in the 2016 election.

U.S. District Judge Amy Berman Jackson said at Manafort's second court hearing on Thursday that she was concerned that he posed a flight risk. In a court filing on Saturday, Manafort's lawyers assured the judge that the reason he had three passports was "mundane": He has a primary passport, a second passport to submit with visa applications to certain foreign countries, and a third that he applied for after he lost his primary passport, which he later found.

Manafort's "frequent flyer status," lawyer Kevin Downing wrote, "should not be over-emphasised to show a potential risk of flight when a person's job requires extensive travel." He said that Manafort was just a "successful domestic and international political consultant" who "travelled frequently and represented businessmen, political parties, and commercial interests around the world," activities that were "completely" legal.

"It would be odd, indeed, if he did not frequently travel, both domestically and abroad, given his clientele and the nature of his business," Downing wrote.

He also noted that Manafort has been married for almost 40 years and has two daughters and two grandchildren in the U.S. He said that his client's primary assets are also in the United States.

One of the charges that Manafort is facing relates to his alleged failure to register under the Foreign Agents Registration Act, which requires lobbyists to disclose when they're working on behalf of a foreign principal. Downing, not incorrectly, said that particular charge was "rarely pursued (or successfully prosecuted) in a criminal case."

Manafort is currently on house arrest under electronic monitoring and a $10 million unsecured bond. He's seeking less onerous conditions of release. To guarantee his future court appearances, his attorney said Manafort would be willing to pledge a $3 million Trump Tower apartment in New York City, another $3.5 million home in New York, a $1.5 million home in Palm Beach, Florida, and a "combination of life insurance policies held in trust and/or in his or his wife's name" and valued at approximately $4.5 million â€• for a total of more than $12 million.

Although Manafort has not yet reached an agreement with prosecutors over the conditions of his release, his lawyers wrote that he would agree to limit his travel to Florida, Virginia, New York and Washington, D.C. Prosecutors with Mueller's office are expected to file their response to the Manafort filing on Sunday.

On Thursday, Jackson seemed open to lifting Manafort's house arrest but skeptical of removing his electronic monitoring.
TITLE: Paul Manafort Offers Up Trump Tower Apartment In Bid To Get Off House Arrest

TEXT:
In der aktuellen Folge der Kuppel-Sendung "Schwiegertochter gesucht" greift RTL zu einer geschmacklosen Methode, um eine Kandidatin zu verabschieden

Im Video oben: Martin reicht der Frau, von der er sich trennen will, ein Mikrofon mit einer unsensiblen Tonaufnahme

Und Kandidat Kevin schenkt Teilnehmerin Nadine statt einer Rose einen Hundeknochen

Die Macher der RTL-Kuppelsendung "Schwiegertochter gesucht" laufen in der diesjÃ¤hrigen Staffel wieder zur HÃ¶chstform der Menschenverachtung auf. Nachdem sie bereits erfolgreich die minderjÃ¤hrige Teilnehmerin Tutti bloÃŸgestellt haben, ist in der aktuellen Folge Kandidatin Petra dran.

Petra hatte sich neben Catrin fÃ¼r das Wolfgang-Petry-Double Martin beworben. Schon in der Busfahrt zum Haus des Hobby-SÃ¤ngers und seiner Mutter wurden die beiden mit Wolfgang-Petry-Musik beschallt. Die Musik begleitete die Kandidaten von da an jeden Tag im Haus des selbsternannten Doubles.

Da ist es natÃ¼rlich nur konsequent, dass die Kandidatinnen auch mit Wolfgang-Petry-Musik verabschiedet werden. Denn RTL hat sich die wohl geschmackloseste MÃ¶glichkeit einfallen lassen, Kandidatin Petra nach Hause zu schicken.

Martin nimmt eine Sprachnachricht der besonderen Art auf

Martin Ã¼berreichte jeder der Kandidatinnen ein Mikrofon mit einer selbst vertonten Aufnahme. Auf dem ersten Mikrofon sang er in wunderbar schiefer Tonlage: "Ich habe Sehnsucht nach dir", auf dem zweiten wiederum: "Ich habe keine Sehnsucht nach dir".

Das zweite Mikrofon Ã¼berreichte er dann in einer Abschieds-Zeremonie der schwer verliebten Kandidatin Petra. Als diese auf den Knopf drÃ¼ckte und Martin frÃ¶hlich sang "Ich habe keine Sehnsucht nach dir" kamen ihr die TrÃ¤nen.

Damit ist es RTL wieder einmal gelungen, eine Kandidatin zum Weinen zu bringen. Denn dass Martin selbst sich diese Idee hat einfallen lassen, ist hÃ¶chst zweifelhaft.

Als Wiedergutmachung hat sich das RTL-Team dafÃ¼r etwas ganz besonders Romantisches fÃ¼r Kandidatin Nadine einfallen lassen. Nadine war gerÃ¼hrt und willigte gleich darauf ein, die Nacht mit Kevin im Zelt zu verbringen.

Wer hÃ¤tte auch widerstehen kÃ¶nnen, bei Kevins gekonntem Flirt-Spruch: "Deine Augen gefallen mir, deine Nase auch, ich wÃ¼rde gerne eine Beziehung mit dir versuchen und spÃ¤ter dann zusammen ziehen."

Das kann man auch gleich beim ersten Date mal so klarstellen. AnschlieÃŸend werden die beiden in einem Zelt schlafen, das so klein ist, dass Kevins FÃ¼ÃŸe hinten rausschauen. Aber es ist bestimmt nicht die Absicht von RTL, sich Ã¼ber die GrÃ¶ÃŸe des Zweimeter-Mannes lustig zu machen. Alles purer Zufall, ganz bestimmt.

NatÃ¼rlich ist das Zelt viel zu klein und seine Beine gucken raus. Mein RTL. #Schwiegertochtergesucht â€” anredo (@anredo) 5. November 2017
