SUMMARY:
NEW BRAUNFELS, Texas â€• The man police blamed for Sundayâ€™s mass shooting appeared to target a small Texas church attended by his mother-in-law.
The suspected gunman most recently lived in New Braunfels, roughly 30 miles northeast of San Antonio, reported the Texas Department of Public Safety.
The Air Force said late Sunday that Kelley was court-martialed in 2012 for assault on his spouse and their child.
That same year he was reportedly sued for divorce in New Mexico, The New York Times reported.
Kelley was charged with cruelty to animals in August 2014 while living in an RV park in Colorado Springs, reported The New York Times.
TEXT:
NEW BRAUNFELS, Texas â€• The man police blamed for Sundayâ€™s mass shooting appeared to target a small Texas church attended by his mother-in-law. Devin Patrick Kelley, the 26-year-old suspected gunman, was involved in a â€œdomestic situationâ€ with his wife and her parents, Freeman Martin, regional director for the Texas Department of Public Safety, said during a news conference Monday. â€œItâ€™s a senseless crime, but we can tell you that there was a domestic situation going on within this family,â€ Martin said. â€œThe suspectâ€™s mother-in-law attended this church. We know that he had made threatening texts.â€ Kelley, wearing black tactical gear and a ballistic vest, stormed First Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs during prayer service on Sunday around 11:30 a.m. and opened fire on churchgoers with what Martin described as a â€œRuger AR assault-type rifle.â€ At least 26 people were killed and 20 others wounded in the attack, according to law enforcement officials. Victims were as young as 18 months, and as old as 77.

The suspected gunman most recently lived in New Braunfels, roughly 30 miles northeast of San Antonio, reported the Texas Department of Public Safety. He previously lived in Colorado Springs, Colorado, according to public records. Kelley is a former member of the U.S. Air Force who served in logistics readiness at Holloman Air Force Base in New Mexico from 2010 until his discharge in 2014, according to USAF spokeswoman Ann Stefanek. The Air Force said late Sunday that Kelley was court-martialed in 2012 for assault on his spouse and their child. He received a bad conduct discharge, a 12-month sentence in a military prison and a reduction in rank for the offense. That same year he was reportedly sued for divorce in New Mexico, The New York Times reported. Kelley was charged with cruelty to animals in August 2014 while living in an RV park in Colorado Springs, reported The New York Times. A former neighbor told the Times that someone called the police to report that Kelley struck his pit bull puppy in the head. The case was later dismissed. Abbott on Monday called Kelley â€œa powder keg waiting to go offâ€ and said state law should have prevented him from buying a gun. â€œI donâ€™t think this church was picked out at random,â€ Abbott (R) said during an appearance on â€œCBS This Morningâ€ on Monday. â€œI think there was purpose and intent that Devin Kelley had in showing up at this location.â€ â€œCurrent law should have prevented him from being able to get a gun,â€ he said.

â€œIt looks like there was connectionâ€¦ the bottom line is this was not a random act of shooting.â€ -- Texas @GovAbbott pic.twitter.com/G4aOqVMJVw â€” CBS This Morning (@CBSThisMorning) November 6, 2017
TITLE: Mass Shooting Suspect Devin Patrick Kelley Had 'Connection' To Texas Church

SUMMARY:
Creators the Duffer Brothers have already confirmed that itâ€™s coming, so here are all the questions that will need answering... Will we see Elevenâ€™s sister again?
Episode seven, â€˜The Lost Sisterâ€™, didnâ€™t quite fit in with the rest of the series.
Given how divise the episode has been, we wouldnâ€™t be too shocked if the Duffer Brothers just pretended this whole thing hadnâ€™t happened.
But as Elevenâ€™s sister, Kali, remains somewhere out there with her group of bandits and misfits, it has cleared a path for potential future storylines.
The Duffer Brothers have confirmed that thereâ€™ll be another time skip for the next series though, so itâ€™s unlikely that weâ€™ll get to see the immediate aftermath of the romantic encounters.
TEXT:
We know, we know, â€˜Stranger Things 2â€™ is only a week old but the world spins quickly and before you know it, weâ€™ll be midway through 2018, with more all-new episodes of the Netflix show about to drop. In the past week, weâ€™ve watched (and rewatched) all of the latest installments which means thereâ€™s only one thing left to do. Yup, itâ€™s time to start thinking about what might happen in the third series.

Creators the Duffer Brothers have already confirmed that itâ€™s coming, so here are all the questions that will need answering... Will we see Elevenâ€™s sister again? Episode seven, â€˜The Lost Sisterâ€™, didnâ€™t quite fit in with the rest of the series. While the writers needed to take Eleven out of Hawkins so that she could return and, ultimately, save everyone in the end, this episode-long shift of focus felt a little clunky. Given how divise the episode has been, we wouldnâ€™t be too shocked if the Duffer Brothers just pretended this whole thing hadnâ€™t happened. But as Elevenâ€™s sister, Kali, remains somewhere out there with her group of bandits and misfits, it has cleared a path for potential future storylines.

Netflix

And what about the other children used by the lab? Eleven is (obviouslyâ€¦) number 11 and Kali was branded â€˜008â€™, so - assuming the scientists worked in numerical order - there are potentially at least nine other children that they experimented on. Are they still alive? And if so, will Eleven use her powers to find them, as she did her â€˜sisterâ€™? Could Elevenâ€™s mother ever be saved? It was heartbreaking to watch Millie Bobby-Brownâ€™s character discover the truth about what happened to her mum, finding her suffering from mental and physical health issues after receiving electro-shock treatment from the lab, in order to make her forget about her daughter. She remains at her home, which begs the question of whether thereâ€™s any way she could be saved? Surely Eleven wouldnâ€™t be able to resist visiting her againâ€¦ #JusticeForBob?

Yeah, he made a lot Dad jokes, called his car â€œthe Bobmobileâ€ and listened to too much Kenny Rogers, but in the end, we really grew to love Sean Astinâ€™s character. If heâ€™s good enough for Joyce Byers, heâ€™s good enough for us - and letâ€™s not forget that Bob played a pretty pivotal role in figuring out where Chief Hopper was when he got lost in the Upside Down, before then coming to the rescue again when the demodogs took over the lab. Quite frankly, to call him â€˜the new Barbâ€™ would probably be an undersell, but just as fans of Nancyâ€™s best pal demanded justice for her after season one, weâ€™re hoping for some sort of event to commemorate for Bobâ€™s untimely demise. At least name the Radio Shack after him. What about the two romance storylines? Lucas Sinclair and Mike Wheeler both had their first kisses, with newbie Max Hargrove and Eleven respectively, during the finaleâ€™s Snow Ball dance scene so this will obviously need addressing in future episodes. The Duffer Brothers have confirmed that thereâ€™ll be another time skip for the next series though, so itâ€™s unlikely that weâ€™ll get to see the immediate aftermath of the romantic encounters. Whatâ€™s next for Hopper and Eleven?

Not all of the new relationships in â€˜Stranger Things 2â€™ were romances and the pairing of Hopper and Eleven brought us so much joy, but it was tinged with sadness given that Hopperâ€™s daughter, Sarah, died years ago. Seeing him dote on Eleven and attempt to teach her about the world was heart-breakingly beautiful and when they patched up their differences to close the gate to the Upside Down, we were literally cheering on the sofa. For season three, weâ€™d love to see their bond get even stronger so please guys, no arguing this time. We seriously canâ€™t take it. And Steve and Dustin?

Netflix
TITLE: â€˜Stranger Things 3â€™: 7 Questions That Should Be Answered In The Next Series

TEXT:
La coalizione di centrosinistra per le politiche va in frantumi giÃ  sugli exit poll per le regionali in Sicilia. Ieri sera, ben prima delle prime proiezioni con i dati reali dello spoglio iniziato stamattina, a Pietro Grasso sono cadute le braccia quando si Ã¨ visto catapultato dal Pd sul banco degli imputati per la sconfitta in Sicilia. "Patetica accusa", replica oggi il presidente del Senato, confermando la scelta di stare ormai fuori dal partito. "Su queste premesse non c'Ã¨ dialogo col Nazareno", dice all'Huffpost Alfredo D'Attorre di Mdp, partito che domani riunisce la direzione nazionale a Roma, con Bersani, D'Alema e tutto il gruppo dirigente.

Pd e Mdp restano separati, a contendersi terzo e quarto posto in classifica dopo centrodestra e M5s, se si vuole proiettare il dato siciliano sul nazionale: un'ombra che oggi oscura le analisi di entrambi i partiti.

"Imputare a Grasso il risultato che si va profilando per il Pd, peraltro in linea con tutte le ultime competizioni amministrative e referendarie, Ã¨ una patetica scusa, utile solo ad impedire altre e piÃ¹ approfondite riflessioni, di carattere politico e non personalistico, in merito al bilancio della fase attuale e alle prospettive di quelle future", si legge in una nota del portavoce del presidente del Senato.

Grasso ricorda ancora quelle settimane tra maggio e giugno quando dal Nazareno si lasciava filtrare â€“ a mezzo di retroscena di stampa â€“ l'idea di Renzi di candidarlo a governatore della Sicilia. Erano i tempi in cui il Pd provÃ² ad approvare il 'Tedeschellum', i tempi in cui il segretario accarezzava l'idea di un voto anticipato a settembre, cosa che avrebbe agevolato le dimissioni anzitempo della seconda carica dello Stato. GiÃ  allora Grasso non gradÃ¬. Oggi gradisce ancora meno. "Sullo stile e l'eleganza dei commenti di alcuni importanti esponenti del Partito Democratico in merito al coraggio del presidente Grasso non resta che confermare ancor di piÃ¹ le motivazioni per le quali il presidente si Ã¨ dimesso dal gruppo del Pd: merito, metodi e contenuti dell'attuale classe dirigente del partito sono molto lontani da quelli dimostrati dal presidente in tutta la sua opera a servizio dello Stato e delle Istituzioni", recita ancora la nota.

Stracci. Le regionali in Sicilia seppelliscono - per ora â€“ ogni ipotesi di dialogo tra il Pd di Renzi e quanto c'Ã¨ alla sua sinistra. Il nuovo caso che si Ã¨ aperto su Grasso - leader di riferimento nazionale per Mdp anche se ufficialmente non ha ancora deciso - Ã¨ solo la punta dell'iceberg di una nuova ondata di tensione e scambi di accuse tra sconfitti. PerchÃ© se il candidato del Pd Fabrizio Micari perde la sfida e si perde per strada anche tanti voti Dem - andati al M5s di Giancarlo Cancelleri e anche al vincente Nello Musumeci del centrodestra - pure la performance del candidato di Mdp Claudio Fava non brilla. Non si vede l'effetto novitÃ  della nascita di una forza politica nuova, lanciata dagli ex Dem anti-renziani.

Insomma: due sconfitte non fanno una coalizione, nemmeno nelle premesse.

"Con Fava siamo riusciti a tenere aperta un'alternativa", ci dice Alfredo D'Attorre di Mdp. "Abbiamo provato a chiedere dei segnali sul Rosatellum, abbiamo detto che cosÃ¬ si aiutava la destra. Il Rosatellum Ã¨ stato approvato e ora, dopo le regionali in Sicilia, con una destra cosÃ¬ in rimonta, Ã¨ tutto piÃ¹ difficile. E' chiaro che non puÃ² esserci dialogo se il Pd continua a rivendicare Jobs Act e Buona scuola. Renzi dovrebbe prendere atto del fatto che quella linea politica ha portato a perdere voti, dovrebbe ascoltare e mettere in atto una nuova prioritÃ  programmatica", continua. "Insomma dovrebbe fare ora, dopo il 5 novembre, quello che non ha fatto dopo il 4 dicembre dell'anno scorso", la sconfitta al referendum costituzionale.

Domani mattina Mdp riunisce la direzione nazionale a Roma. Ci saranno Bersani, D'Alema, Speranza e tutti i dirigenti. Analisi della sconfitta e del nuovo fronte di attacco al Pd di Matteo Renzi.
TITLE: Dopo la Sicilia, centrosinistra agli stracci. Grasso a Renzi: "Patetico imputare me la sconfitta". Mdp: "Nessun dialogo se non cambia programma"

SUMMARY:
For those living in countries with poor population nutrition like India, this saying has more ironic significance than we can imagine.
Hence, a significant section of India's population has poor nutrition and resultantly poor immunity to the TB bacteria.
In the case of TB, poor nutrition also affects recovery from TB and increases drug toxicity, relapse and death once TB develops.
First and foremost, hunger and poor nutrition should be morally unacceptable in largely poor countries like India.
If the state cannot feed its people, it loses all moral right to exercise authority.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

We are what we eat or so the famous saying goes. For those living in countries with poor population nutrition like India, this saying has more ironic significance than we can imagine. In India, it is estimated that half of Indian women age 15-49 (48 percent) and 43 percent of Indian men age 15-49 are undernourished. Arguably, a third of women of reproductive age in India is undernourished. In children under 5, statistics reveal that stunting is seen in 48 per cent while 43 per cent are underweight and wasting is common in close to 20 per cent. Hence, India is what it eats. It seems either hungry or without sufficiently nutritious food.

While governments ignore or dismiss these statistics, what they often do not realise is that poor nutrition is a leading cause of vulnerability to diseases. Nutrition has a critical role in both determining immunity and the ability to recover from diseases. Take the case of Tuberculosis of TB- one of India's top killers.

TB is easily diagnosed and treated, yet it kills lakhs of Indians each year. Several studies globally, and in India, illustrate that social, behavioural, economic and environmental factors like undernutrition, indoor air pollution, smoking and alcohol addiction act as facilitating factors to the spread of TB.

Nutrition has a critical role in both determining immunity and the ability to recover from diseases

Of these, undernutrition is the single-most important predisposing factor for TB in India. Hence, a significant section of India's population has poor nutrition and resultantly poor immunity to the TB bacteria. Not surprisingly, like undernutrition, TB exists in India at an epic scale, most often affecting those among the age group of 15-55 â€” an individual's most productive age.

With undernutrition we essentially create large masses with increased vulnerability to TB and other diseases. This, along with poor infection control and limited awareness, creates disease epidemics such as TB in India. Nutrition also affects recovery from disease. In the case of TB, poor nutrition also affects recovery from TB and increases drug toxicity, relapse and death once TB develops. As a result patients with poor nutritional levels are likely to show poorer performance on TB treatment because of poor muscle strength. There is always a higher risk of TB relapse among such patients as well. Appropriate nutritional intake is critical to ensure treatment completion as well as a faster road to recovery.

NEW DELHI, INDIA MAY 29: The picture featuring TB Patients in Patel Chest Hospital on May 29, 2013 in New Delhi, India. (Photo by Ramesh Pathania/Mint via Getty Images)

When considering India's significant TB crisis, it is clear that new technologies, quick and early diagnosis and less toxic treatments are critical to address India's TB epidemic. With a vast number of people affected, this is needed urgently. An accompanying though more fundamental question, what about addressing hunger and nutrition? How can we comprehensively address TB in the long-term without addressing the nutritional status of the population and ensuring immunity? Until we do so, are we not setting a near-impossible task for ourselves with a large and vulnerable population? Unless we address the root cause, will faster diagnosis and improved treatment alone end TB in India?

India needs food security for increased immunity for all diseases including TB. Why? The answers are simple. First and foremost, hunger and poor nutrition should be morally unacceptable in largely poor countries like India. If the state cannot feed its people, it loses all moral right to exercise authority. Without food, words like vikas are meaningless. Also, continued malnutrition and hunger increase vulnerability, thereby increasing disease prevalence, and consequently human suffering, burdening the health system and society at large. This has staggering human, economic and social consequences that perpetuate inequityâ€”something that should be unacceptable as well. From a purely economic view, it causes increased suffering, loss of wages, unemployment, debt and financial desperation â€” undesirables in India's fantastic march towards vikas.

If the state cannot feed its people, it loses all moral right to exercise authority

It's time India thought of significant investment in nutrition as the foundational basis of a population's well-being, social justice, economic growth and as a preventive strategy for all diseases. Some solutions that India must consider are universal food security. This, of course, is fraught with challenges both in relation to implementation and in funding. However, these challenges cannot be used as the basis of reneging on this essential and beneficial strategy.

Too often there are too many ineffective schemes.We need to re-examine, link and innovate programmes run by various ministries, including health and women & child development among others. This is possible if we mainstream nutrition and food security for all beneficiary groups and not just those affected by diseases. For those affected by diseases, we need to provide long-term specialised nutritional support and supervision through programmes that ensure sufficient nutrition.

It's time to go back to basics and recognise that nutrition is the fundamental building block not just for disease prevention but the nation itself. Until we do so our claims to eliminate TB or any other disease will remain hollow. And our march towards vikas will be like a never-ending one to a mythical heaven.

Also on HuffPost
TITLE: If A State Cannot Feed Its People, It Loses All Moral Right To Exercise Authority

Die Eltern, die wissen, dass ich morgens aufstehe, weil ich ihre Kinder liebe, und nur das Beste fÃ¼r die mir anvertrauten kleinen Menschen will.
Die Eltern, die "Danke" sagen.
Die Eltern, die mir nicht sofort bÃ¶se Absicht unterstellen, wenn tatsÃ¤chlich mal ein Fehler passiert.
Die Eltern, die zu vernÃ¼nftigen GesprÃ¤chen bereit sind, wenn es ein Problem gibt.
* Der Name der Autorin wurde geÃ¤ndert, um ihren Job nicht zu gefÃ¤hrden und sie vor Drohungen und Beleidigung zu schÃ¼tzen.
TEXT:
Als Mutter ist man versucht, in den sozialen Netzwerken sogenannten Mami-Gruppen beizutreten um sich ausheulen zu kÃ¶nnen, wenn das Kleine mal wieder bockt.

Ist man aber von Beruf Erzieherin, rate ich dringend davon ab.

So findet man nÃ¤mlich dort Posts, in denen eine Mutter von ihrem erschÃ¼tterten Vertrauen zu der Erzieherin ihres Sohnes berichtet, weil diese ihn im KiGa beim Essen fÃ¼r 2 Minuten vor die TÃ¼r gesetzt hat, da er sich dort angefangen hatte zu prÃ¼geln.

Das Kind wÃ¤re jetzt emotional total am Boden... Musste das Zimmer verlassen, bis die Erzieherin nach kam, um die Situation mit dem Kind in Ruhe zu klÃ¤ren. Sie fÃ¼hle sich Ã¼berhaupt nicht mehr wohl jetzt dort.

Muss man hier schon etwas schmunzeln, so liest man am besten nicht weiter, was andere MÃ¼tter darunter schreiben:

"Das ist verletzte Aufsichtspflicht! DafÃ¼r kannst du sie kÃ¼ndigen lassen!"

"Melde das dem TrÃ¤ger."

"Erkundige dich beim Rechtsanwalt."

"Vielleicht kann man den KiGa deshalb schlieÃŸen lassen, frag mal bei Jugendamt nach."

Ungelogen.

Alltag im Kindergarten

Ich habe mir also ein Herz gefasst und versucht zu erklÃ¤ren, wie eine Essenssituation im KiGa ablÃ¤uft:

20 Kinder sitzen um einen Tisch und warten darauf, dass du jedem von Ihnen das Essen austeilst. Nebenbei rufen die ersten schon wieder nach was zu trinken, weil ihr Glas schon ausgetrunken ist. Ein kleineres Kind braucht Hilfe dabei, sein Fleisch zu schneiden.

Ein weiteres jammert darÃ¼ber, dass ihm das Essen nicht schmeckt. Der Nebenmann schmeiÃŸt das Glas um, die PfÃ¼tze muss aufgewischt werden. Wieder leere TrinkglÃ¤ser. Zwei Kinder streiten, weil einer eine Nudel vom Teller des anderen geklaut hat und die zwei daneben bewerfen sich giggelnd mit ihrem Essen.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Wir Erzieher stehen jeden Tag kurz vor dem Burnout

So... Ist es da nicht vielleicht gar nicht soooooo unverstÃ¤ndlich, dass das Kind kurz drauÃŸen warten soll, bis alle versorgt sind, damit die Erzieherin dann in Ruhe mit ihm sprechen kann um die Situation zu klÃ¤ren? Vor allem, wenn die GruppentÃ¼re ein Glasfenster hat, um sehen zu kÃ¶nnen, was drauÃŸen vor sich geht?

Ich habe fÃ¼r diese Darstellung viele "Likes" bekommen, hauptsÃ¤chlich von anderen Erzieherinnen. Von den anderen wurde meine Sicht der Dinge ignoriert. Ganz klar, sonst kann man sich ja nicht weiter aufregen.

Keine Ahnung von den Aufgaben der Erzieher

Nun kÃ¶nnte man meinen, dieses PhÃ¤nomen tritt nur im Internet auf. Aber nein.

ZurÃ¼ck in der Arbeitswelt, kann ich nur noch KopfschÃ¼tteln. Und es wird mit jedem Jahr nur schlimmer... KiGa-Bashing, das neue Hobby vieler Eltern. Eine ganz neue Art des Mobbing ist geboren.

Als Erzieher ist es heutzutage kaum mehr mÃ¶glich, sich auf die BedÃ¼rfnisse der Kinder zu konzentrieren, da einige Eltern ihre eigenen BedÃ¼rfnisse beim Personal an erster Stelle sehen.

Es ist nicht mehr mÃ¶glich, Ã¼berhaupt irgendetwas richtig zu machen, deshalb verbringt man gefÃ¼hlte Stunden damit, sich morgens oder mittags vor Eltern im Flur zu rechtfertigen, warum dieses oder jenes so passiert ist.

So kommt zum Beispiel eine Mutter mit der Beschwerde, man habe ihr am Vortag nicht gesagt, dass ihr Kind im Flur beim Anziehen Streit angefangen habe. Sie mÃ¶chte so etwas aber bitte dringend immer sofort mitgeteilt bekommen, denn schlieÃŸlich mÃ¶chte sie dann mit ihrem Kind darÃ¼ber reden kÃ¶nnen, dass man so etwas nicht tut.

Ok... das ist jetzt zum Beispiel eine der Aufgaben, die ein Erzieher eigentlich hat: Hilfe bei der KonfliktlÃ¶sung. Vielleicht habe das aber auch bloÃŸ ich falsch verstanden.

Jedenfalls wird bei dieser Beschwerde und gleichzeitigen Bitte anscheinend Ã¼bersehen, dass wir nicht nur ein Kind betreuen. Und bei einer Gruppe von 20 Kindern wÃ¼rde es ziemlich viel Zeit in Anspruch nehmen, jeder Mutter beim Abholen einen Bericht darÃ¼ber zu erstatten, wann ihr Kind sich gestritten hat. Denn sind wir mal ehrlich: Kinder streiten stÃ¤ndig!

Auch kommt es manchmal vor, dass ein Kind dabei ausholt, und dem andern Kind "eine scheppert". NatÃ¼rlich greifen wir Erzieher dann ein (selten schaffen wir das, bevor es "klatsch" gemacht hat, wir sind Menschen, keine Fantasyfiguren mit Lichtgeschwindigkeit), erklÃ¤ren, dass man dem andern nicht weh tun darf und zeigen alternative HandlungsmÃ¶glichkeiten auf.

Wir Ã¼berprÃ¼fen, ob sich der andere weh getan hat, reichen KÃ¼hlbeutel und KÃ¼gelchen.

Beim Abholen werden Eltern von "TÃ¤ter" und "Opfer" informiert, damit sie Bescheid wissen, falls Ihre Kinder daheim davon erzÃ¤hlen. Passt, oder? Nein, passt nicht.

Drohungen und Beleidigungen gegen das Personal

Greift ein Kind noch zwei mal Ã¶fter darauf zurÃ¼ck, sich kÃ¶rperlich zu wehren oder zu Ã¤uÃŸern, gibt es schon nach kÃ¼rzester Zeit die lautstarke Forderung von Eltern, dieses Kind dem Jugendamt zu melden.

Es wird von einer Gefahrenlage im Kindergarten gesprochen. Ja, es wird sogar der Kindergarten gewechselt. Weil das ja sonst nirgends vorkommt oder toleriert wird! Nur hier ist das so.

Dass es sich hierbei um Kinder handelt, die zwei Minuten nach ihrem Streit wieder miteinander spielen und keiner dabei verletzt wurde, vergessen die Eltern hierbei leider komplett.

NatÃ¼rlich gibt es auch Kinder, die tatsÃ¤chlich BedÃ¼rfnisse haben, die ihr derzeitiger Kindergarten nicht erfÃ¼llen kann. Je nachdem worum es dabei geht, und vor allem, wenn so viel "kÃ¶rperliches Verhalten" im Spiel ist, kann man den Eltern dann also hÃ¶flich ans Herz legen, dass heilpÃ¤dagogisch geschultes Personal ihrem Kind besser dabei helfen kann, seine Konflikte zu bewÃ¤ltigen.

Dabei lÃ¤sst man dann ganz bewusst weg, dass ihr Kind nicht aufgrund von Hochbegabung "unterfordert" ist, wie von den Eltern geschildert, sondern das Problem wo anders liegt.

Wenn's so einfach denn wÃ¤re... Nein.

"Was fÃ¼r ein unfÃ¤higes Personal kommt jetzt nicht mit meinem Kind zurecht? Dieser Kindergarten ist das Allerletzte! Andere mÃ¼ssen vor euch gewarnt werden!"

Wenn man dann als privater Kindergarten auch noch das Recht hat, den Betreuungsvertrag zu kÃ¼ndigen, weil man mit den Eltern zusammen im GesprÃ¤ch nicht weiter kommt und sich angemessene Hilfe fÃ¼r das Kind wÃ¼nscht (und andere Eltern berechtigterweise schon mit dem Jugendamt drohen) erreicht der Frust dieser Eltern ganz neue Dimensionen.

Drohungen, den Kindergarten bei der Familienministerin zu melden. Beim Landesjugendamt Ã¼ber das unfÃ¤hige Personal informieren wollen.

Ja, solche Drohungen gehÃ¶ren mittlerweile zum Alltag eines Erziehers.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: "Die Eltern werden dir die HÃ¶lle heiÃŸ machen" - das habe ich in 40 Jahren als Erzieherin gelernt

Erzieher sollen sich aber ganz selbstverstÃ¤ndlich beiÃŸen lassen, wenn man versucht, das Kind zu beruhigen. Immerhin sind wir ja selber schuld, unfÃ¤hig wie wir sind.

Organisierte Elternbanden

Man kÃ¶nnte jetzt sagen: Ok, vielleicht ist das ein Problem der privaten Einrichtungen. Aber nein! Die Kollegin aus dem Regelkindergarten erzÃ¤hlt, dass sie einen Papa im Garten neulich fragte, warum er mit seinem Handy Fotos der dort zum Spielen vorhandenen FahrrÃ¤der macht.

Sie wurde dann darÃ¼ber aufgeklÃ¤rt, dass sein Kind sich an einem Fahrrad in den Finger geschnitten hat. Drei Tage spÃ¤ter kam ein Brief vom Rechtsanwalt der gegen den Kindergarten klagt, weil bei einem Fahrrad am Lenker der Gummigriff fehlte und sich das Kind dort verletzt habe.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Liebe Eltern: HÃ¶rt auf, eure Kinder zu verweichlichten Menschen zu erziehen

Oder aber organisierte Elternbanden, die sich beim BÃ¼rgermeister beschweren, weil der Kindergarten sich pÃ¤dagogisch begrÃ¼ndet weigert, das Vorschulprogramm nach den Vorstellungen einzelner Eltern fÃ¼r alle zu erweitern.

Wenn ich also morgens aufstehe und mich fÃ¼r die Arbeit fertig mache denke ich mir nicht: Oh ja, heute backe ich Kuchen mit den Kids! Sondern: Mal sehen, was mich heute wieder davon abhÃ¤lt, Kuchen mit den Kids zu backen.

Die traurige Wahrheit ist: Die ganze Zeit, die wir damit verbringen, uns mit solchen Dingen herumzuschlagen, verbringen wir eben nicht bei den Kindern.

Aber liebe Eltern, was glaubt ihr denn, wem ihr hier eure Kinder anvertraut? Sind wir auf das viele Geld aus, dass man als Erzieher verdient? Bekommt man einen Erzieherabschluss durchs Beantworten von Multiple-Choice-Fragen im Internet?

Wir wollen fÃ¼r eure Kinder da sein

Erzieher sind Menschen, die es sich zum Beruf gemacht haben, fÃ¼r eure Kinder da zu sein. Wir wollen sie umsorgen, ihnen etwas beibringen und ihnen einen geborgenen Raum fÃ¼r ihre Entwicklung schaffen.

Die ganze NegativitÃ¤t, die tagtÃ¤glich Ã¼ber das "Nichts-recht-machen-kÃ¶nnen" in unseren Gruppenalltag eindringt, verstÃ¶rt Kinder und Personal.

Wir opfern unsere Freizeit, um Spielzeug fÃ¼r Eure Kinder zu basteln, um Feste vorzubereiten und um uns BeschÃ¤ftigungen mit Lerneffekt auszudenken.

Die geopferte Freizeit wird aber mit jedem mal Drama etwas weniger. Denn ganz ehrlich: Wer hat schon Lust, sich unbezahlt Gedanken Ã¼ber die Arbeit zu machen, wenn man als Dank dafÃ¼r schlecht gemacht wird und sich beleidigen lassen muss?

Liebe besagte Eltern, seht ihr nicht, dass ihr hÃ¶chstpersÃ¶nlich dafÃ¼r sorgt, dass die QualitÃ¤t schlechter und die Geduld weniger wird, die wir gerne fÃ¼r eure Kinder Ã¼brig hÃ¤tten?

Jedem, der sich in diesen Beispielen mit Ã¤hnlichem Verhalten wiedererkennt, mÃ¶chte ich sagen:

Ihr seid die Tyrannen, die ihren Anteil am Personalnotstand der KindergÃ¤rten haben.

Wer mÃ¶chte schon freiwillig unter solchen UmstÃ¤nden arbeiten?!

Es gibt sie noch, die "normalen" Eltern

AbschlieÃŸend mÃ¶chte ich aber dringend betonen: Es gibt sie natÃ¼rlich noch, die "normalen" Eltern!

Die Eltern, die wissen, dass ich morgens nicht aufstehe, um mir zu Ã¼berlegen, wie ich sie Ã¤rgern kann oder ihr Kind negativ in seiner Entwicklung beeinflussen kann.

Die Eltern, die wissen, dass ich morgens aufstehe, weil ich ihre Kinder liebe, und nur das Beste fÃ¼r die mir anvertrauten kleinen Menschen will.

Die Eltern, die "Danke" sagen.

Die Eltern, die mir nicht sofort bÃ¶se Absicht unterstellen, wenn tatsÃ¤chlich mal ein Fehler passiert.

Die Eltern, die zu vernÃ¼nftigen GesprÃ¤chen bereit sind, wenn es ein Problem gibt.

Bitte, liebe "normale" Eltern! Ihr mÃ¼sst endlich lauter sein als die Dauer-Motzer und Drama-Verursacher! Damit wir weiterhin wissen, warum wir morgens aufstehen und nicht irgendwann resignieren.

TITLE: "Eine neue Form des Mobbing" - wie Erzieherinnen und KindergÃ¤rten von Eltern im Internet fertig gemacht werden

"Japan ist ein geschÃ¤tzter Partner und wichtiger Alliierter, und wir danken ihnen fÃ¼r ihre Freundschaft", sagte Trump.
Trump will sich mit Putin treffenDer gefÃ¤hrliche Konflikt um das Atomwaffenprogramm in Nordkorea wird eines der zentralen Themen der zweiwÃ¶chigen Asien-Reise von Trump sein.
DarÃ¼ber wird er am Montag auch mit dem japanischen MinisterprÃ¤sidenten Shinzo Abe in Tokio sprechen.

TEXT:
US-PrÃ¤sident Trump hat laut einem japanischen Medienbericht sein UnverstÃ¤ndnis darÃ¼ber geÃ¤uÃŸert, dass Japan nordkoreanische Raketen nicht abgefangen hat

Dabei ist ein Abfangversuch Ã¤uÃŸerst riskant

Trump will sich bei seiner Asienreise auÃŸerdem mit dem russischen PrÃ¤sidenten Putin treffen

US-PrÃ¤sident Donald Trump ist zu Beginn seiner fast zweiwÃ¶chigen Asienreise in Japan eingetroffen. Einige hundert amerikanische und japanische Soldaten bereiteten ihm am Sonntagvormittag (Ortszeit) auf dem US-MilitÃ¤rstÃ¼tzpunkt Yokota einen begeisterten Empfang.

"Japan ist ein geschÃ¤tzter Partner und wichtiger Alliierter, und wir danken ihnen fÃ¼r ihre Freundschaft", sagte Trump.

Nach Informationen der Nachrichtenagentur Kyodo soll er jedoch im Vorfeld UnverstÃ¤ndnis fÃ¼r Tokios Reaktion auf zwei kÃ¼rzliche Raketentests durch Nordkorea geÃ¤uÃŸert haben. Er kÃ¶nne nicht verstehen, warum ein Land von Samurai-Kriegern die Raketen nicht abschoss, soll Trump gesagt haben.

Dabei wÃ¤re sowohl ein erfolgreicher als auch ein gescheiterter Abschuss Ã¤uÃŸerst gefÃ¤hrlich.

"Japan will der Eskalation wohl aus dem Weg gehen"

Der Abfang einer Rakete - gerade einer Interkontinentalrakete - gilt als groÃŸe Herausforderung. Die USA testeten im Mai 2017 ihr Raketenabwehrsystem "Ground-based Midcourse Defense" (GMD) - mit einer Erfolgsquote von 53 Prozent, wie das Pentagon mitteilte.

Das japanische Verteidigungsministerium habe sich nach der Berechnung der Flugroute der nordkoreanischen Raketen dazu entschlossen, keinen Abgangversuch zu starten, berichtet die japanische Tageszeitung "Japan Times". Ein Fehlversuch wÃ¼rde Japan blamieren und Nordkorea womÃ¶glich zu weiteren Test ermuntern, so die Ãœberlegung.

Ein erfolgreicher Abschuss kÃ¶nnte auÃŸerdem die Situation eskalieren lassen. "Einen Abschuss hÃ¤tte Nordkorea umgehend als Provokation und Anlass fÃ¼r zeitnahe weitere Raketentests gesehen, dieser Eskalation wollte Japan wohl aus dem Weg gehen", zitierte der "Spiegel" einen ranghohen Bundeswehroffizier nach einem kÃ¼rzlichen Raketentest der Nordkoreaner.

Trump will sich mit Putin treffen

Der gefÃ¤hrliche Konflikt um das Atomwaffenprogramm in Nordkorea wird eines der zentralen Themen der zweiwÃ¶chigen Asien-Reise von Trump sein. DarÃ¼ber wird er am Montag auch mit dem japanischen MinisterprÃ¤sidenten Shinzo Abe in Tokio sprechen.

Seine erste Asienreise wird Trump von Japan aus weiter nach Seoul fÃ¼hren, nach China, Vietnam und auf die Philippinen. Trump erwartet wÃ¤hrend seiner Reise auch ein Treffen mit seinem russischen Kollegen Wladimir Putin.

"Ich denke, es wird erwartet, dass wir uns mit Putin treffen", sagte Trump am Sonntag auf der Reise nach Tokio an Bord der Air Force One mitreisenden Reportern. "Wir wollen, dass Putin mit Nordkorea hilft, und wir werden eine Reihe verschiedener AnfÃ¼hrer treffen", sagte Trump. Die beiden PrÃ¤sidenten haben sich zuletzt am Rande des G20-Gipfels in Hamburg getroffen.

Ein Treffen Trumps mit Putin am Rande eines Gipfels der Asiatisch-Pazifischen Wirtschaftsgemeinschaft (Apec) in Da Nang in Vietnam war von russischer Seite bereits ins Spiel gebracht, vom WeiÃŸen Haus aber bislang nicht bestÃ¤tigt worden.

Trump selbst hatte vor der Reise dem Sender Fox News gesagt: "Das ist eine sehr wichtige Reise. Wir kÃ¶nnen uns mit Putin treffen." Eine endgÃ¼ltige BestÃ¤tigung eines Treffens steht gleichwohl noch aus.

Mit Material der dpa.



(jg)
TITLE: Medienbericht: Trump kritisiert vor Asien-Reise Japans Umgang mit Nordkorea

TEXT:
SÃ‰RIES TV - Dans le prÃ©cÃ©dent Ã©pisode intitulÃ© "Les DamnÃ©s", Rick se retrouvait en bien mauvaise posture face Ã  Morales, une ancienne connaissance de la saison 1. A contrario, Jesus, Tara et Morgan parvenaient Ã  prendre le dessus sur les Sauveurs pendant qu'Ezekiel ralliait ses troupes, sous l'Å“il de Carol.

Cet Ã©pisode 3, "Monsters", diffusÃ© ce lundi 6 novembre en France sur OCS, Ã©tait donc attendu par les fans. Qu'est-il advenu de Rick? Quelle dÃ©cision a Ã©tÃ© prise concernant les Sauveurs capturÃ©s (ndlr: On a pu voir des divergences entre Tara, Morgan et Jesus au moment de dÃ©cider de leur sort. Les premiers souhaitant les exÃ©cuter, le dernier voulant leur laisser la vie sauve)? Quid de la bataille au QG de Negan?

ATTENTION SPOILERS





Vous Ãªtes bien sÃ»r de vouloir continuer?

Alors c'est parti !

MenacÃ© Ã  bout portant par Morales, Rick nous avait quittÃ©s dans une situation bien dÃ©licate. Une affaire finalement expÃ©diÃ©e sans trop de problÃ¨mes par Daryl (Qui imaginait sÃ©rieusement la mort de Rick?), auteur d'un magnifique tir Ã  l'arbalÃ¨te.

"C'Ã©tait..." s'exprime alors Rick, sous le choc avant que son coÃ©quipier ne l'interrompe, "Je sais. J'en ai rien Ã  battre." Du Daryl dans le texte somme toute.

Dans le mÃªme temps, Jesus, Tara et Morgan s'occupent de ramener les Sauveurs survivants Ã  Maggie qui doit dÃ©cider de leur sort. Un retour marquÃ© par une "attaque" de zombies sur le chemin. L'affrontement (comme Ã  son habitude lorsqu'il s'agit des affreuses bÃªtes) se transforme en une vÃ©ritable boucherie. C'est le moment choisi par un petit groupe de Sauveurs pour tenter de prendre la fuite dans la forÃªt.

Morgan les prend en chasse et dÃ©cide d'en Ã©liminer un avant de se faire rattraper par Jesus. S'ensuit alors un vif Ã©change entre les deux hommes, chacun restant sur ses positions. Morgan se justifie au motif "qu'ils ont tentÃ© de s'enfuir et qu'ils recommenceront encore et encore". La discussion se finit en bagarre... entre les deux hommes.

Oh HELL no #TWD pic.twitter.com/4DjuosBxyv â€” The Walking Dead AMC (@WalkingDead_AMC) 6 novembre 2017

Certains fans pointaient du doigt (parfois Ã  juste titre) le manque d'action de la sÃ©rie. Cet Ã©pisode 3 permet de revenir aux fondamentaux de "The Walking Dead" avec des scÃ¨nes d'affrontements, en rÃ©sulte un ensemble dynamique et vivant. Rick et Daryl, attaquÃ©s par les Sauveurs, parviennent Ã  s'en sortir assez remarquablement (on pourra au passage Ã©voquer l'aide notable d'Aaron) pendant que Jesus et Morgan continuent de se battre.

We're walking out of here #TWD pic.twitter.com/q9dENlhYhL â€” The Walking Dead AMC (@WalkingDead_AMC) 6 novembre 2017

Une altercation de trop pour l'homme au bÃ¢ton qui dÃ©cide de plier bagage: "Je ne peux pas participer Ã  Ã§a", explique-t-il. Jesus et Tara rejoignent finalement la Colline. GrÃ©gory s'y trouve (vous vous souvenez, le traÃ®tre qui avait rejoint Negan et qui avait pris la voiture du PÃ¨e Gabriel prÃ©cÃ©demment) grÃ¢ce Ã  l'indulgence de Maggie. L'ancienne compagne de Glenn est d'ailleurs confrontÃ©e au dilemme posÃ© par Jesus: abattre les Sauveurs capturÃ©s ou les laisser vivre...

Un choix rencontrÃ© Ã©galement par Daryl et Rick. AprÃ¨s avoir retrouvÃ© Gracie (Nous en avons parlÃ© dans la semaine), les deux hommes sont pris pour cible par un Sauveur qui accepte finalement de leur dÃ©voiler la cache des armes d'assaut tant recherchÃ©e par Rick. N'ayant aucune pitiÃ©, Daryl se charge ensuite de l'Ã©liminer d'une balle logÃ©e en pleine tÃªte (Du grand Daryl dans cet Ã©pisode).

Tout semble aller pour le mieux dans ce 3e Ã©pisode. Mais Ã©videmment, "The Walking Dead" ne se passe jamais comme prÃ©vu. La derniÃ¨re scÃ¨ne voit le groupe d'Ezekiel se faire canarder (on n'y voit pas grand chose mais on se doute que des Sauveurs sont dans le coup) par des mitrailleuses, vraisemblablement celles initialement recherchÃ©es par Daryl et Rick.

Les balles pleuvent et plusieurs membres sont tuÃ©s pour ce qui est sans doute la premiÃ¨re (grosse) erreur du roi Ezekiel. Quant Ã  Negan, aucune nouvelle de lui...

SUMMARY:
Australia's troubled national broadband network is facing a new threat -- cockatoos taking bites out of cables across the country.
Cockatoos developed the enthusiasm for biting into the cables, the NBN said, as a way to keep their beaks in top working condition.
Gisela Kaplan, a professor in animal behaviour at the University of New England, told The Guardian it was unusual for cockatoos to target cables.
"Cockatoos usually go for wood, or strip the bark off trees, they don't usually go for cables.
But it might be the colour or the position of the cables that's attracted them."
TEXT:
Australia's troubled national broadband network is facing a new threat -- cockatoos taking bites out of cables across the country.

Known for enjoying tucking into fruit and cereal crops, the pesky parrots have gnawed through $80,000 worth of cables on the $3 billion internet infrastructure project, NBN Co said on its blog this week.

The organisation said the native birds had been found feasting on spare power and fibre cables strung from its around 2,000 Fixed-Wireless towers dotted around regional Australia.

Cockatoos developed the enthusiasm for biting into the cables, the NBN said, as a way to keep their beaks in top working condition.

"They are constantly sharpening their beaks and as a result will attack and tear apart anything they come across. Unfortunately, they've developed a liking to our cables," NBN's Chedryian Bresland said.

"You wouldn't think it was possible, but these birds are unstoppable when in a swarm. I guess that's Australia for you."

Gisela Kaplan, a professor in animal behaviour at the University of New England, told The Guardian it was unusual for cockatoos to target cables.

"It would have to be an acquired taste, because it's not their usual style," she said.

"Cockatoos usually go for wood, or strip the bark off trees, they don't usually go for cables. But it might be the colour or the position of the cables that's attracted them."

The cockatoo-wrought damage comes amid ongoing roll-out problems for the NBN, including poor service and sluggish speeds.

Customer complaints have jumped more than 150 per cent this year, according to government figures released in October.
TITLE: Cockatoos Blamed For Chewing Through NBN Cables Across Australia

TEXT:
All'indomani della sparatoria che ha portato alla morte di almeno 26 persone in una chiesa di Sutherland Springs, in Texas, Greg Abbott, governatore dello stato, ha espresso parole di cordoglio e di vicinanza ai famigliari delle vittime. Alla stregua del presidente Trump, non ha fatto alcun riferimento alla facilitÃ  con cui in Texas - e in Usa in generale - si puÃ² entrare in possesso di un'arma.

Alla luce della strage - attribuita all'ex militare americano Devin Patrick Kelley, nella quale sono morti almeno 12 bambini, fa riflettere un tweet scritto nel 2015 dal governatore texano. Abbott, repubblicano e, come riporta HuffPost France, convinto sostenitore dell'importanza della diffusione delle armi nel suo territorio, si vergognava perchÃ©, a suo dire, in Texas si compravano poche armi nuove.

I'm EMBARRASSED: Texas #2 in nation for new gun purchases, behind CALIFORNIA. Let's pick up the pace Texans. @NRA https://t.co/Ry2GInbS1g â€” Greg Abbott (@GregAbbott_TX) 28 ottobre 2015

"Sono imbarazzato - scriveva Abbott - il Texas Ã¨ al secondo posto per l'acquisto di nuove armi, dietro la California. Forza texani, acceleriamo il ritmo". Abbott era stupito del fatto che nella democratica California, dove la legislazione in materia di armi Ã¨ piÃ¹ restrittiva che in altri stati si acquistassero piÃ¹ armi da fuoco che nel suo Texas, stato a maggioranza repubblicana, con una legislazione sulle armi estremamente permissiva.

In terra texana, infatti, per acquistare e possedere una pistola basta avere 18 anni. Se invece si desidera un fucile, bisogna aspettare i 21 anni. L'unico limite Ã¨ avere la fedina penale pulita. Se l'aspirante acquirente di un'arma ha commesso un reato, avrÃ  comunque la possibilitÃ  di entrarne in possesso: passati cinque anni dalla condanna, infatti, riacquisterÃ  il diritto a possedere in casa una pistola.
TITLE: Quando il governatore del Texas si vergognava perchÃ© i suoi concittadini compravano poche armi

TEXT:
Donald Trumps Ã¤ltester Sohn soll einer russischen AnwÃ¤ltin eine Aufhebung der Sanktionen gegen Russland in Aussicht gestellt haben

Das behauptete die AnwÃ¤ltin in einem Interview in Moskau

Es kÃ¶nnte ein Paukenschlag sein. Im Fall der Verstrickung des Wahlkampfteams von US-PrÃ¤sident Donald Trump mit dem Kreml hat die russische AnwÃ¤ltin Natalia Veselnitskaya brisante Informationen verÃ¶ffentlicht.

So soll Donald Jr. ihr versprochen haben, ein 2012 von der Obama-Regierung eingefÃ¼hrtes Gesetz zurÃ¼ckzunehmen, das russischen Staatsbeamten Sanktionen auferlegt. Das berichtet die Nachrichtenagentur Bloomberg mit Verweis auf ein Interview der AnwÃ¤ltin in Moskau.

"Falls wir an die Macht kommen..."

Das Versprechen soll Trump Jr. bei einem viel zitierten Treffen am 9. Juni 2016 in New York geÃ¤uÃŸert haben. Ebenfalls anwesend: Trumps Schwiegersohn Jared Kushner und der damalige Kampagnen-Manager Paul Manafort. Letzterer hatte sich Ende Oktober nach monatelangen Ermittlungen gegen ihn dem FBI gestellt. Manafort wird unter anderem VerschwÃ¶rung gegen die USA vorgeworfen.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: SchlÃ¼sselfigur in der Russland-AffÃ¤re: Wer ist George Papadopoulos - und wie gefÃ¤hrlich ist er fÃ¼r Trump?

Nach eigener Aussage reiste Veselnitskaya unter anderem mit dem Ziel nach New York, sich fÃ¼r das Ende der amerikanischen Sanktionen gegen Russland einzusetzen. Darum ging es auch beim Treffen im Trump Tower am 9. Juni. "Falls wir an die Macht kommen, werden wir uns anschauen, was wir diesbezÃ¼glich unternehmen kÃ¶nnen", soll Trump Jr. der AnwÃ¤ltin geantwortet haben.

Veselnitskaya ging nach eigener Aussage allerdings nicht im offiziellen Auftrag der russischen Regierung in die GesprÃ¤che.

Treffen war Zeitverschwendung

Im Gegenzug wollte der PrÃ¤sidentensohn Unterlagen, die belegen, dass Hillary Clintons Wahlkampagne veruntreute Gelder bezogen hat. Geldgeber der Demokraten sollen bei den Steuern getrickst haben und diese Gelder an Hillary Clinton gespendet haben. Eine Information, die der britische Publizist Rob Goldstone Trump Jr. zuvor in einer E-Mail Ã¼bermittelt hatte â€“ im Namen Veselnitskayas.

Mit diesen konnte die AnwÃ¤ltin aber nicht dienen. Trump Jr. bezeichnete das Treffen darum im Nachhinein als Zeitverschwendung.

Veselnitskaya sicherte zu, die brisanten Informationen Ã¼ber das GesprÃ¤ch auch unter Eid an den US-Sonderermittler Robert Mueller weiterzugeben, wenn es verlangt werde. Damit wÃ¼rde der Druck auf Donald Trump massiv wachsen â€“ eine illegitime Absprache mit der russischen Regierung im Wahlkampf wÃ¤re wohl nur noch schwer mehr von der Hand zu weisen.

Trump wird vorgeworfen, Wahlkampfhilfe aus Russland erhalten zu haben. Fraglich ist, ob dahinter eine direkte Absprache mit dem Kreml steckt.

SUMMARY:
Joseph ate a sandwich that did not consist of cheese spread.
Way back in the day before we faced these issues, Joseph ate everything.
But only eating sandwiches that consists of cheese spread causes problems because nobody stocks those in a cafe.
You can't just order a cheese spread sandwich off the menu and that's always been my end goal, ordering something regular off the menu.
Parenting failure meant there was no cheese spread and I'd bought a beef paste a few weeks ago with the intention of trying it out.
TEXT:
Remember, remember, the third of November.

That's how it goes doesn't it? Well that's how it will be in our house forever more. You see in our house, the third was a momentous occasion not to be sniffed at. Joseph ate a sandwich that did not consist of cheese spread.

Any autism parent will know about the food battles. The monotony of the same food EVERY. SINGLE. DAY. Yep, you all know it. The problems it causes when eating out because there is nothing your child will eat and you cannot face the confrontation and succumb to the sensory needs of your child rather than attempting to introduce something new.

Way back in the day before we faced these issues, Joseph ate everything. I can't recall the day it all stopped but over time I have tried a few subtle introductions of old foods. Each time, he has rejected it and in the main, I have accepted it. But a few years ago, I decided that Joseph would eat sandwiches again. I was fed up with taking cracker-bread out and about and decided that there was no reason why he couldn't enjoy bread again. The first time, he wretched a little and I wasn't sure whether I had completely misjudged this. After his initial look of horror, he ate it and we progressed from there. Wholemeal bread, bread-cakes and now he LOVES bread. But only eating sandwiches that consists of cheese spread causes problems because nobody stocks those in a cafe. You can't just order a cheese spread sandwich off the menu and that's always been my end goal, ordering something regular off the menu.

Although I usually plan these changes to the letter, today was completely off the cuff. Parenting failure meant there was no cheese spread and I'd bought a beef paste a few weeks ago with the intention of trying it out.

Yep, you read that right. Beef spread. Tried cheese before and that was a no go. Tried ham and that causes more obscene facial expressions than I can truly describe. I considered that maybe it was the texture of these foods and a spread may be the way to go.

I carefully spread the paste over the bread, taking care not to expose anything to the outer bread (Fuck My Life), in order to fool Joseph completely. Fool Joseph completely? Who the fuck am I trying to kid here? That child can smell a difference a hundred paces off. Despite casually placing the sandwich on the table and walking away, not wanting to make a big deal of it, he knew. Yes he knew. He peeled back the bread and said "what's this?" I explained and told me quite assertively "I'm gonna have cheese spread, not THIS." I calmly told him there was none left and if he ate it, I would be very pleased and he could eat three small bags of Haribo. Yep, I'm that parent who offers the bribes.

We had a couple of tears but nothing we both couldn't handle. I even offered a couple of crisps (boy am I generous) for each mouthful he had, increasing the number I was offering in exchange for each bite. When he got to six he gave me THE EYE and told me he wasn't going to ten. No flies on that child.

After half an hour, he had finished half of the sandwich. I told him if he ate it all, we could go shopping for a treat (bringing the big guns out now) but he told me he didn't want one, so I called it a day.

That to me was a win and I'll take it.

To all those parents who are horrified I would even attempt such a thing with a child with autism who has sensory difficulties, I know my child and I have not scarred him. If the bread scenario is anything to go by, it'll be his new favourite food.

To those who question whether breaking a routine is possible. It is.

To those who wonder why I would subject my child to beef paste sandwiches. I have no idea and in all honesty, I was on the verge of wretching myself. The whiff of dog meat was the only thing I can compare it to and for that Joseph, I truly apologise.

Next time, we'll try a salmon paste.

Tina is mum to a 9 year old boy Joseph who has autism. She recently won the Bloody Awesome Parents (BAPS) SEND Newcomer blogger award. She likes to give an honest (often sweary) account of their lives dealing with autism. You can follow her here on facebook or her blog here.
TITLE: The Day My Child Ate A DIFFERENT Sandwich

SUMMARY:
The experience of turning 50 is confronting.
Not that 50 year olds are ever awake in the small hours of the night that often any more, of course.
If I had the flamboyance and disregard for embarrassment to make this work I'd be tempted, but the truth is turning 50 has given me neither.
Hopes provide direction and motivation, but life is about how you experience whatever the journey has to offer.
Through this very special group of peers and childhood friends we have become the witnesses of our lives.
TEXT:
"In an attempt to reconcile with Father Time, I went on a trip with old school friends to share the misery with a bottle of wine."

The experience of turning 50 is confronting.

The fact of the milestone explains some disconcerting physical changes. Muscles are stiffer in the morning. Golf balls fall short like someone's weighted them. Eyes read blurry.

In truth, these are minor issues and the machine that is the body still manages to deal with the trials of life without too much trouble.

But being defined by a number beginning with a five strikes a blow at one's identity. Claiming youth is now the kind of stretch best left to those of a more limber age. Genuinely young people in their twenties or thirties might talk to you with pity or reverence, but either way the invitation to kick on at the night club later is unlikely to be forthcoming.

Here was the perfect crew to explore what this sad course of events means and how on earth were we going to deal with it.

Never have I struggled so hopelessly to alter a fact of life so stubbornly resolute. I'm 50. I can hide it or not talk about it, but I can't change it.

Of course not all who have recently shared this fate deal with the issue in the same way. There are the Zen-like creatures who claim to have embraced their age, but they are liars.

There are those who enter a deep state of denial. This certainly has its attractions, but no matter how profound my self-deception I still find the truth haunts me in the small hours of the night. Not that 50 year olds are ever awake in the small hours of the night that often any more, of course.

And, there are some who play up in a glorious expression of their mid-life crisis. If I had the flamboyance and disregard for embarrassment to make this work I'd be tempted, but the truth is turning 50 has given me neither.

So, in an attempt to reconcile with Father Time, I went on a trip with old school friends to share the misery with a bottle of wine.

There is something extraordinary about friendships made in teenage years. The shared moment of life's discovery carries with it an honesty about who we really are. Affectations haven't had time to mature. The hopes, fears and dreams of the future lay us bare. Those who knew us then carry throughout life the familiarity of youth. Conversation flows.

Here was the perfect crew to explore what this sad course of events means and how on earth were we going to deal with it.

The content of our discussion did betray the difference in our lives compared with 20-years before. Then it was about life's start as the first kids arrived in the group. The energy and sacrifices required to experience the joy of parenthood were being explored. Our children totally changed our identity, but the exhausting effort meant there was no time to wallow in questions about who we were.

Now, we were talking about life's end. In the past year, three of us had lost our dads. We compared heart-wrenching choices about ageing parents and nursing homes. This clearly predictable side of life had snuck up and mugged us, completely unaware. The idea that our lives would always contain their essential cast of characters had been shattered. Only a few will witness the whole journey.

Even more sadly, thoughts turned to friends and colleagues, people far younger than I, who had already passed. They had been unfairly shortchanged in the experience of life. Through this lens experiencing a 50th birthday really was joyous, and our angst of identity a little indulgent.

Better then to move on to bucket lists and hopes for the future: the familiar discussion we'd been having since childhood.

The dreams ranged from the professional (being on a board of a listed company); to the philanthropic (setting up an NGO for textile workers in the developing world); to developing a new skill (learning to ride dressage); and to the deeply personal -- having the simple courage to change.

We had failed to predict so much of life, good and bad, that we agreed there would be no mid-term review of these dreams. Hopes provide direction and motivation, but life is about how you experience whatever the journey has to offer. Holding to account would be missing the point.

By the night's close there was joy and exuberance in a conversation which took us back to our earliest days. There was also comfort knowing that with these people it was a conversation we could have in the future, again and again.

Age has changed us to be sure. The unsettling nature of 50 still persists. But pain and experience is best handled with company. Through this very special group of peers and childhood friends we have become the witnesses of our lives.

That might just be the comfort I was looking for.
TITLE: Anyone Who Says They Enjoyed Turning 50 Is A Liar

SUMMARY:
For this family of nine, however, budgeting for travel is a way of life.
Greg and Rachel Denning sold their home in Utah back in 2007.
"We got married and were living the script of 'get a mortgage, get a job, then retire and do cool things.'
We realised we've got to live an epic story and try to make a difference in the world."
Ten years later, Greg and Rachel now have seven kids and have visited 33 countries as a family, living in 13 of them along the way.
TEXT:
For some travellers, saving up for a simple week-long vacation is a challenge. For this family of nine, however, budgeting for travel is a way of life.

Greg and Rachel Denning sold their home in Utah back in 2007. They had four kids at the time and packed them into a car for a road trip to Costa Rica, where they lived for a year.

"We weren't OK with just a humdrum existence," Greg told HuffPost. "We got married and were living the script of 'get a mortgage, get a job, then retire and do cool things.' Then we thought, 'There are other ways to experience life, and we can each have our own unique dream.' We realised we've got to live an epic story and try to make a difference in the world."

Ten years later, Greg and Rachel now have seven kids and have visited 33 countries as a family, living in 13 of them along the way.
TITLE: This Family Of 9 Travels The World On $6,500 A Month

SUMMARY:
La legge elettorale voluta dal Pd e da pochi giorni promulgata dal Presidente della Repubblica Sergio Mattarella penalizzerebbe, e di molto, i democratici.
E il responso Ã¨ senza appello per il Pd: zero collegi uninominali.
Il Rosatellum Ã¨ un sistema elettorale misto: proporzionale per il 64%, maggioritario per il 36%.
Uno studio commissionato dal Pd aveva giÃ  messo in guardia i democratici sul rischio di perdere pesantemente nei collegi di alcune regioni.
Salvo sorprese, il Pd rischia di rimanere a bocca asciutta.
TEXT:
Rosatellum amaro per il Partito Democratico in Sicilia. La legge elettorale voluta dal Pd e da pochi giorni promulgata dal Presidente della Repubblica Sergio Mattarella penalizzerebbe, e di molto, i democratici. Lo dice una proiezione fatta da Youtrend che, naturalmente, ha utilizzato come base di partenza il voto piÃ¹ recente, quello delle elezioni regionali appena concluse. E il responso Ã¨ senza appello per il Pd: zero collegi uninominali.

Il Rosatellum Ã¨ un sistema elettorale misto: proporzionale per il 64%, maggioritario per il 36%. Secondo i dati in via di consolidamento di questa tornata regionale, nei collegi del maggioritario il Pd sarebbe tagliato fuori nell'isola fino ad oggi guidata da Rosario Crocetta. Sembra quindi materializzarsi quel sospetto iniziato a circolare negli ambienti parlamentari dem qualche giorno prima dell'approvazione definitiva della legge elettorale al Senato. Uno studio commissionato dal Pd aveva giÃ  messo in guardia i democratici sul rischio di perdere pesantemente nei collegi di alcune regioni. Al Nord, per esempio, come in Veneto e Lombardia, tra le Regioni piÃ¹ pesanti in termini di seggi. Ma anche nel profondo Sud, come in Calabria e in Sicilia.

Nei collegi uninominali la sfida Ã¨ tra i singoli candidati e ad aggiudicarsi il seggio Ã¨ colui che prende un voto in piÃ¹ del suo avversario. La Sicilia, peraltro, Ã¨ terra ostica per la sinistra da vent'anni a questa parte (il Pd Ã¨ il partito uscente di governo ma la sua vittoria alle elezioni del 2012 fu certamente favorita dalle divisioni del centrodestra - con Musumeci e MiccichÃ© avversari e oggi alleati - e da un M5S piÃ¹ debole di oggi). Basti ricordare che in Sicilia si registrÃ² il famoso 61 a 0 del centrodestra nei collegi uninominali alle elezioni politiche del 2001: allora si votÃ² con il Mattarellum che si basava su dei collegi piÃ¹ piccoli rispetto a quelli che dovranno essere ridefiniti dal Governo per l'applicazione del Rosatellum. Saranno tra i 20 e i 22 e in nessuno di questi il centrosinistra riuscirebbe a vincere il seggio. Mentre punta all'en plein il centrodestra, come ha fatto intendere lo stesso MiccichÃ© ospite al Tg La7: "Credo che qui in Sicilia se riusciamo ad arrivare al 40% noi vinciamo tutti e ventidue i collegi delle prossime elezioni nazionali, se il centrodestra Ã¨ unito in questa Regione non ce n'Ã¨ per nessuno".

Secondo Youtrend, se i dati che arrivano dal voto regionale saranno confermati dal voto nazionale di marzo prossimo, alla coalizione di centrodestra andrebbero tra i 12 e i 14 collegi, e tra i 6 gli 8 al Movimento 5 Stelle. Salvo sorprese, il Pd rischia di rimanere a bocca asciutta.
TITLE: Con questi voti (e con il Rosatellum) alle politiche il Pd non vincerebbe in nessun collegio della Sicilia

SUMMARY:
Representatives from nearly 200 countries gather at the United Nationsâ€™ 23rd climate change conference beginning Monday, an annual effort to tackle global warming and its impacts already inflicting havoc on the planet.
Wolfgang Rattay / Reuters Empty seats of U.S. delegation are seen before the opening session of the COP23 UN Climate Change Conference 2017, hosted by Fiji but held in Bonn.
Wolfgang Rattay / Reuters People march during a demonstration two days before the start of the COP 23 UN Climate Change Conference in Bonn, Germany, Nov. 4, 2017.
In fact, the solar industry employed far more people than the coal industry in 2016, according to numbers from the Department of Energy.
The U.N. has agreed that negotiators will need to have such a framework in place by a 2018 deadline to make sure nations are doing enough to combat climate change.
TEXT:
Representatives from nearly 200 countries gather at the United Nationsâ€™ 23rd climate change conference beginning Monday, an annual effort to tackle global warming and its impacts already inflicting havoc on the planet.

This year, however, the U.N. faces a new challenge: Addressing the phenomenon after U.S. President Donald Trump, leader of the planetâ€™s second-largest greenhouse gas emitter, pledged to do nothing to curb emissions.

The U.N. Framework Convention on Climate Change will deal with that question in Bonn, Germany, from Nov. 6 to Nov. 17 as countries work to firm up their commitments to adapt to a warmer world in line with 2015â€²s landmark Paris Climate Agreement. Scientists say the world should prevent the planet from warming more than 2 degrees Celsius beyond pre-industrial levels to avoid the worst effects of climate change, a benchmark set by the Paris accord. Meeting the target means dramatic reduction in global emissions, and the Paris pact urges signatories to craft voluntary pledges to do that.

However, the agreement is not legally binding, and Trump followed through on a campaign pledge to withdraw America from what he calls the â€œdraconianâ€ pact in June. It is a multi-year process to do so, and the U.S. cannot leave until Nov. 4, 2020 â€• the day after the next presidential election.

The U.S. and Syria are now the only two nations opposed to the climate deal.

Wolfgang Rattay / Reuters Empty seats of U.S. delegation are seen before the opening session of the COP23 UN Climate Change Conference 2017, hosted by Fiji but held in Bonn.

The Trump administration announced last week it would actively promote fossil fuels during a presentation at the climate conference, also known as the Conference of the Parties, or COP. Delegates sent by the White House will host a talk titled â€œThe Role of Cleaner and More Efficient Fossil Fuels and Nuclear Power in Climate Mitigation,â€ which will tout the supposed benefits of coal, natural gas and nuclear power.

A delegation of U.S. negotiators are expected to work in Bonn to help write the rulebook for the Paris agreement, but their presence will be awkward. Itâ€™s unclear if negotiators from other countries will be willing to listen to a White House, which, under Trump, would not abide by any rules that emerge.

The summit will feature some U.S. star power, however. Former New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg and billionaire activist Tom Steyer are funding a pavilion to showcase climate action by U.S. cities and businesses. The federal government usually pays the $200,000 or so cost of the showcase, but declined to do so this year.

â€œThe American people and American industry are pretty much all behind doing what the Paris agreement is designed to do, and that is to cut the amount of greenhouse gases going into the atmosphere so we will slow down and maybe even stop climate change, which has the potential to destroy the world,â€ Bloomberg told The New York Times last month.

Environmental groups and local governments around the U.S. reacted with fury following Trumpâ€™s decision to quit the Paris deal, but pledged to do their part to combat his agenda with or without federal support. Other world leaders have vowed to move forward regardless, and in July, every member of the G20, aside from the U.S., unveiled a detailed policy to abide by the Paris pact in a clear rebuke of the White House.

Wolfgang Rattay / Reuters People march during a demonstration two days before the start of the COP 23 UN Climate Change Conference in Bonn, Germany, Nov. 4, 2017.

Trump, while a presidential candidate, notably called climate change a â€œhoaxâ€ manufactured by the Chinese and has long promised to end the â€œwarâ€ on fossil fuels. He has signed several executive orders rolling back environmental regulations on the energy industry and has promised an American future flush with â€œreally clean coal.â€

But, as HuffPostâ€™s Alexander Kaufman reports, such energy doesnâ€™t exist. Environmental groups have long called such rebranding a bait-and-switch by the coal lobby to try and revive an industry dying not due to regulation, but rather the rapidly falling cost of cleaner energy sources.

In fact, the solar industry employed far more people than the coal industry in 2016, according to numbers from the Department of Energy. Natural gas, a far cleaner fossil fuel product in terms of emissions, and oil production jobs are the two leading employers in the industry.

â€œThere is no such thing as â€˜clean coal,â€™â€ Travis Nichols, a spokesman for Greenpeace, told HuffPost in March. â€œItâ€™s a myth used by the industry to get taxpayer money in order to prop up a dying industry. Itâ€™s worse than pixie dust and hope, itâ€™s coal dust and nope. Coal miners deserve a just transition, not snake oil and empty promises.â€

Countries gathered in Bonn already understand this. Many of the worldâ€™s biggest economies, including China and India, are on track to meet their emissions-reduction targets years earlier than expected, and both have invested heavily in renewable energy.

The talks in Bonn will be relatively low key compared with prior summits, as countries work to refine guidelines and review procedures to ensure signatories are meeting their commitments. The U.N. has agreed that negotiators will need to have such a framework in place by a 2018 deadline to make sure nations are doing enough to combat climate change.
TITLE: The World's Largest Climate Change Summit Starts Today. Here's What's Happening.

SUMMARY:
One of the two puppies allegedly killed by Vishesh Iyengar.
Worse, he boasted about killing the first puppy, posting it on a WhatsApp group, reported The Times of India.
"1 down, 1 more to go, DoggyTales," Vishesh Iyengar reportedly posted in a WhatsApp group of some of his classmates at an engineering college in Vellore.
The second puppy had been recently rescued by another resident in the area and was their pet.
The resident who had rescued the second puppy reportedly claimed that Iyengar did not show any remorse, saying, "It's just a dog, I didn't kill a human."
TEXT:
One of the two puppies allegedly killed by Vishesh Iyengar.

ADVERTISEMENT

A man in Tamil Nadu was so overcome with anger that some puppies apparently peed in his clothes, that he flung them off a terrace, killing them on the spot. Worse, he boasted about killing the first puppy, posting it on a WhatsApp group, reported The Times of India.

"1 down, 1 more to go, DoggyTales," Vishesh Iyengar reportedly posted in a WhatsApp group of some of his classmates at an engineering college in Vellore. "Black dog down," he replied after a group member asked him if the dog was dead.

According to reports, Iyengar killed one black puppy and another light brown puppy soon afterwards. The second puppy had been recently rescued by another resident in the area and was their pet. It had apparently wandered into the apartment complex where Iyengar lives.

A police complaint has been registered at the Katpadi K1 station by animal rights activists. The resident who had rescued the second puppy reportedly claimed that Iyengar did not show any remorse, saying, "It's just a dog, I didn't kill a human."

Also On HuffPost:

TEXT:
Vous n'aurez plus Ã  vous dÃ©placer pour obtenir carte grise et permis

VIE QUOTIDIENNE - Les usagers n'ont dÃ©sormais plus Ã  se dÃ©placer en prÃ©fecture pour obtenir cartes grises et permis de conduire, qu'ils recevront par courrier aprÃ¨s avoir fait les dÃ©marches sur internet, a affirmÃ© le ministÃ¨re de l'IntÃ©rieur.

Les guichets d'accueil des prÃ©fectures pour ces "titres de la vie courante", sources d'interminables files d'attente, sont dÃ©finitivement fermÃ©s Ã  partir de lundi 6 novembre et remplacÃ©s par des procÃ©dures dÃ©matÃ©rialisÃ©es ouvertes "24 heures sur 24, 7 jours sur 7, via le site du ministÃ¨re de l'IntÃ©rieur ou de l'Agence nationale des titres sÃ©curisÃ©s", www.ants.gouv.fr.

Le remplacement par des dÃ©marches numÃ©riques de ces guichets devenus "obsolÃ¨tes" doit "faciliter la vie de l'usager" et permettre une meilleure "lutte contre la fraude", a expliquÃ© le secrÃ©taire gÃ©nÃ©ral du ministÃ¨re, Denis Robin, en saluant "un vÃ©ritable changement de modÃ¨le pour les prÃ©fectures".

Pour rÃ©pondre Ã  tout dysfonctionnement, les prÃ©fectures garderont "une capacitÃ© rÃ©siduelle" pour traiter les cartes grises et permis jusqu'au 30 novembre. Le site www.demarches.interieur.gouv.fr permet d'aiguiller les internautes, et l'ergonomie des nouvelles procÃ©dures sera suivie par un comitÃ© d'usagers, prÃ©cise le ministÃ¨re.

Cette dÃ©matÃ©rialisation des procÃ©dures permettra de recentrer une partie des personnels prÃ©fectoraux sur des missions prioritaires de l'Etat comme la sÃ©curitÃ©, l'accompagnement des collectivitÃ©s, la lutte contre la fraude et la coordination territoriale des politiques publiques, selon Beauvau. Bayerns Finanzminister SÃ¶der hat bei einer Rede in Erlangen erklÃ¤rt, wie er sich die Zukunft der CSU vorstellt

Die Rede glich einer Kampfansage an Parteichef Horst Seehofer

Es mÃ¼ssen gute Tage fÃ¼r Bayerns Finanzminister Markus SÃ¶der sein. Seit Jahren wird er als Nachfolger des CSU-Vorsitzenden Horst Seehofer gehandelt.

Derzeit arbeitet sich der Chef in Berlin an den GrÃ¼nen ab, zuhause begehrt die Jugend auf - und SÃ¶der sieht tÃ¤glich seine Chancen wachsen, Seehofer zu beerben.

Eilig hat es SÃ¶der nicht. Das wurde auf der JU-Landesversammlung in Erlangen am Sonntag deutlich. "Mein Wunsch und meine Hoffnung ist, dass wir gemeinsam eine LÃ¶sung finden, dass wir es zusammen tun", sagte er Ã¼ber die kÃ¼nftige personelle Aufstellung der Partei. Wie Seehofer will er erst die Jamaika-Verhandlungen abwarten.

Eilig muss es SÃ¶der aber auch nicht haben. Denn die Personaldebatte in der CSU wird kommen - und mit seiner Rede brachte sich SÃ¶der gegen Seehofer in Stellung.

Klare Kampfansage

SÃ¶der mahnte, die Herausforderung mÃ¼sse "mit Anstand" bewÃ¤ltigt werden - aber auch "mit Ergebnissen". Ein "Weiter so" dÃ¼rfe es nicht geben - eine klare Kampfansage gegen Seehofer, kommentierte auch die "Bild"-Zeitung diesen Satz.

SÃ¶der machte in seiner Rede deutlich, wie sehr sich die CSU nun Ã¤ndern mÃ¼sse. "Es muss uns gelingen, unsere Basis zu motivieren und die WÃ¤hler ein StÃ¼ck weit wieder zu inspirieren", betonte er und forderte: "Es muss am Ende ein Ruck durch die CSU und durch ganz Bayern gehen."

"SÃ¶der - unsere Nummer 1"

Seehofer steht massiv unter Druck. Am Samstag forderte die bayerische Junge Union (JU) offen seinen RÃ¼cktritt.

In einer neuen Umfrage verliert die CSU weiter an Zuspruch: In einer Erhebung des Instituts Insa im Auftrag der "Bild"-Zeitung vom Montag kommt die CSU nur noch auf 37 Prozent, bei der Bundestagswahl waren es noch etwas mehr als 38 Prozent.

SÃ¶der hatte den Mut der bayerischen JU mit ihrer RÃ¼cktrittsforderung gelobt. Er setzt zwar auf eine gemeinsame LÃ¶sung - die Sympathien der JU gehÃ¶rten ihm an diesem Tag in Erlangen allerdings schon, wie Fotos zeigten. "SÃ¶der - unsere neue Nummer 1" stand auf Plakaten.

Mitglieder der Jungen Union Bayern neben dem bayerischen Finanzminister Markus SÃ¶der

Bis Dezember muss SÃ¶der sich noch gedulden. Dann kÃ¶nnte es tatsÃ¤chlich soweit sein.

TEXT:
Peter Dutton has been called a "terrorist" by the Greens.

Immigration Minister Peter Dutton has shrugged off comments by Greens MP Adam Bandt after he accused the senior Liberal of being a "terrorist" over his handling of the Manus Island detention centre crisis.

Bandt told a rally in Melbourne on Saturday that Dutton was prepared to kill for political gain, likening him to a "terrorist" for "threatening people's lives".

He also said Australia was "being shamed in the eyes of the world" for its treatment of the remaining 600 Manus Island asylum seekers, who are said to be without water, power and food after the shutdown of the PNG facility.

If terrorism is using violence to threaten lives for political purposes, then yes, Peter Dutton is a terrorist. https://t.co/xLBgSlKE1H â€” Adam Bandt ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ (@AdamBandt) November 4, 2017

Dutton brushed off the criticism, saying the federal government stood by its record on preventing asylum seekers dying at sea.

"I think that says more about Mr Bandt and the Greens than it does about me. The Australian Government has stopped deaths at sea. We've got every child out of detention," he said, according to the ABC.

"Mr Bandt, when he was in Government with [former Prime Minister] Julia Gillard, presided over 50,000 people coming on 800 boats and 1,200 people drowned at sea."

More than 1,000 people gathered at Melbourne's State Library on Saturday for the rally before an action at Federation Square backing the men who remain at the centre, despite its official closure this week.

In Sydney, hundreds rallied in the city's CBD against the treatment of the men.

Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull will discuss the issue on Sunday with newly-elected New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, who is in Sydney for a whirlwind visit.

Ardern this week confirmed that the previous NZ government's offer to take 150 refugees from Australia's offshore detention centres still stands amid the ongoing stand-off on Manus.

Labor Senator Doug Cameron said Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull had failed on the long-running issue.

"The Coalition could have easily done the Bali process, walked there with our neighbours about how we deal with this issue, (and) done international agreements to get people off the island," he told the ABC.

The UN has described the situation on Manus as an unfolding humanitarian crisis.
TITLE: Manus Island Crisis: Peter Dutton Hits Back After Greens Label Him A 'Terrorist'
