SUMMARY:
Law enforcement officials also reported that witnesses at the scene claimed Saipov yelled out the phrase â€œAllahu akbarâ€ during the attack.
CNN: We know that Allahu Akbar is a popular phrase among terrorists.
A Phrase With A Profound Spiritual HistoryThe phrase Allahu akbar has a long history of use within Islam.
The phrase Allahu akbar is also used by non-Muslim Arab speakers, since â€œAllahâ€ is the Arabic word for God.
This summer, an Italian mayor threatened that anyone who shouts Allahu akbar in a main square in Venice would be immediately shot.
TEXT:
â€œAllahu akbarâ€ is an Arabic phrase that translates to â€œGod is greater.â€ In the wake of a deadly attack in New York on Tuesday, this inherently spiritual phrase is being used in a different context: to signify a link to political terrorism.

Eight people were killed and 12 others injured after a driver plowed through pedestrians and cyclists in lower Manhattan on Tuesday. The suspect, a 29-year-old Uzbek immigrant identified as Sayfullo Habibullaevic Saipov, rammed into a school bus and exited the truck holding imitation firearms before being shot by police.

On Wednesday, federal prosecutors accused Saipov of plotting out a terror attack inspired by propaganda from the so-called Islamic State. Law enforcement officials also reported that witnesses at the scene claimed Saipov yelled out the phrase â€œAllahu akbarâ€ during the attack.

JEWEL SAMAD via Getty Images Investigators work around the wreckage of a Home Depot pickup truck a day after it was used in a terror attack in New York on November 1, 2017.

This phrase has also reportedly been invoked during other terror attacks this year â€• in Belgium, the United Kingdom, France, and Spain. As a result of the way it surfaces during these acts of violence, Allahu akbar has become something that provokes fear among those who are unfamiliar with or suspicious of Islam.

CNN: We know that Allahu Akbar is a popular phrase among terrorists.



COME ON MUSLIMS SAY THIS EVERYDAY IN PRAYER. â€” Rowaida Abdelaziz (@Rowaida_Abdel) October 31, 2017

To hear a spiritual phrase that Muslims use in their everyday lives twisted in this violent way is incredibly frustrating, said Rabiah Ahmed, director of media and public affairs at the Muslim Public Affairs Council.

â€³[Allahu Akbar] has been used in traditional Muslim prayers for centuries and is used as a peaceful reminder of their religious commitment. They are also the opening words of the Adhan (Islamic call to prayer) and is also often used in approval in the same way Christians say Amen,â€™â€ Ahmed told HuffPost.

â€œIts extremely painful and frustrating [to see it misused], and unfortunately, just another example of how our religion is co-opted by those those who act outside of it.â€

John Moore via Getty Images A makeshift memorial stands on a bike path in lower Manhattan on November 1, 2017 in New York City. Eight people were killed and 12 injured on October 31 when suspect 29-year-old Sayfullo Saipov intentionally drove a truck onto the path.

A Phrase With A Profound Spiritual History

The phrase Allahu akbar has a long history of use within Islam. It expresses a sentiment that is at its heart a theological reflection about humanityâ€™s place in the world: That no matter what trials or victories people face, God is greater than it all.

It appears a few times in the Quran, but only mid-sentence, according to Imam Omar Suleiman, president of the Yaqeen Institute for Islamic Research. The phrase is more explicit in the sunnah, a set of teachings about the way of life modeled by Islamâ€™s founder, the Prophet Muhammad.

Suleiman pointed in particular to a hadith â€• one of the collected reports about the prophet â€• where Muhammad is recorded as saying, â€œAllah is Greater, Mightier than all His creation. He is Mightier than what I fear and dread.â€

â€œWhat it suggests is that God is greater than all our concerns, God is greater than all that is ascribed to him, greater than all the disappointments we have,â€ Suleiman said. â€œGod is greater than our pain, God is greater than our material possessions.â€

Allahu akbar is an affirmation of a belief in a monotheistic God, Suleiman said â€• since it suggests that God has no partners. Belief in absolute monotheism is a core part of orthodox Islamic theology.

The phrase Allahu akbar is also used by non-Muslim Arab speakers, since â€œAllahâ€ is the Arabic word for God. Some Christians from Syria, Lebanon, and other regions in the Levant, say Allahu akbar to express surprise, excitement, puzzlement or dismay â€• in the same way that English speakers may use the phrase â€œOh my God.â€ (Itâ€™s not a religious pronouncement for these Christians, however, and some Arab Christians, such as Egyptâ€™s Copts, do not use it.)

From a theological point of view, the idea that God is greater than human circumstances is not limited to Islam. In English, one verse of the Bible declares, â€œHe who is in you is greater than he who is in the world.â€

A popular Christian worship song by the band MercyMe is based on the verse. Another wildly popular Christian song, by the musician Chris Tomlin, states, â€œOur God is greater, our God is stronger, God you are higher than any other.â€

Nick Jonas has a symbol representing the words â€œGod is greater than the highs and lowsâ€ tattooed on his arm.

A post shared by Nick Jonas (@nickjonas) on Aug 8, 2013 at 5:03pm PDT

Saying Allahu Akbar In Prayer, Joy And Sadness

For Muslims, the phrase Allahu akbar is built into the prayers that are one of the pillars of Islam. It begins the call to prayer, or â€œadhan.â€ Itâ€™s also used as a verbal transition between the different positions Muslims assume during prayer â€• standing up, bowing, kneeling, prostrating on the ground.

â€œThereâ€™s something extremely powerful about saying Allahu akbar and then prostrating yourself, putting your face on the ground in supplication to our creator,â€ Suleiman said. â€œIn Islam, the greatest position of prayer is prostration â€• the more you lower yourself to God, the higher he elevates you.â€

Muslim Girl via Getty Images Muslims repeat Allahu akbar as a transition between different positions used during prayer.

Outside of the context of formal prayer, Allahu akbar is also used by Muslims in moments of celebration, such as when someone passes a hard exam or is accepted into college. It is also said in times of sorrow â€• such as when a dearly loved one passes away.

The phrase is often the first sound Muslims whisper into a babyâ€™s ears at birth and one of the last sounds they hear during a burial, as a body is lowered into the grave.

Suleiman said that often during Islamic fundraisers, every time someone raises their hand to donate the whole audience will say Allahu akbar in celebration of the act of charity.

The phrase is so much a part of daily life that Qasim Rashid, a spokesperson for the Ahmadiyya Muslim community in America, estimates that heâ€™s said it more than 1.6 million times over the course of his life â€• just because of the five daily prayers.

â€œ[Praying] five times a day, since I was about seven years old, it comes out to about 1.6 million times over the last 28 years or so,â€ Rashid told HuffPost. â€œThat doesnâ€™t include when I said Allahu akbar when my kids were born, or when I helped build a hospital, or Michael Jordan made the game winning shot in the NBA finals.â€

â€œItâ€™s part of our celebratory mode, and to believe that it could mean something violent is asinine,â€ he said.

For the record, "Allahu Akbar" has no inherent political/violent connotation meriting instant terror diagnosis.I say it like 20 times a day. â€” rabia chaudry (@rabiasquared) October 31, 2017

The Consequences Of Misusing The Phrase

Despite the prevalence of this religious concept, Hind Makki, an interfaith educator and activist, told HuffPost said she feels that a stigma has become attached to the phrase in American culture â€• particularly when it is said in Arabic.

â€œItâ€™s one of those Arabic phrases that people who arenâ€™t Muslim or arenâ€™t really familiar with Islam treat with dread because they connect it to a crime,â€ she said.

â€œItâ€™s frustrating because we have seen how many mass shootings and mass murders there have been recently and several of the suspects, I would assume have some kind of ideological bent,â€ she said, referring in particular to the Las Vegas shooter Stephen Paddock, whose rampage in October left 58 people dead and hundreds more injured. â€œBut because the person is not from a Muslim background, or didnâ€™t yell Allahu akbar, people are like, â€˜We donâ€™t know why he did it.â€™â€

Some Muslims have become wary of saying the phrase, or speaking in Arabic in general, while in public. The feeling of anxiety is felt heavily on planes, where some have reported being taken off flights for speaking in Arabic.

Rashid said that as a result of how the phrase is treated in America, he tries to use it as much as possible around his children.

â€œI donâ€™t want them to feel intimidated. I feel young Muslims feel intimidated using words like jihad, or Allahu akbar, or even saying â€˜assalamu alaikumâ€™ [a common greeting] in public,â€ he said. â€œItâ€™s an unfortunate side effect of whatâ€™s happening right now.â€

Burhaan Kinu via Getty Images Allahu akbar is said during prayer and also in everyday conversations -- as an expression of celebration.

Another side effect of misusing and misunderstanding Islamic phrases is that it leads to fears of a backlash against the Muslim community. Anti-Muslim hate crimes have increased dramatically since the Sept. 11, 2001 attacks.

Allahu akbar has been weaponized in the past by people whose intent is to harm Muslims. In Quebec City, Canada in January, it was reportedly yelled out by a suspect with far-right, white nationalist views during a deadly attack on a mosque community.

This summer, an Italian mayor threatened that anyone who shouts Allahu akbar in a main square in Venice would be immediately shot.

Ahmed, of MPAC, said she believes every terrorist act done in the name of Islam not only takes away innocent lives but also threatens the security of Americans who are Muslim.

â€œBecause there is so much misinformation and misunderstanding about our faith and community, those who seek revenge for these attacks will usually direct their anger toward the first innocent Muslim they see on the streets, at school, and at public places,â€ she told HuffPost. â€œSince 9/11, this has been our reality. Whenever there is any terror incident done in our name, we mourn not only as Americans, but we mourn the hijacking of our faith and brace ourselves for potential backlash.â€

Thatâ€™s why Ahmed believes education about Islam is crucial. Instead of allowing the Islamic State to define what Allahu akbar means, she said itâ€™s important to seek authentic, legitimate voices and interpretations of the phrase.
TITLE: Here's What You Need To Know About The Phrase 'Allahu Akbar'

TEXT:
Seit nunmehr fast 30 Jahren verzaubert Kate Moss (43, "Kate") als Supermodel auf Laufstegen und in Fotoshootings die Modewelt. Ihr wichtigstes Beauty-Geheimnis ist aber weder teuer noch kompliziert. Im Interview mit der britischen Tageszeitung "The Daily Telegraph" erzÃ¤hlt Moss von ihrem SchÃ¶nheitstrick: dem "Ice Plunge".

Das braucht man dazu

Keine Gurken fÃ¼r Kate Moss' Beauty-Tipp mehr im Haus? Hier kÃ¶nnen Sie frisches Obst und GemÃ¼se ganz einfach online bestellen

FÃ¼r den simplen Hautpflege-Trick, benÃ¶tigt man nur ein Waschbecken, etwas Wasser, EiswÃ¼rfel und eine Salatgurke. Letztere ist im Supermarkt in der Regel fÃ¼r unter einem Euro zu bekommen. "FÃ¼lle ein Waschbecken mit EiswÃ¼rfeln, kaltem Wasser und Gurkenscheiben und tauche dein Gesicht so lange wie mÃ¶glich ein", erklÃ¤rt Moss ihre Methode. Das verringere "sofort Geschwollenheit und straft die Haut".

Schaut man sich Fotos des Supermodels an, das im Januar 44 Jahre alt wird, dann muss man neidlos anerkennen, dass an dem Kate-Moss-Eis-Trick definitiv etwas dran sein muss. Entdeckt wurde die gebÃ¼rtige Britin ursprÃ¼nglich bereits 1988 im Alter von nur 14 Jahren. Sie wollen nicht mehr in die Schule gehen, kÃ¶nnen nachts nicht schlafen, fÃ¼hlen sich traurig und bedrÃ¼ckt: Schon die Kleinsten in unserer Gesellschaft leiden unter psychischem Stress und hohem Erwartungsdruck, warnen Psychologen.

Erziehungsexperten versuchen Antworten darauf zu finden, warum inzwischen schon bei GrundschÃ¼lern Burnout-Syndrome diagnostiziert werden und was eigentlich aus der Idee einer unbeschwerten Kindheit geworden ist.

Kaum jemand im deutschsprachigen Raum hat sich mit dem Thema Kindererziehung wohl so lange und lebensnah beschÃ¤ftigt wie der Schweizer Kinderarzt Remo Largo.

Auch wenn sein erstes Buch â€œBabyjahreâ€ schon fast zwei Jahrzehnte alt ist, gehÃ¶rt es noch immer zur Grundausstattung junger Eltern.

Viele Eltern wollen ihr Kind maximal fÃ¶rdern - auch Ã¼ber sein Potenzial hinaus

Seit mehr als 30 Jahren befasst sich der â€œbekannteste Kinderarzt der Schweizâ€ mit der kindlichen Entwicklung und dem Einfluss, den unsere Gesellschaft darauf hat.

Largo, der selbst Vater von drei TÃ¶chtern und auch lange schon GroÃŸvater ist, beobachtet ein entscheidendes Problem in der modernen Erziehung: Er ist der Ansicht, dass viele Eltern eine falsche Vorstellung davon haben, wie ihr Kind zu einem glÃ¼cklichen, erfolgreichen Menschen heranwÃ¤chst.

â€œEin Kind ist darauf ausgelegt, sein Begabungspotenzial auszuschÃ¶pfenâ€, sagte er der HuffPost. â€œDoch in unserer Gesellschaft ist das fÃ¼r viele unglaublich schwer geworden.â€

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Ein Hirnforscher erklÃ¤rt, was Kinder mehr als alles andere von ihren Eltern brauchen

Schuld sei ein Irrglaube, dem viele Eltern unterliegen. â€œViele Eltern versuchen, ihr Kind Ã¼ber sein Begabungspotenzial hinaus zu fÃ¶rdernâ€, erklÃ¤rt er. â€œDas ist aber nicht mÃ¶glich.â€

Die Folge: â€œSie Ã¼berfordern das Kind und verunsichern es.â€

Eltern mÃ¼ssen die Grenzen ihrer Kinder akzeptieren

Largo zieht einen simplen Vergleich: â€œJedes Kind ist verschieden groÃŸ. Wenn ein Kind zu wenig Nahrung bekommt, wird es kleiner. Wird es Ã¼berfÃ¼ttert, wird es nicht grÃ¶ÃŸer, sondern nur dick. So ist es auch mit den geistigen FÃ¤higkeiten.â€

So wie das kÃ¶rperliche Wachstum eines Kindes also limitiert ist, stÃ¶ÃŸt es auch bei seinen Begabungen und StÃ¤rken an klare Grenzen.

(Das hat Largo Ã¼brigens zu Kindern zu sagen, die nicht gehorchen; der Text geht nach dem Video weiter:)

Ein Kinderarzt erklÃ¤rt: Das ist der oft Ã¼bersehene Grund, warum Kinder ihren Eltern nicht gehorchen





Eltern mÃ¼ssten erkennen und akzeptieren, dass ihr Kind in manchen Feldern besser sei als in anderen und dass es nichts bringe, die nicht so stark ausgeprÃ¤gten FÃ¤higkeiten ohne RÃ¼cksicht auf seine eigentlichen BedÃ¼rfnisse verbessern zu wollen, erklÃ¤rt Largo.

Dass Eltern ihre Kinder Ã¼ber ihr Potenzial hinaus versuchen zu fÃ¶rdern, lÃ¤sst sich laut Largo durch den gesellschaftlichen Druck erklÃ¤ren.

Zu viel FÃ¶rderung fÃ¼hrt nicht zu mehr Erfolg

Andere Eltern und Erzieher in der Kita setzten MaÃŸstÃ¤be, wie weit ein Kind in einem bestimmten Alter in seiner Entwicklung sein mÃ¼sse. Und in der Schule gehe es weiter - mit starren LehrplÃ¤nen und oft unflexiblen Lehrern.

â€œWenn das eigene Kind dann beispielsweise weniger gut lesen und rechnen kann, als es nach dieser Vorstellung sollte, lÃ¶st das bei den meisten Eltern Ã„ngste aus.â€

Die Reaktion vieler Eltern: stÃ¤rkere FÃ¶rderung - auch dort, wo das Potenzial des Kindes bereits voll ausgeschÃ¶pft ist. Damit entstehe die Gefahr der Ãœberlastung, warnt Largo.

â€œEltern dÃ¼rfen ihre Kinder nicht Ã¼berfordernâ€, sagt er. â€œDie zunehmende Zahl der Burnout-FÃ¤lle selbst bei Kindern zeigt aber, dass viele Eltern genau das tun. Die Kinder wollen dann nicht mehr lernen, kÃ¶nnen nicht mehr schlafen, fÃ¼hlen sich niedergeschlagen.â€

Largos Rat: â€œBemerken Eltern, dass sie ihr Kind Ã¼berfordern, sollten sie sich selbst hinterfragen und sich ehrlich Ã¼berlegen, weshalb sie solchen Druck machen.â€

Viele Eltern machen sich selbst groÃŸen Druck

Die Ursache fÃ¼r ein solches Verhalten der Eltern, so Largos Erfahrung, sei nÃ¤mlich in vielen FÃ¤llen gleich.

â€œDer Grund ist hÃ¤ufig die eigene existenzielle Verunsicherung der Elternâ€, sagt er.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Das passiert mit Kindern, die frÃ¼h in die Kita kommen

â€œSie haben Angst, dass sie ihren Lebensstandard nicht halten kÃ¶nnen und fÃ¼rchten, dass die LebensqualitÃ¤t fÃ¼r ihre Kinder nicht mehr so hoch sein kÃ¶nnte wie bei ihnen. Sie versuchen deshalb, die Kinder extrem zu fÃ¶rdern - in dem Glauben, das mache die Kinder klÃ¼ger und damit auch erfolgreicher. Doch das ist ein Irrglaube.â€

Was sollten Eltern also anders machen? Largos Antwort darauf ist einfach.

Kinder mÃ¼ssten nicht die ganze Zeit beschÃ¤ftigt und gefÃ¶rdert werden.

Eltern sollten ihre Kinder sinnvolle Erfahrungen machen lassen

â€œEltern sollten Vertrauen haben in die Kinderâ€, sagt er. â€œIhre Aufgabe ist nicht, die Kinder mit allen mÃ¶glichen Dingen zu fÃ¶rdern, sondern ihnen sinnvolle Erfahrungen zu ermÃ¶glichen, zum Beispiel mit anderen Kindern.â€

Dann, so erklÃ¤rt er, werde das Kind auch Erfolg haben. â€œDenn es wÃ¤hlt das aus, was es fÃ¼r seine Entwicklung braucht und was es kann.â€

Ohne diese Erfahrungen werde ein Kind verunsichert - und das habe laut Largo wiederum negative Auswirkungen auf sein Lernverhalten. Bei einer Ã¼bermÃ¤ÃŸigen FÃ¶rderung kann sich auÃŸerdem der gewÃ¼nschte Effekt umkehren und das Kind stattdessen Lernschwierigkeiten entwickeln.

â€œEin NeunjÃ¤hriger ist dann beispielsweise beim Lesen auf dem Entwicklungsstand eines SiebenjÃ¤hrigen - obwohl seine Eltern genau das Gegenteil erreichen wollten - nÃ¤mlich, dass er besser ist als die Anderen.â€

Falsche FÃ¶rderung fÃ¼hrt zu einer Ãœberforderung

Diese falsche FÃ¶rderung fÃ¼hre zwangslÃ¤ufig zu einer Ãœberforderung in der Schule und diese wiederum zu Misserfolgen, warnt der Mediziner.

Die Folgen seien dramatisch: â€œDas GefÃ¼hl des Versagens zerstÃ¶rt das SelbstwertgefÃ¼hl immer mehr, bis wir es mit einem zutiefst verunsicherten Erwachsenen zu tun haben, der sich nichts zutraut und Probleme hat, sich in der Berufswelt zurechtzufinden.â€



Und damit ist Largo bei einer Botschaft angelangt, die er seit Jahrzehnten predigt - Kinder so nehmen, wie sie sind.



â€œEs ist deshalb wichtig zu akzeptieren, dass sich jedes Kind auf seine Weise und in seinem Tempo entwickeln will. Dazu gehÃ¶rt also anzuerkennen, dass jedes Kind anders ist.â€



Eine Botschaft, die sich alle Eltern noch mehr zu Herzen nehmen sollten - auch wenn sie vÃ¶llig selbstverstÃ¤ndlich klingt.

TEXT:
Tucson, Arizona, was the 21st stop on our Listen to America road trip. We spoke to residents to find out what they love (and donâ€™t!) about the city. Hereâ€™s what they had to say:

â€œOne of the things I really appreciate about Tucson is the sense of community and social connections that Iâ€™ve experienced through my career as a firefighter/paramedic for Tucson. Actually, Iâ€™m the first woman firefighter in the history of the Tucson fire department.â€

â€• Deanna Lewis, 55, graduate student/physician assistant

â€œIâ€™m originally from Denver, Colorado ... I really liked Arizona so I wanted to stay. So, I chose U of A.â€

â€• Brenden Harris, 19, student

â€œThe heat is a challenge here ... Otherwise, I like the climate here.â€

â€• Brenden Spangler, 18, student

â€œI really do love this city a lot. Partially because it is where I grew up, but I think thereâ€™s a lot of charm to it that a lot of people donâ€™t quite see.â€

â€• Brittany Taylor, 19, student

â€œSometimes I feel safe. Sometimes I donâ€™t. There are points in time when Iâ€™ll get scared when something happens ... I am hopeful. I hope that it gets better.â€

â€• Abigail Williams, 19, student

â€œMy husband and I were heading west in 1978 and ran out of gas here and stayed. We really do like it.â€

â€• Dorothy Cook, 69, retired

â€œMy family lives in Phoenix. I moved down here on campus so Iâ€™ve been here for about a month and a half.â€

â€• Mckayla Smith, 18, student/barista

â€œI got here by accident, but I love it.â€

â€• Alora Cohen, 26, behavioral health technician/certified recovery support specialist

â€œIâ€™ve chosen to stay because I fell in love with the city. I love what I do for my job. I love the people. I love that every day Iâ€™m surrounded by people with like-minded ideals.â€

â€• Cristina Siqueiros, 28, job coach/catering manager

â€œFate brought me here ... Iâ€™ve had plenty of opportunities to leave ... I donâ€™t want to leave. I think that Arizona is a great place to live. Tucson is my center of existence.â€

â€• Robert Morris, 59, engineer

â€œItâ€™s like being on vacation every day.â€

â€• James Harrison, 61, engineer

â€œI have been here for 40 years ... Itâ€™s my home and Iâ€™m very proud of Tucson. Arizonaâ€™s a red state and Tucsonâ€™s a blue city. Itâ€™s a safe place for me to be able to express my opinions and live the life I value.â€
TITLE: 'Itâ€™s Like Being On Vacation Every Day': Meet The People Of Tucson

TEXT:
Im Alter von 55 Jahren verstarb Hannah Summers Mutter an Nierenkrebs

Nun teilt die junge Frau den Abschiedsbrief der Mutter, mit einer wichtigen Botschaft

Die ganze Geschichte seht ihr im Video oben

Die 18-jÃ¤hrige Hannah Summers aus dem amerikanischen Indiana hat mit einem Tweet Hunderttausende Twitter-Nutzer berÃ¼hrt. Ihre Botschaft ist simpel, aber berÃ¼hrend: SchÃ¤tzt eure Eltern.

Die Vorgeschichte dazu ist traurig. Vor wenigen Tagen starb Hannahs Mutter Peggy im Alter von 55 Jahren an Nierenkrebs. Sie hinterlieÃŸ Hannah und ihren Geschwistern emotionale Briefe, in denen sie sich von jedem ihrer Kinder verabschiedete.

Obwohl sie zuerst mit sich haderte, verÃ¶ffentlichte die junge Frau den Abschiedsbrief der Mutter in den sozialen Medien, um der Welt zu zeigen, â€œwas fÃ¼r eine Person meine Mutter war. Sie war stets besorgter um andere als um sich selbst und war so eine groÃŸartige Mutter fÃ¼r alle ihre Kinder.â€

In dem Brief an Hannah schrieb die Mutter demnach: â€œEs tut mir so leid. Ich habe versucht, diese furchtbare Krankheit zu Ã¼berwinden, aber ich denke, Gott hatte andere PlÃ¤ne fÃ¼r mich.â€

"Ich bin immer noch genauso stolz auf dich, wie ich es immer war"

Mutter Peggy erinnerte ihre Tochter daran, dass sie noch viele Menschen in ihrem Leben habe, die sie lieben und mit denen sie in dieser schweren Zeit reden solle. Sie riet ihr, sich mit Menschen zu umgeben, die an die selben Dinge glauben. â€œAber vergiss nicht, dass ich immer noch bei dir binâ€, schrieb sie weiter. â€œUnd ich bin immer noch genauso stolz auf dich, wie ich es immer war.â€

AuÃŸerdem richtete sie auch Worte an ihre zukÃ¼nftigen Enkelkinder. â€œFalls du eines Tages Kinder haben solltest, stelle sicher, dass sie wissen, wie sehr ich auch sie liebe und wie gerne ich sie kennengelernt hÃ¤tte.â€

Zum Schluss gab sie ihrer Tochter noch mit auf den Weg, jeden Tag zu leben, als wÃ¤re es ihr letzter. Man wisse nie, wann dieser sei.

Der HuffPost erzÃ¤hlte die 18-JÃ¤hrige, dass es fÃ¼r sie sehr schwer war, den Brief zu lesen. Trotzdem habe sie sich getrÃ¶stet gefÃ¼hlt.

Sie hat eine wichtige Nachricht

Mit ihrem Tweet, der den Brief der Mutter beinhaltet, erreichte die SchÃ¼lerin Hunderttausende Menschen und erhielt Ã¼ber 1000 Antworten.

An all diese Menschen hat Hannah eine wichtige Nachricht: â€œNehmt das als Anlass eure Eltern heute etwas fester zu drÃ¼cken. Seht sie nicht als selbstverstÃ¤ndlich an. Denn wir wissen alle nicht, wie lange wir sie bei uns haben werden.â€

(sk)

ADVERTISEMENTThe Morning Wrap is HuffPost India's selection of interesting news and opinion from the day's newspapers.
Subscribe here to receive it in your inbox each weekday morning.
Hollywood superstar Kevin Spacey came out as gay after an incident of sexual harassment of another minor actor blew up.
Nearly A year after demonetisation, credit card usage has seen a sharp rise with outstandings rising 38.7% during the 12 months ended September 2017.
Scientists at the Pune-based National Institute of Virology (NIV) spotted a new dengue virus and had been tracking it in India.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

The Morning Wrap is HuffPost India's selection of interesting news and opinion from the day's newspapers. Subscribe here to receive it in your inbox each weekday morning.

Essential HuffPost

A recent report published in Lancet has said that indoor air pollution caused 1.24 lakh premature deaths in India in 2015, more than the emissions from coal power plants or other industrial sources.

Why does every political party, the rulers and the Opposition, want to bask in the reflected glory of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, 57 years after his demise. Sandip Roy explains.

Hollywood superstar Kevin Spacey came out as gay after an incident of sexual harassment of another minor actor blew up. By the way he disclosed his identity, Spacey has done a disservice to the LGBTQ community.

Main News

India surged up 30 places to the 100th rank among 190 countries in the latest edition of the World Bank's global rankings on Ease of Doing Business, which proves that financial reforms are paying off, says PM Modi.

Nearly A year after demonetisation, credit card usage has seen a sharp rise with outstandings rising 38.7% during the 12 months ended September 2017.

The Union and state governments said on Tuesday the Army will build foot overbridges at three stations on Mumbai's suburban network, including Elphinstone Road, sparking a row about involving the forces in a civilian project.

Off The Front Page

A man in a rented Home Depot pick-up truck mowed down civilians after driving onto a busy bicycle path near the World Trade Center memorial in Lower Manhattan area in New York City on Tuesday.

In an interview with The Hindu, Dineshwar Sharma, appointed to facilitate a dialogue in Kashmir, said there can be no solution to the political unrest in the area in the shadow of the gun.

Scientists at the Pune-based National Institute of Virology (NIV) spotted a new dengue virus and had been tracking it in India.

Opinion

The rise of intolerance, where dissent is smothered and self-censorship takes its place, is endangering democracy and calling for a culture of tolerance, writes Soli Sorabjee in The Indian Express.

While the Doing Business report ranking gives the government enough reason to celebrate, it would do well to retain the single-minded focus that has seen it improve its position this year, says an editorial in the Hindustan Times.

Nothing could possibly be more dramatic, or attractive, than the setting of a courtroom trial, argues AP Shah, former chief justice of the Delhi High Court, in The Hindu.

Also on HuffPost
TITLE: The Morning Wrap: New Dengue Strain Found In India; Suspected Terror Attack In New York

TEXT:
Maisie Williams canâ€™t wait to get out of Westeros.

â€œGame of Thronesâ€ fans may shed a tear when HBOâ€™s fantasy epic draws to a close following its eighth and final season, but the British actress says sheâ€™s eager for the show to end so that she can pursue other projects.

Itâ€™s â€œincredibly excitingâ€ and â€œwill be nice to pick roles that I want to do,â€ the 20-year-old told BBC Newsbeat in a piece published online Thursday.

â€œI can show the world what sort of actress I want to be and shape my career a little bit,â€ she added.

Williams has appeared as the sword-wielding, list-keeping Arya Stark since she was just 14. The actress acknowledged that the prospect of not having the show as a safety net was â€œnerve wracking.â€

But â€œon the other hand,â€ Williams said sheâ€™ll be â€œfreeâ€ and able to develop independent movies via her newly-launched production company.

The final season of â€œGame of Thronesâ€ is expected to air in 2019.
TITLE: Here's Why Maisie Williams Is Eager For â€˜Game Of Thronesâ€™ To End

TEXT:
TEXAS - "Nos priÃ¨res vont aux victimes de tous ceux qui ont Ã©tÃ© touchÃ©s par ce drame", s'est Ã©mu le gouverneur du Texas aprÃ¨s la fusillade qui a fait au moins 26 morts dans une Ã©glise de Sutherland Springs.

DÃ©plorant "la pire fusillade de masse dans l'histoire" de son Ã‰tat, Greg Abbott a dÃ©clarÃ© devant la presse qu'il ne savait pas encore si le bilan allait s'aggraver mais, Ã  l'instar de ses collÃ¨gues rÃ©publicains, n'a pas Ã©voquÃ© de s'attaquer au contrÃ´le des armes Ã  feu.

Et pour cause, le gouverneur de cet Ã‰tat -auquel la NRA, le tout-puissant lobby des armes, a versÃ© plus de 500.000 dollars au cours des vingt derniÃ¨res annÃ©es- est un grand partisan de l'armement des habitants comme l'a montrÃ© l'un de ses tweets sur le sujet, datant du 28 octobre 2015, qui a refait surface ce dimanche en prenant une toute autre dimension.

I'm EMBARRASSED: Texas #2 in nation for new gun purchases, behind CALIFORNIA. Let's pick up the pace Texans. @NRA https://t.co/Ry2GInbS1g â€” Greg Abbott (@GregAbbott_TX) October 28, 2015

"J'ai HONTE: le Texas est le 2e Ã‰tat du pays Ã  Ãªtre le plus gros acheteur de nouvelles armes Ã  feu, derniÃ¨re la CALIFORNIE. Texans, il faut accÃ©lÃ©rer le rythme", avait lancÃ© Greg Abbott en mettant en lien l'article qui rapportait que la Californie, Ã‰tat dÃ©mocrate de 39 millions d'habitants et stricte en matiÃ¨re d'armes Ã  feu, vendait plus de nouvelles armes que le Texas, Ã‰tat rÃ©publicain de 27 millions d'habitants rÃ©putÃ©s pour leur passion de la gÃ¢chette.

Dimanche 5 novembre, un homme a ouvert le feu dans une Ã©glise du Texas tuant 26 personnes en plein service religieux. Les victimes sont Ã¢gÃ©es de cinq Ã  72 ans. Une des filles du pasteur de l'Ã©glise baptiste, Ã¢gÃ©e de 14 ans, fait partie des personnes tuÃ©es, a dit son pÃ¨re qui Ã©tait exceptionnellement absent ce jour-ci.

Cette tuerie intervient cinq semaines seulement aprÃ¨s celle de Las Vegas, la fusillade la plus meurtriÃ¨re jamais perpÃ©trÃ©e dans le pays avec 58 morts.

TITLE: Fusillade de Sutherland Springs: Quand le gouverneur du Texas avait "honte" que les habitants ne soient pas les plus gros acheteurs d'armes du pays

Y cuando estÃ© preparada, dirÃ© lo que tengo que decir", zanjÃ³ la actriz.

TEXT:
Uma explicÃ³ a Access Hollywood: "Creo que es admirable que las mujeres se atrevan a hablar".

"No voy a decir nada, porque he aprendido... ya no soy una niÃ±a. He aprendido que cuando hablo enfadada suelo arrepentirme de la manera en la que me expreso. De modo que estoy esperando a sentirme menos enfadada. Y cuando estÃ© preparada, dirÃ© lo que tengo que decir", zanjÃ³ la actriz.

El vÃ­deo en el que Uma habla sobre este tema se ha hecho viral en las redes sociales, al igual que un vÃ­deo similar de la actriz Emma Thompson el mes pasado, cuando salieron a la luz las acusaciones contra Harvey Weinstein.

Por su parte, Weinstein ha negado todas las acusaciones de "sexo no consensual".

Desde entonces, una gran cantidad de figuras clave en el mundo del cine se han enfrentado a acusaciones de acoso sexual, incluidos los directores Brett Ratner y James Toback, quienes las han negado.

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTCHENNAI -- Prime Minster Narendra Modi on Monday said that editorial freedom should be used in public interest and urged the newspapers to devote space to increase awareness about climate change.
He said: "Editorial freedom should be used wisely and in public interest."
Pointing out the natural calamities occurring around the world at regular intervals, Modi urged newspapers to allocate space to increase awareness about climate change.
Earlier on his arrival Modi was received by Purohit, Palaniswami and others at the airport.
At INS Adyar, Modi had a meeting with Palaniswami and discussed about the rain and relief situation in Chennai and neighbouring districts.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

CHENNAI -- Prime Minster Narendra Modi on Monday said that editorial freedom should be used in public interest and urged the newspapers to devote space to increase awareness about climate change.

Speaking at the 75th anniversary celebrations of Tamil newspaper Daily Thanthi at the Madras University Centenary Auditorium, Modi said lot of things happen around the world and the editors decide what is important to be published in their newspapers.

He said: "Editorial freedom should be used wisely and in public interest."

Pointing out the natural calamities occurring around the world at regular intervals, Modi urged newspapers to allocate space to increase awareness about climate change.

He said the freedom to write does not in anyway reduce the importance to be accurate and correct, adding that though media outlets may be owned by the private sector, they serve a public purpose, have much social accountability and their conduct should be above board.

He said technological advancement enables citizens to compare, discuss and analyse the credibility of news and the media should take extra caution to maintain its credibility.

According to him, reform in media can come from within and through introspection.

Observing most of the media discourse revolves around politics, Modi said the nation is made of over a billion people and the media should focus on the people and their achievements.

Citing the spread of mobile phones, Modi said citizen reporting is important in showcasing individual achievements and also helping in the aftermath of natural disasters.

Modi also released a souvenir.

Governor Banwarilal Purohit, Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Union Minister of State for Finance and Shipping Pon Radhakrishnan, Chief Minister K. Palaniswami and his deputy O.Pannerselvam also participated in the function.

Paying encomiums to the founder of Daily Thanthi S.P. Adithanar and his son Sivanthi Adithan, Palaniswami said the daily would certainly see centenary celebrations.

Leaders of several political parties, law makers, industrialists, movie actors and diplomats attended the function.

Earlier on his arrival Modi was received by Purohit, Palaniswami and others at the airport.

From the airport Modi reached the INS Adyar naval base here in a helicopter.

At INS Adyar, Modi had a meeting with Palaniswami and discussed about the rain and relief situation in Chennai and neighbouring districts.
TITLE: Editorial Freedom Should Be Used Wisely And In Public Interest, Says PM Modi

SUMMARY:
Priti Patel has apologised for taking time out of a family holiday to meet Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other politicians without telling the Foreign Office in advance.
The international development secretary has also been reprimanded by Downing Street for her actions.
The BBC was the first to report on Friday that Patel had undisclosed meetings.
Kate Osamor MP, Labourâ€™s shadow development secretary, said: â€œTodayâ€™s statement is a desperate last-ditch attempt by Priti Patel to save her job.
However Patel today admitted the foreign secretary â€œbecame aware of the visitâ€ but â€œnot in advance of itâ€.
TEXT:
Priti Patel has apologised for taking time out of a family holiday to meet Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other politicians without telling the Foreign Office in advance.

The international development secretary has also been reprimanded by Downing Street for her actions.

Labour said Patel must either be investigated by the Cabinet Office or resign.

Patel was accompanied to nearly all of her meetings with Israeli ministers, charities and non-governmental organisations by honorary president of the Conservative Friends of Israel lobbying group, Lord Polak.

She apologised for setting up and reporting the meetings â€œin a way which did not accord with the usual proceduresâ€ and clarified her claim that Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson â€œknew about the visitâ€, admitting he did not know about it in advance.

The BBC was the first to report on Friday that Patel had undisclosed meetings.

Patel said in a statement on Monday: â€œThis summer I travelled to Israel, on a family holiday paid for myself.

â€œWhile away, I had the opportunity to meet a number of people and organisations. I am publishing a list of who I met.â€ The Foreign and Commonwealth Office was aware of my visit while it was under wayâ€.

â€œIn hindsight, I can see how my enthusiasm to engage in this way could be misread, and how meetings were set up and reported in a way which did not accord with the usual procedures. I am sorry for this and I apologise for it.

â€œMy first and only aim as the Secretary of State for International Development is to put the interests of British taxpayers and the worldâ€™s poor at the front of our development work.â€

Downing Street said Theresa May had spoken to Patel and â€œaccepted her apology for her handling of the matterâ€.

â€œThe prime minister met the secretary of state this morning to remind her of the obligations which exist under the ministerial code,â€ a No.10 spokesman said.

Downing Street also revealed May did not know about the meeting between Patel and Netanyahu until Friday.

Kate Osamor MP, Labourâ€™s shadow development secretary, said: â€œTodayâ€™s statement is a desperate last-ditch attempt by Priti Patel to save her job. It has now emerged that, contrary to her statement on Friday, the Foreign Secretary was never told in advance about her meetings in Israel - which we have only now discovered included meetings with Prime Minister Netanyahu and with the Foreign Ministry.

â€œNot only does it look like she might have breached the Ministerial Code, she has now been caught misleading the British public. If she doesnâ€™t now resign, then Theresa May must immediately refer the issue to the Cabinet Office for a full investigation.â€

Dfid has admitted that the statement Patel gave to The Guardian on November 3 could have left given the impression Johnson knew about her trip in advance.

â€œBoris knew about the visit. The point is that the Foreign Office did know about this, Boris knew about [the trip],â€ she told the newspaper.

However Patel today admitted the foreign secretary â€œbecame aware of the visitâ€ but â€œnot in advance of itâ€.

Dfid also had to acknowledge that Patel may have led people to believe all the meetings she had in Israel had already been publically reported - when they had not.

â€œThe Secretary of State regrets the lack of precision in the wording she used in these statements, and is taking this opportunity to clarify the position,â€ Dfid said.

The department has also published a list of those Patel met on her visit.
TITLE: Priti Patel Apologises For Undisclosed Meetings With Israeli Government

Die Eltern, die wissen, dass ich morgens aufstehe, weil ich ihre Kinder liebe, und nur das Beste fÃ¼r die mir anvertrauten kleinen Menschen will.
Die Eltern, die "Danke" sagen.
Die Eltern, die mir nicht sofort bÃ¶se Absicht unterstellen, wenn tatsÃ¤chlich mal ein Fehler passiert.

TEXT:
Als Mutter ist man versucht, in den sozialen Netzwerken sogenannten Mami-Gruppen beizutreten um sich ausheulen zu kÃ¶nnen, wenn das Kleine mal wieder bockt.

Ist man aber von Beruf Erzieherin, rate ich dringend davon ab.

So findet man nÃ¤mlich dort Posts, in denen eine Mutter von ihrem erschÃ¼tterten Vertrauen zu der Erzieherin ihres Sohnes berichtet, weil diese ihn im KiGa beim Essen fÃ¼r 2 Minuten vor die TÃ¼r gesetzt hat, da er sich dort angefangen hatte zu prÃ¼geln.

Das Kind wÃ¤re jetzt emotional total am Boden... Musste das Zimmer verlassen, bis die Erzieherin nach kam, um die Situation mit dem Kind in Ruhe zu klÃ¤ren. Sie fÃ¼hle sich Ã¼berhaupt nicht mehr wohl jetzt dort.

Muss man hier schon etwas schmunzeln, so liest man am besten nicht weiter, was andere MÃ¼tter darunter schreiben:

"Das ist verletzte Aufsichtspflicht! DafÃ¼r kannst du sie kÃ¼ndigen lassen!"

"Melde das dem TrÃ¤ger."

"Erkundige dich beim Rechtsanwalt."

"Vielleicht kann man den KiGa deshalb schlieÃŸen lassen, frag mal bei Jugendamt nach."

Ungelogen.

Alltag im Kindergarten

Ich habe mir also ein Herz gefasst und versucht zu erklÃ¤ren, wie eine Essenssituation im KiGa ablÃ¤uft:

20 Kinder sitzen um einen Tisch und warten darauf, dass du jedem von Ihnen das Essen austeilst. Nebenbei rufen die ersten schon wieder nach was zu trinken, weil ihr Glas schon ausgetrunken ist. Ein kleineres Kind braucht Hilfe dabei, sein Fleisch zu schneiden.

Ein weiteres jammert darÃ¼ber, dass ihm das Essen nicht schmeckt. Der Nebenmann schmeiÃŸt das Glas um, die PfÃ¼tze muss aufgewischt werden. Wieder leere TrinkglÃ¤ser. Zwei Kinder streiten, weil einer eine Nudel vom Teller des anderen geklaut hat und die zwei daneben bewerfen sich giggelnd mit ihrem Essen.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Wir Erzieher stehen jeden Tag kurz vor dem Burnout

So... Ist es da nicht vielleicht gar nicht soooooo unverstÃ¤ndlich, dass das Kind kurz drauÃŸen warten soll, bis alle versorgt sind, damit die Erzieherin dann in Ruhe mit ihm sprechen kann um die Situation zu klÃ¤ren? Vor allem, wenn die GruppentÃ¼re ein Glasfenster hat, um sehen zu kÃ¶nnen, was drauÃŸen vor sich geht?

Ich habe fÃ¼r diese Darstellung viele "Likes" bekommen, hauptsÃ¤chlich von anderen Erzieherinnen. Von den anderen wurde meine Sicht der Dinge ignoriert. Ganz klar, sonst kann man sich ja nicht weiter aufregen.

Keine Ahnung von den Aufgaben der Erzieher

Nun kÃ¶nnte man meinen, dieses PhÃ¤nomen tritt nur im Internet auf. Aber nein.

ZurÃ¼ck in der Arbeitswelt, kann ich nur noch KopfschÃ¼tteln. Und es wird mit jedem Jahr nur schlimmer... KiGa-Bashing, das neue Hobby vieler Eltern. Eine ganz neue Art des Mobbing ist geboren.

Als Erzieher ist es heutzutage kaum mehr mÃ¶glich, sich auf die BedÃ¼rfnisse der Kinder zu konzentrieren, da einige Eltern ihre eigenen BedÃ¼rfnisse beim Personal an erster Stelle sehen.

Es ist nicht mehr mÃ¶glich, Ã¼berhaupt irgendetwas richtig zu machen, deshalb verbringt man gefÃ¼hlte Stunden damit, sich morgens oder mittags vor Eltern im Flur zu rechtfertigen, warum dieses oder jenes so passiert ist.

So kommt zum Beispiel eine Mutter mit der Beschwerde, man habe ihr am Vortag nicht gesagt, dass ihr Kind im Flur beim Anziehen Streit angefangen habe. Sie mÃ¶chte so etwas aber bitte dringend immer sofort mitgeteilt bekommen, denn schlieÃŸlich mÃ¶chte sie dann mit ihrem Kind darÃ¼ber reden kÃ¶nnen, dass man so etwas nicht tut.

Ok... das ist jetzt zum Beispiel eine der Aufgaben, die ein Erzieher eigentlich hat: Hilfe bei der KonfliktlÃ¶sung. Vielleicht habe das aber auch bloÃŸ ich falsch verstanden.

Jedenfalls wird bei dieser Beschwerde und gleichzeitigen Bitte anscheinend Ã¼bersehen, dass wir nicht nur ein Kind betreuen. Und bei einer Gruppe von 20 Kindern wÃ¼rde es ziemlich viel Zeit in Anspruch nehmen, jeder Mutter beim Abholen einen Bericht darÃ¼ber zu erstatten, wann ihr Kind sich gestritten hat. Denn sind wir mal ehrlich: Kinder streiten stÃ¤ndig!

Auch kommt es manchmal vor, dass ein Kind dabei ausholt, und dem andern Kind "eine scheppert". NatÃ¼rlich greifen wir Erzieher dann ein (selten schaffen wir das, bevor es "klatsch" gemacht hat, wir sind Menschen, keine Fantasyfiguren mit Lichtgeschwindigkeit), erklÃ¤ren, dass man dem andern nicht weh tun darf und zeigen alternative HandlungsmÃ¶glichkeiten auf.

Wir Ã¼berprÃ¼fen, ob sich der andere weh getan hat, reichen KÃ¼hlbeutel und KÃ¼gelchen.

Beim Abholen werden Eltern von "TÃ¤ter" und "Opfer" informiert, damit sie Bescheid wissen, falls Ihre Kinder daheim davon erzÃ¤hlen. Passt, oder? Nein, passt nicht.

Drohungen und Beleidigungen gegen das Personal

Greift ein Kind noch zwei mal Ã¶fter darauf zurÃ¼ck, sich kÃ¶rperlich zu wehren oder zu Ã¤uÃŸern, gibt es schon nach kÃ¼rzester Zeit die lautstarke Forderung von Eltern, dieses Kind dem Jugendamt zu melden.

Es wird von einer Gefahrenlage im Kindergarten gesprochen. Ja, es wird sogar der Kindergarten gewechselt. Weil das ja sonst nirgends vorkommt oder toleriert wird! Nur hier ist das so.

Dass es sich hierbei um Kinder handelt, die zwei Minuten nach ihrem Streit wieder miteinander spielen und keiner dabei verletzt wurde, vergessen die Eltern hierbei leider komplett.

NatÃ¼rlich gibt es auch Kinder, die tatsÃ¤chlich BedÃ¼rfnisse haben, die ihr derzeitiger Kindergarten nicht erfÃ¼llen kann. Je nachdem worum es dabei geht, und vor allem, wenn so viel "kÃ¶rperliches Verhalten" im Spiel ist, kann man den Eltern dann also hÃ¶flich ans Herz legen, dass heilpÃ¤dagogisch geschultes Personal ihrem Kind besser dabei helfen kann, seine Konflikte zu bewÃ¤ltigen.

Dabei lÃ¤sst man dann ganz bewusst weg, dass ihr Kind nicht aufgrund von Hochbegabung "unterfordert" ist, wie von den Eltern geschildert, sondern das Problem wo anders liegt.

Wenn's so einfach denn wÃ¤re... Nein.

"Was fÃ¼r ein unfÃ¤higes Personal kommt jetzt nicht mit meinem Kind zurecht? Dieser Kindergarten ist das Allerletzte! Andere mÃ¼ssen vor euch gewarnt werden!"

Wenn man dann als privater Kindergarten auch noch das Recht hat, den Betreuungsvertrag zu kÃ¼ndigen, weil man mit den Eltern zusammen im GesprÃ¤ch nicht weiter kommt und sich angemessene Hilfe fÃ¼r das Kind wÃ¼nscht (und andere Eltern berechtigterweise schon mit dem Jugendamt drohen) erreicht der Frust dieser Eltern ganz neue Dimensionen.

Drohungen, den Kindergarten bei der Familienministerin zu melden. Beim Landesjugendamt Ã¼ber das unfÃ¤hige Personal informieren wollen.

Ja, solche Drohungen gehÃ¶ren mittlerweile zum Alltag eines Erziehers.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: "Die Eltern werden dir die HÃ¶lle heiÃŸ machen" - das habe ich in 40 Jahren als Erzieherin gelernt

Erzieher sollen sich aber ganz selbstverstÃ¤ndlich beiÃŸen lassen, wenn man versucht, das Kind zu beruhigen. Immerhin sind wir ja selber schuld, unfÃ¤hig wie wir sind.

Organisierte Elternbanden

Man kÃ¶nnte jetzt sagen: Ok, vielleicht ist das ein Problem der privaten Einrichtungen. Aber nein! Die Kollegin aus dem Regelkindergarten erzÃ¤hlt, dass sie einen Papa im Garten neulich fragte, warum er mit seinem Handy Fotos der dort zum Spielen vorhandenen FahrrÃ¤der macht.

Sie wurde dann darÃ¼ber aufgeklÃ¤rt, dass sein Kind sich an einem Fahrrad in den Finger geschnitten hat. Drei Tage spÃ¤ter kam ein Brief vom Rechtsanwalt der gegen den Kindergarten klagt, weil bei einem Fahrrad am Lenker der Gummigriff fehlte und sich das Kind dort verletzt habe.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Liebe Eltern: HÃ¶rt auf, eure Kinder zu verweichlichten Menschen zu erziehen

Oder aber organisierte Elternbanden, die sich beim BÃ¼rgermeister beschweren, weil der Kindergarten sich pÃ¤dagogisch begrÃ¼ndet weigert, das Vorschulprogramm nach den Vorstellungen einzelner Eltern fÃ¼r alle zu erweitern.

Wenn ich also morgens aufstehe und mich fÃ¼r die Arbeit fertig mache denke ich mir nicht: Oh ja, heute backe ich Kuchen mit den Kids! Sondern: Mal sehen, was mich heute wieder davon abhÃ¤lt, Kuchen mit den Kids zu backen.

Die traurige Wahrheit ist: Die ganze Zeit, die wir damit verbringen, uns mit solchen Dingen herumzuschlagen, verbringen wir eben nicht bei den Kindern.

Aber liebe Eltern, was glaubt ihr denn, wem ihr hier eure Kinder anvertraut? Sind wir auf das viele Geld aus, dass man als Erzieher verdient? Bekommt man einen Erzieherabschluss durchs Beantworten von Multiple-Choice-Fragen im Internet?

Wir wollen fÃ¼r eure Kinder da sein

Erzieher sind Menschen, die es sich zum Beruf gemacht haben, fÃ¼r eure Kinder da zu sein. Wir wollen sie umsorgen, ihnen etwas beibringen und ihnen einen geborgenen Raum fÃ¼r ihre Entwicklung schaffen.

Die ganze NegativitÃ¤t, die tagtÃ¤glich Ã¼ber das "Nichts-recht-machen-kÃ¶nnen" in unseren Gruppenalltag eindringt, verstÃ¶rt Kinder und Personal.

Wir opfern unsere Freizeit, um Spielzeug fÃ¼r Eure Kinder zu basteln, um Feste vorzubereiten und um uns BeschÃ¤ftigungen mit Lerneffekt auszudenken.

Die geopferte Freizeit wird aber mit jedem mal Drama etwas weniger. Denn ganz ehrlich: Wer hat schon Lust, sich unbezahlt Gedanken Ã¼ber die Arbeit zu machen, wenn man als Dank dafÃ¼r schlecht gemacht wird und sich beleidigen lassen muss?

Liebe besagte Eltern, seht ihr nicht, dass ihr hÃ¶chstpersÃ¶nlich dafÃ¼r sorgt, dass die QualitÃ¤t schlechter und die Geduld weniger wird, die wir gerne fÃ¼r eure Kinder Ã¼brig hÃ¤tten?

Jedem, der sich in diesen Beispielen mit Ã¤hnlichem Verhalten wiedererkennt, mÃ¶chte ich sagen:

Ihr seid die Tyrannen, die ihren Anteil am Personalnotstand der KindergÃ¤rten haben.

Wer mÃ¶chte schon freiwillig unter solchen UmstÃ¤nden arbeiten?!

Es gibt sie noch, die "normalen" Eltern

AbschlieÃŸend mÃ¶chte ich aber dringend betonen: Es gibt sie natÃ¼rlich noch, die "normalen" Eltern!

Die Eltern, die wissen, dass ich morgens nicht aufstehe, um mir zu Ã¼berlegen, wie ich sie Ã¤rgern kann oder ihr Kind negativ in seiner Entwicklung beeinflussen kann.

Die Eltern, die wissen, dass ich morgens aufstehe, weil ich ihre Kinder liebe, und nur das Beste fÃ¼r die mir anvertrauten kleinen Menschen will.

Die Eltern, die "Danke" sagen.

Die Eltern, die mir nicht sofort bÃ¶se Absicht unterstellen, wenn tatsÃ¤chlich mal ein Fehler passiert.

Die Eltern, die zu vernÃ¼nftigen GesprÃ¤chen bereit sind, wenn es ein Problem gibt.

Bitte, liebe "normale" Eltern! Ihr mÃ¼sst endlich lauter sein als die Dauer-Motzer und Drama-Verursacher! Damit wir weiterhin wissen, warum wir morgens aufstehen und nicht irgendwann resignieren.

* Der Name der Autorin wurde geÃ¤ndert, um ihren Job nicht zu gefÃ¤hrden und sie vor Drohungen und Beleidigung zu schÃ¼tzen.
TITLE: "Eine neue Form des Mobbing" - wie Erzieherinnen und KindergÃ¤rten von Eltern im Internet fertig gemacht werden

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTThe Haryana Urban Development Authority (HUDA) today said it sold approximately 10-acre plot to Swedish furniture maker IKEA for around Rs 842 crore in its single largest property auction till date.
HUDA sold an approximately 10 acres of commercial land for a whopping Rs 842 crore in Sector 47 of Estate-II of HUDA Gurugram, an official said.
"The site was successfully auctioned to IKEA, a multinational group, that designs and sells ready-to-assemble furniture..," J Ganesan, Chief Administrator HUDA, said.
This is not a one-off deal as we have planned out auctions of other institutional and commercial properties across the city in the next few months.
Gurugram has seen a reduced demand mainly due to rapidly changing investments scenario in real estate, especially in commercial sector.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

The Haryana Urban Development Authority (HUDA) today said it sold approximately 10-acre plot to Swedish furniture maker IKEA for around Rs 842 crore in its single largest property auction till date.

HUDA sold an approximately 10 acres of commercial land for a whopping Rs 842 crore in Sector 47 of Estate-II of HUDA Gurugram, an official said. The site was put for e-auction on October 6 this year and was bidded on October 31.

"The site was successfully auctioned to IKEA, a multinational group, that designs and sells ready-to-assemble furniture..," J Ganesan, Chief Administrator HUDA, said.

"It will augment our efforts in ensuring steady revenue stream for HUDA. This is not a one-off deal as we have planned out auctions of other institutional and commercial properties across the city in the next few months. Gurugram has seen a reduced demand mainly due to rapidly changing investments scenario in real estate, especially in commercial sector. However, we are hopeful to sell more properties and gather handsome revenue for HUDA from the Estates of Gurugram," an official release quoted Ganesan as saying.

With IKEA marking its arrival in Gurugram, it very well highlights the importance of this city and its position in the global marketplace as a business and investor friendly destination, he said.

The site was put for e-auction three times earlier but had no takers until October 31 when the multinational finally participated and emerged successful.
TITLE: IKEA Buys 10-Acre HUDA Plot In Gurugram For Whopping Rs 842 Crore

SUMMARY:
Qualcosa non torna nelle due audizioni sulle banche venete di Consob e Bankitalia.
Altri membri della Commissione perÃ² non sono ancora soddisfatti e hanno chiesto che l'audizione del 9 novembre sia testimoniale.
Tradotto: obbligo di dire la veritÃ  altrimenti si incappa nel reato di falsa testimonianza.
Anche la leader di Fratelli d'Italia Giorgia Meloni ha chiesto la "convocazione congiunta di Barbagallo e Apponi in forma di testimonianza al fine di verificare le affermazioni rese.
La seduta si ritiene anche necessaria al fine di verificare il rispetto da parte di Consob e di Banca d'Italia dell'art 7 del TUB, il quale prevede che la Banca d'Italia e la Consob collaborino tra loro 'anche mediante scambio di informazioni, al fine di agevolare le rispettive funzioni.
TEXT:
Qualcosa non torna nelle due audizioni sulle banche venete di Consob e Bankitalia. Sul pressing di gran parte delle forze politiche della Commissione d'inchiesta, il presidente Casini ha quindi detto sÃ¬ a un confronto "all'americana": il presidente della Commissione bicamerale ha convocato in audizione congiunta, giovedÃ¬ 9, il capo del dipartimento Vigilanza bancaria e finanziaria di Banca d'Italia, Carmelo Barbagallo, e il direttore generale della Consob, Angelo Apponi, "per approfondire i rapporti tra le due istituzioni in riferimento alle banche venete". "La convocazione, fissata alle 10.30, Ã¨ stata richiesta - sottolinea una nota - da diversi gruppi politici".

Questo perchÃ©, secondo quanto emerso dalle audizioni (separate) di Barbagallo e Apponi, qualcosa non torna tre le due versioni sul comportamento dei due istituti sulle banche venete. Lo sintetizza bene Renato Brunetta, vicepresidente della Commissione d'inchiesta: "Visto che le descrizioni fatte ieri da Barbagallo e Apponi non sono state sempre concordanti, valuteremo con il presidente Casini se sia il caso di risentire entrambi, proprio per verificare le incongruenze delle due relazioni", aveva detto in mattinata. Altri membri della Commissione perÃ² non sono ancora soddisfatti e hanno chiesto che l'audizione del 9 novembre sia testimoniale. Tradotto: obbligo di dire la veritÃ  altrimenti si incappa nel reato di falsa testimonianza. La richiesta verrÃ  certamente avanzata da Andrea Augello, di Idea: "GiovedÃ¬ chiederemo che sia trasformata su base testimoniale".

Anche la leader di Fratelli d'Italia Giorgia Meloni ha chiesto la "convocazione congiunta di Barbagallo e Apponi in forma di testimonianza al fine di verificare le affermazioni rese. La seduta si ritiene anche necessaria al fine di verificare il rispetto da parte di Consob e di Banca d'Italia dell'art 7 del TUB, il quale prevede che la Banca d'Italia e la Consob collaborino tra loro 'anche mediante scambio di informazioni, al fine di agevolare le rispettive funzioni. Detti organismi non possono reciprocamente opporsi il segreto d'ufficio".
TITLE: Qualcosa non torna sulle Venete: la Commissione d'inchiesta (ri)convoca in audizione congiunta la Vigilanza di Bankitalia e Consob

SUMMARY:
WASHINGTON â€” In a surprising move, the White House has signed off on a lengthy report by more than a dozen federal agencies that reaches a conclusion about climate change that President Donald Trump and his team refuse to acknowledge: The crisis is real, and humans are to blame.
"It is extremely likely that human activities, especially emissions of greenhouse gases, are the dominant cause of the observed warming since the mid-20th century," the report states.
"In addition to warming, many other aspects of global climate are changing, primarily in response to human activities.
In a series of posts to Twitter, Katharine Hayhoe, a co-author and director of the Climate Science Center at Texas Tech University, said the report confirms what scientists have known for decades.
"Much of what we've learned in recent years suggests changes could be more extensive, more rapid, and more damaging than we thought," she wrote.
TEXT:
WASHINGTON â€” In a surprising move, the White House has signed off on a lengthy report by more than a dozen federal agencies that reaches a conclusion about climate change that President Donald Trump and his team refuse to acknowledge: The crisis is real, and humans are to blame.

The planet has entered the warmest period "in the history of modern civilization," with global average air temperatures having increased by 1.8 degrees Fahrenheit over the last 115 years, according to the findings.

"It is extremely likely that human activities, especially emissions of greenhouse gases, are the dominant cause of the observed warming since the mid-20th century," the report states. "In addition to warming, many other aspects of global climate are changing, primarily in response to human activities. Thousands of studies conducted by researchers around the world have documented changes in surface, atmospheric, and oceanic temperatures; melting glaciers; diminishing snow cover; shrinking sea ice; rising sea levels; ocean acidification; and increasing atmospheric water vapor."

In a series of posts to Twitter, Katharine Hayhoe, a co-author and director of the Climate Science Center at Texas Tech University, said the report confirms what scientists have known for decades.

"Much of what we've learned in recent years suggests changes could be more extensive, more rapid, and more damaging than we thought," she wrote.
TITLE: U.S. Government Report Says Humans Cause Climate Change

President Donald Trump responded to the deadliest mass shooting in Texas history by saying the attack was a result of â€œa mental health problemâ€ and not due to lax gun control laws.
During a news conference Monday in Tokyo, Trump said it was â€œa little bit soonâ€ to get into a discussion about gun control.
â€œThis isnâ€™t a guns situation,â€ Trump said, noting that a person in the crowd with a gun shot at the attacker and caused him to flee.
â€œThis is a mental health problem at the highest level.
While answering questions in Tokyo, the president referred to the gunman, who multiple reports identified as 26-year-old Devin Patrick Kelley, as a â€œvery deranged individual.â€
TEXT:
President Donald Trump responded to the deadliest mass shooting in Texas history by saying the attack was a result of â€œa mental health problemâ€ and not due to lax gun control laws.

During a news conference Monday in Tokyo, Trump said it was â€œa little bit soonâ€ to get into a discussion about gun control.

â€œThis isnâ€™t a guns situation,â€ Trump said, noting that a person in the crowd with a gun shot at the attacker and caused him to flee. â€œThis is a mental health problem at the highest level. Itâ€™s a very, very sad event.â€

The president woke on Monday morning in Japan to the news that a lone gunman had opened fire on churchgoers at a small Baptist church in rural Texas and killed at least 26 people and injured another 20. The dead and wounded range in age from 5 to 72 years old.

While answering questions in Tokyo, the president referred to the gunman, who multiple reports identified as 26-year-old Devin Patrick Kelley, as a â€œvery deranged individual.â€
TITLE: Trump Says Deadly Texas Shooting Isn't A Guns Issue, It's A Mental Health Problem

No hay ningÃºn motivo para pensar que la implementaciÃ³n de los principios rectores y el desarrollo de un tratado de este tipo no sean procesos complementarios.
Como era de esperarse, las agrupaciones empresariales insistieron en que no son sujetos obligados frente a los derechos humanos, sino que son sÃ³lo los Estados quienes deben garantizar su respeto.
Por ello, confian en que el mandato del Grupo de Trabajo se mantendrÃ¡ como estÃ¡ y que Ecuador seguirÃ¡ acompaÃ±ando el proceso hasta llevarlo a buen puerto.
Confian, ademÃ¡s, en que los Estados participantes seguirÃ¡n sumÃ¡ndose para aportar de forma proactiva a este proceso.
Lo que llevÃ³ a todas y todos quienes estuvieron en Ginebra fue el consenso de que las empresas transnacionales tienen la obligaciÃ³n de respetar los derechos humanos, y que estas no pueden, ni deben, ser mÃ¡s fuertes que los Estados donde operan.
TEXT:
Por: Eugenia LÃ³pez y Fernanda Hoppenhaym de la organizaciÃ³n civil PODER.*

A mediados de los aÃ±os sesenta, una petrolera perforÃ³ grandes pozas en la selva amazÃ³nica de Ecuador donde arrojÃ³ petrÃ³leo de prueba y residuos tÃ³xicos, sin importar que esa prÃ¡ctica fuera daÃ±ina. Pasaron 26 aÃ±os y la empresa se retirÃ³ dejando un ecosistema devastado y cerca de mil "piscinas" que, cuatro dÃ©cadas despuÃ©s, siguen filtrando sustancias tÃ³xicas y contaminando las aguas subterrÃ¡neas. Aunque ha habido diversos juicios contra la empresa, la contaminaciÃ³n provocada por Texaco-Chevron permanece impune a la fecha.

En MÃ©xico, hace tres aÃ±os, la minera Buenavista del Cobre, filial de Grupo MÃ©xico, contaminÃ³ los rÃ­os Sonora y BacÃ¡nuchi con mÃ¡s de 40 mil metros cÃºbicos de Ã¡cido de sulfato de cobre, afectando de forma directa a 22 mil personas que viven en los siete municipios situados a orillas del rÃ­o Sonora, daÃ±ando su salud y mermando la productividad de la regiÃ³n. A pesar de los exhortos de Naciones Unidas para que el gobierno mexicano atienda este caso, hasta hoy las autoridades no han castigado a ningÃºn responsable del peor desastre ambiental de la minerÃ­a en el paÃ­s.

Situaciones como estas, donde las empresas siguen operando sin problemas, a pesar de haber violentado los derechos de miles o millones de personas, podrÃ­an evitarse en el futuro con la existencia de un tratado internacional que las obligue a responder por sus actos.

Esta iniciativa de Tratado Vinculante, ha sido impulsada a nivel mundial por cientos de agrupaciones civiles que llevan mÃ¡s de una dÃ©cada organizÃ¡ndose para llegar a este momento. MÃ¡s de 200 se hicieron presentes en Ginebra del 23 al 27 de octubre, a fin de impulsar este instrumento diseÃ±ado especialmente para frenar los abusos de las grandes corporaciones.

Fue una semana histÃ³rica en muchos sentidos, pero sobre todo porque marcÃ³ el inicio de la creaciÃ³n de un documento que, de concretarse, proveerÃ¡ los mecanismos jurÃ­dicos necesarios para que las grandes empresas trasnacionales estÃ©n obligadas a respetar los derechos humanos y, en consecuencia, quienes han visto violados sus derechos por parte de esas empresas puedan acceder a la justicia y a la remediaciÃ³n.

Y precisamente el acceso a la justicia y a remediar el daÃ±o constituyen el centro del debate entre grupos empresariales, representantes de los Estados y asociaciones civiles, pues las empresas argumentan que no se requiere un Tratado Vinculante, sino que basta con cumplir con regulaciones voluntarias como los Principios Rectores sobre las Empresas y los Derechos Humanos que Naciones Unidas aprobÃ³ en 2011.

No obstante, como ha seÃ±alado Surya Deva, integrante del Grupo de Trabajo de Naciones Unidas sobre Empresas y Derechos Humanos, sin un Tratado Vinculante nunca podremos garantizar el acceso al remedio, porque las violaciones a derechos humanos por parte de las empresas suceden cada vez mÃ¡s en otros paÃ­ses, y si no contamos con una cadena de jurisdicciÃ³n y de responsabilidad de los Estados a nivel transnacional, las empresas siempre podrÃ¡n evadir la justicia. No hay ningÃºn motivo para pensar que la implementaciÃ³n de los principios rectores y el desarrollo de un tratado de este tipo no sean procesos complementarios.

La discusiÃ³n estuvo a cargo del Grupo de Trabajo Intergubernamental de ComposiciÃ³n Abierta, especialmente generado para desarrollar el Tratado Vinculante sobre derechos humanos, empresas transnacionales y otras empresas (GTI), liderado por Ecuador con apoyo de SudÃ¡frica. En las sesiones participaron los estados miembro de la ONU (MÃ©xico incluido), asÃ­ como agrupaciones empresariales como la International Chamber of Commerce (ICC), la International Organisation of Employees (IOE) y, por supuesto, numerosas organizaciones de la sociedad civil.

A pesar de que las negociaciones iniciaron con crÃ­ticas a la propuesta hecha por Ecuador (principalmente por la falta de tiempo para consultar al interior de los gobiernos y porque el documento necesita trabajar mejor el sustento jurÃ­dico), lo cierto es que al final de la semana se logrÃ³ un acuerdo sobre los principales temas que deberÃ­a abordar un tratado de esta naturaleza, y los Estados participantes lograron involucrarse en un debate tÃ©cnico sobre el contenido para generar este instrumento.

Al tÃ©rmino de las discusiones, el pleno acordÃ³ que Ecuador deberÃ¡ definir en breve una hoja de ruta para llegar con un borrador enriquecido para la siguiente sesiÃ³n del Grupo de Trabajo que se darÃ¡ en 2018.

Como era de esperarse, las agrupaciones empresariales insistieron en que no son sujetos obligados frente a los derechos humanos, sino que son sÃ³lo los Estados quienes deben garantizar su respeto. No obstante, la responsabilidad corporativa frente a los derechos humanos no aumenta ni disminuye si el Estado cumple o no su deber de proteger los derechos humanos, como bien ha seÃ±alado John Ruggie, creador de los Principios Rectores de Empresas y Derechos Humanos.

En este punto cabe seÃ±alar que, aunque el Tratado Vinculante busca frenar los abusos de las grandes empresas, tambiÃ©n permite atacar la captura corporativa del Estado, la cual sucede cuando una Ã©lite econÃ³mica se apropia de la polÃ­tica y la economÃ­a nacional para beneficio propio y, como resultado, el estado de derecho falla al obligar a las empresas a rendir cuentas.

Las organizaciones civiles que participaron en la creaciÃ³n de este tratado, entre ellas PODER, ven con optimismo los avances logrados y se mantienen alerta sobre las posibles amenazas contra un instrumento de este tipo. SeÃ±alan, por ejemplo la intenciÃ³n de algunos paÃ­ses de la UniÃ³n Europea, de cuestionar el mandato de Ecuador dentro del Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU en marzo de 2018 para que no se llegue a discutir un nuevo borrador del documento.

Para algunos Estados y la sociedad civil que participa en este proceso, no hay duda de que el mandato del Grupo Intergubernamental de Trabajo ha sido claro desde el inicio de este proceso, y es un mandato que sigue abierto hasta que se genere el Tratado Vinculante. Por ello, confian en que el mandato del Grupo de Trabajo se mantendrÃ¡ como estÃ¡ y que Ecuador seguirÃ¡ acompaÃ±ando el proceso hasta llevarlo a buen puerto. Confian, ademÃ¡s, en que los Estados participantes seguirÃ¡n sumÃ¡ndose para aportar de forma proactiva a este proceso.

Lo que llevÃ³ a todas y todos quienes estuvieron en Ginebra fue el consenso de que las empresas transnacionales tienen la obligaciÃ³n de respetar los derechos humanos, y que estas no pueden, ni deben, ser mÃ¡s fuertes que los Estados donde operan.

* Fernanda Hopenhaym es directora ejecutiva adjunta de Proyecto sobre OrganizaciÃ³n, Desarrollo, EducaciÃ³n e InvestigaciÃ³n (PODER), y Eugenia LÃ³pez es directora de vinculaciÃ³n de esta misma organizaciÃ³n.
TITLE: El tratado internacional que podrÃ­a poner fin a los abusos de las empresas transnacionales

LITTÃ‰RATURE - Olivier Guez a reÃ§u ce lundi 6 novembre le prix Renaudot pour son livre "La disparition de Josef Mengele" paru aux Ã©ditions Grasset. Il succÃ¨de ainsi Ã  Yasmina Reza, laurÃ©ate 2016, rÃ©compensÃ©e pour son roman "Babylone".

"La disparition de Josef Mengele" raconte l'histoire vraie de la fuite de Josef Mengele un mÃ©decin tortionnaire nazi. ArrivÃ© en Argentine en 1949 et cachÃ© derriÃ¨re de divers pseudonymes, l'ancien mÃ©decin Ã  Auschwitz croit pouvoir s'inventer une nouvelle vie Ã  Buenos Aires. Mais la traque reprend et le mÃ©decin SS doit s'enfuir au Paraguay puis au BrÃ©sil. Son errance de planque en planque, dÃ©guisÃ© et rongÃ© par l'angoisse, ne connaÃ®tra plus de rÃ©pit jusqu'Ã  sa mort, mystÃ©rieuse, sur une plage en 1979.

SUMMARY:
There is little doubt that land reform is one the most pressing issues facing our country.
A 2016 report by the Financial and Fiscal Commission reviewing land reform confirms that land reform initiatives have failed to achieve their objectives.
If this were to happen, we would all suffer, but the the poor, whom we are hoping will benefit from land reform, would be most affected.
South Africa stands at a crossroad in a number of areas, including meaningful land reform.
South Africa stands at a crossroad in a number of areas, including meaningful land reform.
TEXT:
Koos Mthimkhulu inspects his crop at his farm in Senekal, about 287km from Johannesburg in the eastern Free State, in this February 29, 2012, file photo. South Africa's plans to undo the wrongs of apartheid by returning land seized from native blacks is embodied in the life of Mthimkhulu.

There is little doubt that land reform is one the most pressing issues facing our country. From the pronouncements of politicians to government policy to social media commentary, everyone is talking about land. And with good reason.

It impacts directly on a critical sector of our economy that employs some 850,000 people, and contributes about 2.5 percent to the country's GDP as well as towards food security. Over and above this, the agri-business sector, which ensures primary products reach our shelves and pantries, is a substantive employer and country revenue earner. Estimates are that the agriculture sector's total economic contribution to the multiplier effect is at about 28 percent.

South Africa remains saddled with massive inequity inherited from centuries of colonialism and apartheid exploitation. We cannot continue with a situation where some 70 percent of productive farmland in the country is owned by the minority white population. The frustration and anger of the landless are clear, not to mention the poverty, unemployment and hopelessness of the rural dispossessed. A workable land reform solution must be found.

Various land reform programmes have been implemented over the past 23 years, with some R50-billion invested into a number of programmes, such as the Settlement/Land Acquisition Grant (SLAG), Land Redistribution for Agricultural Development (LRAD), the Proactive Land Acquisition Strategy (PLAS), Land Acquisition for Sustainable Development (LASD), the Recapitalisation and Development Grant (RDG), and the Comprehensive Agriculture Support Programme (CASP).

A 2016 report by the Financial and Fiscal Commission reviewing land reform confirms that land reform initiatives have failed to achieve their objectives.

It attributed this to:

The state being torn between equity and economic development considerations, resulting in a tension between promoting pro-poor land reform and encouraging larger-scale commercial agriculture.

State subsidies to alleviate farming risk discouraging beneficiaries from investing and learning the skills needed to farm successfully.

Remote decision-making on support programmes by non-agricultural skilled officials slowing down the process.

Leasing farms to beneficiaries, leaving them without assets to borrow against so that they can develop and work their farms.

A lack of support and upskilling to ensure that beneficiaries can effectively translate their presence on the land into operational and developmental success.

Should the agricultural property be "expropriated without compensation" both private sector financiers and the state-owned enterprise (that is the Land Bank) would be adversely affected.

The Banking Association South Africa firmly supports the need for more effective land reform and the orderly re-distribution of commercial farms to Black beneficiaries. At the same time, we must ensure that it does not increase the plight of the poor either, as a result of job losses or -- more importantly -- increased levels of food insecurity, caused by the collapse of food production. If this were to happen, we would all suffer, but the the poor, whom we are hoping will benefit from land reform, would be most affected.

Also, such policy should not place the country's financial system at risk. Hence the policy of "expropriation without compensation" that is mooted in some quarters is worth unpacking.

For most individuals, property (either a home or a farm) is the biggest investment they will ever make in their lives. In turn, it is also an attractive asset class against which they are able to raise credit, which can then be used for further investment into their lives or businesses. For better or worse, credit drives much of the South African economy. This credit is primarily provided by the country's commercial banks, using money sourced from deposits which the public place with commercial banks -- for example, in the form of their salaries, savings and so forth.

Commercial banks, therefore, have a fiduciary responsibility to ensure that when they make loans from these deposits, they do so without placing depositors like you and me at undue risk. This requires loans to be paid back by borrowers. The problem arises when the property no longer serves as an attractive collateral, as lenders will not be able to recover the debt from the collateral provided, which would result in losses being experienced by lenders. If these losses become severe enough, they could even cause the collapse of the lender.

The commercial agriculture sector has capital assets -- in other words, land and fixed improvements -- valued at about R208-billion, about R61-billion worth of machinery and vehicles/implements, and about R124-billion worth of livestock/produce. Against these assets, the R166-billion the primary agriculture sector gets in loans is broken down as follows: from commercial banks, about R112-billion, from the Land Bank, approximately R38-billion, from agricultural co-operatives, approximately R10-billion, and from other lenders/investors, approximately R6-billion.

Should agricultural property be "expropriated without compensation", both private-sector financiers and the state-owned enterprise (the Land Bank) would be adversely affected, as these loans would not have the necessary collateral to support them. This would in turn force lenders to review their loan portfolios and resort to the courts to recover as much of their debt as is possible.

South Africa stands at a crossroad in a number of areas, including meaningful land reform.

Also, lenders may seek to withdraw from providing any further loans to the agricultural sector, with dire consequences for employment, the economy and food security -- already, 25 percent of our population are food insecure, with 5 percent of our poor experiencing hunger.

Whilst commercial banks would be able to absorb the initial losses caused by "expropriation without compensation", the resultant secondary shocks to the South African economy in the forms of investor flight (both international and local), the further downgrade of South Africa and commercial bank international credit ratings, the plight of companies registered on the stock exchange whose business models are agriculture-related, and the negative impact on pension funds would be catastrophic. And that is before we consider the impact this will have on both employment and the poor.

While it may be argued that "expropriation without compensation" would impact only a minority of commercial farms, many in the value chain would ask: "Who is next?'. Investors would also be concerned that "expropriation without compensation" would migrate into other asset classes -- such as residential or commercial property.

What is the way forward? We all have to acknowledge that we are in this together. The fortunes of business, labour, civil society and government are all intertwined. Key private-sector stakeholders, including financiers, recognise their responsibility and the important role they play in helping to shape a just and equitable future for our country.

BASA, in collaboration with the Agricultural Business Chamber and other stakeholders such as AgriSA, have developed financing models premised on a partnership with government that will realise the transformational target within the National Development Plan of transferring an additional 20 percent of commercial agriculture properties to Black beneficiaries by 2030.

These models are underpinned by developmental support, including mentoring and upskilling, that will have to be provided to the new farmers -- there is no debating the principle that unproductive land is of no value to beneficiaries nor for food security.

This represents meaningful land reform, where such Black beneficiaries receive title to their land, failing which they would not be able to use their newly acquired asset to borrow money from financiers for improvements or for production purposes.

South Africa stands at a crossroad in a number of areas, including meaningful land reform. Our hope is that the heavy burden that rests on the shoulders of policymakers sees decisions made in a responsible and informed manner, to reverse the current economic and social plight of our citizens, and in particular our poor.

Cas Coovadia is the MD of the Banking Association South Africa and currently serves as the chair of the International Banking Federation (IBFed). He is also Treasurer of the African Union for Housing Finance.
TITLE: We All Want Land Reform -- Letâ€™s Make It Work
